Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Eur0traveller70
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Sofitel for our wedding anniversay - has a strong french influence. From the time of setting foot in the hotel to the valet parking delivering our vehicle, we found the staff, customer service provided to be outstanding, award winning & highly professional. The dinner in the restaurant was fabulous, we were left wanting more & the the french wine the waiter recommended was superb. We have travelled the world & find the Sofitel outdoes some other 5 star hotels in the area. The stay was brilliant, I cannot mention anything to fault; the concierge were the BEST! I would recommend anyone to stay at the hotel & we will stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: michael2417 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Motel was very impressive and welcoming on arrival but the bathroom sink was very dirty on edges. My room was straight outside the lifts which was very noisy as you could hear every movement of the lift which made it very hard to sleep. I overheard a Lady at Breakfast complaining to someone else about the same thing. The complimentary newspaper was not delivered and i mentioned this to Reception and they told me to go and get one from front desk. Whilst i was checking out someone else was also complaining about the paper and they were also told to go and get one from front desk.

Reviews.Title: “The Sofitel Wentworth has become very ordinary - what a shame”
Reviews.Author: Doctor623 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment the Sofitel Wentworth has become. I had such a stressful stay. The first problem was that my room smelled of smoke and I was tight-chested trying to breathe in it. My colleague who visited my room to drop off some papers noticed the same thing. I rang and asked about this. I was told that the room was a non smoking room and that people shouldn't smoke in it. Well I knew that! But clearly someone HAD smoked in it. There was no effort to move me to another room. A young man came up and sprayed the room to little effect. The ventilation was stuffy and all I wanted to do was open a window. From the point of view of the air quality, I couldn't wait to leave. I raised this again on checkout and was told the room would be 'fumigated' again. Big Deal! The dinner at the Garden Court was also disappointing. I invited my colleague to dinner and was frankly, embarrassed about it. We have eaten there together and with others many times and have always been pleased. But the food was ordinary. My colleague's duck was tough and disappointing and my pork belly was very fatty - the fat had not been adequately rendered from it. The female hostess of the restaurant was not at all focussed and we had to ask several times for things. I was incredulous when she came and asked me if I would like a drink and then walked off with my order. She had not asked my colleague if he wanted one as well. So I had to get up from my place and go and find her and let her know that my colleague would like a drink too. She just wasn't with me! My colleague joined me in the bar for morning coffee. We both noticed that there was no soap (both on the day I checked in and day I checked out) in the male and female bathrooms near the Lobby Bar and near the Garden Court restaurant. This was two days running. I reported this to a hotel staff member. However when I left after having a drink in the bar there was still no soap in the ladies' toilet. The toilets at Central Train station are routinely better supplied than this. What has happened to the lovely hotel with the wonderful service that Sofitel Wentworth used to be? Not coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Country to the City”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I reckon the measure of a good Hotel is how you feel about it on subsequent visits. This one just keeps getting better. I experienced genuine friendliness and courtesy from all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed”
Reviews.Author: 675cobra23
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal for the Sofitel over the easter break. The room was basic but was very clean and the best bed I have ever slept in. Housekeeping were great and the room was fresh and clean on return each day. Check in and check out was a breeze and very quick and even though I arrived at 8.30am after my flight, my room was ready which was a nice surprise. I would defiantly stay there again and I would consider upgrading to club Sofitel on my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Little bit of luxury”
Reviews.Author: tina14011
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 night with our young son. As Accor members we received an upgrade to a suite which was awesome. We also had executive club access which was well worth it. Breakfast in the club was great - and the staff there were always attentive. Room was large - and clean. Bed was super comfy. Only con - the hotel is a bit of a walk from the mall and centre of town. Would be fine if it was just me and my partner - but for our son it was a bit of a hike a few times a day. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful visit to Sydney complemented by the Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: stevie_23
Reviews.Content: We had planned a long weekend in Sydney to celebrate my partner's birthday, and I originally just wanted a fairly cheap centrally-located hotel. I went on various accommodation websites and noticed the Sofitel Wentworth seemed to have really good rates on the nights we wanted. When I went to book it, Expedia offered me a free upgrade from the standard room (which I would've been happy enough with) to a Club Sofitel Prestige Suite. Of course I took it! For a 4 night stay, having a separate lounge room and bedroom, 2 bathrooms and just more space in general is much more pleasant than being slightly squashed into one single room. So we arrived in Sydney and got to the hotel (after getting there by foot from Wynyard Station, dragging our case up 3-4 blocks, all uphill!) at around 2.30pm. We went to check in at the normal foyer reception area, but were told to go up to Level 5 as we had a Club Sofitel suite and we would be checked in up there in the Club Sofitel Lounge. So up we went. The club lounge was very nice...cushy lounge chairs around small tables, a view of an internal sort of courtyard, TV screen, an assortment of cakes, macaroons, scones, tea and coffee for afternoon tea. We checked in, however due to some room cleaning issues earlier in the day, we were not able to actually get into our room yet. We were offered afternoon tea (free daily full buffet breakfast, afternoon tea, and "happy hour" drinks and canapes were available for Club Sofitel guests) so indulged in a macaroon and some coffee for a while before leaving our bags behind the counter and heading out to nearby Pitt Street Mall (about 2 blocks away). We wandered around, enjoying the bustling crowds and numerous talented street performers, looked in some shops, and then received a call (which I missed) from the hotel, so we went back, got our bags and found our room (on Level 15). So we got into the room and...it was a normal room, not a prestige suite like I'd seen on the website. The room was very NICE, but...it had 2 single beds (we'd ordered one king) and was just one room. So I went back down to the club lounge, and Andrew (who was fantastic by the way, despite having a bad day with the cleaning staff issues and also a new computer system that was having some first day teething problems), who had checked us in earlier, was very apologetic and promptly rectified the situation. We went up to our new room on Level 17 (the top level of the building), and the suite was REALLY nice. Almost TOO big! Separate living area with TV and DVD player, powder room, a main bathroom around the corner and then the large bedroom with king bed and another TV. We settled in quickly and were very happy to be "home" in our room finally. Whenever we entered or exited the hotel and the club lounge, we were greeted with "Bonjour" or "Bonsoir" due to the French heritage of the hotel, which I found very nice. Each morning we went down to the lounge for our breakfast, which we thoroughly enjoyed. The breakfast service is available in the lounge from 7.30am-10.30am, which suited us well. We were generally out of the hotel by 10am each day to make the most of our time in Sydney. The hotel is in an excellent location. Just 2 blocks to Pitt Street Mall, 2-3 blocks (uphill) to St James Station and Hyde Park, about a 10-15 minute easy walk to Darling Harbour, 3-4 blocks (downhill) to Wynyard Station, and 3-4 blocks to Circular Quay (also downhill)...coming back is a different story though. When you are tired and weary, walking up almost vertical inclines is HARD! Other things to note are that in our personal opinion, the bed was WAY too soft for us. We slept quite well in it, but noticed we kept sinking into various uneven / lumpy areas and each morning we would wake up with very sore backs. In fact, on the second morning of our stay, I was in quite severe back pain the whole day. The shower was excellent. Powerful flow, good hot water. As part of being a Club Sofitel guest, we a complimentary newspaper of our choice each morning, however only 2 mornings out of the 4 we were there did our paper arrive in its little cloth bag hanging on the outside of our door. Not sure what happened to the other 2 days' papers, but it was no big deal. I found at night it was fairly quiet, being 17 floors above the city. Though for someone with very sensitive ears, I did notice increasing traffic noise from about 4am or so. I don't think any of the rooms at the hotel have balconies, so any smokers...you will have to go down in the lifts (which at peak times could take a little while, but nothing too bad) and go outside. Check out in the club lounge after breakfast was effortless and quick. Normal check out is at 11am, which was perfect for us as our flight was at 1.10pm. All in all, we had a fantastic stay in Sydney and would definitely stay at the Sofitel Wentworth again. Another special mention to Andrew of the Club Sofitel lounge. Very professional, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Golaeth Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our brief stay at the wentworth! We liked the room layout and service! People were very nice and showed a little personality when probed.... Hahaha We would stay there again as it was very convenient spot, close to shops and train stations!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible bed”
Reviews.Author: jaymelu
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here for a special night in Sydney, I booked on line and the site said it was a 5 star hotel ... No. The staff were all very nice, we got in at about noon and there was no room ready so the concierge kindly took our one bag so we could look around Sydney. The hotel is perfectly located near Circular Quay and the Rocks. We were seeing a show that night so we got back at around 4 pm, took a shower ---- terrible dribbling water saving device ---- and then headed out to the Opera House --- easy walk from location. We retuned at midnight and found out we had an awful bed; it sloped to one side and was really soft. It was too late to complain, we were tired. Both of us had a rotten night's sleep. When we checked out they asked us if all was fine and I told them the bed was awful. I was told that it was probably two beds pushed together! Who cares? I paid for a five star hotel! Will definitely give it a miss next time.

Reviews.Title: “Still on the ball”
Reviews.Author: Raymond B
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Wentworth in Sydney remains one of Sydney's leading hotels .The aservice and ammentities were fiirst class as always.

Reviews.Title: “Very unhappy experience !”
Reviews.Author: Y L
Reviews.Content: I found one of my luggages damaged when I received them in room. I reported to the staff at once, however, nobody gave me any reply regarding this. After several days, a staff replied me impolitely that they would not repair or compensate my damaged luggage because no evidence would be shown that it was damaged by them. When I carried my luggages and entered the hotel, all of my luggages were found no damage. Most of the staff's services were bad. Room was dirty. When I opened the small balcony, many cigarette-ends were found. Very disgusting. Very unhappy experience to stay at the Wentworth Sofitel Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Wenworth - Tres Bon!”
Reviews.Author: Sue-Murray
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel Wentworth for six nights over Easter. We originally booked a Superior Room but were upgraded to a Luxury Room. On the first night we noticed that the air-conditioning made a disturbing noise and reported the problem. Engineering staff were not available to fix it, so we were moved to a better Luxury Room (with Lâ€™Occitane toiletries, an ipod docking station and a Nespresso machine). The move was dealt with quickly and efficiently. We tried the hotel breakfast on one occasion (we donâ€™t particularly like hotel breakfasts as thereâ€™s nothing appealing about luke warm, dried up bacon etc). The choices were comparable with most other five star hotels, but at $40 each, it is an expensive option. However, the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. In fact all the staff we dealt with were friendly, courteous and pro-active in meeting our needs. One delightful characteristic is that to honour the French heritage of Sofitel, greetings such as bonjour, bonsoir and bon appetit are frequently extended. We used Room Service on quite a few occasions and this service was better than most we have experienced in Australia. The food was delicious, hot, very well presented and was delivered within half an hour or so of our order. Another service we appreciated was the hot beverages and pastries in the lobby for early morning departures. To make our flight, we had to check out at 5:45am, so a hot coffee and a warm pastry was a wonderful treat as we waited for our driver. The location of the Sofitel is perfect: close to Martin Place, Pitt Street Mall and Circular Quay. The only complaint I have about our stay is the VERY EXPENSIVE Wi-Fi. In this technological age, free Wi-Fi should be the norm in five star establishments. Fortunately, I only used my Ipad for checking email, banking and Facebook, however, business users could easily tot up a substantial internet bill. Lastly â€“ very comfy and cosy beds. Thank you Sofitel Wentworth.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: oils1216
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. Location is wonderful. Rooms are small, but very comfortable beds. The last morning of our stay, our bathroom flooded. The staff was very quick about finding another room and making sure that we had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Wentworth Sofitel satisfies”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were greeted by friendly and accommodating desk staff. Our room was comfortable and the breakfast made for a good start to the next day. As we were in Sydney for the excellent production of La Traviata, the Wentworth was ideally located, enabling a pleasant walk to and from the venue. This is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We just loved it!”
Reviews.Author: fredbkk
Reviews.Content: Great location (walking distance to the opera, the harbour bridge and circular quay), professional staff, amazing breakfast, fabulous room (we got upgraded to a junior suite), we loved every moment we spent at the sofitel! We had also taken the sofitel club package (including breakfast, wifi, free drinks and snacks from 5 to 7pm) which was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway/shopping”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Close to the harbour and shopping. Breakfast - food and service was great. Beds very comfortable. Rooms very quiet. Staff very freindly. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Sydney Slipping”
Reviews.Author: Emeste22 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Sofitel Sydney is a fine hotel but on this occasion I noticed a general decline in customer service and care. The room I was allocated was a little sparse and needed some additional ornamentation. The air conditioning was noisy and rattled constantly. The television regularly needed rebooting and was unreliable. Breakfast prices are too expensive as are internet rates. My platinum membership provided me with a good rate however.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Sydney - Great”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in an ideal location. Good room with very comfortable bedding. Can definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Construction in progress”
Reviews.Author: sdwylie
Reviews.Content: As per my previous review of this hotel, I really enjoy staying here - however, on my recent stay here (1st to 3rd April), I noted that during the day (from around 8:30am) the hotel was performing noisy renovation and construction work on the floor I was staying on (and perhaps others?). The hotel did not advise of the construction work taking place at any point - from the online booking, hotel website, through to the check-in process. Not only was I not made aware of the noise, but obviously no compensation or consideration has been given as a result. Very disappointing. Perhaps it's a good idea for potential travellers to call the hotel to find out whether the construction has finished if expecting peace and quiet in the hotel throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely bed, agree was underwhelmed by a Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: SnowCat M
Reviews.Content: My husband had his trip booked by the Travel Office at his company, so this hotel was a nice surprise. It was booked for its proximity to his office. We were a little surprised at check in due to a miscommunication between the Travel Office and the front desk so when we finally arrived in the lobby at 8 am to check in after 26+hours of travel time to discover they had put us on the no show list. The front desk was lovely and did everything they could, but we had to go amuse ourselves for 3 hours to wait for a room to be cleaned before we could go collapse in our room. We has a minor plumbing issue in our room that was swiftly resolved when we informed the front desk. The staff was unfailingly polite and efficient. The location was wonderful, walking distance to most downtown Sydney attractions, close to the trail stop and the ferry station. I feel the for the price of each nights stay was a little steep for the size of the room and the amenities. It never fails to surprise us that the more expensive a hotel is, the worse and more expensive the internet services are. There are a number of coffee shops or restaurants nearby that have free wifi, but I massively went over my international data plan. We did not use the business center. We did not use the spa. The breakfast was AMAZING. We ate at the Garden Court every morning. Fantastic selection, delicious food. It's a good thing I walked everywhere because I was determined to eat as much smoked salmon and fresh fruit as I could; my husband thoroughly enjoyed the hot food - the waffles and sausage were fabulous. It was a lovely stay, I would definitely stay there again if we were able to score a good deal on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not really 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: travelerAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Bottom line is: It is a decent hotel - but not quite 5 Star. Starting with the check-in: The room required (in written) two months earlier (twin bedded) was not available, 1 1/2 hours wait until the room was ready. The room is decent, not very spacious, the bathroom is smallish but well equipped with amenities. No newspaper service - at a room rate of about A$300 a free morning paper should be expected. Dinner plates left outside (by a room nearby) were cleared only in the late afternoon the following day. Most important: Rooms facing the street (which is very busy in the morning) have no double glazing, only two layers of curtains which is definitely not enough to insulate the noise. Upon checking out, the bill showed a charge for the car park (never used); amount was cancelled immediately. It's not five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Room, Fantastic Lounge”
Reviews.Author: Matthudski
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location for touring around sydney. We stayed in a Prestige Club Sofitel suite and I have no complaints. Check in was a bit slow (late to get room), But as we had lounge access, we just left our bags, had some drinks and food and went out into the City. The hotel is very nice and as a we were staying in a Prestige Club Suite, they looked after us really well. I'm not sure if the hotel is worth the money, but still, there was nothing wrong with it and if the rates were cheap enough, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: K_P_S24
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, neat, in a good location, and elegant but businesslike. It has everything you need (except free wifi), but isnt particularly memorable. Go for business

Reviews.Title: “My Bed indeed”
Reviews.Author: pRincEssEun
Reviews.Content: or rather... My pillow. As some other guests have already mentioned, Sofitel's pillow are THAT good. I wish they would sell them (believe me, I asked). As the rest of the hotel, it is an excellent choice for Sydney if you do not like to be in the middle of everything, but still stay pretty close to it. Access to buses and ferries are really good. It is also walking distance to Pitt Street. I like the fact that it is not in the crowded areas of Sydney (i.e. George St, etc.), but most things you need is pretty much around the hotel. There are 2 convenience store (one just across from the side entrance, one in the same block), there is a food court just accross the street (Chifley building) and the chain Sushi Tei in the same block. The check in and check out process went pretty smoothly. It would not have happened if Emily at the reception was not there. We innitially had (innitial) R to attend to us, and he was one of those pretty snotty kind of staff who looked down on you (just because you were using your complimentary voucher, or some otherworldly excuse). He tried to make live hard for us and even gave Emily an evil look for helping us. Fortunately Emily came to the rescue. Ha ! The rest of the staff was superb too. William in reception, Nick at concierge (he would make you laugh within 2 minutes of talking to him), and many others I did not come to know their names. Thumbs up for them. The room was ready for us when we arrived, although my friends had to wait another 20 minutes for theirs (we arrived after 2). Room was clean and had everything we needed. I was especially impressed with their coffee and tea selection. They had better than usual selection and was generous with them (4 tea choices with at least 3 bags each, 2 hot choccolate for the little kiddies in us, and more coffee than a caffeine-addict could ever finish in one day). The room had an ironing board, and good iron (offcourse!), and the twin bed were huge almost 140cm-wide. I would rave some more about the pillow, but I think I will save it for my next Sofitel review in Gold Coast. One thing I noticed missing was toothbrushes. I always travel with my own toothbrush, but at odd times when I forget my toothpaste I like the fact that the hotel has it. So when I did not see one at this hotel, it seemed a little strange to me. Luckily I had plenty of toothpaste to last me the whole 11 days' trip. Another thing was the chair by the window. I did not expect it since I have seen that some pictures had them and some did not. However, my friends and I booked the same upgraded room. Theirs had the chair, and mine did not. Lucky draw ? Overall, it is a very good hotel. Not the newest, but you can see it has been very well maintained. I was told by a friend (a Sydneysider) that the convention center is one of the best in Sydney. From the other hotels I have stayed in Sydney in the past, I think the hotel might be too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location let down by little things.”
Reviews.Author: Clouds10
Reviews.Content: Parking was bit confusing as doesnt appear to have conceirge parking and you are directed to a car park around the block. Vehicle is then parked by a parking attendent, and wasnt really informed of process re collection of car as we bundled out of car trying to make sure we had everything we wanted for next few days. Also had some confusion picking up car with attendant hard to understand pointing for us to wait out on street at left. Anyway got car back so all ended well. Room was bit larger than had expected, but found bathroom odd in that had a single basin with no bench, or rail for hand tal. Had a tray on which tals were placed and used this for our toiletries. Suspect it was a room for disabled guests given amount of rails in bathroom and foldout seat in shower. Called conceierge to see if we needed to come and get out bags or do they bring them up; given confusion around parking. Concierge seemed bit defensive saying were busy and lifts were slow; when all I really needed too know if they brought up bags, but only minor thing. Was bit disappointed next morning as didnt get a newspaper even though had ticked on form when checked in. Staff at front desk also bit defensive, no apology was then directed to concierge who gave me his last newspaper and must have been sick of me by now. Breakfast area was quite nice, standard buffet breakfast. Good location, easy walk to rocks, botanical gardens and martin place train station.

Reviews.Title: “Has some great attributes”
Reviews.Author: Champagne4everyone
Reviews.Content: Lobby is emaculate and very well presented, club lounge staff fantastic and hotel is in a good location. The Luxury King Rooms are nice but are getting tired, especially carpets. It's the little things that lt this property down, inconsistent service and poor communication between staff. The bathrooms are well appointed ( please note that all rooms have shower over bath apart from superior rooms), would be much better if they ripped the small baths out and provided a large shower for luxury rooms. Enjoyed stay but had quite a negative experience on check in but service recovery process was quite good and I would stay again. Has potential to be a fantastic hotel just need to improve on consistentcy of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Where the customer comes last”
Reviews.Author: Terry L
Reviews.Content: Having booked a Superior Twin room, my first surprise was that we'd been 'downgraded' to a standard room. This was bad enough, but after returning home and contacting Sofitel, my email was completely ignored. I then had my booking agent take up the issue and they reported great difficulty in getting even a response from the hotel. Finally, the Sofitel suggested it was down to 'human error'. No apology. My agent managed to get them to begrudgingly refund the difference between what I'd paid for and what I received. As far as customer service goes, the Sofitel Wentworth considers it an extravagence. I have stayed at the hotel many times, but this was the final time. The hotel is good, but their indifference to customer complaints is typically arrogant of the French.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was a very enjoyable stay at the Sofitel and would recommend it and would like to stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed I have ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: AussieFreeSpirit
Reviews.Content: We purchased a deal which included the room and club sofitel access. The room had a fabulous view and was very comfortable, complete with l'occitane toiletries. I cannot begin to describe how amazing the bed was (and we have stayed in a lot of 5 star hotels!). The down comforter with down quilt and down pillows, heaven! Club sofitel access was brilliant. We had afternoon tea to begin with which was delicious. Then the drinks and canapes in the evening. The staff did not skimp on the drinks and topped us up constantly. The nibbles were yummy and plentiful. Unfortunately the only negative about our stay was the breakfast. Eggs were watery, cold bacon, soggy hash browns, stale pastries. Plus there were so few staff that were trying their hardest to look after us all but there just weren't enough of them. There also is no pool, spa or sauna at the hotel which is a bit of a shame. But having said all of that we really had a brilliant stay. Great location, helpful and friendly staff and a brilliant room. I would definitely recommend the sofitel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely building but the room is not 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: ExoticKoala
Reviews.Content: In the past 12 months I have stayed at Sofitel in Melbourne, Broadbeach and Sydney. Sadly the Sydney Sofitel comes a distant last. On checkout I was waiting for staff to ask - how was your stay but nothing was said other than Thank you and goodbye! My overall rating is 3.8 out of 5. The lobby is very pretty as you enter the building but the room is the main item people are paying for. Sadly the Superior King Room was very old. The carpets had minimal fibre left, the windows required window winders to draw up/ down, the tv was small and so was the room compared to other Sofitels. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom had old swing doors to open/ close and the step into the over-bath shower was appox a 500mm step. The toilet paper roll was approx 300mm from the ground. Try bending over everytime to grab the paper - not very well designed! The bath products supplied were very nice. If I was going to visit Sydney again I would consider other establishments considering the Full Room rate as advertised on Last Minute.com is $595 per night. My fellow Trip Advisor reviewers have got it correct and rated this hotel as the 15th to 25th best hotel to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the room was not ready until 3:45pm & I had a 5:00pm engagement that I had to get ready for, other than that it was a very pleasant stay. The bedding was extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is situated in a highly convenient position with high quality comfortable beds and toiletries on offer. I would happily stay again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended although I am coming back to try again...”
Reviews.Author: ajhooker
Reviews.Content: Actually I was completely and utterly disgusted with my experience at the Hotel. Upon arriving at the hotel at approximately 5:00pm, the attendant at the Reception did not even acknowledge my wife and I. She briefly looked up and continued on her phone call about what time she was starting in the morning and the earliest time she could be 'up' that afternoon. I understand that people receive phone calls they need to take, but there wasn't even a smile, an 'I won't be a moment gesture' or ANYTHING, let alone telling the person on the other end of the line that she would phone back. She then proceed to advise that my reservation required payment. It was prepaid as per the confirmation I presented. Her manager also insisted that the girl was correct. I EVEN SHOWED THE TRANSACTION WHERE THE MONEY HAD BEEN WITHDRAWN! The room was lovely, as expected. It was clean and quiet and we enjoyed a lovely night's sleep. Breakfast the next day was another nightmare though. The staff were rude, bored and slow with no sense of urgency, personality or customer service. The food was quite good... Very simple. There were never any bowls, plates or glasses at the buffet which was extremely frustrating. Our coffees never arrived, despite us asking twice for them. There seemed to be about 4 or 5 staff on but none of them ever came to our table. The supervisor or manager seemed a little vacant and unconcerned with the whole debacle. Check out again was slow, perhaps because we were checking out at 10:00am (check out is 11:00am) and a number of people were also leaving at this time. That said, again the attendant was curt and 'pushing the departures though'. We weren't even asked how our stay was or given the standard 'have a nice day'. The most consecutive words spoken were 'anythign from the minibar'. Very, very disappointing. I wrote to the hotel after departure and my comments were addressed by the hotel manager's assistant. Credit should most certainly be given to this young lady as she promptly followed up my concerns and had the courtesty and professionalism to regularly write to me to inform me of the progress of the 'investigation' for lack of a better word. She was extremely patient, sympathetic and everything that you would associate with a supposed five star hotel. Although she couldn't make the hotel better, i feel that I must give her credit because I was nothign short of impressed with her manner. Otherwise I woudl have scored 0/5. In short, she should be out there managing, preventing these issues, not dealing with them. Upon speaking with her, I have agreed to try the hotel again next time i'm in town. I guess we'll see how that goes!

Reviews.Title: “Something special in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: gypsymum
Reviews.Content: I booked accomodation for a recent one night stay in Sydney at the Sofitel. I turned up early (11 am and, was not expecting to be checked into a room) to offload my bag and head off to an event at the Opera House. I was pleasantly surprised to be checked-in when I presented at the counter, I was advised a room was available and, I could 'freshen up' before the event which was welcome after a few hours travel. On the advice of the man checking me in, I paid the extra and took Club Sofitel (on the 5th floor) which included a room upgrade and a few other 'perks' for an extra AUD$80.00. My room had a view of the courtyard garden on the 5th floor, the room and bathroom was clean, pleasantly decorated in neutral tones. The standout for me was sleeping on one of the most comfortable king sized hotel beds I have slept on in a long, long time complimeted by the pillows. The last time I slept on a bed with pillows this good was somewhere in Dubai! I took dinner in the Garden Court Restaurant which has a superb menu and wine list, on the night I dined I was offered the last table at that time and, late comers were asked to return later! I think that speaks for the quality of the venue. Breakfast was a self serve affair at Club Sofitel - I always choose a Continental breakfast and was delighted to see a selection of fresh rather than canned fruits, there was table service for eggs, coffee, tea etc. One of the 'perks' I mentioned previously includes paying my hotel bill and checking out of the hotel at the end of breakfast at Club Sofitel. As I exited the elevator on the Lobby floor to see clusters of individuals waiting to check out I discovered the true value of $80. The hotel is within walking distance of most tourist attractions in Sydney esp.Circular Quay and the CBD with numerous transport options. If you don't want to venture too far from the hotel there is shopping on the ground level of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and class - as expected”
Reviews.Author: peterandanne56 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here some years back and much appears to have changed - a grander entrance and marble bathrooms for example. On this trip stayed just one night but it was just as we expected - a quality place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds - Dirty bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: FiverACT
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sofitel with a friend to attend an event nearby. We had booked in advance on the recommendation of other friends who had stayed here some time ago and had reported a great hotel and overall experience. With high hopes were at least slightly disappointed. On arrival I was told there was no booking, either in my name or that of my friend. The front desk staff did not appear particularly interested in assisting me to find the booking or resolve the situation - they suggested I call my friend to confirm the name out room was booked in. I did so and confirmed the name and was again told there was no relevant booking. Soon after my friend arrived and it turned out the hotel had mistakenly entered his name during the booking process, the names were close, but apparently not close enough the front desk could find them until we 'discussed' the issue with them for some time. Normally we'd have booking details with us, however being a phone booking we didn't have them at the time. The next disappointment was the 'credit swipe' process. We had $450 put 'on hold' against a credit card for a security deposit. To me that was a little high considering the room was around $300 a night. I've travelled widely and the standard is usually $1, $100 or the equivalent to one night's stay. No major concern though, as these deposits are refunded back to yor car two weeks later. On arriving at our room the decor was nice and modern, although the room was a little small for a twin, there was only about 15cm between the two beds, again, no major issue, but a bit more space would have been nice. (see pic) Into the bathroom and this is where disappointment really set in. The bathroom was nothing short of disgusting. The toilet seat was improperly attached and made using the bathroom akin to riding a rodeo bull (OK it wasn't that bad but it was definately not the standard you expect from such a hotel). The hand basin and bath/shower were also quite mouldy. The problem with the level of mould is that it suggested not that a single cleaner had missed something, but that there was a systemic issue with the cleaning process. I raised concerns about the bathroom (both the unstable toilet seat and the cleanliness) with the front desk and was told they'd be looked at while we out for dinner. When we returned the toilet seat had been fixed, however the mould remained - it didn't look like there had been any attempt to clean it - The photos I've uploaded were after the 'cleaning'. On the upside the bed was fantasticly comfortable and the pillows were also perfect - My friend reported a great night's sleep too. While the beds were comfy and the decor modern, the shortcomings in cleanliness were enough to have us both doubting we'd choose the Sofitel again.

Reviews.Title: “There is no way this is a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: M M
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is barely scrapping 4 star. There is no pool/spa and the work out centre is privately owned so they close early on the weekends. The rooms are boring and very drab. The Tv's are old and aren't mounted on the walls. If you don't get one of the more expensive rooms you are likely to get one of the dark interior rooms. Oh, and they charge you extra if you want ice (or an ice bucket) or a newspaper. There is no way that I could recommend this hotel to anyone especially when it claims to be of the same caliber as the Sheraton, Westin and 4 Seasons. Don't waste your money, stay at the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: Incredible_Hemang
Reviews.Content: Was in Sydney for the New Years and stayed at the Sofitel Wentworth. The rooms are really good and service is very prompt. We were erroneously booked for 2 single beds, however the staff were prompt in swapping the room for a comfy double. The location is very central and close to the Sydney attractions. The concierge were fantastic. Had the breakfast at the restaurant and the spread was amazing. All in all a fab experience

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, beautiful decor & first class service”
Reviews.Author: ThatMrRobinson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and I cannot fault this hotel. From the moment you enter the lobby, the scent of flowers fills the air and you are welcomed by the immaculate reception staff. The lobby area is beautiful, and the lobby bar is a fantastic place to relax and unwind with a glass frontage allowing views of the outside street. The rooms are extremely well maintained, with a powerful shower, lavish toiletries and a good quality flat screen television. The beds are incredibly comfortable and the mini bar was full to burst! Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was amazing, and the staff were so attentive without being intrusive at such an early time in the morning! Internet is chargeable inroom and this is a flat rate fee which allows a certain amount of data transfer. All in all a fantastic hotel, and if you turn left as you exit the lobby and walk for about 5 minutes, that famous Sydney Harbour Bridge will appear along the horizon and you you reach the waterfront in no time. Perfect hotel to stagger back to after an evening meal

Reviews.Title: “Failed to Shine”
Reviews.Author: UpfrontAustralia
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it was the dreary wet weather but sadly the Sofitel failed to shine, despite booking a suite and executive club. There is no excuse for thread bare armrests on chairs in the lounge other than its time for a face lift folks. Our bed was superbly comfortable. Everything else has fine but not special.

Reviews.Title: “Accor Member Experience”
Reviews.Author: RubyPerth
Reviews.Content: As an Accor Advantage Plus member, the Sofitel Sydney Wentworth was chosen for my first nights stay in Sydney using my â€˜Complimentaryâ€™ 1 night voucher. (This is included in your $299 annual membership). The hotel is well positioned, in walking distance to both the Quay (Opera House & Sydney Harbour Bridge) and the main shopping district, including Myer, David Jones & numerous other smaller retailers â€“ many upmarket, designer boutiques too. The Wentworth is not new, but is well maintained with a still rather glamorous entry foyer with large glass chandeliers. The concierge was immediately helpful, taking my bags so I could progress to Check-in free of cumbersome items. Luggage was brought to my room shortly after I arrived. Check-in was painless. I had paid $40 (on top of the Complimentary Certificate) when booking on the Accor website, as the base level rooms were already full. This ensured a stay in a Superior Room, 1 King Bed, Garden, Courtyard View. As am Accor â€˜Goldâ€™ member, I am entitled to a free upgrade of room. I requested this & was given a room that was slightly larger and on the 11th floor, still overlooking the garden courtyard. The room was very clean and had more than enough room for 1 person. The bathroom was well fitted, though small. The bed was sublimely comfortable. A flat screen TV, fridge, safe, iron, ironing board, digital alarm clock, great lightingâ€¦...were all provided. The room has plush carpeting. There was only 1 window, no balcony, no views (only other buildings) except for the courtyard garden on the 5th floor, when you looked down. Staff were attentive in all areas of the hotel. 2 free drinks were provided complimentary, as was a fruit plate. I believe these were as a result of my membership status. On checkout, I had used a $60US voucher that I had printed at home using Accor points. This was to be used to pay for the $40 room cost and a Club Sandwich plus coffee I ordered whilst there. On returning home, I have noted that a fee of $61.66 has been deducted from my Credit Card INCORRECTLY instead of the hotel using the Accor Credit Voucher. I phoned the hotel yesterday & am yet to resolve this matter. I have also been charged an additional amount for a Minibar expense that did not occur. Overall, a comfortable stay only marred by the poor accounting process.

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: GuitarmanBowral
Reviews.Content: Have stayed her a couple of times when attending shows in Sydney. Very good location within walking distance of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and the Rocks. Overall very comfortable older hotel. Rooms are in good order. By far the best thing about this hotel are the beds. They are probably the best I have ever slept in. Great nights' sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Always a good choice for museums, opera house and circular quay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The sleep quality is down because I never sleep very well in Air conditioning - I always find it's too warm or too cold. I do like the quality of the soaps, gels, etc in the bathroom, many hotels only offer cheap and nasty toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay at Sofitel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: parischris2007
Reviews.Content: I was the recipient of an airline baggage system meltdown on the day I flew to Sydney, which meant that I arrived with only hand luggage after waiting in vain for an hour for it to materialise in arrivals and navigating lost luggage with a few hundred other passengers. On arrival at the Sofitel, having already gotten a great deal on a Junior suite, the reception desk greeted me with a complimentary upgrade to a Prestige Suite, which turned a grim day into an absolutely fantastic one! It is those little touches that mean so much (including having a toothbrush provided in the room), that keeps me coming back the the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Tania T
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the end of January. The rooms are small and we found it difficult with two small children. We thought the hotel could have been more accommodating with requests. This is a good hotel if you are a business traveller. It is in a good location, in the heart of the city. Not recommended for families.

Reviews.Title: “great stay a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sherms57
Reviews.Content: From the time we entered the hotel to the time we left it was a pleasure - room however small compared to others I have been in But very clean and cosy - and great great location

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Fluffytowels
Reviews.Content: This is a classic Sofitel hotel with all the luxury, service and amenities one would expect. Special praise should be given to Chanel in the down stairs bar. I had a number of business associates to meet and she ensured that we our meetings went well with a quiet area in the lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TO BE ACKNOWLEDGED”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Wentworth is one of the most nicest hotels in Sydney. Clean and well furnished. The staff are more than happy to take that extra step to acknowledge you and make you feel special. Caters for all your needs. Its very important as a guest to be acknowleged and looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury indulgence and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Aussies2011
Reviews.Content: (PART OF A PRIZE WON) Walking into this hotel was intimidating! Though our faces must have said it all - we had won a nights accommodation at this lovely hotel. Remember the scene in Pretty Woman (credits to all rights belonging to film) where Julia Roberts' character walks into the hotel with Richard Gere's character putting on the jacket/coat for the first time! WOW. Immediately the staff (bell hops: I think) were asking if we needed assistance and helping us find our way. The counter lady was a little off putting to start with - but also done her job. This lady had to seek assistance from another lady behind the reception desk who helped us with our booking. The room was very nice; clean; tidy; fresh smelling even. It was indulgence at its highest. There was a study table area. which was situated opposite the front door. between the front door and the lounge area was a divider for privacy. The lounge comfortably seated three chairs, coffee table and tv suite unit. Toward the back of the suite - there was a full size ensuite style bathroom and massive bedroom which had its own television, and cupboards. The bed. The most important part of any stay- the bed! OH MY GOSH! If you could pack the mattress in to your suitcase it would been done! To sleep on that mattress was absolute heaven. Unless we're sick we don't sleep in the middle of a day let alone a trip - but we had an hour to relax before having to get ready to go out and so we decided to watch a movie or part thereof; both of us were woken by the reminder alarm set on our phone so we both knew - no matter where we were that we had to get ready now-. . . it was unexpected and so comfortable. Laying on this bed it felt like having every arch, nook and crest in your body filled in with a sponge. And while we were out - our room was re made up for us. And a lovely note was left for us. Easy check in (in the situation that we had won this accommodation as a part of a prize) and easier check out . Again the bell hops were very happy to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Expl0rergirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a 2 night weekend in a standard room with a king bed. The room was a decent size and looked out over Philip street, some city buildings and partially the gardens of the hotel. The hotel lobby smells beautiful and the chandelliers are gorgeous. The orchid displays are just beautiful. Check in was a quick and smooth affair. As Accor Advantage Plus members we also received a complimentary box of gourmet chocolates and a free drink for two in the hotel lobby bar which was very enjoyable. The bathroom has a bath/shower combination, and marble floors. There is a good quality hairdryer and good amenities (Roger & Gallet). The bed was the most comfortable I have slept in, in ages. I wish I could buy one of those beds. With the heavenly bed and the block out blinds we had a fantastic night's sleep. The room also had an extensive mini bar selection, bathrobes, flat screen tv with satellite channels as can be expected and coffee making facilities (instant). The hotel is a 7 minute walk from circular quay and about 15 minutes from the Pitt St Mall shopping area. Centrally located - The Rocks are also about 10 minutes away by foot where there are plenty of restaurants. The hotel made us feel welcome and the service was very friendly. You are greeted by a courteous bonjour - loved it - as this is a French hotel chain a lot of their staff are French speaking. We felt like valued guests throughout our stay. The only negative is that the carpet in the hallway looked a bit dated, but that is a very minor observation. I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: A G
Reviews.Content: I'm not a five star hotel connoisseur, but my stay at the Sofitel was very enjoyable. We booked online using the Entertainment Book which was great value and cheaper than most online prices. Stayed for 3 nights in the Superior Room. Check in was easy, the lady at the front desk was to-the-point and efficient but at the same time friendly. Asked forextra coat hangers which arrived without hiccup. Room was spacious and clean. Bed is softer than what I am used to at home but got used to it by the second night. We asked for firmer pillows the next day and they arrived without trouble. Location was great for what we wanted. Close to train station, halfway bewteen the harbour and the CBD shopping at Westfield. Very convenient location. Free bus (555) took us around to Chinatown and was convenient. Bondi was not hard to get to by train and bus. Gym was well stocked with cardio equipment and had most weght equipment specialises in yoga and pilates. Limited hours on weekends 9-4pm Sat and 9-12pm on Sunday??? from memory. We were looking forward to the group classes but they did not run on weekends. Highlight was the conceirge staff who were incredibly helpful. It was so easy to wake up in the morning decide where to go without knowing how to get there, go downstairs and ask the concierge and in 2 minutes have a map and easy directions to follow, bus, taxi, ferry etc. They also organised a limousine service to the airport which was good value, fixed rate, unlike the taxis. Overall a great stay, with few if any negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: AirmileAlex
Reviews.Content: Immaculate hotel in the heart pf Sydney - stylish without being pretentious & good service which retained Aussie sensibilities. Calm environment

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but there are better options in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: CanberraLad
Reviews.Content: Main problem: the staff try hard, there are simply aren't enough of them to look after the guests. I had to wait an inordinate amount of time to be seated for breakfast, and then had to chase down one of the poor wait staff to get a coffee after sitting there for without caffeine for 20 minutes (pre-coffee time is not a pleasant time). On checking out I has to wait while a complex situation was resolved in front of me: only three staff on the desk at peak checkout time is not good enough. The up side: the room is roomy and pleasant, bathroom clean and functional. The conference room we were using was fine, and refreshments tasty. If you get a deal or someone else is paying, then it's fine. Otherwise, there are plenty of other options in Sydney for the money.

Reviews.Title: “room to learn”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: actual arrival date in Sofitel hotel was February 14. There was some confusion with our booking because of our one-night free stay. Reception (William) sorted this out for us. Next time we wil book a room without a bath because of the danger of stepping into the shower. I nearly had my holiday ruined when the plastic mat slipped. The service was very good. Although I was charged for a meal which we didn't have and the free day was not deleted from the bill. Cockroach baits need to be placed in rooms as we stumbled over a big one. The lounge service was very efficient. The breakfast was acceptable. But the plates needed to be warmed. As with the meal as well. Otherwise we were very impressed on arrival with efficient service and look forward to another stay. Thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Fiona M
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight for a business trip. The hotel looks stunning as your walk in, so I expected there to be a decent level of service. Such a let down. At the reception desk the girl asked for my name and credit card to check me in, asked me to sign a receipt, and then put my cc and room card on the desk and walked away. Errr...how about telling me what floor I'm on? How about telling me where the elevators are? I guess I just had to figure that out for myself. The room was quite nice. The beds have feather overlays which feel very comfortable, but I find difficult to sleep on as they mold around you and make it impossible to move. I ordered room service as I got in quite late. They couldn't make a steak sandwich as they were out of stock (!), so I ordered a burger instead. They said it would be an hour wait (again (!)) and true to their word it took at least that long to arrive. And when it did, it was cold. And dripping blood everywhere. My only consolation is that work was paying for it, not me. By this stage it was too late to complain and I didn't want to wait another hour....such a shame that this hotel doesn't offer the full experience - great amenities AND great service.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable room when you are out all day”
Reviews.Author: RuralDreaming
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after booking a mystery hotel, and I think if we had paid full price I would have expected a little more. Â We stayed in a classic room and while small it was clean and tidy. Â The bed was a king size and comfortable however there was a definite ridge that could be felt in the middle. Â The bathroom was clean up till about 1.5m high, after that marks can be seen. Â The cost of room service and the mini bar was a joke, probably the most expensive I have seen, however the lounge in the lobby provides light meals at a fraction of the cost and even a few breakfast options for $10 (although it wasn't open Saturday morning). Â The staff were very attentive and helpful, my only issue was on the Friday we put a do not disturb on the door. Â When we arrived back at the room in the afternoon there was a note saying they didn't clean our room and to call housekeeping if we wanted anything. Â We then left and came back to our room around 6:30pm to find housekeeping cleaning our room and she was not happy that we asked her to leave. Â Aside from this the staff were great. Â Overall we enjoyed our time at the hotel, however I would most likely only go back if I wasn't paying full price.

Reviews.Title: “A night in the city”
Reviews.Author: Grizzly888
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay in the city on a Saturday night after attending a show at the State Theatre. We were fortunate that a friend had gifted us a night at the Sofitel and included the Club Sofitel option. What a treat! All of the staff we met were friendly and professional and our experiences with Club Sofitel were most enjoyable. The special check-in for Club Sofitel was super fast and efficient, our room was comfortable, spotlessly clean and the bed was like sleeping on a cloud. We thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary hors d'oeuvres and sparkling wine before setting out on the pleasant walk to the theatre. The only downside for us was that the hotel does not have a pool or spa but everything else was first class. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The sofitel was excellent, bed was really comfy and room was a good size and all very clean. We ate ate the resturant and it was excellent. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The only down fall was we werent able to book into our room until about 3.30 as it wasnt ready but overall it was an excellent stay. Will be definately staying again.

Reviews.Title: “sofitel wentworth sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel but if paying $250 a night or more i really do not think it is worth it,have stayed in better rooms at least than half the price.The service was fantastic and the Valentines dinner was well worth the money paid .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Antonio-ASJR
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay with family. This is a traditional Sofitel which means nice amenities, well kept property and kind of friendly staff. Check-in was a bit slow since only one gentlemen was on duty Saturday morning. Weird part was that checking out on the middle of the week was exactly the same: a long line with just one person to check a bunch of people out. Overall, it was a pleasant stay, with silent rooms and a extremely comfortable bed. Location wise, this Sofitel is at a walk distance from all main attractions such as the Royal Botanical Gardens, Darling Harbor, Opera House and The Rocks. We did the "hop-on hop-off" bus which was ok. Sydney is easily explored on foot so you might want to skip that. Went to Lord Nelson Brewery twice and I do recommend a pint of Nelsons Blood. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Another great night at the Sydney Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: carltonCanberra Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Another lovely stay at the Sofitel. I really appreciate the recognition as a regular guest, with a quick agreement to a later check out as I had an international flight to catch later inthe day Location great

Reviews.Title: “Not far from Sydney Harbor”
Reviews.Author: IneffableTX
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here due to a flight connection cancellation. Hotel was nice, pretty lobby and we had a "luxury" room on one of the top floors. No views, but easy to walk a few blocks down to the harbor. 10 minute walk and you end up at the infamous Opera House. Loved that! Negatives were with wifi. For $30 per 24 hours you could only use 1 device per room. When we tried others (phone, iPad, etc.) it said already in use by another device even when that device shut down. Wifi also slow and if you went over a set mb then charges increased. Not so great for $30. Room was good but not really luxury in our opinions. It's okay for a night but wifi issues coupled with no views and just average food would send us somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “The smallest bedrooms ever.”
Reviews.Author: heb999
Reviews.Content: The aspect of this hotel that I most remember was the size of my bedroom and adjoining bathroom. It was clean, very stylish and perfectly well equipped with fridge, safe, kettle etc. but finding enough space for my luggage was quite a challenge. I was travelling alone with only hand luggage so cannot imagine how two adults with full luggage would be able to squeeze into a standard room. The bathroom was fitted with just a shower which was a big disappointment as I particularly like a bathtub. The view from my room was directly onto a large office building which required me to keep the blinds closed all the time for decency. Thankfully, the room was well lit. There is no in-house gym but the hotel offers complimentary membership to a good private facility next door. The wifi is expensive. The location is good being situated near to Circular Quay and not far from the main shopping areas, Hyde Park and the Opera House. I must admit I had expected something just a bit better from a Sofitel having found other hotels in the same chain always to be very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: L L
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is its best attribute. The concierge staff were also very helpful but unfortunately overall our stay at the Sofitel Sydney was hugely disappointing. Our room was very small, very noisy (room next to the lift) and in need of maintenance and cleaning. The TV did not work, there was hair in the hand basin, the walls needed painting and the lifts could be easily heard. Not at all what is expected from a 5 star hotel...it is more like a 3 star hotel. After complaining about the noise of the lifts, they did put us into a room further away from the lift which was at least a lot quieter which was good. The TV in the second room did work but again the maintenance of the room wasn't 5 star standard. I would not recommend this hotel, particularly at this price range. There are better alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Discerning-guy
Reviews.Content: Good location- 10 minute walk down to Circular Quay & Opera House- although an uphill walk back. Lobby appears luxurious and wonderfully scented by many lit candles. However, our room although clean seemed a bit 'tired'. The corridors could have done with a good vacuum. Daily charge for Internet access was very high having experienced complimentary access in Hong Kong & US. However, if you go out into the adjacent mall and out down the escalator to the back of the hotel- there is a good cafe on the left which serves good reasonable breakfasts & coffee and has FREE wi fi. Hotel is used by Emirates & Air France flight crews. Bar seemed expensive & a bit pretentious. We had a good time in Sydney but this hotel is not quite the 5 stars it makes out to be.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected!”
Reviews.Author: jk1605
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Sofitel on Collins in Melbourne previously, and had a very pleasant experience, I was rather looking forward to my stay at the Sofitel Wentworth. However that was soon forgotten when I got to my room. Albeit just a Classic Room, I still expected a basic level of cleanliness. In the bedsheets was a mixture of hair and dust. Coming back to the room that night, bugs were found in the bathroom. Then, whilst in the shower on my first day (with the Do Not Disturb sign on the door), a maid walked in, wanting to do the housekeeping. Not impressed at all, and needless to say, will not be returning to the Sofitel Wentworth.

Reviews.Title: “So/so hotel not what you would expect of a Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Pat71
Reviews.Content: Disappointing hotel and there is much better in Sydney within this price range. Check in was ok and the room was fairly modern. However the hotel has no turn down service and the cleanliness in the rooms was basic at best (maybe I am spoilt living in Asia). The bed was disappointing it was two beds pushed together and not what you expect in a king size room. There is no pool and the gym is poor. All in all I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The purpose of our trip was to go to the theatre to see comedian/ composer Tim Minchin and visit the NSW Art Gallery to appreciate Picasso's body of work. Sofitel is a handy location, you just drive off southern freeway and your at the hotel. Service is great at front desk and we also experienced good friendly service at the lounge. The lounge has an excellent range of food and drinks. We also ate breakfast at the lounge and a further lunch because the food was so good and it was very convenient. The Sofitel provides that extra bit of attention to detail in quality of food and service. We didn't visit the resturant or breakfast area but i'm sure that would of been a high standard. Merci Sofitel

Reviews.Title: “Good shower, noisy, soft bed”
Reviews.Author: Slug012
Reviews.Content: The shower was great but this was needed after a poor night's sleep. The road noise seemed to be channelled onto my room. The extremely soft bed failed to provide any back support so I got out of bed feeling aged. The location is excellent but you may need to do some stretches before you are able to function effectively.

Reviews.Title: “Great option if you can get a special deal”
Reviews.Author: Aisle_Walker
Reviews.Content: I'd like to join other reviewers who provided high for this place. I have stayed here a number of times and the good accommodation quality was consistent. I agree the rooms are smaller than other 5-star properties, but the beds seem to be one of the best. As a result, one can find special deals on this property more often and get excellent value for money as a result. However, when the price is over $280-290, I'd consider InterContinental instead.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does not deserve Sofitel brand”
Reviews.Author: ulyssesonline
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. I had high hopes but the room was very small- I upgraded but even that was hardly expansive. On the food side, the room service breakfast was exceptional (especially by Sydney hotel standards), but dinner was spoilt by a very stingy serve of overcooked rice. At these prices, they have to do better. Generally the staff were very good. Location is another positive. However, you can do much better for your money in Sydney CBD. I am giving it three stars but one for value.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Traveller123
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights in this hotel. On check in they made a mistake and gave me the incorrect room. Then long wait to correct it. I do not mind the mistakes by the bad attitude bugged me. It was as if they were doing me a huge favour sorting this out. This negative non proactive attitude at reception leaves a bad impression on the hotel. Rooms are dated and could do with some renovations. Location is good, but there are other 5 star hotels - I have stayed in that are better locations / better views and have better service and room quality. On every request called through to reception the initial answer is no, when challenged to double check, I was put on hold and then the answer changes to yes - we can help and provide what was requested. This is not good enough. Perhaps better training will fix such situations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Sofitel Wentworth is a great place to stay - perfect location for getting to the shops or Circular Quay for other connections. Lovely rooms, comfy beds, very clean, excellent helpful staff and a great price. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay at the sofitel in sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this hotel was a poor excuse for a Sofitel. my room wasnt cleaned at 4 pm and the excuse was that they had other guests to attend to. deluxe room is not up to sofitel standard. the restaurant was understaffed. everytime i called for assistance to remidy a problem i was told asap. NOT GOOD ENOUGH however i must give a very good comment for nick the conceirge. he was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation”
Reviews.Author: LucyHudski
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 days with our 17 month old daughter. We stayed in a Club Prestige Suite and there was enough room for her to enjoy walking around in. The hotel is modern and well maintained. Our room was clean. The hotel reception / lobby area is amazing, beautiful chandeliers and flowers. The staff were very friendly. We had access to the Club room where the food and drink was great. We ate breakfast there and afternoon tea which saved lots of money. The staff were attentive and friendly. The hotel is close to the Botanical Gardens and the Royal Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. Great hotel, I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Bad first up experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Sofitel Wentworth in Sydney for the first 2 days of a 10 day NSW North coast holiday we were initially greeted hospitably and told we had been given an upgrade. This turned out to be a mistake. When we informed staff that we did not wish to have a twin share but the King size we booked we were taken to floor six. This happens to be the smoking floor (very obvious) and my wife is asthmatic. Upon explaining this to the concierge we were made to feel he had been put out. Back to reception. We finally get the room only to have a broken toilet seat, someone had been sitting on the bed and the blinds did not work correctly (worn). The toilet was fixed promptly but the bed never remade as promised. By this stage we decided not to make any more requests and just left it as is. There were some positive elements (beds were comfortable) and staff excellent in the bistro but on leaving we were charged initially for 2 phone calls we never made and left paying more than we believed we should have. Having spent the rest of the week in excellent accommodation along the North Coast, we can say with certainty, the Sofitel Sydney Wentworth is very much overrated.

Reviews.Title: “The 'Club Sofitel' and excellent service keep us coming back!”
Reviews.Author: peznee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have had 3 stays as a couple and we have had one stay with our 3 young kids (all within the last 18 months). This hotel is our default setting when staying in Sydney! Each time we have stayed we have enjoyed the 'club Sofitel' level of accommodation. The club lounge is a hotel within a hotel concept and it is a serene, tranquil place to relax. The check-in and check-out service at this lounge is sooo relaxed and effortless. Without rambling too much; the service is the jewel in the crown. A quick example of this was on the day we checked out we decided to take the kids to Taronga zoo. We left our bags in the room and the staff arranged them to be stored (we had about 15 pieces of luggage!!), headed off to the zoo, got drenched in the rain and 3 hrs later returned to the hotel; cold,miserable and wanting to leave. The concierge wouldn't have it and took us up to the lounge again (remember we checked out 3 hours before), he arranged for all of our luggage to be delivered to the lounge and we used the bathroom facilities to shower and get warm again.The bathrooms in the lounge are the most opulent I've ever seen and they are pristinely maintained.The mirror has a heater behind it (similar to floor heating) and the radiant heat coming from the mirror onto my frozen body was blissful and hedonistic! After showering we were then invited to have a hot drink and food at the lounge (remember we have already checked out and they are still looking after us!!) During all of this the staff were engaging the children and they couldn't offer us enough help. Charles was an absolute gentleman to my moments-before-frazzled wife. We left the Sofitel warm, dry, fed and grateful for all the kindness we received. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: adeymac7
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel. We checked in at 1.30 and our room wasn't ready so was advised to come back to collect the key. We got back to the hotel at 5pm and finally got into our room at about 5.45. How a hotel can only have one person on the check in desk is beyond me?! I asked the girl at the check whether our bags would be brought to the room and she said "I Don't know". Ok then, I'll find out myself shall I? We were rudely awoken the next morning at 8.50am by loud drilling outside our bedroom door. Not once were we notified that renovations would be taking place at this hotel. 8.50am on a Sunday morning isn't the most reasonable of times. All in all a really disappointing stay. The staff did as lettle as possible to help and didn't really care if you weren't happy. from the reviews on this page it seems the management doesn't care about the running of this hotel either.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevinpng
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Wentworth is a Sydney institution and maintains a sense of prestige. Location is very good - an easy 10 minutes walk to either Circular Quay or Martin Place. Rooms are well appointed and functional. No complaints and would be happy to stay here again for the right rate.

Reviews.Title: “Five star price but not five star service”
Reviews.Author: vacancer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK - not offensive but, given the high tariff, I would be embarassed to recommend it to any overseas visitor who has experienced real five star service. We arrived in a taxi and carried our own bags to reception. Reception was friendly but service was what you would get in a suburban motel. That is, we were given our card with room number and told which floor it was on. Off we went on our own. The room was clean but with no character and the bathroom was small but functional. I had forgotten to bring my mobile phone charger and called for a spare charger (a service offered by the hotel) but the person on the end of the line brushed it off as unavailable obviously not even interested enough to make the effort to find out what type of phone I had. This was actually the attitude of the hotel, politely doing as little as possible. We didn't eat in the hotel because when we ordered two similar cocktails, they arrived looking quite different from each other, i.e. one was quite dark and the other very light. Also, I found it a bit pretentious for all staff to great guests with "bonjour" and then when I continued the conversation in French, they all coyly advised that they could only say "bonjour" - what was that about??????? Good points - we were tired, bed was comfortable, room was quiet and we were left in peace. Checkout was cold and efficient, with no-one offering to carry our bags (and when we were checking out we saw lots of new arrivals lugging their own suitcases). We were not asked if we had enjoyed our stay. I have stayed in Sofitels overseas and I hope that the lack of service I saw in Sydney was an aberration as it was embarassingly bad.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location, decent value, great service. Expensive internet.”
Reviews.Author: remhed
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights to wrap up our 2 week trip in Australia. This is a very nice hotel- solid 4 star, very classy. Room was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was very clean and up to date, but it had a "European" shower. By this I mean it has a step-up tub with no enclosure, just a small partition on one end. I do not like this type of set up as water seems to get everywhere and I am cold in the shower. But that is small quibble. All of the staff we came across were top notch, especially the counter staff (check in / check out). The location is outstanding. You are between Circular Quay and the shopping district (Westfield / Queen Victoria Building area). There is a lounge at the hotel, but we did not visit it. I did not see a restaraunt and we did not use room service. Like a similar experience at another Sydney hotel, my main complaint is the internet service. They charge you for in room access, and it is really a restrictive scheme. You pay for a block of time, and within that time you are restricted to the bandwidth you use. I don't remember exactly the limits, but I paid for a 24 hour block of time that cost about $25. After uploading maybe 5 pictures to my blog i was already over the bandwidth limit. At that point you can either pay more and maintain your connection speed, or they basically degrade your speed for the duration of your time block. If you want to upload pictures or are using email with attachments, this arrangement is wholly unacceptable. I am tired of hotels using this as a profit center...

Reviews.Title: “Top rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozrick33Sydney
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel my Wife and I have stayed at on many occasions. It is a perfect place to sleep and unwind in and we will sometimes come here just for two days relaxation. It is also handy to come to after a concert in the city. Being a Sofitel it is very much influenced by French themes and cuisine. The food at the restaurant is excellent and the room service, equally appealing. The decor is refreshing and its in an excellnt location for shopping in the city. Top hotel in superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Sofital stay 20 - 22 January 2012”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was excellent except for the service for breakfast on both days of our stay was very, very slow. This also was experienced in the foyer bar. Waited 25 minutes to be served at about 3pm on the Satruday.The TV in the room was quite small and the picture quality was very poor. We were told that this was because the cabling was analogue and the TV image was digital and that the wiring had not been upgraded when the hotel was refurbished. When watching the tennis it was impossible to see the ball or identify who was playing

Reviews.Title: “Seems like the GFC has hit the Sofitel Wentworth”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We (maybe now used to) go to Sofitel Sydney at least twice a year. Early last year cost cutting became patently obvious. This year the hotel with the exception of the main lobby appears very, very tired. Quality control appeared to be non existent, burn marks in carpet & timber bench in our room was tolerable but a chipped rim on a glass in the bathroom & an old lip stick stain on a bar glass simply is not. I have visited both Brisbane (in the height of their flood recovery) & Melbourne Sofitel's in 2011 & both were far superior to Sydney. I hope we don't have have find another hotel for our next trip to the city, (Vivid Festival in winter). Once a happy customer! Kyle A Hill

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, beautiful lobby”
Reviews.Author: NkkLndn
