Reviews.Content: Very convenient location - walking distance to good restaurants, shopping and station for transport links. The lobby of the hotel looks beautiful as well. Not sure if I just got a particularly basic room (don't think I did, as it wasn't lowest price available) but was poor decor - white painted room with no pictures etc. Wifi is available but very expensive - more for 24hrs here than I pay for 1 month at home. Bed very comfortable and good bathroom. Make sure you ask for a view if you want one, because otherwise all you will see is another building! Didn't try the restaurant but cafe opposite (outside) is brilliant for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “courteous”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was one of the best hotels we have stayed in in the accor group. The little extras, complimentry drips , and the tray of goodies in our room was a nice touch. WE were celebrating our 48th wedding anniversary so it was special.

Reviews.Title: “Look out for the specials”
Reviews.Author: SusanPerth
Reviews.Content: We took at room at the Wentworth for 4 nights after finding an online special. We had a suite with a large living area, bathroom, second toilet and spacious bedroom with a king bed. Access to the Club lounge was included. We enjoyed an excellent breakfast and evening drinks and canapÃ©s in the lounge. The club lounge staff were attentive and friendly. The location is excellent. Circular Quay, Government House, the Botanical Gardens and several museums are only a short stroll from the hotel. There are also several bars and restaurants in the immediate vicinity. My only criticism was the noise that seems to travel so easily from the restaurant to the rooms. On our first inquiry about the sound, like someone dragging a chair over a tiled floor, we were told there were renovations happing on the floor above us. When the noise kept us awake until late one evening then resumed around 6am the next day we made a trip to the next floor to investigate. There were no signs of renovations. In fact it appeared from the newspapers on the doors that there was a similar occupancy level to our floor. We then asked another staff member who told us the sound was indeed people dragging their chairs over the tiled floor in the restaurant several floors below. Apparently the sound carries through the various shafts in the hotel. We were told we were not the first to make a complaint. Although the noise wasn't excessively loud we were probably kept awake more through intrigue that anyone was working so late and began again so early. It was very disappointing that we had apparently been lied to by a staff member. I would only rate housekeeping as average. Apart from some of the staff not acknowledging you as you approached them one member didn't even respond when greeted. The cleaning of the bathroom was not up to standard and there was not the level of attention to tidying the room that I expect in a 5 star hotel. Although the hotel has the use of a gym it was surprising to find there isn't a swimming pool. Despite our disappointment regarding the noise issue I would recommend the hotel and consider it on a future visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good, standard 5-star hotel but experience was soured.....”
Reviews.Author: Bennelong
Reviews.Content: ....by a ridiculously expensive daily internet charge of $28 per day. And even that had limited time and downloads! Breakfast was also not included, which is pretty average given the cost of staying there. Otherwise it is in a handy spot close to most of the big Sydney attractions, good service, and rooms of a quality you would expect. So a four-star TA rating but would not stay again as I feel the sting of being slightly ripped-off.

Reviews.Title: “Failed to meet expectations...”
Reviews.Author: DrGuinness
Reviews.Content: I'm a regular at Accor hotels worldwide, the Sofitel naturally being my preferred brand. My recent stay, however, at the Sofitel Wentworth Sydney was disappointing. I arrived rather late in the evening as my flight was delayed. My A|Club status provides free room upgrades where possible. On this circumstance, because it was a weekend and I was checking in rather late, there weren't any available, however the reception staff tried their very best, and I was able to get an upgrade to the top floor, which I was grateful for. Admittedly I booked the bottom-basic room they had to offer as I was only there for one night, so I couldn't expect a luxury suite, however the room was really a shoe-box. Europe is known for small hotel rooms, but this was woeful for a 5-star luxury hotel. My A|Club status also allows for complimentary welcome drinks, which I didn't see at all... The bathroom doors were doors belonging to a wardrobe or closet. The room had been recently renovated, however I'm not sure they had finished it: there was an ironing board in the room but no iron; the television didn't work; I didn't get any slippers; there were little white flecks all over the place from the new paint-job; and the bathtub was dirty. Of course, this could have been resolved with a call to House Keeping, however for this level of hotel, I should have expected this to be checked before the room was available. The room was positioned right next to the lifts which ensured I was bothered by the lift motors running all night. I realise someone has to stay in the room there, however it was still annoying. On the other hand, the staff were very courteous and helpful, except perhaps the three male bar staff who were all more interested in chatting up a Spanish tourist than printing the bill for my $9 cup of coffee. Perhaps my expectations of the Sofitel brand are set too high. I would be hard pressed to stay here again, especially when there are hotels offering a much better product, better rooms, better service at a much better price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay, normally pretty expensive though.”
Reviews.Author: Adrian182
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with our stay in Sofitel Wentworth. Room was very comfortable, very good bed (usual for Sofitel), and would definitely stay again. Location wasn't that good though. A short walk from Wynyard station. We did not have a good view - unless you particularly like construction sites. The restaurant in Sofitel also could not be faulted. We are very fussy travelers, but would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: kballtraveler
Reviews.Content: My initial impression was that the hotel was well appointed and had excellent service. The room was a bit small, but that may be typical of Australia. I thought the location was excellent. It's a short walk to public transportation, Circular Quay, the botanical gardens and close enough to the Sydney Opera House. My only complaint or word of caution would be regarding the bed. It was clearly two twins pushed together. Again, this may be typical, but the mattresses were different firmnesses and there was somewhat of a hard edge between the mattresses. It did prevent me from sleeping in the center of the bed. While it wasn't much of an issue because I was travelling alone, it could be a hassle if you were with a significant other.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near trains, ferries and buses in Circular Quay making it very easy to explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Jef1011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel for 4 nights in early January. The hotel room and bathroom were a standard size...not too big but enough room for all of our luggage. The hotel staff was friendly. Room service was good but it's very expensive. I know all of Sydney is expensive but $150 for 3 burgers/sandwiches with fries and bottled water is ridiculous. However, I do recommend this hotel because of its location. It's a short walk, about 5-7 minutes to the main transportation area in Circular Quay where you can catch a bus, train or ferry. Because of its location, we didn't need taxis. One warning if you take the train from the airport to the hotel. The entire walk is uphill (but not to steep) which can make it difficult if you have a heavy suitcase. Recommended things within walking distance: - Take a ferry to the zoo - Take a ferry to Manly Beach - Climb the bridge - Take a bus to Coogee beach and do the 4 mile coastal walk to Bondi. Gorgeous! - Eat brunch at MoS (museum if Sydney) - Eat dinner at Cafe Sydney (expensive but view is incredible) - Eat dinner at Spice Temple Again, great location with friendly staff. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great. Noisy renovations”
Reviews.Author: Trave1_lover
Reviews.Content: First impressions of the Sofitel were very pleasing. Lovely entrance area with the most amazing smell coming from all the candles that are lit in the evening. The porters were friendly and prompt to take our luggage and reception efficient resulting in smooth check-in although I did feel they were a bit pushy in trying to sell upgrades. The room itself was a standard 5 star hotel room, nothing special but nothing to complain about either...... Until the morning. At 9am we were woken by loud banging and drilling, unsure of what it was we assumed it was a one off and went out for the day. However the next morning when we needed to rest the exact same thing happened. Complained to reception who explained some of the rooms were being renovated and admitted it was a known problem for rooms on our floor/area.... My question therefore is why are they accommodation people here without warning them about it at the very least? We were offered a different room but as we had to be up for an early checkout the next morning didn't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Robyn12
Reviews.Content: The Wentworth doesnâ€™t have the stunning views of the Sydney harbour and so canâ€™t compete with the other big, grand harbour side hotels â€“ but what the Wentworth does have is superior service. From the moment we entered the hotel, we were welcomed sincerely and nothing seemed to be too much trouble. The concierge was knowledgeable and organised as bridge climb for us (highly recommended) and a ferry ride to Bondi beach via lunch at Watsonâ€™s Bay. The room was clean and there were plenty of fresh towels.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Change”
Reviews.Author: AlanGelder
Reviews.Content: What a difference to our shocking reception at the Grand Mercure Newcastle. We were treated & greeted to such an extent that we really felt privileged & valued as Accor members. Our second visit recently & although the only views available are over Chifley Square, the location of this hotel is great for shopping restaurants & Sydney's attractions. An excellent restaurant at the hotel, great service 7 an enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Nick2012 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the staff at the hotel to be exceptional from checking in, the welcome drink to helping us find our way around. The location is amazing, the beds are very comfortable - i highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful service and over priced”
Reviews.Author: notleighanymoreUk
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we had a very bad stay over the new year. We paid for a city view room but were given a room looking at a wall. When asked to be changed we were then sent to a smaller room next to the lift. Both times when we complained to the front desk, they couldnâ€™t be bothered to apologise. We ended up taking the review with no view. We paid what we think is a very extravagant amount because we wanted to be in Sydney over the New Year, there were probably other hotels where we could have stayed for the same price and had better service. The rooms were ok size but the bathrooms were tiny. The location was however good, which is what I guess you pay for. Next time i think i would look into somewhere in Darling Harbour. I would think twice before boking the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was good”
Reviews.Author: jpm_105
Reviews.Content: Bit of an issue with my booking on check in and they handled it very well. Did end up in the smallest room with no view but I didn't see it as a negative. It was all very acceptable. Breakfast was very good but not outstanding. Rooms were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday trip”
Reviews.Author: Fearless01 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Travelled with another couple to celebrate my birthday. We had dinner at the Garden Court and had a wonderful evening. The food was fantastic and the service was excellent. We also had breakfast each morning and loved the buffet. Location is perfect as it is a short walk to the Quay and ferries and also our favourite pizza place, Zia Pina at the Rocks. Final mention of a big thanks to the concierge, who was excellent and nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Kodak”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Sofitel Sydney was Magnificent, right from the moment you step into the grand foyer, be politely booked in and shown to your room, you feel welcomed. Nothing is too much trouble. My room, Prestige-was amazing. I had been upgraded for my 6 nights stay. Spacious, spotless, super quiet and yes, I felt spoilt. Very large King bedroom, loads of cupboard space, fantastic full bathroom, seperate lounge room containg high quality furnishings, great desk and their restaurants are of a high standard. The hotel's location lends it to be not too far from anywhere. 2 blocks south of Circular Quay (ferries) was an advantage, bus service excellent, close to The Rocks, Darling Harbour & Quality shops within walking distance such as The QVB.. Enjoy, no negatives in this Hotel. Kodak - Hunter Valley

Reviews.Title: “New Years in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ImBusyB
Reviews.Content: We arrived quite early for our 3pm check-in and the reception staff was quick to accomodate us. We were able to get into our room sometime around 10:30am, which was so hepful after a 15 hour flight. The beds & pillows are really comfortable, which is hard to find these days while traveling. Breakfast was included with our stay, or else I would have NEVER spent $80 AUD per day on what was available. If breakfast isn't included in your rate, there are plenty of other options at the harbor that cost much less and boast better scenery. WiFi is not included, however we spent the $28 for 24 hours one day so we could catch up on emails, etc. You can get free wiFi at plenty of locations around Sydney for quick e-mail checks, just keep your eyes open. The location is perfectly central - steps away from Circular Quay, The Rocks, the Opera House, Botanical Gardens. In Circular Quay you can take the ferries to all sorts of destinations (Manly Beach, Darling Harbor, Toronga Zoo) or a quick bus ride to Bondi Beach. Transport is not at all expensive if you purchase a weekly pass (which is good for busses & ferries together). We never had to resort to a cab. It was also cheaper to pre-book transport to the hotel as opposed to hiring a taxi. We did that last year and it was quite pricey in comparison! Take a scenic cruise on the harbor if time allots - we used Sydney Sea Cruises for NYE and cannot sing their praises enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but noisy due to refurbishment works!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several time, but this time there were refurbishment works and these did make a bit of noise during the day. The manager of the Cafe / Bar made us feel very welcome and remembered us from last time. He is outstanding and we appreciated his care and service.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay at Sofitel Wentworth”
Reviews.Author: SydneyNessie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel Wentworth for one night in January. Standard rooms are small but adequate, what you expect in Sydney. Rooms next to the lifts are noisy at night, not to be recommended. Beds and pillows very comfy. Staff in every area were excellent, warm welcome and efficient. Garden Court very pleasant place for dinner and breakfast. Ten minute walk to the quay, 10-15 minute walk to the top end of town.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Rating a Joke.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated as a 5 star establishment. It is unfortunate that my stay was anything but 5 star especially considering we were staying over Christmas! First, there was nothing but confusion surrounding my booking - something I have never experienced with Accor before. Then, we arrived to find that the room was shabby and in need of a serious renovation (as an example, the blinds were hanging from their mounts) Apart from this cups in our room were dirty (ie. they still had lipstick on them!) and the glasses chipped. Overnight we were periodically woken by furniture being moved on other levels and scrapped across a hard floor - a blood curdling sound at the best of times let alone at 1, 2 and 3am in the morning. There were other numerous incidents over the period of our 4 day stay but they are just too many to detail here. Surfice to say that you can't complain about the service, because there was so little of it. As a Sydney resident, and being aware that there were international guests at the hotel, I was embarresed to think that this is supposed to be one of the best hotels in Sydney. Sofitel Wenworth, you need to get your act together as you are a discrace. Might I suggest that some of the management go to the Melbourne Sofitel on Collins and see how a 5 star hotel should look and be run.

Reviews.Title: “Room was already occupied”
Reviews.Author: frank m
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for my wife's birthday Checked in to find that room we were given was already occupied but according to their system it wasn't. waited approx 45 mins for them to sort it out which then left us in a rush to get to the Opera on time. We were given a free drink at the bar from a predefined list while waiting. Bath in superior room was not suitable for adults. Breakfast was good but a bit short staffed, waited ages to order tea/coffee and then no tea spoons on table. Not a true 5 star experience

Reviews.Title: “great stay with sofitel club lounge”
Reviews.Author: hensby1 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We are members of Accor Advantage Plus and upgraded our free night accommodation to a superior room with the added bonus of the club lounge. We went mid week so there was no problem with availability. It was fantastic. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great escape. The upgrade cost $150 and we got a luxury room, the bed was magnificant, the room quiet, you could not believe it was the middle of the city. Late 4pm check out, speciailised reception, afternoon tea, complimentary drink at the lounge bar, pre dinner drinks with canapes, breakfast and after noon tea again before leaving. Transport was at the door, we walked to the quay for a ferry ride to manly. A true 5 star experience in a 5 star hotel. The Best!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was for our stay in December 2011 but nothing has been received for a survey for our January 2012 stay. I can assure you that will be completeletly different. We tried to book in on the morning of 5th January 2012 and where advised there were no rooms available yet as it was onlt 10.00am. I said that was ok but when we spoke to a gentleman when we booked out on the 27th December he said we just had to say we had made prior arrangements for early check in. The gentleman I had then was great and said give it an hour and come back. On our return we got Rod. Rod just said nothing he could do as computer down and could not look at anything until after 1.00pm. It was 12.10pm by this time. We sat in the foyer and watched while other people booked in and none where turned away. I was getting a little hot under the collar by 1.20pm and I'm sure Rod could see I was a little upset. He then called us forward and allocated both myself and my husband and my brother and sister in law our rooms. He also presented me with a drinks voucher but not one for my brother. When I asked him about a voucher for my brother he said he was given one when he booked in earlier. I advised he had not been given a voucher earlier so he just thru a voucher at my brother. Off we went to our rooms. I was allocated 1106. While awaiting 10 minutes for our luggage we we driven crazy by constant hammering and also a jack hammer. When Ben delivered our luggage I asked him about the noise and Ben advised the hotel was doing renovations and the noise would stop at 4.00pm. Let me say Ben was the shing light in all of this he was the only person who told me the truth and was so polite and helpful at all times. This constant hammering continued until about 1.45pm when I could not stand it any longer and rang to ask what could be done as we were trying to have a rest and with the very loud noise that was impossible. I was told a manager would call me back. No one had called me back by 2.45pm so I called again and was but thru to the assistant Manager and she said she would organise for us to be moved if that's what we really wanted. She was not helpful or sympathetic at all. She said she would have a room ready shortly and would give me a call. At 3.40pm No one had called back so I rang again and was told a room would be ready shortly and if I could just be patient. Well I do not know how much more patient I could have been. This e-mail will not allow any further info I will send an e-mail.

Reviews.Title: “$6 For Frozen Water”
Reviews.Author: littlecossack
Reviews.Content: To be honest the hotel well presented but my biggest bug bear with this hotel is a charge of $6 AUD for a bucket of ice!! Very rarely in my travels have I been charged for ice. If they feel the need to charge for such a basic service then install ice machines on each or every other floor and I'll be happy to fetch my own. Also $27.50 for the internet is again way too steep. Also be aware that some rooms only have showers with no bath. On the plus side I do like the fact they still have smoking rooms for us few left.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel but service levels need improving”
Reviews.Author: flyingroo
Reviews.Content: We had a weekend stay at the hotel and the ambiance is charming and very chic. Our bedroom overlooked the courtyard and the room was well clean and appointed. The bedding and the bed was first class and enabled a very relaxing nights sleep. The bathroom, although on the small side was fit for purpose. Housekeeping was efficient and did a very good job. Concierge was knowledgeable and excellent. The main area of improvement would be in the service levels that we received over the course of the weekend, it ranged from non existent to outstanding. Service in the Garden Court Restaurant was slow on the first day and severely inadequate on the second. Not only was there a wait to be seated, but there were lenghty waits on beverage service also. The range of breakfast buffet choices was adequate however less extensive than other 5 star hotels in Sydney. Check in was also slow, with only 1 staff member at the time we checked in (9pm Friday), however checkout was much more efficient. But at all times staff members on the desk were friendly and professional. Compared to other 5 star hotels in Sydney, the Sofitel just falls short on expectations and delivery of a truly memorable and luxurious stay due to its inconsistencies.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best”
Reviews.Author: JCeeKim
Reviews.Content: Most hotels will have free wifi in the hotel lobby, but this one did not. They also charged $27 a day for internet in the room! That is a bit outragous even for Australia. They are in the middle of revamping their rooms so they started contruction at 6am on our last morning there. They did not give us a warning about this so I was NOT happy. I would probably not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and all round nice experience”
Reviews.Author: OzzieMuse
Reviews.Content: I used my Accor account to book a night at the Wentwoth. Smooth check-in and friendly staff. We were also offered 2 complimentary drinks in the lounge bar which we certainly used. Not a bad selection of wines and beers to select from. Room was nice and clean and very comfortable king-sized bed. We also used our Accor card to dine in at the restaurant on the 5th floor. Certainly well presented food and very tasty. Nice discount using the Accor card too. Overall, a happy experience and would certainly use Sofitel Wentworth again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Sydney hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparklysuz
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here over the Christmas/New year period. I usually stay at the Westin, but was much too expensive, but was very impressed with the Sofitel. The location is good, and close to good restaurants and cafes. The room was wonderful, and the bed was the BEST hotel bed I have ever slept on. Would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 5 star hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms were really nice, couple of excellant touches like compimentary chocolates and drinks made us feel special. The restaurant was brilliant for dinner and the staff were courteous and entertaining, the food beautiful. The breakfast service was a little tardy for a 5 star hotel. We also thought the lobby bar service initially a little slow. The shower in the bath was a disappointing for 5 star, I would rather see the bath go in this rooms case. I know there are other rooms but if I want 5 star I expect better then a shower/bath even if it is the standard room. Please don't take this review as negative as everything else was fantastic, I am just offering these suggestions so that the hotel may become even better. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay over Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and Club level well worth the extra for levels of service and attentiveness. Check out was a breeze. Use of Omni cars for airport transfer was brilliant Close to major shops and mall and even circular quay is a leisurely walk

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay at Sofitel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELEMSYDNEY
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to Sofitel Sydney Stayed 3 nights in a prestige club suite, noticed the differance inservice immediately. The room was lovely and comfortable for my husband and I. Club axcess,Room turn down service each evening with little chocolates and Evian mineral water were all added extras. We enjoyed the club lounge and found it to be of good value, the staff very pleasant and willing to serve you. The location is great within walking distance to the harbour, circular quay, the rocks,botanic gardens and the CBD shopping district. We even walked downto china town and darling harbour, it was a long walk but enjoyable. We enjoyed a meal in the garden court restaurant and again it was lovely.. being Accor Club members the discount is of exceptional value for the restaurant serving such lovely food, We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great value for five star. Being a Accor club member the values seem to continue with complimentary drinks on arrival with chocs in the room also. I would recommend the sofitel to anyone who enjoys getting value for money and a little of the finer things in life.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas without cooking and cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 adult children wished 3 days and nights without cooking and cleaning. We received that and more by the friendly and efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great central business district hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: Very much as you would expect; great hotel with good sized room.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location for downtown Sydney was great. Initially had a std room which was a bit small and had a view of building opposite despite saying city views. Having stayed in Sofitel's before this one wasn't quite up to the same standard.

Reviews.Title: “Belated Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kristina M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel Wentworth for the second time on November 26th, and we were kindly upgraded. We stayed in a Premium Club Room with all the benfits and trimmings. The Club check in went smoothly, the room was really lovely, we had champagne, chocolates and strawberries in our room which was the perfect touch. We enjoyed pre dinner drinks and some canapes in the Club lounge before heading out for dinner. The wine and drink selection was vast, we enjoyed Cloudy Bay Sauvignon Blanc, a good array of mineral waters etc also available. The breakfast in the Club lounge was excellent, the staff all round really go out of their way to assist. All levels of service during our stay were outstanding and Management clearly demonstrated that this is important to all at Sofitel. We both would pay the extra to enjoy the Club benefits when we stay again, definately worth it. Thank you sincerely Mr Panetta and Simone for making our stay a most memorable one at Sofitel Wentworth. KM

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Wentworth Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, Exceptional staff. We were particularly impressed with the quality of food and service in the Courtyard Garden Restaurant. The position of the hotel is very convenient for many tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value with decent club lounge facilities”
Reviews.Author: Cynicor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in early October, in a Prestige suite with club access. Overall the stay was very pleasant and the room was large and comfortable. Check-in was handled well given that we had only booked online that morning and the record of it hadn't actually come through on their computers yet. Given this, the room was not yet ready but they called our mobile as soon as it was. The suite has separate bedroom and lounge rooms with their own toilets and television. The bathroom included bath, shower and one of the toilets and had a good range of amenities included. The club lounge was spacious with adjoining rooms that could be isolated if required. Cocktail hour had a good selection of spirits and wines but only entry level champagne available. The food selection was also quite decent and could substitute for a light dinner if you were that way inclined. The one drawback is the club staff never mention last drink orders, something we have come to expect from other lounges, but this may be because we were sitting away from other guests. We took breakfast only once and that was in the club, where we found nothing to complain about. We were uncertain whether breakfast could also be taken in the main restaurant with club access rooms. We had room service once, which we had delivered to the club for dinner, and found it to be good value and quality, as far as room service is concerned. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants in the hotel but there are plenty of good restaurants nearby, as the hotel is located close to the centre of town. It is close to the harbour bridge, Hyde park and the ain shopping streets of Sydney, as well as a train station and bus stop. Check-out was simple and easy, but I noticed an additional charge for the room on my credit card the next day despite having pre-paid the room rates. This was rectified via a single phone call and email, with a refund received within the week. Booking on the internet, we got a very good rate for the room, making the stay overall very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Liars”
Reviews.Author: NotHappyJan68
Reviews.Content: We booked and paid for the superior room 3 night new years eve package in early October. Upon arrival on the 30th at 3pm we were told that the room was not ready (2pm check in). When we finally got into our room after 4:30 we found we had been placed in a standard room. The first response to our inquiries was that we should have been informed that we had been downgraded due to lack of availability. No apology, no offer of compensation, no offer to refund the difference in price, nothing. When we took it to the next level we were offered free breakfast, but still no apology. When we said that was unacceptable we were finally offered a paltry sum as a refund. We asked to see the manager's manager, finally he told us the truth, that refurbishment on a number of the rooms was running behind schedule so they had a shortage of rooms, hence the downgrade. On our suggestion that we should be upgraded rather than downgraded he said the place was completely fully booked. An hour later however we finally got him to offer to move us to a superior room. In other words, he ha previously lied to us. Unacceptable. We never ever we offered an apology.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent value hotel in the Sydney CBD. Walking distance to major business venues and tourist attractions including Circular Quay and the Opera House. Staff are pleasant and helpful. Standard rooms are not exactly spacious but more than adequate for a business visit. Only minor issue was that we were not upgraded despite being Accor Plus Gold members - maybe there weren't any rooms available.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Robert454 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service upon arrival very good everyone very pleasant. The room had a very pleasant outlook and bed very cosy had a great nights sleep. Location was great as we used buses to paddington and train to Bondi. A biscuit to have with our tea and coffee on arrival would have been nice. The best thing was just being able to relax in lovely surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Quick get away before Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend joining 'Club Sofitel' if staying more than three days. Great location to the central shopping district of Sydney. The Hotel was very comfortable and great value for money. The staff were always genuinely friendly and ready to help if needed. Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and helpful. Great service and a lovely restaurant environment. Really made our stay enjoyable. Able to leave car in garage while we went shopping. Convenient location as just a short walk to major shops.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Carolyneb
Reviews.Content: Great bed. Good stay. Staff were friendly and efficent

Reviews.Title: “Blissful Luxury and Generosity”
Reviews.Author: Expectans_expectavi Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We checked in at Club Sofitel which was an enjoyable experience in itself. All the A | Club/Platinum Advantage Plus benefits offered without asking. The Club offered a full afternoon tea with sandwiches and scones. Evening drinks and canapes much enjoyed. Breakfast, also. Service always very pleasant, but needed reminding. Drinks vouchers in the downstairs bar produced Christmas cocktails! Enjoyed eavesdropping and people watching. King room good size and comfortable. Occitane toiletries fragrant. Service down a notch because we waited while the two downstairs reception staff had a gossip with someone else. Also the Restaurant head lady at lunch wasn't particularly helpful or pleasant. When I booked the night before the staff were lovely. The concierge map directions were wrong. I eventually looked on the website we showed them. Tip - look for a good price for Club Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and we stay there few time a year. Each time however, the check-in and check-out process take an extremely long time, waiting a long time to check in is frustrating. It's not even that there are not enough staff (although this contributes), it's just that the check-in process itself take so long. While I would recommend the hotel to others it would come with a warning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Not so good on the maintanance”
Reviews.Author: Drew Jones
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel Sydney Wentworth again for three nights in late November 2011 and had booked a Junior Suite, as on my last stay here I found the standard rooms quite small. As an Accor platinum member I asked for and received an upgrade to a Suite on level 15. The suite was a good size and in good order. A comfortable lounge area and separate bedroom, we were very please it had both a bathroom and a powder room. We did however have a few problems with the facilities in the room, the Nespresso machine was faulty and after many, many calls to have it replaced, they did not replace it but said it worked, it did occasionally work at random, the Hotel made me feel I was at fault, even though I had told them I have three of these machines including a commercial one that I maintain for work â€“ I know how they do and should work. We also had ooze in the shower â€“ this was a dirty coloured liquid seeping from the bottom of the tiled wall. We also had to request the hand held shower be replaced as it had sharp bits on it â€“ this was done but not without argument. The ooze was to be addressed once we left the room â€“ this was ok with us as we did not want a room change. We also had the door to the minibar fall off while we were here â€“ based on the poor response to the Nespresso machine we did not bother to attempt to get it repaired. The Club in the hotel is one of the best I have been too, excellent service, good range of food and drinks and free internet. It was mostly quiet except for the occasional loud conversation or noisy child â€“ I would book a club room again based on my experience here. The check in and out was easy, the staff were friendly and the hotel is well located both by road and foot, clean, and a haven from the busy streets. Although I was disappointed with the Nespresso fiasco and shower ooze I would not hesitate in coming back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, good location, smallish rooms, great breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: vardon
Reviews.Content: The room itself had an exteremely comfortable bed and felt luxurious but not in size. The view was nothing special. We found the staff very helpful with numerous tips, directions and customized trip planning. The concierge helped us make a dinner reservation that suited us. He gave us tips about visiting the coastal areas, directions to pick up our rental car and went out of his way to offer ideas to improve our short stay. The lobby was tastefully decorated for the holidays and we enjoyed a complimentary drink in the lobby bar. They had a creative drink of the month. The breakfast we had at this hotel was the best of our 3 week stay in Australia. I would definitely return to this hotel. It seemed the best value for a hotel of this high caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: AuntyNives Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Whilst close to the city centre, the NOISE from passing traffic during day/night was very loud and obviously the windows are not double glazed! Reception and Concierge staff are helpful and polite but the wait staff in both the Lounge and Garden Court Dining are inexperienced, unkempt in appearance, inattentive and basically rude. I have loved my experiences at Sofitel in Melbourne so was extremely disappointed at my stay with Sofitel in Sydney. Calling Reception and asking to speak with Guest Relations, I was told to except a return call...this did not occur: Very disappointed. On a good note, the beds were very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “4 star groundlevel, 3 star rooms and zero service”
Reviews.Author: Trip_Datum
Reviews.Content: My main question after staying there on a business trip for 3 nights was: Did I stay at a Sofitel or at an upgraded form of Imbiss? Main problem 1: Rooms are very small and poor for a Sofitel. Poorly equipped, with no style and poorly served. Frankly if you were putting me into the room without knowing where I am I would have never though that this is a Sofitel room (or a 4 or 5 star hotel room). Main problem 2: Internet. It is crazy expensive and one night it was not working. I called the reception and they told me that they can do nothing and I have to call the internet provider myself!!! They gave me the number of the provider to call! And I was so desperate for internet connection that I called the provider myself only to understand that the help-centre was not operating at that time. I called again the reception but was helpless; Neither the receptionist nor the shift manager did anything to assist me and overall they were unresponsive and they didn't care. The best thing now: When my connection came back (after many hours) they charged me double and I had to make an issue when I was checking out. I mean how you charge twice internet for one night?! Overall the price quality ratio is one of the lowest I've ever experienced in any kind of hotel. This is a freaky expensive hotel and it provides no service at all. Definitely I will NOT recommended to anyone and I'll never go back there.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A centrally situation hotel of superb quality. We arrived late having been delayed, the check in staff were very efficient and although the restaurant was closed our room service meal was as good if not better than we would have expected from any restaurant. Next morning we received the same top service from all other members of the staff. Tip - let the staff know what you want and they will do their utmost to help you achieve it.

Reviews.Title: “Time out”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived until we departed everything was taken care of for us, nothing was too much trouble. Very warm and pleasant atmosphere with genuine caring staff. Close proximity to circular quay, the rocks and Opera house gave us many hours of enjoyment and beautiful restaurants overlooking the harbour. This hotel was within walking distance of cbd shopping and entertainment. We enjoyed a very romantic time within the hotel and the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Special deal”
Reviews.Author: grapex
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wentworth Sofitel on Saturday night 17 December. Accor had a 50% discount on the room rate but forgot to advise that the 50% discount also applied to the room size room and even greater discount on the size of bathroom. Combine this with the sound of the lift all night, which was located adjacent to the room, this hotel has been poorly rated if they are 5 star. The previous night I stayed in the ageing Novotel North Beach Hotel and the room had less mould, less mechanical noises and more room than this Sofitel. When complaining at checkout, the response was they are Heritage Listed. So does this make it acceptable to have sub-standard accommodation?

Reviews.Title: “Pre Xmas visit with family and visit to the Picasso Exhibition”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four days at the Sofitel, used the Club Sofitel through our Accor Advantage Plus, really good way of staying in the centre of Sydney, up grade was great and the beds are very good, staff were great and we would recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Choukie2007 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This stay i spent More Time in Sydney. The weather was not Good. We had a warm welcome back at our arrival. We arrived early and the Check in Time was at 14.00. The hÃ´tel was fully booked. The concierge kept our staff untill we get a room. That s great, we were able to visit Sydney. The room was Nice, clean and a Nice view on the garden. The breakfast was excellent in the exÃ©cutive lounge. The cocktails are Good in the lounge at the ground floor. The christmas trees are Nice. I finally get my laundry back after a long delay. I ll dÃ©finitely come back. Thank you for the chocolatÃ© in my room. The prÃ© dinner canapÃ©s was excellent in the exÃ©cutive. The meal in the restaurant was Good.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff excellent position”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaJulian Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I visited Sydney with my 10 year old daughter, we have stayed at the hotel previously, and came again because of the child friendly ambiance. Though this time it was less apparent than last. Great for walks to the art gallery, museum and the shopping district. Rooms are small but adequate, spotlessly clean, staff usually helpful. We ate in the restaurant twice, which has a children's menu, nothing spectacular but good. The beds are very soft. Overall a pleasant stay, not luxurious but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There are two issues of which I am disappointed with. 1.I used a number of A club vouchers to pay for my accommodation. The 8 A club vouches I used equated to $480.00 USD but the hotel only valued the Vouches to $420.48 AUD. Considering the Australian dollar is near parity with the US dollar it appears the Hotel is taking advantage of A Club members. 2.As a platinum member of Accor I believe members are entitled to room upgrade. In my circumstances I mistakenly paid for the upgrade when I booked the room but was never credited. These items may be an over sight of the Hotel but I would like to hear back from them so as they can give me their point of view. Thanks Paul Allsop

Reviews.Title: “Same old, same old.”
Reviews.Author: oziwarren
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Sofitel Wentworth twice a year, not because of the wonderul experience, but because of the location, smack bang in the heart of Sydney. After staying around ten times, I have a very low expectation of this hotel. I still have yet to hear "welcome back" when checking in. Room was booked for two people, yet only one bath robe in the wardrobe. Because we stayed in a city view room (at the back of the hote)l, the bathroom was larger than if we were in a garden view room at the front. I just wish that Accor had another luxury hotel in the vicinity of the Sofitel Wenthworth. I stayed at the Sofitel in Melbourne around five years ago, and this hotel leaves Sydney for dead.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people”
Reviews.Author: sunset079
Reviews.Content: Check in took about 3 mins, courteous and efficient, no lingering, all smiles and polite. Room was well presented, and a bottle of fizzy for our anniversary. Car parking is by valet, which seems well organised. Breakfast was good. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Amazingly Comfy Bed!”
Reviews.Author: lmeyers108
Reviews.Content: The wife & I stayed here for the last three nights of our honeymoon and after staying in numerous smaller lodges & boutique hotels for the majority of our early trip in New Zealand, we were skeptical of staying at a large national chain. The Sofitel Wentworth, however, proved to be a great choice. We were especially pleased with the EXTREMELY comfortable bed in our well appointed room that also had a small 'juliet' balcony overlooking the courtyard. The staff was friendly, the concierge helpful and the manager was kind enough to welcome us with a personal note accompanied by tiny box of chocolates (champagne would have been a nicer touch, but a nice gesture nonetheless). As far as location goes, the hotel is located in a very convenient location, just a few blocks from the Circular Quay and a number of bus stops even closer by to get to most other parts of the city. Definitely worth consideration if you're looking for a standard, upscale & comfortable room in a great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Accor Sofitel Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well positioned & room very clean & spacious. Staff at all levels very courtesous & friendly. I used a number of units within the hotel, Bar, Restaurant & Club > All of my expectations attained. My actual room was clean & the bed extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Really comfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaUnitedfan
Reviews.Content: Seemed very disorganised at checkin...3pm (check in is 2pm) and they were telling most people that the room was clean but hadn't been inspected. Got 2 free drinks while we waited..but then at 4pm there was a queue at the desk...Finally got to check in, lovely room, nice bathroom (small bath) and really comfortable bed and pillows! Only stayed one night...but slept really well!

Reviews.Title: “Our Ballet trips!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As always the sofitel Wentworth was wonderful. We enjoy the location, the friendly, helpful staff and always enjoy our meals. We choose the Wentworth because of its proximity to the Opera House (where we see the Australian Ballet performances) and the shops (where we usually do a bit of damage to the credit cards).

Reviews.Title: “Resturant Service needs to improve.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel; however the wait in the retaurant at breakfast is way too long. There is an understaffing problem. The young lady does an excellent job but the wait can be 10 minites or more when thre is a line up. Needs to improve.

Reviews.Title: “special night away”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Wentworth was very friendly in its service and one felt that all the staff genuinely cared about you having a good time. Comfortable rooms, albeit slightly older in furnishings. Excellent food in restaurant and superb location for walking down to the Botanical Gardens etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Superb service all round ... from the French check-in receptionist (who treated us to a drink while waiting for our room) ... to the German check-out receptionist (equally warm and chatty) ... and Asian floor cleaning staff in between (spontaneously friendly) ... and the efficient Aussie concierge staff and waiter in the coffee lounge. The European waiters for dinner were also tops, Will definitely consider staying here again ... and glad I asked my wife to join me on this Friday business trip, and stay on for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Not Remotely 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: Kate D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not on a par with other 5 star hotels in Sydney and is very cheeky to charge the same rate as they do. Rooms are miniscule - absolutely tiny. The bathroom is smaller and more poorly equipped than you would find in many motels, and this is in a room that was supposedly upgraded for us to "superior"! In particular, the bath was shallow and barely 1.2m long, too short and shallow for any adult to lie down in, and the shower had appallingly poor water pressure. We were so disappointed that we tried to leave and book the Westin or the Observatory where we knew the rooms and bathrooms actually are 5 star, but they were full. A very disappointing experience. If you like a decent sized room and a relaxing bath, do not stay here. The food was good though, that's the only positive I could find.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bezzaact
Reviews.Content: We booked a "Classic " room and were upgraded to a "Superior" room, given chocolates, a fruit plate and free cocktails which was very nice. Sadly the room didn't, in my opinion, reach 5* level so the "Classic" room obviously doesn't either. The room was nicely fitted out but quite small with a small bathroom. A big crack in the toilet seat was a bit of a worry. We looked out onto the roof garden and could see washing hanging out on two guest balconies on lower floors - tacky! Our room wasn't made up until 3.30 even though we had the "make up room" sign out all day. More staff needed at checkout, there were ridiculous queues. The toilets in the foyer need to be serviced a bit more often, no toilet paper & a broken seat in one of the ladies cubicles. I agree with a previous reviewer about free wifi or lack of - we traveled in Europe last year & SE Asia this year and just about every hotel had free wifi, why do Australian hotels insist on charging for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but average condition in room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Sofitel Sydney is located conveniently near Circular Quay which is key to move around by ferries, bus and trains. Just 3 mins walk and you are at Circular Quay. However the room condition is not good. The TV was not working well and the towel rack fell off its bracket. Worst still there is no free WF. Breakfast is average with limited hot food available, no Asian selection except a miso soup

Reviews.Title: “Bonsoir Madame!”
Reviews.Author: Klarita15
Reviews.Content: Sofitel Wentworth has one of the best locations considering its a high rise, city hotel. Harbour and the Opera house are literally just around the corner as well as busy shopping streets and number of bars, coffee houses and great restaurants. Everything is right in the neighbourhood. The hotel itself is mid-sized with 436 regular rooms out of which 46 are luxury suites. Rooms are not very spacious, but all are elegantly furnished in a light wood and light brown colours. In room you have available standards such as coffee maker, minibar, iron, hair-dryer, fluffy bathrobes and flat screen with decent choice of TV channels. Internet in the entire hotel is chargeable and not exactly fast. I have selected 24hr wi-fi in my room and the data transfer was painfully slow. You can opt for faster connection, but that comes with additional charges on top of AUD 27 you're already paying. You certainly don't wanna miss out on the Magnifique breakfast, which is so deliciously french that you can stuff yourself enough to keep going the entire day. While in town, art lovers might wanna go for rendez-vous with Picasso and visit his exclusive exhibition in Art Gallery of NSW http://www.artgallery.nsw.gov.au/exhibitions/picasso/ Hotel has pretty descent fitness facilities and little pricey spa, but if you get some time off, you can sign up for free yoga classes. Staff is very friendly, profesional and without failure greeting you in french. My overall stay was great, except drunk guest singing Christmas carols at 4am on my floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Motel was very well located as we had a function in Macquarie St in Sydney. Beds were very comfortable and allowed a good nights sleep. View was not spectacular. We booked a luxury room, however I could not see any difference from the standard room (friends next door) Theirs was better value. Booking service from Advantage plus did not work well for us as we ended up paying well above what we thought we had booked. Not the Motel's fault and they tried hard to offset our frustration and provided complimentary breakfast

Reviews.Title: “25th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: All up the hotel and general service was exceptional. We did have one issue with a junior concierge finding us an umbrella. We were told by the assistant on level 5 check-in that if we wanted to look around the city a complimentary umbrella would be provided. That evening we were going out for dinner and were dressed accordingly. When we tried to get an umbrella the junior concierge couldn't find one and pretty much said sorry can't help. We then walked in the rain for 15 minutes to the restaurant in which we both got fairly wet. This was very annoying and was a bad reflection on the hotel as a whole. Kerry Busby

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: STraveller26
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Good location. The most comfortable bed among all 5 star hotels I've ever been to. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent venue for our needs. Wonderful service and bonus extras as we are Accor members which was a nice touch. First Accor hotel that we have stayed at that does this! Could be more economical by not replacing toiletries every day. Not necessary. TV tricky to easily view in standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Benny A Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, but it definitely doesn't live up to its five star rating. Good: the hotel has a nice location and my room was quiet. Bad: the room furniture and carpets are old and stained, on top of that the room was repeatedly not cleaned properly. (I stayed for one week in a Superior room with King bed) I wouldn't stay here again. I'll pick one of the other five star hotels the next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel more than exceeded my expectations for the Brand. The room was very spacious and had top-quality furnishings. The staff were very friendly and attentive. Check in/out was very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great part of Sydney. Close to so many attractions and shopping. The foyer and rooms are always so clean, comfortable and welcoming. The beds are so comfortable. The foyer is always a special experience with the wonderful display of flowers and lighting and the staff are always very helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent -- Presentation, Concierge Staff and Location Not so good -- Size of room, Doors to bathroom , servicing of room Poor -- Restaurant Greetings in French a little over the top, however staff were helpful and friendly, bed was perfect.. would stay again... DB [--]

Reviews.Title: “Romance Package: Junior Suite”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great package , really good value, staff very accommodating, could not fault anything. Will be book several more stays in the near future and have already recommended it to a few friends. Thank you for making us feel so special. Even down to the 40th Birthday wishes for my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Don't give customers any excuse! Don't waste customers' time!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A reception girl annoyed me. I had to collect some document from reception and go out as soon as possible. But a reception girl told me "You talked to operater,not me.....etc". Is that so important information that she can steal my time though I had to go? I pressed 'reception'button on the phone. I didn't know who had answered me on the phone. I was dissapointed because that was my first time I encountered a reception staff who gave me excuse without smile or "I'm sorry". Don't steal customers' time. But I love sofitel. All the staff welcomed me with smile. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money Stay”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at this centrally located hotel in the heart of Sydney my wife and I were made to feel like we were the most important guests there. The service was the best we have received and i would even say it was exceptional and we have travelled worldwide. Just a short walk to the heart of Sydney, for shopping and close to all forms of transport including the ferries. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Rock'n Roll hotel”
Reviews.Author: daijobu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in November 2011. Location is convenient to the office I was working out of in Sydney's Central Business District. Rooms are not big - beds are a little too soft for comfort. Strange arrangement with the bathroom door being in 2 parts like cupboard doors. There was no tub in the room I stayed at, which I was paying over Aud$350/night. Since I was working every day from 9am - 9pm, I only got to see the gym as I walked past it every morning and at night as I returned back from work. I guess I'm spoilt by hotels in other countries, and this being my first visit to Australia, I must say I'm disappointed that they charge extra for everything. My company typically recommends using iPASS to connect to the internet, but the hotel blocks this even though it shows up on the directory upon iPASS connection search. I ended up paying around AUD$30 a day for internet. There was no complimentary bottled water, and in spite of the fact people tell me tap water in Australia is drinkable, prices of bottled water in Sydney is highway robbery - even more than what you'd pay in Paris! 7-11's are a rip-off and so are the CITY Convenience Stores around CBD. If you're looking to buy water or breakfast items, I suggest heading down George Street to the Woolworth's or Coles supermarket for much better deals than the convenience stores. Around the hotel there isn't much going on after 8pm, and walking around at night you stand a chance running into Post-Happy-hour drunks. All in all, if you have business in the CBD district, SOFITEL is likely a convenient, but probably not the best choice for value. I've stayed at other Sofitel's across Asia and definitely this is not one that would be known for its hospitality. One day I had yogurt for breakfast, and left in a hurry for work in the morning. By the time I returned in the evening, I found the yogurt still on the nightstand, and the bins have not been emptied. They even left my tea cups just the way I left it in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, lovely foyer, room could have been larger,staff excellent. Good location and nice bar Only problem tried to charge for mini bar when nothing take. Only reason I checked bill on TV monitor was another gentleman had same problem when I checked in previous day. Trust it is not a common practice by Hotel so check bill .

Reviews.Title: “One night at the Sofitel Wentworth”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Staff were friendly and the rooms clean. The only thing was that the shower was in the bath and was very small. The position of the Hotel was great and meeting clients in the ground floor coffee shop made meeting my clients easy. I would stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Jersey Boys”
Reviews.Author: Jim528977 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel close to the venue for Jersey Boys. I have stayed there previously and was not disappointed. My usual travel is by train but since there were issues with train travel that week we drove. We found the cost of overnight parking quite high and will use trains in future.

Reviews.Title: “Best beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a nice surprise when we checked in at the Sofitel Sydney Wentworth - an upgrade to a prestige suite. The room was beautiful. We also received two free drinks for being an AccorAdvantages member which we used for our nightcap after our concert. Was very convenient to shopping and to the Opera House precinct. The beds were the best we have ever slept in - like sleeping on a giant pillow! Although a little pricier than others the Sofitel Sydney Wentworth was worth it for our little getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean and nice quality hotel, but with extremely small rooms for their price with next to no draw space or bathroom space. Mini bar service was only completed once on a five day stay and toilet rolls not replaced until asked for. As with our last stay with a Sofitel (In Mauritius) we had anomalies with our bill, which had to be rectified. Overall...better than others for the price, but not as good as many for a fraction more.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel very impressive and so are all the staff. only problem we came across was the tv in our room had a set volume on it and you were unable to hear the tv which made booking a movie for 1 night very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Could not of wished for a better place to stay for my wife's birthday........ The service was exceptional, we could not fault anything which makes for a very relaxing time even on a short stay. We can not wait for a reason to return, hopefully it will be soon.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel only”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was very good. In terms of facilities and services there was a lot to be desired for, considering that this was supposed to be a 5 star hotel. There was no pool (as the building was supposedly a heritage building, though that was not apparent in any way as a special feature within the hotel), no hotel spa, the room was average at best, and Internet was available at additional costs only which is unacceptable these days (when will such hotels learn that when even a 3 star guesthouse and coffee shops can provide Internet for free). I don't know whether it is now customary in Australia - certainly never come across that on my travels anywhere else in the world- but the additional charge for paying by credit card was the icing on the cake. So, overall, a very average stay in the hotel so that I would not think of returning.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stay started with getting out of taxi and taking own bags (walking past concierge staff) to a busy reception where we waited 5 minutes to get served. Room was especially small and tired. TV faced a strange way and we felt turning it so we could watch it was risky as it looked like it may fall off space where it was placed. Smell coming from drain in shower and air conditioner noisy. Bed extra comfortable and rooms very quiet (except for airconditioner). Staff very pleasant. On checking out - again no help with bags and waited at least 5 minutes to check out as not enough staff. Foyer beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “A decent 5-star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wabi05
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights, one before my wedding day and two after. I have to say that the Hotel was aesthetically amazing, with beautiful flowers in the lobby with a most pleasant aroma. I had Club lounge benefits which really was luxurious with a great check-in by the receptionist there. Room was spacious, with a great view to the street below. Very comfortable bed. Everything you'd expect from a 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In Sydney for 30th Wedding Anniversary- Obviously a very special occasion these days! Very lacklustre greeting at reception- Concierge was lovely though! Room was VERY small, bathroom very small- have stayed numerous times at Sofitel in Brisbane and Melbourne and loved both, first time at Sydney and very disappointed- Will try Novotel next time. Breakfast - a TOTAL disaster- we were put at a table next to entry desk- place setting for 1, waited 15 minutes, asked for a setting for my Husband, a knife and fork put on table, no teaspoons, no plate,no coffee cups- NO SERVICE- people who arrived 30 mins after us ( in business suits) were offered coffee straight away- no one cleared our table at all- Manager? walked past 3 times, looked at out table with plates on it and walked away- even though rest 3/4 empty at this time. Young lady on desk very involved with imputting customers rooms numbers into system, another staff member stood NEXT to us, looked at table and still did nothing! Will NEVER go back- so very disappointed in Hotel- and I used to work at Sofitel Melbourne! I mentioned my disatissfaction as leaving, and was told sorry- but hoped I had a Happy Anniversary- Well we did, but certainly not due to service from Sofitel Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Attended Wedding in one of the Function Rooms. Food was superb and waiting staff fantastic. Enjoyed our short stay. Room spacious and comfortable, staff efficient and friendly and buffet breakfast great. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Feeling like a special guest”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Checking into our two courtyard view rooms was such a nice surprise for us and our friends, especially with our welcome bottles of wine and chocolate treats! We'd booked the basic rooms as we were attending a concert and leaving early to join a cruise but were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to level 11 and rooms with a view. The only downside was the siren noise in the night. As an A|Club Platinum member of Accor hotels you are made to feel like a special guest, especailly when you stay at Sofitel. The Wentworth is a lovely, well located hotel within walking distance of the Opera House and the Quay. We enjoyed a tapas style meal and our complimentary drinks in the lobby lounge before heading to the Opera House. Breakfast was as good as always with plenty of variety and an egg chef on hand to make eggs to order. We've already booked for our next stay and recommned the Sofitel wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Devastated - so bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: drsmlparso
Reviews.Content: How this hotel is rated as Five star is beyond me. My wife and I arrived at 4.10pm and went to the club lounge to book into our suite for our wedding anniversary weekend. Sorry your suite is not ready we were told, would you like a drink! No we would like our suite considering check in time is 2pm, we finally got our suite at 5.20pm, don't believe the hotel website that all suites have 2 flat screen TV's, we had 2 TV's that were definately not flat screens, more like 15 year old big blurry boxes (see photos). When we questioned the staff regarding the tv's, they said they hadn't got around to putting them in all the suites yet, I said it states on the hotel website ALL suites have 2 flatscreen tv's As we were late getting to our room and had dinner reservations we showered, changed and left. On return we noticed the room was filthy, there had been a drink sprayed up the wall, with run marks down the cupboard, the carpet was filthy, stained and the cupboard that held the bar fridge was rotten and had a huge stain across the front. The next morning we contacted conceirge and told them how revolting the room was, they finally found another room at 3.30pm after several calls to find out how much longer it would be. This new suite was at the noisy street end of the hotel, we finally got the nice flat screen tv, but unfortunately couldn't hear them due to the traffic noise and wind rushing through the unsealed window!!! They said yes the noise is a problem in this room, we are happy to put you back in the old room, I said great, could you ask housekeeping to at least clean the sprayed drink of the wall, nope still there! Remember we had booked there top suite, separate lounge, we were hoping to watch a few movies, room service etc Be warned once you past the glitter of the reception area, its old, dirty, stained and no where near 5 star. Thank goodness we book great restaurants outside the hotel as they saved our wedding anniversary weekend. Thank you Aria, Pendolino and Black by Ezard - great food and service. The staff were apologetic but really did nothing to fix things, when I showed the porter the drink sprayed up the wall and all over the carpet, his response was that is disgusting! Pretty much sums it up, we had christmas lunch at the hotel last year with our families and this was supposed to be a 3 night celebration, WE WILL NEVER GO BACK, there are too many real 5 star hotels in Sydney. Disappointed Starwood Preferred Guest!

Reviews.Title: “Five star class all the way”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay was absolutely fantastic thanks to the great staff and nice food. Would highly recommend this hotel for those who want all their holiday needs met. The room was clean and very modern. It was our anniversary and we were most plesantly surprised to find complimentary chamnpagne, strawberries and chocolate waiting in our room

Reviews.Title: “FIVE STAR HOTEL WITH FOUR STAR SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: aussie_travellers_90
Reviews.Content: This hotel has nice rooms, good meals and a nice reception area. It isn't memorable and if you stay in a lot of hotels you won't remember anything special about this one. The reception on check in was slow with a group arriving but some time before reception staff were called to help. The staff are say all the right things and smile but it really just lacks the warmth. Suggest the Sofitel send some staff up to the Stamford in Brisbane to see the difference.

Reviews.Title: “LOOKS LIKE A FIVE STAR, CHARGES LIKE A FIVE STAR AND SERVICE LIKE A FOUR STAR”
Reviews.Author: Canberra-ites
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel for 2 nights. The room I had had a small window and was well appointed. Whilst this is clearly a 5 star hotel it has nothing distinctive to remember it by. The decor is muted, the food is the same as what you would find in most hotels and the entrance is also fairly standard. I did find the room service very expensive with pasta bolognaise approaching $30. The only disappointing aspect was the check in. I was part of a reasonably large group and it took a while (and an angry customer in the queue) for the reception staff to seek assistance. Other than that the service was pleasant but not memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Quality”
Reviews.Author: cdscons Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel 5 or 6 times over the past 6 months, and the service and facilities are first class. Staff are extremely competent and friendly. Food and beverage service outstanding. Great location in central Sydney. Parking a little expensive, but that is Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ljpoy
Reviews.Content: I read where it is the oldest 5 star hotel in Sydney CBD. I remember having drinks in the lobby bar 40 years ago as a single guy. The hotel has got fabulous character & ambiance. My wife and I stayed there in Nov 2011 in a King Superior room with nice views and included breakfast . It was a wonderful stay and thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Sydney”
Reviews.Author: vixenaus
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business. Very good service, very comfortable beds ! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and helpful.We were able to check in at 12.30pm instead of 2pm and that was good as we were seeing a show at 2pm.Received a free drink voucher for 2 although the bar was crowded and noisy on the day we went. The room was as good as you might expect from a hotel of this class but was expensive given that we are advantageplus members. The Garden Court restaurant served nice meals for dinner but we went to another hotel for breakfast to have a hot buffet as the buffet at the Wentworth served continental. The big downer was $46.50 for 24 hr parking.Far too expensive! We have stayed before and will do so again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Break away”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sofitel Wentworth Sydney more than once and will certainly return. The location is perfect. Staff are more than helpful and very friendly. Rooms are spacious and very clean. Perfect place for a weekend stay. Great food. Good on you Sofitel!

Reviews.Title: “mrs brenda vardanega”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the service and the standard of accommodation.We will certainly stay with the hotel again when in Sydney. We visit the city on business quite often and will make this hotel our base. Thank you for your assistance and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable 5 star in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: JandR_38
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel occupies an older building which has been extensively refurbished internally. Rooms are reasonable size and adequate. Bed was too soft but still comfortable. Bathroom was small but worked OK. Tiny flat screen TV and I could not understand why they would skimp and put in such a small set. For the star price you are expected to pay for the Sofitel i would also expect better complimentary items like a bottle of water, extra milk for tea/coffee, some sort of free snack. This is a good hotel for business travellers but there is better value in Sydney CBD for the leisure traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check in/out was quick and easy. Staff were friendly and helpful. Great room , soft bed. Just what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Location was great just a short walk from railway station . just felt right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but the cost of rooms and extras is very high”
Reviews.Author: travelin45
Reviews.Content: The cheapest breakfast is 35.00 for continental, it would be expected this day and age that Internet would be included in a $350 a night room. Hotels need to get with the Internet programs. The bed was not Sofitels usual high quality very uncomfortable

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasurable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the rooms smaller than expected when we first walked in, as we upgraded to a club room and floor. However, the quality of the furniture was excellent - didn't like the bed....you sank in and no movement or bounce.... The Club service was amazing.....they couldn't do more for you..... A very exciting 2 days - but not normally affordable without the Accor Club card. Thanking you Margot

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Gayle777
Reviews.Content: Everything about the operation of this hotel has improved since I last stayed here several years ago. The staff were superb, the parking well organised and the bar/dining excellent. Very neat and modern rooms with all facilities. One thing I would remember for my next stay would be to bring an airline sleep-mask, as there is a blind but no black-out curtains on the window and the morning light tends to wake me quite early. The French touches make it feel like an overseas stay. Location is very central to the Sydney CBD, shops, theatres & harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean but not what i thought 5 stars would be!”
Reviews.Author: Libs77 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
