Reviews.Content: Room was nice and clean, bed was very very soft, I felt like i was sinking in the middle of it. I thought the room was fairly average considering the price and 5 star rating. I expected more but then again it wasn't bad just nothing flashy. Parking at an extra $47.50 a night was a bit steep considering what you pay for the room. Location is very good as its on the quieter side of the city CBD,but still close to the shops,the rocks, circular quay and the opera house. Breakfest buffet was excellent. Overall its a nice clean hotel in a good location but a bit pricey for what you get for your money and thats extra spending money when you really dont spend that much time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: ELLAACT Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were very warmly greated and given an upgrade, complimentary chocolates (Accord Member) and drinks. Room was very neat and clean, had everything we needed for our stay. Had our drinks at the bar and staff was very friendly and helpfull. Would recommend this hotel very highly.... actually staying there again next week I loved it so much!!!

Reviews.Title: “A warm and faultless destination”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Sofitel hotels are always nice to 'come home to'. Restful, charming and staffed by knowledgeable and professional people. I make few demands and there is never a need to complain, The Wentworth experience was no different this time.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Wentworth Sofitel is positioned in a very central location being a short walk to the shopping in Pitt Street Mall, close to the heart of the CBD and a short stroll to Circular Quay. I have been staying here for business and pleasure for over 7 years. Staff are great, ground level bar is a really good meeting venue and the level 5 restaurant is very good if not a little quiet. I recommend upgrading rooms as the basic rooms are a little sparse. nevertheless, all rooms are spacious, clean and the beds are heavenly. Also your luck with the room can be a bit hit and miss. Try to avoid those rooms near the lifts or those with small balconies (smoking). I was provided with a balcony room on my last visit and complained of the stale smell of smoke. As per usual Sofitel hospitality however, I was instantly upgraded without question or fuss. Great place to stay. If you can afford it and are staying for leisure, upgrade to club sofitel levels with club room access. Well worth it if you are spending a little time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to believe its five start”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel apprence is really nice and the staff are really friendly. However we paid for the superior king room with garden/court yard views and the room that we got was a queen bed with a veiw of another building. We rang up to question this and they insisted that it was correct. Lets say it looked nothing like the photos on the net of king seperior rooms!!! Also be warned that thhe parking is no covered in the price you pay for your room its an extra $47.50 a night.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Lyn255060
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for six nights. The staff were very attentive and couldn't do enough for us, recommending places to eat etc. The hotel was very clean. The beds were excellent. This hotel is very close to Circular Quay and within walking distance. Also within walking distance to Darling Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suite”
Reviews.Author: Sandra W
Reviews.Content: Nice suite, guest service staff were friendly, didnt like the old style TV however the club lounge was absolutely brilliant and well worth the spend. My new place to stay in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Can't get Basics right....”
Reviews.Author: Don2156
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing, tried Sofitel for first time in Sydney, it will be back to the Swissotel for me...when checking in don't answer the phone twice in the middle of the process....just rude. If exercise is important to you forget this place: 5 Star hotel where the gym closes at noon on a Sat! and when the bath was emptied the flood was so bad the water went into the room. Disinterested front desk, and much better value hotels in Sydney, give it a miss.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Sydney?”
Reviews.Author: Countrybloke_11 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times. Every stay the service is first class and the rooms great. They have the best beds in the business for a great night's sleep. We took the choice to upgrade to Club Sofitel. If you really want to spoil yourself, this is the way to do it. You will be treated like royalty and nothing is too much trouble from the staff. When we win the lottery we will stay here for a month!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointingly Pseudo French Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Even the French at their rudest could not compare to this hotel's staff! We were stranded in Sydney by the Qantas Union dispute having driven from Canberra to Sydney to heighten our chances of a flight home to Perth. We arrived late into Sydney but were fortunate enough to book two junior suites at a very reasonable rate courtesy of Accor Advantage Club, however, having provided the check in clerk with proof via our ipad of our booking, payment and confirmation, she proceeded to tell us that the next days staff would have to clarify the booking as she could not. We stayed for two days and upgraded to the Sofitel Club. Upon check out we were informed that we would have to pay the account again and we explained yet again that we had pre paid with Accor and our bank statement showed that they already had our money. When we arrived home to Perth our bank statement showed that they had taken another payment for the rooms out of our account. I have rung the Hotel accounts department, the Duty Manager and the front desk staff, all of whom simply don't wish to return my calls and certainly are not as quick to give back our money as they were to take it.

Reviews.Title: “Always Good”
Reviews.Author: PJMAustralia Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is always a pleasure to stay at this Hotel. They have all the facilities needed, excellent staff, great mid-city location. excellent Restraurant (in the Garden Court). Nothing seems to be too much trouble for the staff, who really make you feel most welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but”
Reviews.Author: BROOZA Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found the Sofitel Sydney to be nice, but we would probably try other options next time in Sydney. We stayed in a club suite room. Highlights: bathroom; club lounge, club lounge service (thanks mainly to Pearce; a truly first rate attendee!). Low-lights: what decade did that TV come from?, what century did the carpet get laid?, and sorry but it's just an awful, awful looking building. Let's call it the best prison we have ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “This is how a hotel should be run!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel at short notice via my A-club membership for a 2 night stay. The hotel is in a very good location, close to martin place train station and very close to the shopping centre. The one most important thing about this hotel that really impress me, is every staff, from reception, conceige, bar, and restaurant all have a lovely smile and very friendly. It really brightens up my weekend. The food and drinks are reasonable price too, and as an accor advantage plus member, i got 2 free drinks at the bar and the 50% discount eating at the Garden Court restaurant with me friend. The room is very clean, and the bed is very comfortable. I left the hotel, a very satisfied customer. Well Done to Soffitel Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: lloydy64 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for our Wedding Anniversary. Was greeted by Benoit, who was quite genuine in asking about our stayed, when i advised him it was our anniversary without a blink we were upgraded and provided with a bottle of champagne and strawberries. The service was first class the room was nice and clean and would have to say the bed was the most comfortable i have stayed in a hotel and that is all around the world. All the staff were friendly and warm. Benoit was there to check us out and remembered us and enquired about our stay. That is what service is all about. Would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at at wentworth”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had particular check in requirements which we thought would be difficult for the Hotel but they solved all the problems, checked us in early before 2 pm and we were very happy. Staff seemed to handle any enquiry/ difficulty without referring to management. Cannot praise the service high enough.

Reviews.Title: “SOFITEL CLUB”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you have the chance join the club for your stay - we did and enjoyed it very much and we thought it was great value eg included in the club was afternoon tea and really this equated to high tea and also canapes before dinner and drinks and then we even had breakfast in there on the Sunday morning and this included hot and cold and proper coffee!

Reviews.Title: “20th wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very clean, but surprised at small room for the big price considering parking not included.. Efficient friendly staff. Little extras for our 20th wedding anniversary were a nice touch. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We couldnt have asked for more after our recent stay with Sofitel Wentworth. Such a beautiful hotel, all staff were always more than happy to help with our enquiries. Will definatly be returing to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A return to my Sydney home”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Warm, loving and welcoming. These words describe our return to my favourite hotel in Sydney. I declare that we received a bottle of wine in our room from the Manager, but there is no bias in my statement that the elements are all there. Great staff, fabulous providence, and a really nice suite that my wife adored. Evening canapes in the Club were great but the Club breakfast was rather second-rate as the staff failed to keep up. Never mind - they all kept smiling! The most telling thing is that we were there on the day Qantas announced its grounding, and the hotel cared for us. This is beyond expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A disappointuing stay. My reservation was for a Superior room with a courtyard view. On check in I was provided with room 1153, which did not have a courtyard view at all. On raising this with reception I was advised this was still a superior room. When I informed reception the room dod not match the description given in my reservation the only comment offered was it was still a superuior room. The hotel may call it superuior but I do not share this view, partucularly in that it diectly overlooks a considerable and active construction site. All in all, a very disappointing stay, with no attempt to deal with me complaint. I will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It....”
Reviews.Author: Tsosti
Reviews.Content: There is nothing negative to say about my trip. From the concierge through to housekkeping every member of staff is totally committed to making your stay memorable. The young man on Front Desk was extremely proffesional and is an absolute credit to his department. all the staff in the Club were exceptional!!!

Reviews.Title: “Night before boarding a cruise ship”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We used our Accor free night so it was excellent value for money on this occasion. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was very small but okay for a single night and close to the cruise ship terminal.. Hot breakfast food in the dining room was cold but variety was good. Enjoyed a very nice dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Excelence”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was so refreshing to be accommodated in The Wentworth Soffitel in the heart of such a beautiful City.Access to all the attractions,ancient and modern was so easy.The quality ,cleanliness and above all the service in the Hotel was impecable and second to none. I look forward to my next stay at a Soffitel Hotel no matter the location.Thank you for your excellence.

Reviews.Title: “City Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For a first time hotel stay in Sydney, the Wentworth was a nice pick - close to all major transport hubs and city sights! Only poor thing was transit to hotel from airport on a "air bus" for $15 each would have been better to travel by taxi and there in a quarter of the time!

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: TAKLAYTON
Reviews.Content: It is just not worth the money. I think I have stayed at a Novotel as good as Sofitel Sydney Wentworth. It was not a bad hotel, but I would not rate more than average for a Sofitel hotel. I have stayed quite a few Sofitels around the globe, I would have to say it was one of the poorest, especially after staying Sofitel Melbourne, which was really fantastic, My booking included daily breakfast. Again, it was not Sofitel standard at all. I was not even Novotel standard either, very close to Mercure breakfast. I had breakfast for three days there, same food everyday, empty plates left on the buffet, no replacement, no juice, had to wait for a cup of coffee for 20 minutes, poor selection of food. Not only one day, but all three mornings. I would not go back there again unless I get unbeatable deal. If i have to pay same money, I would stay another 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fanatstic”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we had such lovely time staying at the sofitel, the people there were so friendly and helpful. the room was very nice and it was so nice and relaxing. the location was great and had no trouble finding publc transport and taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay at an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: THis is third or fourth time we have stayed here and I would recommend it to anyone who was visiting Sydney for theatre, opera or shopping. It is ideally placed for all. Beds very comfortable. Excellent service. Only drawback if staying in summer is that there is no pool.

Reviews.Title: “OLD!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms are definitely not a 5 star standard. Needs renovating urgently. The colour schemes look faded. The blinds were manual in an erra of technology. The pine furniture looks dated.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Wentworth Sydney Australia”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was very high standard. The service and restaurants first class Location central to all of the city of Sydney's highlights. I would recommend the Sofitel Club which for a fee supplies afternoon tea, pre dinner snacks and drinks and breakfast in a private room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value near the harbour”
Reviews.Author: mpc04 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great vealue in a city hotel near the harbour, with very good service. A tad noisy in the hotel with guests running up and down very early in the morning and slamming doors, however a comfortable bed helps in this regard!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The bed in this hotel was so comfortable it was like sleeping on a cloud. The matress had a soft additional layer of foam which is extremely comfortable. The service in the hotel was good, the hotel is well positioned and was only a short walk to the State Theatre and the Pitt St Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location, and the comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi-1976
Reviews.Content: Best hotel bed I slept in for a while! Very comfortable and spacious, though if you donâ€™t like soft beds this may not be for you. The circular bathroom was quite nice, however hubby found the shower a bit of a squeeze â€“ the splash back shower glass doesnâ€™t really cover enough of the bath if youâ€™re a broad shouldered six foot male! Having said that, I found it perfectly fine. TV was the smallest hotel TV I had seen in a while, but the selection of channels was great. Loved the location of the hotel â€“ about 10 minutesâ€™ walk to the Opera House, 20 minutesâ€™ walk to Darling Harbour and 10 minutesâ€™ walk to the shopping areas. If you go shopping in the Pitt Street area, stop by the Westfield food court (level 5 in the Westfield Shopping Centre â€“ fantastic selection, higher end than your average food court but you can still find a delicious lunch for $10 to 15. Very popular with the office crowd so try to avoid the lunch rush during the week). There is a convenience store about a block away if you want to stock up on non-alcoholic drinks or sweet treats without the mini bar prices. Hotel was everything I would expect from a 5 star hotel: elegant lobby, efficient service, well appointed room. It ticked all the boxes though it didnâ€™t quite manage to be truly special. But it was a perfectly good hotel in a great location and we would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with the hotel and service that was given the hotel was great the staff was so helpful as I have used my walker to get the whole was vey helpfull I recommend this hotel to my relatives and friends the service was outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of Calm”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Sydney can be a frenetic place! The Wentworth proved to be an area where the hustle and bustle seemed a thousand miles away. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff, especially at the Concierge desk. Rooms spotless, quiet and comfortable. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: Oange
Reviews.Content: The softel is a real hotel, with exceptional service. Quintessentially great and professional serbic. Rooms are great, depending on location. Make sure you ask or a room away from the elevator. The ones close to the lift are busy and difficult to sleep in. Sone rooms look out directly onto office nicks, so ask for a room with a view. Beds very comfortable and very clean. Excellent location, five mins walk to major city shops and irculsr quay. Expensive, but a terrific place o stay. Plent of eateries nearby so if you don't want to pay hotel prices for food, options glare. Note- the inner city kind of shuts down on weekend, so once office staff all leave on Friday, many eating p,aces do to, but the big city centre still opens. So still shopping available.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Accor raves about Sofitel being its top hotel but I must say that the quality of rooms and value for money is very disappointing. Rooms are too too small, almost felt like a claustrophobic. The cleanliness of the rooms was also not the 5star quality I was expecting....Shampoos were missing from the bathroom and overall the room felt like it needed a renovation (although it's claimed to be recently renovated). I'll definitely not be staying there any time soon again!

Reviews.Title: “WEEKEND GET-AWAY”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd stay at the Sydney Sofitel & unfortunately this time it fell far below previous experience. We booked a luxury room, but the room we were given was quite basic with a very small bathroom. The room safe didn't work & even though we brought this to the attention of the hotel staff, it remained unusable for the duration of our stay. My tip would be to make a follow up phone call after you have received your confirmation booking to make sure you are getting the room you really want. Our room was definitely not value for money on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous friend catchup!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephannie2525 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Another excellent stay at Sofitel - great service, great and such ambience! I love being greeted with a bonjour! We stayed up here with friends, had a drink or two in the hotel rooms and enjoyed a lovely dinner at our fav restaurant - Wildfire at Circular Quay. The hotel is SO close to all our fav restaurants! Will stay again and again, love this place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RandallM81
Reviews.Content: The Wentworth never fails and you can rest assured that any issue you have will always be sorted by the fantastic staff. I have stayed at the hotel on many occasions both for pleasure and business and never had a problem that couldnt be sorted out. My partner and I stayed there over the weekend just gone and the one thing that was a bit different from previous stays was the room - 1053. It seemed to be in the front corner of the hotel and an odd shape, it also lacked the decor of other rooms I have stayed in, no book case setup that is normally around the window. The bed is super comfortable but we had a spilt level arrangment going on. I was about 20cm higher than my partner. Great nights sleep and the staff were going to look into the issue. It is a great location, really clean and good bar ( bar downstairs out the back is also great if you are looking more for a pub...cheaper also)

Reviews.Title: “SOFITEL - AGAIN Maybe NOT next time....”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Comfortable Stay. Arrived in late due to the current Industrial trouble with QANTAS affecting Sydney airport the most at this time. The downstairs bar was not open. It closed at 10 pm which seems early for an Internatinal Hotel. Breakfast Room was busy - many of the items needed replenishing. The Head Staff seemed more interested to get you in and seated than making sure you were looked after. The Room was clean but quite sterile. Just seemed to lack something. Maybe a call from the Reception Staff once you check in making sure all is OK. The simple and thoughtful things often work the best!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Oct 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall nice hotel, but thought the hotel was a little over priced for what you got, but it was a last minute trip and other hotels did not have rooms. Bathrooms small but equipment levels of the room were ok, but did have trouble with the TV and could not get a few free to air channels

Reviews.Title: “Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Junior Suite and it was lovely, the bed was very comfortable as well. Service was excellent from the beginning til the end. Room service was punctual and the food was devine. Location was great-can walk to Circular Quay, Pitt St Mall, Rockpool restaurant etc

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service from all staff was fantastic, the rooms were really clean and spacious, the location of the hotel was great for our needs right in the centre on town and only a short walk to Pitt St. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Baldies Comments”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I love staying at the Sofitel when I can get a booking. These days I find it difficult to get a room it seems the airlines have first preference. nevertheless I was lucky to get a room on this occasion. When I arrive I found that my room was one reserved for a person wit a disability. There were no benches in the bathroom. Had I been advised before hand I probbaly would still have accepted my booking but it would have been nice to have been forwarned. Secondly the toilet hadn't been cleaned and was marked inside...a real put off. Other then that the bed was soft the service good and I had a restful evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beds and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My only disappointment was that a very large payment authority was held over my account during and after my stay which was not communicated to me until after it posed a problem to my personal cash flow and I made enquiries into the nature of the authority.

Reviews.Title: “3 words...GREAT,SENSATIONAL,BRILLIANT!!!”
Reviews.Author: may58 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Don't need to go into things,here. The Wentworth is divine!!! & one of THE best places,we've ever had the pleasure of staying at. The beds are SOOO comfy, they'd be like sleeping on a cloud. We've stayed a few times,here & just keep coming back.The big bonus is its location. Its only approx 300 metres from Circular Quay & the CBD, is just a VERY short walk,away And you never know,who you might see!! (Andrew O'Keefe, from Deal or No Deal, was checking in the last time we stayed). Check in & out was fast & the staff are so helpful. You would be hard pressed to find a fault with the Wentworth. Its THAT good!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We are Advantage Plus members and wanted to stay in a nice hotel that was central. The Sofitel was good on both these points. The room was spacious and quiet, and the staff were very helpful. We dined in the restaurant and had lovely meals. It wasn't too long a walk to the centre of the city and even closer to the Opera House. We would go back there and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have just had an amazing 5 day stay in Sydney where I took my husband for a surprise birthday celebration. Once again the Sofitel Sydney Wentworth did not disappoint us. It is in such a great central location where we walked everywhere. Since we were last here they have extended the breakfast finishing time at the weekends to 11.30am which was fantastic to have that sleep in (it really is hard to get out of those comfy beds) and was lovely to enjoy bubbles at breakfast - we have only ever experienced that at the Sofitel Fiji. Knowing the great service you get and the friendly staff always so happy to help, we will certainly be back again.

Reviews.Title: “A night at the Opera”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very helpful. The concierge obtained pre theatre dinner reservations on our behalf at a nearby restaurant which was very enjoyable. We received chocolates and drinks voucher on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Wentworth”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We usually stay here when we visit Sydney overnight. Very close to Circular Quay for Opera House events, also very convenient to city. Parking easy (on site). Rooms modern, clean, spacious. Excellent beds. Very good room service. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but try and leave the car at home”
Reviews.Author: Gems151
Reviews.Content: Greeted by freindly staff when we arrived early, but our room was ready and they were happy to let us in, and park the car, parking very expensive, I think there could be a reduction for guests. Hotel very cleanand very conveniently located,, beautiful room, staff pleasant but no one took any time to explain any of the facilities to us, consequently we didn't actually use any.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: di_sassy
Reviews.Content: I am acctually a member of the accoradvantage club and got a complimentary overnight stay at Sofitel Sydney. The hotel lobby is very luxurious and the location of the hotel is pretty good. (a 10 minute walk from Circular Quay) Service is also awsome, something that you would expect from a 5 star hotel. The only thing that I didn't like was parking. It was confusing & difficult to find their parking area. Over-all it was a pleasant stay and will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SoniaH255057 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The reception was very prompt and welcoming. There was a problem with the room. When we went in there was an overpowering smoke smell which was not good for my wife's asthma, she immediately had trouble breathing and went outside into the corridor while I called reception. They were very fast to come up and agreed the Non Smoking room had definitely had a smoker staying there. We were put into a different room which was fine. We went down for an early dinner as we were going to the Opera House. The dining room was absolutely fabulous, wonderful decor and the staff very attentive and helpful. The food was really first class. We could not fault one thing with our meals. The new Spring Menu was innovative with lots of choices. There were two small suggestions about the bathroom which we did tell reception about on our departure. The taps in the shower had no colour or markings on the hot and cold taps. Because it took a long time for the hot water to come hot, we thought we had the cold tap on and vice versa. This could have been a very bad thing for either a young person or an old person as once the hot water came on, after several tries, it was very hot! The towel rails were far too small to allow the towels to be easily hung onto after use and because the towels were very luxurious and thick it did not allow them to dry out over night. However this is the first hotel we have stayed in that had the card saying if you want to use them again hang them up and the cleaner actually took notice. It is annoying when one wants to save the environment but are given clean towels every day. I never mark these survey forms excellent in every category as I always think there may be some improvement. I cannot see how any improvement other than the bathroom and the smoking in non smoking rooms at the Sofitel. Thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “i'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we will be back , as we find the hotel to full fill all our needs !! thank you for a great , saddly short stay with you . We look forward to future stays with this lovely hotel and hope that they'll be even better than our first stay , we found every thing , was far above what we had expected !! . SO if you are looking for a place for all your needs the Sofitel has all and more then you will ever need !! Thank You !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, excellent service in the business lounge, we will return”
Reviews.Author: horsefish
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location along with several other hotels at this end of town, within easy walking distance of the Opera House, Circular Quay, the Rocks and the downtown shopping area in the other direction. We have tried some of the other hotels and after this stay, have decided that the Wentworth is our Sydney hotel of choice. Our room was clean, with enough space and good fittings/decor to meet the advertised 'luxury' category. The only downside is the lack of valet parking, which is quite a surprise for a five star hotel. We were directed to take our car around the block to the public car park, which does have a deal with the hotel, and is then parked by the carpark attendants. Given that the hotel new we were driving from Canberra, it would have been good if the welcome email sent a few days before had told us about the parking (lack of) arrangements. Now we know, we will arrive prepared, and will still stay here. The staff in the business lounge were very friendly, fixed a couple of things up with our bill without any drama, found a copy of the previous day's paper when I asked, and overall provide true 5 star service.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice but....”
Reviews.Author: freyjablue
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel but I have a feeling we got the 'dodgy room'. We stayed here as a free night on our Advantage Plus account and I am glad we didn't pay for it. The room was clean but very small. The mattress was sagged and my head went through to the mattress as soon as I laid down on the pillow - with both sides of the pillow puffing against my cheeks - ridiculous! There were also strange noises coming from the speaker at random intervals. Not very conducive to a good night's sleep. The reception area is lovely and spacious with lots of comfy chairs to relax on. The location is also very good. We enjoyed a 10 minute walk to Circular Quay for lunch and another ten minutes to The Rocks for Dinner. The State Library is close by and often has free and interesting exhibitions. The staff at reception were friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, giving dodgy rooms to free-night stayers is not good advertising and we will not pay to stay in this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you like seeing so many airline crew at breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: ValSurreyUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for 2 nights in November 2010 at the end of a trip to Australia. The rooms are spacious and clean and the bathroom ok although quite small. The breakfast buffet was very good with lots of choice and we particularly enjoyed the large selection of fresh fruit. However the Sofitel Wentworth is very much an hotel used by the large airlines and there was always a queue in Reception, usually behind at least 15 flight crew and cabin crew who were checking in for their 2 or 3 days in Sydney before the return flights to wherever they originated from. The location of the hotel is good - not too far to walk to Circular Quay and the Opera House. We had previously stayed at the Menzies (many years ago) and found that the rooms there were much larger and more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff but room quality very poor”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The wonderfull staff and warm reception, with lovely flowers and candles, is let down by the room quality, leaking bath, as the base was warn out causing the water to spill onto the tiled area. Mould around the bath Blood on the wall and used shower cap, still hanging on the door. Faulty electric Kettle that at 1/2 full spat water out and zapped when you tryed to turn off - but front desk advised - thats normal !! No milk, Ice or Ice trays in the fridge. Handy location to Heart of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Luxury Hotel?? A REAL disappointment!!”
Reviews.Author: loki1075
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Sofitel Wentworth for our annual Advantage Plus "free night" and were very much looking forward to staying at the "Wentworth" without our children. Upon arrival were were asked to park around the back of the building and the "door man" kindly took our luggage and assured me that it would be placed in our room upon check-in. We parked the car around the back of the hotel and were told to leave it and it would be parked for us. We were greeted by a very friendly guest relations member at check-in who kindly offered us an upgrade on our free room for a quite reasonable price. Perhaps if we would of had a better stay if I would of paid the extra $150 for the upgrade! I asked about our luggage and I was assured once again that it would be in our room by the time we get up there. We left the hotel and went to lunch before returning to the hotel and going up to our room. We were placed on the 17th floor (top level of the hotel) a long way in the slow elevator. On arrival to our room we couldn't locate our luggage and I had to ring guest services to follow it up (3 hrs after we initially checked in!!) When we saw the room we were very disappointed, it was extremely small (no bigger than an Ibis room)! The bathroom was small and the room was very dated. The TV was small and the range of channels was quite limited. The mattress was very poor quality and the pillows were unsupportive. It was without a doubt the worst bed I have ever slept on (not that I slept much)! Another issue was that throughout the night and following morning we were frequently disrupted by sounds coming from the overhead speaker. As a Accor Vacation Club member and a frequent traveller we were expecting a luxurious stay at one of Accor's Premium hotel brands. In the future I won't be staying at the Wentworth as I know that there are a number of better 4 STAR hotels in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the Sofitel, welcoming and helpful service, room whilst small was ok for a solo traveller, no street noise even for being in the heart of the city, close to restaurants and services

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A lovely Hotel in a fantastic location. Possibly the best Hotel bed I've slept in and the staff are really helpful. I did however have a room directly next to the lifts so if you are a light sleeper then I wouldn't recommend a room in the same location. The rooms are average size but have everything you need for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Diappointment is an understatement!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights to celebrate our anniversary. We choose this hotel because we had heard great things about it....boy were we disappointed! Upon check-in, we lined up at reception (there were two check-in desk and therefore two lines). When we reached the counter (after waiting 5 minutes already), the worker behind the desk simply walked off...he didn't acknowledge us or anything. Meanwhile, the other line was moving swiftly. After what felt like a life-time of waiting, the worker on the other check-in desk offered to serve us! The bathroom had not been cleaned properly and the door to the bathroom was stained with, God knows what! On the second night of our stay, we came to access our room and they had deactivated our card...then tried to give us some pathetic excuse about the magnectic strip rubbing against credit cards; however, when we got into our room, we had left a key card in there (which had no contact with credit card strips) and when we tried that card, it didn't work either! Check-out was no better...very slow process! Parking $42.50 PER NIGHT....most expensive we have EVER paid in the city. We have stayed in some of Sydney's best hotels (Pier 1, Hilton, Marriott, just to name a few), and have never been so disappointed as we were on this particular stay. I would never recommend it and will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Best bed and bath linen in any hotel I have stayed in to date. Quiet well appointed rooms. Central location but no views. I had no need to contact staff so i am not able to accurately rate service quality.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey for a good reason, sophisticated, professional & elegance, what more can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: LorieNakasenh Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wow wow wow wow, just checked out today 2/10/2011. Tick Tick Tick!!!! All checkbox passed with double ticks. Rank 20 on trip advisor? come on, should in be in the top 10. Ok so I stayed here on the 01/10/2011 for the long weekend as a lil romantic getaway, now I must admit that I did go into this thinking it may be really bad due to some recent post here. But like always, I want to decide to myself. Now as you enter you are greeted by a nice doorman, and than you see the grand lobby, and yes its GRAND!!! Maybe not as grand as melbourne park hyatt but you know your walking into a expensive luxurious place. Check in: Check in was really smooth, no complaints, less than 2 minutes. Front desk had friendly and polite manners. Hotel Interior & Decor: That $10million renovations sure did not go to waste, a hotel with great modern sophisticated interior. Room: We booked through hotel website, as always. We booked the luxury room for $360 per night got courtyard views on level 14. Room is bigger than I thought, 28sqm is pretty small compared to other 5 star hotels around but the furnishing and luxurious beds make up for it you dont even notice. The bathroom has nice rich beige marble tones, again very modern interior. Cleanliness: Very very clean, from the furniture, to the carpet, to the bed. Everything you would expect from a 5 star. Bedding: Like i said before when I stayed at sofitel broadbeach, I stand by my first statement, "Sofitel has the best beds so far, compare to any other 5 stars hotel I've stayed at. Expensive, quality beds used for sure! Service & Concierge: Our bathroom light was flickering so my partner called front desk to get that fixed, and you know what, there wasa knock on our door no less than 5 minutes and the handyman did his thing for like 2 minutes and went. Talk about express handyman service. Concierge, what can I say. Nick who is the concierge there was very professional and seems like his been working in his field for years. Not only was he knowledgeable but very very polite and well mannered. I was looking for a steak house near by after looking up a few on our laptop and we wanted a third opinion. Called up nick, he knew alot about the steakhouses around but also recommended us to the hotel gardencourt restaurant and offered to send us a menu to our room. Again less than 5 minutes a knock on our door and someone was there to give us the menu. After careful consideration we called up Nick to book for 7.30pm, and was told he would call us back in 5 minutes to confirmed. When he called us in less than 5 minutes, he advised us that there was no availability at 7.30pm only 7.15pm and 7.45pm, by the time I called to ask for him to book it, it would of been 7.10pm. Nick advised that he knew we wouldnt make it to 7.15pm so he put us down for 7.45pm. That incidently made me impressed, a concierge that thinks ahead and for the the guest and by that time I wasnt even ready yet so 7.45pm. I hope hotel management also notices his friendly and professional service to guest. And yes I will remember this concierge cause he was really really pleasant and because of him we will definitely becoming back...(after ive done my 5 star hotel tour in sydney). So thanks Nick!! Gardencourt Restaurant: Mmmmm yum yum yum, atmosphere? hits the romantic spot with cupids arrow, what can I say. You walk in and you can tell this place is Expensive, sophisticated, luxurious, professional. The interior is out of this world, very classic, very intimate, come on fellas lets take your girlies here. Staff greets you in french, and is very professional. Now I hear from time to time that when people go to restaurant they say the staff are snobby this and that. Now I always take a closer look, to me its not that they are snobby its taking into consideration that because you are working in such a upscale place, the staff need to maintain that professionalism, also having some personality and well mannered because its very easy to get to personal with guest and than lose some of that professionalism. Thats what it felt like at the Gardencourt Restaurant. Food was great and you know what, actually well priced considering that you do have other great fine dining options around and outside the hotel. Meals came out quick, well portioned and service was good. Those Yamba prawns as an entree were yummos!!! Me and my partner only had entree, mains and sides and drinks. Dessert i just wanted to go to Guylian at circular quay. So restaurant is very good. Views: The only thing that you wont get with Sofitel are views of harbour, city skyline or anything like that like other 5 star hotels. You do get court yard views which is probably not that appealing to alot of you guys. BUT Sofitel execs or managers probably know this and thats why they focus on other selling points, service, luxurious and beautiful lavish interiors and beds. Internet & Facilities: Our booking included free wifi and internet usage so hell yeah we brought our laptop, but they do give you a limit amount of data of only 1gig, but who cares, your there to enjoy the hotel or whatever you have plan. The reason we brought our laptop cause it was useful to search for things to do, restaurants and most importantly, YES facebook, saves us from using our phones. Internet is very fast and easy to hook up. Check Out: Fast fast fast, no complaints. Overall & Value: Fantastic stay, certainly a memorable stay and I actually stayed up and wrote a letter to management tellling them how much we enjoyed the stay. $360 per night for a luxury room on a high level floor, courtyard views + free internet & wifi? why not. Come on guys, give it a go. Thanks alot Sofitel Wentworth Sydney for a great spring long weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “another visit another joy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: all excellent throughout except for food- too cold, poorer quality than before. The quality of the restaurant seemed to have gone down quite badly. There was a guy screaming out on the street after 10 PM for an extended period but nothing was done to prevent us from being disturbed. hotel staff were friendly and professional and did what they promised they would do. The sofa was a little worn out and looked a bit ugly. Overall, however, very satisfied. will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Sofitel Wentworth in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the HK department of the Sofitel Wentworth In Sydney, excellent servive from there. Could not say the same with the night manager (asian looking guy). Was very dismissive when I went to collect my second key for my second reservation early in the morning. I do also work in hospitality, and sometimes we cater for 400 above guests, none the less I stop smiling. To me a smile says a thousand words.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Biow H
Reviews.Content: We checked into Sofitel Wentworth on 28 Sept 2011 & since then it has been 1 disappointment after another. On the first day of our stay, we were given a rude shock when someone tried to force open our door. When we called the concierge to find out what happened, we were told that the hotel had sent someone up to hand us a box of chocolate as our honeymoon gift. What was meant as a nice surprise turned out to be a rude shock for us. The hotel staff could have at least given us a call or have the staff knocked on the door & not tried to forcefully open our door. The next disappointment came the next morning. We had left the housekeeping sign on the door in the morning before we left for our day trip. When we came back in the evening, the room was still in a mess, the towels were not changed at all, obviously, no housekeeping has been done. This is extremely disappointing & put a dampener on our honeymoon experience.

Reviews.Title: “Club Sofitel or dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: Hardiman_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on a TV special in August last year and after booking , the hotel rang up and asked did we want to upgrade to a classic room at the front, so we said ,YES, for $20.00 a night extra. When we arrived at the hotel ( no car) we were told that "dont you know that booking in time is 2 pm?" and the receptionist was talking :down " to us. So we decided to walk to the Rocks area to fill in time. When we finally got our room we expected something really nice but it was only ordinary and the small bathroom was 3star. . On to the best part of our stay was the afternoon Hor,D "eovres and wine. It really saved the day. The service was really good and a touch of France. Dinner at night was very French indeed, small meals but quite pleasant. I dont usually go to hotels without a view of water and our view was looking on to the courtyard and other tall buildings. I wouldnt go here again because there are so many better hotels in Sydney . I also asked that rude girl that booked us in, for an evaluation sheet to fill in and she said they dont have one ,its on line.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Wentworth Sydney quality stay”
Reviews.Author: DAVIDXOTIC Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service and Restaurant were exceptional, a calming oasis in an otherwise hectic city. rooms were clean and well stocked, the bathroom could be a little larger however it was well fitted with quality fittings and fixtures, a great 5 Star Hotel in the heart of the business and Historical district of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Room not 5 Star standard”
Reviews.Author: HolidayVibes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a "secret hotel" deal which was still expensive so we were happy to see it was the Sofitel but left a little disappointed. It's quite a walk uphill to the hotel from Wynyard train station but a nice location. Our room was large and very clean. It was definitely 3 star though not 5 star - it was terribly dated, carpet older and worn, paintwork similar. Bathroom was large and clean but such an old bath with minor damage to the enamel, small holes where taps had been repaired and repairs at edge of bath. Nice toiletries. Bed was okay but sheets had small in holes in them. Good selection in mini bar (we didn't use it though as prices were higher than most). Tea, coffee sachets as expected but cups were ancient, one white and one cream colored, not matching. Silver teaspoons had plating coming off the ends. Small Lobby Bar was really nice with good food (we had lunch meals and drinks later at night). Our coffee, tea and wine came with tiny cookies and chocolate which made it special. Staff at Bar were friendly. Check in was good; our bags were dropped off by my husband and held while I attended a course and came back later to fully check in. Checkout was efficient considering there was a queue. It was an overnight stay only but comparing it with a 5 star hotel very nearby I stayed at a month ago, it was disappointing. It seems when you choose Sofitel on a cheaper deal you don't get the 5 star hotel pluses others have written about.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed and delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 1 night and were very impressed. We found the staff very friendly and the service was great. The bed was extremely comfortable. There was a great selection of lovely food for breakfast. The rooms are simple but very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding anniversary overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. Reception & all staff very accomodating,pleasant & friendly. Room very clean & well presented, bed was probably most comfortable ever experienced. The complimentary bubbly was a lovely gesture, breakfast next day was really good especially if you are using advantage plus or sofitel membership.Great central location with short walk to all major attractions & shops.Hope to dine there next time. Parking & drinks are typical Sydney prices.Overall lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our balcony room had a broken latch on the door. It kept flying open. my husband jiggled with it to move the top latch up and it worked for a while. The repair man came and reported to us that it would take a day and a half to fix the latch. We stayed in the room overnight - but it flew open early in the morning. We then requested another room and you guessed it - we were told a room was available and concierge were on their way with a key - but it took 2 hours for them to arrive! it spoilt our stay

Reviews.Title: “Wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for our wedding anniversary and we had a lovely time. The room was great - I had read that they are small, however, this was not my experience - and the feather bedding was just heaven. To top it all off, when we returned to our room in the afternoon we were left complementary wine and strawberries for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “A tad expensive”
Reviews.Author: danielt25 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel Wentworth in a superior room on the 16th floor (out of 17). Used accor advantage plus and got the room for $281. Quite expensive for what close to $300 for the room. However if you can get it cheaper then obviously the value is better. The lounge on the ground floor serves nice food, again using advantage plus card get 50% discount off food. Hotel was a short walk from Martin Place Railway station, that made it a convenient location to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Wentworth Sydney....Cost Cutting?”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite, which you pay a premium for and I was very disappointed to find it rather dark and tired. The carpets are thinning, the lounge was more like a waiting room lounge than a comfy lay back lounge. The fittings were ageing. The bed was great as was the bathroom. The bathroom was top class clean. Windows are not double glazed so there is much noise from the city interfering with sleep. The hotel facilities are beautiful. We were in Club Sofitel which is very convenient, always food and drinks on. While the food is good it has definitely declined in quality since we were there about 2 years ago and service is a bit thinner on the ground but good when you get it. It would be nice to drive up to the front door and have your car taken away and returned as many other hotels do but you have to drive around the back and to the basement yourself. While I did see some concierge with bags etc we moved our own bags the whole time without any assistance. I feel value for money was lacking in so may areas.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, club lounge on lv5 is a must for great value. The room was perfect and the bed ultra comfortable. a great place to stay if you're catching a show as we did at the theatre royal.....................................................................................................................................

Reviews.Title: “Thank You”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I just want to say thank you for making my stay special for my birthday celebration. I was surprised and excited to recieve a beautiful cake from the hotel!! This made my stay even more special. I felt special from the minute i pulled up at the hotel, with my room keys out the front for me, then to be upgraded and treated so special was an experience i will remember and one i truely want to thank you for from the bottom of my heart :)

Reviews.Title: “20 years of staying here - and still my fav Sydney Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: parischris2007
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel on Sydney visits for nearly 20 years now, back when it was the Sheraton Wentworth and stay here for at least 7 nights every year. As a birthday treat, I booked the Prestige Suite, 1651. Lovely big room, and despite having the luxury 'goose down duvet, still provide a spare blanket for those of us who find duvets too hot and prefer a sheet and blanket. There were three disappointments for me - the TVs need updating to flat panels to lift the decor to feel more 'modern'; the bathroom amenities didn't include lotion, which I had deliberately not packed as previous stays have always had it as a given; and lastly, the popularity of Club Sofitel on a Saturday evening meant that there were no seats available, perhaps due to the wedding group in the library area. These are all relatively easily fixed, and not enough for me to change from my choice of hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “always excellent at the Wentworth. A favourite of ours.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: always love it at the Wentworth great staff, excellent food. bed not comfy this stay, too soft & spongy. still enjoy it there. Parking price over the top but i realise its expensive to park anywhere in the city. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for everything Sydney has to offer”
Reviews.Author: Graham D
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. On the expensive side, but when in Sydney.....

Reviews.Title: “3 night deal at Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A good location ,handy to tourist spots with plenty of public transport nearby. A nice ambience at the hotel, breakfasts very good, as were the dinners. Room very clean and comfortable, but a little dated. We were very disappointed that the television set was small and old- needs updating. Otherwise we were very satisfied

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous!!! luxury at its best...”
Reviews.Author: AbhijeetKarajgi Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Best experience I have had staying in a brand like Sofitel. Staff has a humane touch and make u feel welcome and if u need more then, they have the most comfy bed u can get outside your home. Breakfast layout is great and few more f&b outlets would have been ideal addition.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Heaven”
Reviews.Author: dudleybecky Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at Sofitel Wentworth after a long flight from Italy. Strawberries and chocolate dipping sauce awaited to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary along with champayne! Nice touch and very much appreciated. Highly recommend a stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing W'end”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you need a relaxing w'end away i would recommend the Sofitel Wentworth Sydney. The staff were very helpful and went out of their way to make us feel comfortable . The in house food was excellent so was the breakfast. The location was central in walking distance to the harbour and the shops . Will certainly be back in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Dreamtime_2007
Reviews.Content: On entry to the hotel the foyer smelt as though someone was wearing a quite overpowering aftershave (or maybe someone had dropped a bottle), it was still evident the following day. The room was a good size, slightly unusual layout but that is a function of the shape of the building. The room was clean and comfortable, the bathroom was starting to look tired but still fine. Limited Wireless internet was included in the cost of the room, enough to check emails etc. The hotel is located between the shopping district and circular quay, there is not a broad range of restaurants nearby - you will need to walk in the right direction (or eat in). Breakfast was quite expensive, it cost $27 for continental while at another hotel in Sydney that I have stayed at recently they offered an equivalent breakfast for about half this. The staff though were quite attentive. Check in/check out went smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: found the room for the 5 star hotel is to small that is why we only rate this hotel as 3, otherwise everything else was good. For the plus point we were given a voucher for 2 to have a welcome drink at the lobby bar, and found the cocktail was very good and different.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is too much trouble!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mackayvers
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with lovely staff. We found ourselves out of tea bags late at night, and because my wife can not function in the mornings without a cuppa she phoned room service. Within 10 minutes there was an extremely polite bell boy at the door with top quality tea bags. He was also very apologetic. The concierge when needing directions around Sydney was superb. Couldn't do enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for business travellers, but not great if you're paying.”
Reviews.Author: wgtnmike
Reviews.Content: Good location in the CBD and close to St. James railway station which makes it cheap & easy to get to from the airport. Circular Quay is a couple of mins away. We were on a corporate rate so had decent rooms and breakfast included, but you can get much better value for money at the cafe across the street otherwise. My coffee drinking colleagues said the brew was good, and the atmosphere is pleasant. Service though is very slow - especially for a 5 star hotel. The hotel is decidedly uninspiring from the outside and there is no view from your room with the hotel surrounded by other high-rises. The bar and lobby though are comfortable, in fact it's probably one of the nicer hotel bars around. The bed was very good - echoing other contributor's comments, although one colleague said it was too soft for him. No, his name isn't Goldilocks.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms..stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Rosimax
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights. Room was so small was very disappointed. Given other options in city would avoid in the future. Also cross that charge for wi-fi so expensive..if i'm paying $300 a night for a tiny room I expect wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Girl's night out”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great accommodation and location as we were combining birthday celebrations with going to Jersey Boys - everything was perfect ... food and drinks were delicious, staff very friendly and attentive and nothing beats a Sofitel mybed! Can't wait to come back to Sofitel

Reviews.Title: “Just image, no substance”
Reviews.Author: Chevalierlatin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sofitel for two days. The poor service started at the valet parking where we had to wait for 15 minutes before somebody took care of us. Almost missed my morning business session waiting for a table at breakfast time. The elevators were desesperately slow. The bathroom was dirty with several hairs around. We were rushed to leave the bar at 10:45 PM. Very poor quality. I wouldn't recommend this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Mutton dressed as lamb”
Reviews.Author: GS_new_horizons
Reviews.Content: My partner and I got a great corporate rate and we were just staying overnight for a family dinner nearby, but we woudn't pay the rack rate. Totally over-rated as far as we are concerned. A 'has been' 5 star and just not really getting there now. Ok, that's the emotion out the way! Room had been updated - modern fixtures and fittings; king bed reasonably comfortable; flatscreen TV, but the carpet looked original - certainly didn't match the rest of the apparent update. Bathroom on the small side and, despite signs of being updated, the grouting was cracked in places and looked quite weary. Room looked clean, but the tiles in the shower area looked as though they had streaks on them. We like to have tea and bikkies in the morning - there was some tea and long life milk, but no biscuits - just a pet hate! There was also no offer of nor delivery of morning newspaper. As we left in the evening to meet the family, there must have been something wrong with three of the 4 lifts. We waited for 5 minutes or more to be collected from the 10th floor. When we eventually arrived at the reception level there were lots of people waiting to go up. Service was somewhat superficial - they went through the motions at the arrival desk and during checkout; lobby staff muttered some French greeting on a arrival, but there was no gushing welcome, no offer to take bags - no-one to open taxi doors when we returned mid-evening. It was all a bit 'matter of fact'. (I personally find the French greeting in this Sydney, Australia location almost irksome or vexatious. Ok the property has a French connection but come on! I don't expect a "G'day mate how are yer?", but a "Good evening sir, madam" is more appropriate than a French greeting!) In conclusion, it was okay to get the head down for the night, but presentation and service was tired and disappointing for a 5 star property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be excellent in every regard. Staff courteous. Meals excellent. Location excellent. All transport available within a short walking distance, including trains, buses and ferries. We would highly recommend this hotel for all reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rc33
Reviews.Content: Check-in was done efficiently. I was staying in a classic room. The room is quite small and had a smaller tv than what I am used to in a 5 star hotel. The bathroom had a shower over the tub. Also quite small. The bed is probably the most comfortable and always look forward to the Sofitel Mybed as the down comforter over the mattress makes it completely soft. The buffet breakfast is reasonable and service is excellent. Overall I ranked it one star less only because of the size of the room. Last time I was in a superior room and the extra space makes a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juanus
Reviews.Content: In the business district, good location, ok for business. As companies pay, therefore expensive for what you get. If you go for holiday, go somewhere else. Rent a villa, there's plenty to rent around or go a hotel outside of the center. Public transport in Sydney is great, cheaper that way.

Reviews.Title: “Massively overrated”
Reviews.Author: lucybg
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel twice for work. The reception area for the hotel is lovely - that's all for the nice parts. The hotel an unappealing, brutalist, brown brick crescent shape - even more hideous when viewed from inside the hotel. The room on both occasions was painfully small - with room for a bed and a small chair. The mirrors on the far wall of the room did nothing to make the room feel larger. The decor was top-shelf Ikea, but still Ikea - it felt cheap, clearly much less than expected for a supposed 5-star hotel. The bathroom was relatively featureless, although the plastic toilet seat and cheap toilet did give an air of a prison cell. On the plus side, the service at the desk on arrival was good. Overall, Sydney is flush with hotels, so make sure you choose a nice one .... not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the hype!”
Reviews.Author: DoMeAFavour
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the hype or all the 'Accor hotel' staff writing reviews on here! This is NOT a 5 star hotel. The rooms are very small, the bathrooms are tiny, the in-room tv is an antique LCD (not widescreen) from 1998, the internet is very expensive (and they don't even offer free wi-fi in the lobby to just check your e-mail!), many of the rooms have a view of other rooms as the hotel is a half circle design (so unless you want to have an audience when you get dressed you'll have to have the curtains closed) and the staff are friendly until you have a problem that needs sorting, then you notice how full of themselves they are and not really interested in helping you at all, because how could these rooms be anything but perfect! On this visit the room wasn't very clean as my socks were covered in hair after walking around the room with my shoes off after check-in. So unless you can get an amazing cheap deal it is probably not worth staying here. There are much better hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Grand-daughters visit to Opera House”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Wentworth hotel was excellent for our purposes- my grand daughter was performing with her primary school at the Opera house that evening, and it was close enough to walk there and back. Our room was not very large, though that wasnt of great importance. As I paid an extra $40 for a Superior room, I have to admit that I was disappointed at the size.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Sofitel hotels are my favourite hotels anyway, but the Sofitel Wentworth is top of my list. It is in a great location. The beds are the most cpmfortable you will ever find. The service is excellent, you feel like a vip when you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sound proofing required”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very, big rooms, nice comfortable bed, but got woekn up at 3:00 am by screaming kids next door. Sound proofing should be improved in rooms, you could hear also people walking from the floor above.

Reviews.Title: “Do you always get what you pay for?”
Reviews.Author: Azhkman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work in late July 2011. I was in room 711, ironic, no? The room itself offered no view, which was not expected as the hotel is a shorter building surrounded by much taller office towers. The price was around ~300 / night with taxes. The room was tiny! I mean really small. I was offered an upgrade for 60 / night, that would have given me a better room, breakfast, and internet. I only really needed internet, and that is 27 / day. Amazing that in this category, this is not included! Probably because we pay it... The TV was also tiny. See my review for Mercure on George Street, for a hotel that offers a great value for money. The service was great, certainly no complaints there. The location of the hotel is good for business and also good for tourists. As a tourist you would be close to the Domains park, which is next to the Botanical Gardens and close to the Opera House. Circular Quay (pronounced "Key") is a few minutes away and offers plenty of stuff around-the-clock if you are jet-lagged. The room and bathroom were clean. The lobby is really well-done, feels like a country house with parlor and library like area near the elevators. If you want to save your money, you can find brekkie anywhere nearby for less than $10 (the hotel will charge you $30), so if the room size doesn't bother you, you save yourself 33, if you only pay for the internet and avoid the 'club charge'.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, superior service!”
Reviews.Author: g1raffe
Reviews.Content: Went up to Sydney for 2 nights, to celebrate our anniversary, and climb the Bridge! Fantastic location, 2 mins walk to the Botannical Garden, less than 5 mins walk to Circular Quay. They left champagne, strawberries and choc diping sauce in our room, which was lovely. We stayed in a Garden view room, with a view over the courtyard, very nice. A bath in our room was very much an enjoyed plus. TV was quite small in comparison to what we have seen elsewhere. The bar in the foyer had great tapas and drinks, so we just enjoyed them for dinner, as we were still full from breakfast! The Bridge climb at twilight was fantastic, seeing the view in sunshine, then the sunset, and then on the way down, the lights of the city, and the black sky...fantastic! A late check out was easily forthcoming, when our flight home got rescheduled for a few hours later, so we checked out at 1pm, thanks Softel reception staff!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Maritime_Historian
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at a different 5-star hotel in Sydney (my list of reviews will reveal which one) but due to Accor offering my firm a special deal at the Sofitel Wentworth I decided to give it a try.Â  The hotel is good, but not amazing. Nicely located with a pleasant ambiance and some very friendly staff.Â  Big plusses are: - the concierge team greeting you as you come and go.Â  - quiet rooms.Â  - friendly staff all throughout the hotel, - it has a very pleasing decor.Â  What made it lose the true 'wow' factor for me was:Â  - very slow check in, - breakfast in the room arrived with toast cold and soggy, - very low hot water pressure, - drain in sink was clogged on first night (though was fixed on day 2), - each night I had to call the reception to ask for a new in-room breakfast order menu with it taking over 20 minutes to arrive on the last night, - hotel would not honor request for QANTAS Frequent Flyer points.Â  Given it's status as a 5-star hotel I expected nothing less than perfection.Â

Reviews.Title: “leisurely stay in sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with excellent refinements. The scent of the hotel is divine. It is easy to get to and within walking distance of all the major attractions in Sydney. I would recommend this hotel to any tourist wanting a little bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay as Usual”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just an overnight stay, but as usual we were well looked after. As an A-Club gold member our room was upgraded and a 4.00pm checkout accomodated without a problem. The room was clean and everthing was working perfectly. The only issue I had was the bed, which is too soft for my liking. The breakfast was enjoyable and the quality had improved from our last stay

Reviews.Title: “We will charge for our complimentary nights”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed as I found out they later in my credit card statement I was bill A$756.00 for the night stay there. when we check out on the last day I was told all has been settle and no charge. The breakfast Sofitel bill us 100% with not discount for me and my wife We did show them our Accor membership card we expect to get 50% off . I am now writing to them I would appreciated if Accor can help to clear matter up. Our Reservation 22/7 Pauline Lee, F47-0N3N, 23/7 David Yap F47-0NRL 24/7 Sean Yap F47-0OPU 25/7 Daryl Yap F47-0O88 26/7 Sean Yap F47-0P6G All in 5 night.. Thanks David Yap

Reviews.Title: “Great staff. Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: sandy78_travels
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Great location. Great staff. Food could have been a little better (breakfast mainly). But a great city hotel in an amazing city!

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Once again I had a thoroughly enjoyable 2 night stay at Sofitel Sydney Wentworth. As always the facilities, The Garden Court Restaurant and the rooms were excellent. I have the best nights sleep in the luxuriously comfortable beds! The staff in all areas are efficient, friendly and respectful, better than going overseas in many ways.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Response”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: To review this hotel is simple, I cannot recommend this as a good to excellcent hotel as we had problems from the start type of room booked to what we received ,lounge service and billing and quality of food in lounge.Then to finish after leaving a letter for the GM after 4days no reply.Would not waste my time to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great stay but disappointed in the main restaurant. Given its standing as a 5 star hotel I thought the food quality was ordinary. Prawns were tough and chewy and the steak main course came with just steak and 3 croquettes...not even a bit of parsley as decoration! Plate looked very bland and unappealling and the steak had no flavour. On the upside, I had Coq au Vin as a main and it was divine. Location is fantastic and we have stayed here before on 2 occassions and plan to stay again...but will probably avoid the main restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DiChin Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although we booked a club room which was lovely and included afternoon tea, evening drinks and breakfast we were disapppointed that we had to go downstairs to pick up a paper (as it was not delivered to our room even though we had filled out this preference) and there was no one at check out on the club floor and we were told to go downstairs and check out in the lobby which was extremely busy.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good location, great ambience, excellent food and helpful staff. Limited opening hours for the gym and No pool were our only downside. The Garden Court restaurant was good for breakfast and very good for dinner. The Advantage Plus card made it even better.

Reviews.Title: “Grumpy Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TropicSue
Reviews.Content: This hotel just added to a weekend of disappointments, with two fabulous exceptions at Bill's and Rockpool. We stayed at the Sofitel for three nights, the room was excellent although the bar fridge was not restocked during our stay; the staff were all the most unpleasant, grumpy individuals we have come across in our vast traveling life. Not once did anyone smile, it was all too hard. From the desk clerks to the car park staff, each and every one was miserable. We felt like we should apologize for taking up their valuable time! Sadly this was repeated almost everywhere. Sydney needs to realize that tourism is a big contributor to it's wealth. We won't be back unless we have to, and certainly not to the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place to stay right in the middle of Sydney. Staff were first class. Problem with bag not being sent up, had to go back down and get it myself because I needed it. Black out blind broken, had to get maintenence to repair it, which they did within half an hour. Was a Starwood member and changed to Accor due to range of hotels. Usually stay at Westin and the rooms are much larger. The room at the Wentworth was half the size, although very comfortable and well set out. The bathroom was probably a third the size but adequate. For two people I think the room was rather small. Overall I give it an A+ stay.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The locality very good and we could walk to Circular Quay and Darling Harbour easily . Everything is withinreach ,overall we were very pleased with our stay there . The staff were very friendly and helpful and breakfast was a treat especially with our A/CLUB card ,one get to eat free . Will choose Sofitel again for our next visit .

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: SeeingIsBelieving007
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for one night on a business tip through Sydney. Location is handy for anywhere in the city. Service s great - check in staff helpful and the concierge was fantastic, helped me out with a few questions and obviously new the area very well. The rooms were disappointing, nothing wrong with them but they feel dated. The place could do with a rennovation, whilst there were no major problems everything just felt a little worn.
