The quality of the rooms is not consistent with the lobby and quality of service. In summary nothing wrong with this place, but doesn't deliver good value for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “good service - bad room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: service from staff was excellent. room was small (and we had an upgrade) and facilities were poor. bathroom was cramped and tv was smallest we have seen in a hotel. wind up blinds were tattered. bed was king size and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Must try harder!”
Reviews.Author: Coasting10 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel name is let down by the service in this hotel. Whether checking in, ringing from our room, ordering a drink in the bar or finding out something we needed to know, the service is slow, slow, slow. Te Sofitel beds are still heavenly - they just need the service to match.

Reviews.Title: “luxury”
Reviews.Author: jjj2234 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: wonderful weekend, all staff excellent in all areas. club sofitel well worth theextra cost. the staff in club soffitel were the best - helpful, polite, great service, friendly - highly recommended. hotel in good location to all tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Need to pick up their game”
Reviews.Author: Fletch1971
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Sofitel Wentworth Sydney and probably our last. On arriving at the hotel in our car, we were instructed from across the road that the car park was around the back. As you could probably understand, on a busy Sydney Street on a Friday afternoon this was quite difficult to understand from across the road and as this was my first visit, a few more instructions would have been helpful. Anyway I decided to (against instructions from hotel employee) to pull up in the front driveway to unload luggage etc. I was again told that I could not park there and that valet parking was around the back. After some discussions with said employee I was informed that he did not wish to fight with me as I am a guest of the hotel. Very noble of him I thought..... By the way they insist they are 5 star but you still have to drive your car around the back to the carpark where you hand your keys to a third party, separately run carpark. Back upstairs to the foyer where we check in. Given the key and room number, we proceed to go up to our room where the key does not work. Back downstairs we go and we are informed by a different member of the reception team that we were told the wrong room number. On receipt of the correct room number we return back upstairs where we manage to open the door and we enter our room. Finally!!!! The room itself is not too bad although we have stayed in much better, but the bathrooms are very small with the shower over the bath. I really don't like this I have to say but understand space is a critical issue for city hotels. The bed is quite comfortable and the room itself clean. The television is incredibly small though. Our room was cleaned on the Saturday with the previous nights champagne flutes placed outside our room by housekeeping for collection by someone. This was along with breakfast trays etc from other rooms as well. This along with a dirty t/shirt or something were littering the corridors until well into the evening on our return from dinner on the Saturday night. This is not good enough from a 5 star hotel to leave dirty trays and dishes in the corridors for a full day before removal. One last thing is we found out you cannot ring down and have your car brought up for you so it there waiting for you. You have to make your way down to the carpark and ask the attendants there to bring it up for you. Then you wait. Also don't expect them to book a taxi for you as we were told it would be best if we went across the road to the taxi rank. This was ok as there were taxis waiting I simply say this to indicate the level of service and willingness to help by the staff. Overall it was a disappointing stay and we never really felt like we were valued guests of the hotel. I think they are kidding themselves if they think this is a 5 star hotel of the same league of other Sofitels around the world. They simply are not.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ordinary and not really the 5 star flagship I expected of Accor.Rooms were small and simple for the money charged. The real value I suppose was the location in the CBD for business travellers .Nothing really to be excited about.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, dated rooms, not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: mella2007
Reviews.Content: As an Accor Advantage member I have stayed in numerous Sofitel properties around the world, and this is the poorest I have stayed in so far. Reservations are always advisable way in advance to get a better rate, but at the price we paid for 2 nights it was still very costly for this particular hotel. Location: Yes the location is fairly central. 7 min walk down hill to The Rocks area and Pitt St for shopping, less than 10mins in a taxi to the Casino and Darling Harbour area. Airport is normally around 25mins in good traffic. Reception: The lobby area smells fantastic with a lovely perfumed fresh smell. No concierge or porters to help on arrival. Check in was fairly friendly, however explained hotel was room after I asked if any paid upgrades were available. (Booked the Superior Room, which is one above the standard room) Lifts: Lifts were quick, however available to anyone to use, as you didn't need to use your card to swipe in to your particular floor level Rooms: The initial room we were given was filthy...stains all over the carpet and very dusty. A quick call to reception put us in the same room next door which was cleaner. The rooms are very basic for Sofitel standard and more of a Holiday Inn feel than a Luxury hotel. Small desk, ottoman, 24inc flat screen tv, all cheapish made wood furnishings. The bed and pillows are always the highlight of any Sofitel stay and as usual...comfortable, fluffy and a delight to sleep in/on. The blinds had a weird handle that you had to use quite a bit of arm strength to wind up and down...this was a nuisance every time I wanted to see some light. We had a tiny balcony overlooking the inner courtyard. Bathroom was very small....shower over bath, one basin, Roger and Gallett amenities...it always surprises me that Sofitel rarely supply toothpaste as other 5 star hotels do. Linen was fresh and changed regulary and rooms serviced quickly. Rooms not that quiet and you can hear noise from rooms up in the halls. Room Service: Ordered at midnight and took around 30mins. Delicious burger and icecream dessert. Typical prices. Small mini bar...very tired looking plastic jug, one bathrobe, no slippers, dirty lint brush, iron and ironing board. All in small cupboards. Fridge was looking tired (old white) however cold. Had afternoon tea, however was totally full so had it in the library. One TINY scone, and I do mean tiny, however waitress was lovely and did her best though we were far away from the main area. Choice of newspapers in the morning and check out is at 11am. Concierge: Some were helpful, some dissapeared when they saw someone approaching them. We hailed taxis ourselves. They were not overly helpful. Internet: 2 Hours for $10 or $28 for 24 hours of Wifi. Found it hard to get service in the room without buying the Wifi, but made do by going outside or downstairs. Day Spa: Adjoining Latouff Spa and Facial was fantastic and great service. This was a good idea back in the day. It is very dated apart from the lobby and the rooms are in major need of an overhaul at the prices they are charging. Wouldn't stay again, and if you are a fan of the Melbourne Sofitel, this is a very poor distant cousin twice removed!

Reviews.Title: “great pillows”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great location and the attention to detail is one of the best ive stayed in the pillows are great and if you spend a lot of time in hotels you know that this is the deal breaker the room was small but fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Standard rooms are a bit pokey-recommend ugrading to Club Sofitel.Didn't require dinner after drinks and canapes! Great pillows and lovely bed. Lovely staff. Great way to use our complimentary night with Accor club

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: hosiyaar Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: is a wonderful hotel, could not find anything wrong except would have been happy if there were more vegeterian choices in the restaurant. The softel club was wonderful. it had very pleasant atomsphere and the staff there were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Sydney Wentworth”
Reviews.Author: Penfold90 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel - good location just back from Circular Quay and easily walkable in 5 mins. Staff very helpful and Prestige Suite room was excellent - plenty of room and v good bathroom. Bed one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on!

Reviews.Title: “Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the hotel. It suited my needs at the time. The only thing I did not like was what smelt like men's deoderant in the lobby. Obviously it was air freshener, but it was not to my taste. I did not like all the smokers outside the hotel or office buildings everywhere you walked, is there any fresh air in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The wentworth holds good memories for us and whilst the facilities and staff were very good we need to highlight the following: 1.On our 1st morning we were woken at 6am by a an unsolicited wake up call! which interrupted a much needed rest! 2.Newspaper not delivered as ordered. 3.Housekeeping did not satisfactory remake Bed which simply had the cover pulled over. These are not monumental problems but nonetheless,disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “small room next to the elevator”
Reviews.Author: hstone5
Reviews.Content: Not stayed in a Sofitel before so thought that it would match with a Crown Plaza or equivalent. The room was really small almost like in a Holiday Inn Express. I was as well unlucky to get the room next to the elevators. The room itself has equipped in an expectable way for an average hotel. The bathroom has been tiny. Internet & breakfast would have costed 20+AUS. The only thing outstanding has been the concierge who has been very helpful and gave me good advise on restaurants in the area. - Overall, i am not a fan and will book next time a different hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Joint but Breakfast Below Par”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. A warm welcome. Very nice room with well-lit bathroom. I would say to others that its a well thought-out hotel, except for the breakfast room. I suspect went for form over function. It would be interesting to know how long the average staff member would put up with this set-up. The barista needed automatic coffee machines to help satisfy the waiting patrons. You can't expect one person to make coffee for a roomful of people in reasonable time. I left after eating, without coffee. For the following mornings of my stay, I went to a nearby hotel for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Dodge Scent”
Reviews.Author: Raf1966
Reviews.Content: Rocked up at 7.30pm and asked for 2 rooms. The man on the desk (Rodney) was most helpful and found a couple of rooms for $240 a night. We took them for one night but said we might do 2. He was very helpful. He also gave us some discount vouchers for breakfast which reduced the price from $44 to $29 which made it just about worth a go. First of all I can't stand the scent they waft through the air conditioning. I inquired discreetly about the very "male, old spice style" aroma to be informed it was the signature Sofitel perfume used globally. Oops...suddenly I thought of Dominique Strauss-Kahn...why not something feminine and welcoming..oh well the flowers were very nice. I'm not a big fan of these corporate hotels but the kids seem to love them....guess they haven't done lots of business trips!! The rooms were ok....pretty small but nice pillows which my wife loved. The bathroom was small....the bath was small.....ok it's the French thing...i like a shower or a bath...this was kind of in between. Room service was excellent....delivered quickly and with a smile. Food was good. The breakfast buffet was a winner....kids devoured half of it. Internet was for a fee and a maximum of 100MB until it went on a go slow or you paid more for it. Do these people have kids? 100MB lasts about 30 mins.......I'd be here all night if I wrote about this topic so I'll move along. The location is really good. Quick to walk to everything. Slept well on the comfy beds. Gym looked good though attendants were slight officious. Nice chocolate cafe next door to the lobby. Overall I'd recommend it on the grounds of location but I wouldn't get too excited about it. Service was great from the grafters (room service, housekeeping) but slight stilted from the front desk. As for the aroma....quelle horreur!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: a great, central place to stay. bedding and other services excellent.. dinner was amazing. we are members of advantageplus and were given an upgrade without asking. we could walk to opera house for our concert and to see jersey boys on the sunday.A really great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “5* Rudeness”
Reviews.Author: topgon
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at a few hotels in downtown Sydney on many business trips, this should of been the best as it was billed as 5 star luxury, the only thing that is 5 star is the rudeness from the staff!! The room I was allocated sure must of been a store cupboard before a guest room, there was no natural daylight, the window in the room looked out to a brick wall and was also safety glass(with wire in it!). The shape of the room made it impossible to walk around the bed without stubbing your foot! The bathroom was small and basic no tub just walk in shower.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the 08 rooms”
Reviews.Author: kingsleylion
Reviews.Content: I was in an 09 room and I could hear the elevators moving up and down at all hours. Goodness knows what the 08 rooms were like,it must have seemed that you were in the lift shaft ! My door deadlock didn't work,the iron collapsed on my foot,the scent in the lobby was overpowering and the breakfast was hideously expensive for what we received. The bathroom door arrangement was weird and the TV channels/reception were poor. Check-out was painfully slow,apart from that, it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: DSR67 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great bed, nice layout and fantastic service from all staff. Definitely felt a little more special than most places. Only things to improve for the room in this day and age would be to have a bigger TV, put it up on the wall and then use the table for your bag. Oh and why do Aussie hotels still mostly charge for wireless. I would definitely go back though as all staff were really good.

Reviews.Title: “A night at the sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Upon walking into the foyer reception, you know your gonna have a experience, but walking to the room I was a little disapointed, room small, tv was too small, bathtub small, I thought I booked a room with a 2 seater sofa but instead got a single arm chair and ottoman well at least we had a balcony and view of the court yard. That aside we had a very nice time, inroom dining menu was a little limited but some dishes were worth a try, overall a good stay, if I were to come back I would upgrade and choose a different room.

Reviews.Title: “good overall”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the sofitel wentworth is a great hotel with excellent features and good location inthe city. the only let down was the reception staff who were not very freindly, they also seemed to talk downto me as if they were better than me and didnt have time for me. also there is an overpowering oudour of mens aftershave in the foyer. other than these small problems it was a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great to stay in your own city and explore what Sydney has to offer”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Occasionally it's great to stay in your own City. We had a wonderful couple of days exploring the CBD and all it has to offer. We found some fabulous restaurants off the beaten track and the food, service and atmosphere was excellent. I am thinking we will do this on an annual basis!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and AMAZING beds”
Reviews.Author: Irishstandards
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times before this trip! Always consistently friendly staff with a very welcoming modern lobby and rooms. I found the champagne breakfast to be very pleasant although I did make suremy eggs were cooked to order. The rooms are pretty small however by normal standards and no bath in the bathroom not that that really bothers me. But the best thing about this hotel is the amazingly confortable beds! You need to experience them to believe them! Then I course the 5 minute walk to circular quay and all it's landmarks! Great hotel

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Well we only stayed one night so did not get to experience everything the hotel has to offer but the staff were friendly, efficient and numerous (no waiting for anything). Also the rooms were clean, a little small but overall would recommend it to anyone. Now we just have to stay at the Sofitel Melbourne to compare it!

Reviews.Title: “Mary Poppins visit”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great, right from the first contact with staff on Sat 4 July untill we checked out on the Sunday. The staff our always courteous, friendly and extremely helpfull. The Motel is in a great location to the CBD, The Rocks and Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel with a 6 yo and 2 yo”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hi recently stayed at Sofitel Sydney with husband and children. Room was very comfortable we were on 16th floor, nice surprise to have Nespresso machine in room - no way to warm milk though. 2 dbl beds in room which made it very tight but the beds were comfortable except for one. The topper did not fit right and my son kept falling off this big ledge in the bed! All in all room comfortable though small. Breakfast another matter! both tables we were sat at in the restaurant were so unstable it was unsafe to have children and hot drinks at the same table. The staff though friendly were inadequate for the amount of people, we had no salt and pepper asked for some and was told to take some from another table and this set was empty! Yoghurt was incorrectly labelled so ended up with some kind of disgusting yoghurt - also very hard to serve the hot breakfast - need two hands and somewhere to sit the plate - all in all dissapointing for a hotel that charges $38 each adult for breakfast! Parking was also a surprise at $45 which was not mentioned at all on booking or check in!

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Both my wife and I had a fantastic weekend in Sydney. The motel was excellent and the staff were friendly and always there to help and assist. I will be staying here again. The location was close to all attractions and the advice given by he staff was accurate and timely.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay was most enjoyable. All the staff were exceptionally polite and helpful. Our meals in the garden terrace were beautiful as well as lunches in the foyer bar and restaurant. The position of the Hotel made access to a number of our preferred visits very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great position.”
Reviews.Author: 2gnomesinparis
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, in a perfect position, near the botanical gardens and a short walk to the Harbour. The restaurants and cafes in the hotel are very good. The rooms are lovely, bright and modern and very clean and comfortable. Staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Night in Town”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The first room I was given had not been cleaned. We were quickly allocated to another room. The second room was clean, and the bed comfortable. We had breakfast which was nice, howerevr I thought the juices very exceptionally sweet.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Club Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, staff were very helpful, club rooms and facilities were great and well worth a try. Check in was at the club lounge, and afternoon tea, canapes. drinks, and breakfast were all supplied in the club lounge. Our room was on the top floor and amenities were excellent. I would recommend that clients book a room with the Sofitel club facilities, it makes the stay that little bit more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk into the Wentworth you can tell that this Sofitel is a classy joint - friendly and helpful staff welcome you and the place has a wonder ambience. A great place to stay and very well located.

Reviews.Title: “Not a conference venue”
Reviews.Author: Topp1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb 2011 as part of a 300 person conference. The hotel itself was great, although the gym is ordinary. The massive drawback of the hotel was the staffs inability to service a conference group and other subsequent guests, service was snail pace slow, some requests took over 48 hours to rectify

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the expense!”
Reviews.Author: Indie5
Reviews.Content: We has high expectations walking into the lobby, but were sorely disappointed! The room was supposed to be a twin share however the beds were practically pushed together so it may as well have fitted a king! Ridiculous design, hardly any room to move. Awkward bathroom doors - awkward to get in and out and were very noisy. Annoying for the other person if you were trying to use the facility while they are sleeping. Very lame 'garden view' - actually an office building, road, and something like a mini terrace? Completely not what we were expecting for the price paid and brand name of 'the Sofitel'. Also bar was dirty when we went once (needed a good vacuum, and clearing of plates from tables), and the staff were not very attentive on two occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury all around”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: From the moment you step through the doors you can sense the difference. Having stayed in another hotel in Darling Harvour for the previous 3 nights where you felt like any question was an inconvenience to the staff to this hotel where you are greeted by every staff member with a smile and no question was too difficult. I had heard the rooms were small, but I didn't find that to be the case. We upgraded to the courtyard room which seemed was a good move as these room are in a crescent over looking the 5th floor court/resturant plus views out to the east. The lounge at the front near reception actually was inviting and relaxing instead of cold and sterile like most hotels. The restaurant was faultless, again staff were so friendly and helpful. It was like walking into a completely different genre of hotel where service Does Matter! Well done and can't wait to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “my stay at the Sofitel SYDNEY”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We are regaular patrons of the Sofiltel in MELBOURNE, which is always an exceptional experience.In comparison,there were a few disappointing aspects about our stay in Sydney--the main one being that EACH morning the HOT food on offer for breakfast was always COLD.The first morning we pointed this out to the staff,but found that the same thing happened each day.A 5 star hotel should be able to do better.I was also a little disappointed in the state of the carpet in our room--it was either ready for a good clean or up for replacement.Otherwise we had a pleasant stay,with professional and courteous service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This would have to be the best hotel I have stayed at in Sydney.excellent service.the room was nice.the location was the only problem.otherwise really good.I would definitely stay here again and recommend a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you need 'time-out' then Sofitel Sydney Wentworth is the place to stay! We really needed to spend a couple of days and nights away from our jobs, study and exams and this hotel was perfect. The service is exceptional and the bed was so comfortable. Thanks Sofitel Sydney Wentworth.

Reviews.Title: “"My Bed" - pure bliss!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn06469782
Reviews.Content: Arrived here at 11am for 1 night stay, we had upgraded to Executive Club and were welcomed in and offered great coffee etc till our room became available. The room was smaller than expected and the shower was over the bath which is not really acceptable but the bed (My Bed's are especially designed for Exec Club rooms) was to die for .. like no other bed and the best I have ever slept in. We didn't make the afternoon tea but got back in time for the delicious canapes and drinks Unfortunately we had to leave early and missed the breakfast so can not comment. Although we had WiFi as part of the package, we were only allowed one connection which was inconvenient and something we have not struck elsewhere. The check out was very slow, our transport was waiting and we were in a cue of airline people who were checking in and we had to wait close to 15minutes however this will not put me off coming back and next time I will make use of the late check out!

Reviews.Title: “night in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff were very obliging and offered advice on travel options and how best to get around to do the things we had planned. The meal we enjoyed in the restaurant was magnificent and again service was exellent.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Hotel room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The decor of the hotel lobby is grand and the overall service level of staff was exceptional. The only problem I found was the decor and furniture placement in my room was not up to standard of a 5 star hotel. The writing desk and the TV stand was small. The TV itself was small. It feels like the TV stand and writing desk was temporary placed. The picture on the TV was grainy and unclear. The experience of the room was disappointing. The extra space on the TV side wall could be more efficiently maximised to make the room look fuller and grander (the small size of the furniture made it look empty). Furthermore, an envelope addressed to another guest was placed on my desk when I checked in. The staff''s attention to detail may need to be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great Comfy bed you just sink into... good location... walking distance to both Sydney Harbour and Darling Harbour... Good Service... Good Prices if you are able to get one of their specials (stay Three pay for Two)

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to club and save... In the end”
Reviews.Author: cta1207
Reviews.Content: We paid an extra$110 per night (for 2'of us ='$55 ea) and saved. The extra then included breakfast, exclusive use of club sOfitel area, where we ate brekky plus food and beverage any time of dayin the club area, so we at lunch and dinner there. Food during the day includes finger sandwiches, mini gourmet rolls, scones with jam and cream, cakes, fruit. Beverages include selection of teas. Cappuccinos or other coffee styles. Soft drinks and a selection of waters, and fresh juices. So that's morning tea, lunch, afternoon tea taken care of. From 5pm to 7.30pm it is. Free drinks.... Wines, champAgne, beer, spirits and hors duevres that will fill u including hot and cold selections and plenty of it, so that takes care of dinner. All the beverages all day are served by waiters. By upgrading we saved money ($55 day included 3 meals and alcohol). Couldn't beat that. Rooms are exceptionally well appointed and comfortable. Located just near circular key ferries and major shops and famous rocks area all 5 mins walk Service was excellent too. A great place to-base yourself

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Great Location ... but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: abc_rocket_travel
Reviews.Content: Despite the size of the rooms, this was a great hotel to stay in. Efficient service (with a smile) and great breakfast in the lovely club lounge. Thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Sydney Wentworth”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely quiet rooms with ideal location to all entertainment, shopping and transport. Best linen, pillows and very comfortable bed. Tv channels are basic and lack all the stations but ok if you are Fox sports fan. Service was great !

Reviews.Title: “June stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in Sofitel and we were celebrating our 29th Wedding anniversary - only comment would be the check in process could be a bit faster as there were only two on the desk and we had to wait quite a while before we could check in !!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Cannot speak highly enough of this hotel, great locaton, extremely friendly staff. I have stayed at hotels all over the world, the beds in this hotel are the best. Club Lounge staff exceptional, nothing too much trouble. Booked this hotel for my Wedding Anniversary and it didnt let me down. Will be back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Winner of world's smallest bathroom competition.”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneTravelbug
Reviews.Content: Room very tight for space. Bathroom even smaller. Thumbs up for the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Sofitel Hotels”
Reviews.Author: jbfivestar
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel. Although in the business area of Sydney it was just a 10 minute stroll down to Circular Quay, a well known part of Sydney down by the harbour. We arrived very early soon after eight in the morning after 22 hours from London Heathrow. Our room was not ready at this time of the morning nor was it expected to be. All our luggage was swiftly taken and stored and receipts given. We sat for 10 minutes in the lovely reception lounge and then obtained directions from the very pleasant concierge staff to Circualr Quay and we strolled down for tea and breakfast in the sun .On our return our room was ready, approx 10.30 a.m. (an upgraded room due to our being members of A/Club). Following on from our first day we found the hotel and staff just wonderful. We used the all day lounge/bar quite often and the staff were always interested to know where we came from and what we had been doing that day. Service and food were perfect. The hotel came across as very comfortable with beautiful furnishings and chanderliers that sparkled. A definite must should we ever be fortunate to visit Sydney again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In answer to this survey, I would like to mention a couple of things. One, after being awakened at 3:50 am in regards to a fire alarm, we were informed of the situation by one of the staff walking the hallway and further updated over the hotels speaker system. We were also advised that we would be kept up todate,this never occurred and there was no apology at check out. Two, the breakfast, whilst of great quality would have failed a food inspectors test, as the food offered was at best, only tepid to the taste.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star should be better and where are the smiles?”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We travelled with another couple and booked this hotel online through Accor. We chose it due to its close proximity to the Royal Theatre. It is easily accessed from the Cahill Expressway. The valet parking is excellent. Knowing before arrival that access to parking is from the street behind would be helpful. Check-in was easy and the reception area was inviting and immaculate. Rooms are of adequate size and well laid out. Beds and pillows were excellent but there was no top sheet so either the doona or nothing. The mini bar was well stocked. TV was very small and the channel selection basic. Only one robe was supplied. Well appointed bathroom but it was cramped in the shower and there were rusty coloured stains on some of the tiles. Towels were of excellent quality. Our problem was with our Pre-theatre Dinner Package advertised on the hotel website and booked for 6pm. We arrived at about 6.05 and were seated immediately. During the ordering process the Maitre'd advised politely there wasn't any such dinner package and I must have confused the "Quick Lunch". Our waitperson agreed. We proceeded to order a single course as we were advised that two courses before the theatre was a possibility but not a certainty. Our friend checked using his blackberry and there it was. We showed this to the maitre'd suggesting the website should be updated. He came back to our table shortly after with a nicely printed menu he had found for the "Pre-theatre Dinner Package". He apologised that he was a replacement. But what of the waitperson? Were they new too? We were asked what could be done for us but it was too late to change anything. As it was, our single course arrived at 7.20. The food was excellent and the staff unfailingly polite, but the experience was well below expectations. The cocktail bar was closed when we arrived back from the theatre at 11pm even though it is open "till late". Breakfast in the restaurant was excellent. Checkout was easy. Overall, staff are conscientious, helpful and polite but there are very few smiles and in the restaurant at least the apologies seemed superficial and lacking sincerity. 5 star should be excellent not merely near enough.

Reviews.Title: “A city escape”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: short of staff on check in and check out and not friendly at all cleanliness of bathroom not up to standard of 5 star hotel very disorganised at breakfast in restaurant. had to go to counter to ask for coffee when we eventually received coffee it was cold. whole experience rather disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Best beds”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel really lovely, even though we were upgraded to a room with a balcony the rooms were very small and the TV was too small for the room. The beds were the best, had the best 2 nights sleep that I can remember. Even ordered the bedding online before we checked out. If I was to go back to Sydney I would again stay at the Sofitel Wentworth.

Reviews.Title: “My stay for the Shires Conference”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wentworth for the NSW Shires Conference, and the Hotel does a great job looking after delegates and their partners. I was not aware of a special breakfast rate for delegates till the last day, but this may not have been the Hotel's fault. At breakfast, I was disappointed with the breakfast fruit selection compared to previous years, but impressed that the chef's could do any hot dish you wanted. The Buffet Lunch meals for the Shires Conference were still "ordinary", and could be improved. Maybe it is what the Conference organisers ordered, but it should be better. My wife and I had a meal in the Restaurant at night, and were pleased with the service. I get frustrated with the trend restaurants are going where they only give you basic meat or fish meal, and you have to pay extra for vegetables etc to go with it, The mash I had was a bit "ordinary" and I am a lover of good mash.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: paulhb
Reviews.Content: Generally the hotel was good - foyer is really flash, but the rooms look like they needed a renovation a number of years ago. I'm also not a big fan of the penchant for speaking French. Sydney is a long way from Paris, and I'd much prefer the local touch - the whole "Bonjour" thing strikes me as somewhere between quaint and contrived. The restaurant is severely overpriced, even for a five star hotel in Sydney. My stay is normally paid for by the company, but for my money, I'd prefer to go up the road to the Four Seasons, or even the Hilton. I wouldn't say it's a bad hotel, just a little disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baldivis Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very clean room, good service. I suggest that for the price you can do better as the rooms are smallish and there is no separate shower. On the positive the service was great, the staff very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic night away”
Reviews.Author: ladychippy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for his birthdayand Booked through Advantage plus program. Everything abut the Sofitel was amazing. Got a voucher for a complimentary drink at the bar and also had an amazing dinner in the restaurant. The room was quite small but was of good quality. The bed was quite comfortable however should have made use of the pillow menu. I would recommend the Sofitel to anyone who wanted to stay in Sydney and did not mind being right in the areas of Darling Harbour or Circular Quay. Quality throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Sofiel Wentworth”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. From reception to restaurant staff were exceptionally friendly. We were a little surprised. We upgraded to Sofitel club as it was special occassion. That was great, included afternoon tea, free drink canapes. Also buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT 2 NIGHT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The service was great ...Gillian was excellent on the front desk....managed a upgrade for us and was very helpful at check-out. Potter was good with directions and telling us about the free bus. Parking was a bit rich...$45 a day. We did not get the ice tray as requested from room service. Other an that a most enjoyable experience. Highly recommended. Many Thanks, i will be back

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Experience - Comparable to other top end Sydney Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Novemberbravo1974
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Wentworth Sydney ( Previously known as The Sheraton Wentworth and then The Wentworth ) is one of Sydneyâ€™s more established premium hotels having been on the Sydney Hotel Landscape for more than 50 years. ( The Hotel itself has weathered the years very well and still holds the title quite possibly as the largest brick building in the Southern Hemisphere ) Whilst it may have been overtaken by newer flasher competitors this hotel does promise and for the most part delivers a solid higher end hotel experience. Situated in a quieter corner of the CBD itâ€™s a 10 to 15 min walk to most CBD attractions including areas such as Darling Harbour, Chinatown, The Rocks, Opera House and Botanic Gardens. Its secluded but not out of the way instead situated in between areas populated heavily by hotels, The location would be ideal for the corporate traveller during the week but this likewise means deals are to be had here on weekends. Arrival and Check in her was fast and friendly. Someone offered to take my bags as I got out of the Taxi ( nice touch not always found in hotels these days even at the top end ) And in a few mins I was at my room. The room I had for 1 night was not the biggest nor smallest hotel room I have seen. Given the age of the building the room was very modern and quite functional, They designers went for a clean, bright, simple layout as opposed to trying to get too creative. There was plenty of hanging space, a single recliner lounge, adequate desk space for working, The TV was on the smaller side of standard for most I have seen but usable never the less. There was rectangular picture window with a view of the street that finished off the space. The bathroom was small but very well designed to give as much space as possible, Reasonably well stocked with Hotel Premiums including Loccitaine soups and shampoo. Not as good as Pullman Brand Hotels but still adequate all the same. The Shower Hose however looked quite worn and didnâ€™t function properly and the glass shower screen could have done a better job. A few extra bath towels would have been nice but generally not too bad overall. The Hotel features several bars, A Sofitel Club Lounge, Its own shopping arcade ( nothing amazing ) and the very respectable Garden Court Restaurant ( The Garden Court brands itself as contemporary French but is more general in some respects with a reasonable grill menu to compliment some pretty reasonable French offerings. ( The bouillabaisse was very good the Foie Gras salad was okay though a little frugal on the foie gras I felt the only real failing would have been how long it took the bread and dip starter to arrive and the absence of any truly chocolate desert at the end of the meal ) The Bar does a very good job with Cocktails excellent Daiquiris and the wine list is very extensive. Service was attentive and friendly all the way thru. I would go back to this restaurant again its was really quite good. The lobby bar is governed by some quite silly laws so it closes about 1am, Tough luck if you want a cocktail. This however is not so much the Hotels fault as the stupid laws that govern the serving of alcohol in Sydney these days. Overall this is a nice Hotel its nothing that is going to stop the world and make you count the days until you come back, but its a solid offering and certainly better than its Melbourne Counterpart ( Sofitel on Collins ) and worthy of its place in what is a very competitive hotel marketplace.

Reviews.Title: “Relax”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was fantastic and the service from the staff exceptional. The bed and room was the best we have experienced. I would thoroughly recommend staying at this motel to all our friends and relatives. Thanks for a memorable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “HOPE YOU ARE NOT HUNGREY”
Reviews.Author: janelle12 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was our wedding aniversary , we checked in with no problem then went dtraight to the Day Spa ( FANTASTIC - will be going back ) We then made our wayto the Club Lounge was very disapointed as I have stayed in Melbourne Sofitel many many times and have always been able to help myself with drinks or food ( Food you might say well their wasnt any ) After a lovely night . The next mornign we went to breakfast was very impressed with the service until it came to ording and egg to be cooked .After 45mins we got up and left - still waiting for my egg

Reviews.Title: “What's the point?”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: What is the point of being an A Club member when the service is the same when I was not! When I arrived to check in all I got was complaints that the hotel was fully booked and I would have to take a room with twin beds. What's the point in making an early reservation? The room actually had twin kingsize beds which left no room to move and no room to work at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy modern rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Traveller1968
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the Wentworth for a special treat. The room was on the small size, but very nicely appointed and very clean. Bathroom was small but very nicely appointed. (Hooray! No shower curtain!) The bed was deliciously soft and comfortable, and the location was handy to see all the Circular Quay attractions. There was a bit of noise from other guests arriving back from a big night out, but their lack of concern for others is not the hotel's problem. Common areas were well presented and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Sydney Wentworth is located well close to shopping and sightseeing. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are comfortable but a bit on the small side. The food in the restaurant was excellent and the service first rate. We had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but standards have dropped somewhat.”
Reviews.Author: Bebej1976
Reviews.Content: My company has a contract with this hotel do over the years ive stayed on a regular basis. I've noticed a significant downwards trend in most aspects. The rooms have always been on the small side, especially for Sydney hotels but they are also becoming a bit tired. I find their penny pinching irritating as well. They have no ice machines so you have to call down for ice to be delivered which to be fair is the case with many hotels. But the Sofitel Sydney charges you AU$6 for the ice. Which is quite tacky in my opinion. On the plus side great location and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Opinion”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We thought the mattress needs replacing, both of us complained of back acke which we do not suffer at. We both had to visit a masseur other wise the room was fine. We visited the resturant on the fifth floor on Friday night of the 6th of May Service was excellent, the meal was left alot to be desired. We both ordered atlantic salmon it came with a cheese muffin, very poor presentation, one was over cooked and dry the other was raw, my wife sent it back and when it was returned the chef had re cooked it that is not what would be expected from a 5 star hotel. We would stay there again but would never eat at that resturant again.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice staying in this hotel during Public Holidays”
Reviews.Author: oziwarren Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel eight times before but staying over the Easter long weekend was a mistake. On checkin my room was not ready, but if I upgraded to Sofitel Club for $80 per night I could check in straight away. We did upgrade because they had "all day canapes and refreshments". We went to the Sofitel Club for lunch and all they had was two croissants left over from morning tea. We went to The Sofitel Club in the afternoon, there were no waitstaff so I got a beer from the bar, then a waitress said if I wanted the drink I would have to pay for it. "Free drinks" started at 5:30 pm. As there was no al day canapes and refreshments I cancelled the upgrade. I tried to book for dinner in the afternoon on Saturday & Sunday: no answer on the restaurant phone, I suppose it was too difficult to have the calls redirected. I had to make my booking with the Assistant Manager of the hotel. At the restaurant we were served the wrong meals ( I wanted well done, the wife wanted medium to well), it was only when I was half way through my meal when the meat was getting rarer, did I see that my wife had the well done meal. It was Easter and because the man at another table was chatting up the waitress, he was given an Easter egg. We were not offerred anything. It was our wedding anniversary, and we were there for a good time, but the shortage and calibre of staff was evident throughout the hotel. I had a query at the front desk, and I got from the man, "this is not my country" as he did not understand me. I'm sure I would have got better service at an Ibis or Mercure. That is the last time I would stay at this hotel. The tariff was not cheap. There are plenty of others in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “City View- just another brick in the wall”
Reviews.Author: MatHerveyBay Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at this hotel for a romantic weekend away. We booked a city view King room. The view was of a part of the city- a brick wall in a court yard!!! Not impressed at all. The room was pleasant but a little small for a five star hotel and the bathroom was tiny. It looked like a wardrobe when the doors were closed and had the weakest shower I have experienced in many years. The reception staff seemed very distracted and rather disinterested at both arrival and departure. The lBar staff and door staff were excellent but the food in the lounge was also rather disappointing. I have enjoyed staying at Sofitel in different locations but our experience at this hotel was the most disappointing I have every encountered with the group.

Reviews.Title: “Spencer Stay at Sydney Wentworth”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, our stay was fantastic. Staff: Checkin/out staff - good service. told us all we neeed to know aboutb staying there. Concierge - demostrated good knowledge of local sydney tourist info. Was able to give us advise on whch Ferries went where etc before we left the hotel. Restaurant - not quite open ontime each morning, but staff very good once open. Floor staff very attentative to needs. Chefs/cooks - cooked my eggs to order perfectly all three breakfasts. Food: Only had breakfast in hotel restaurant. food quality great. Selection great. Having accor dining card accepted for breakfast also good. OVerall: We had a great stay stay the hotel. A good central location for the CBD & Circular Key and public transport. The level of service offered by the staff was a very high standard and made us appreciate our stay even more.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed where we attended the Emerge Ball”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very convenient. The accommodation was very clean and comfortable and the service was friendly and efficient. The only negative comment about the accommodation was the bathroom was a bit small. I was disappointed with the breakfast -mushrooms were tasteless and the food in general was not hot enough. The venue for the Ball was excellent and being able to stay at the same hotel was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Restuarant”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I throughly enjoy staying at the Sofitel/Wentworth in Sydney and always make it our priority to stay there. We can't really say a bad thing about the Hotel except we were a little disappointed with the Restaurant ( Level 5) our reason is that the Menu needs to be changed on a regular basis perhaps with the seasons of the year what is available. After staying at the Wentworth in December,February and recently April the Menu at the Restuarant was still the same. Also, attending Breakfast in the very same Restuarant my Husband and I felt like we were sitting in a cloak room to be surronded by guest luggage. This particular morning there must of been a tour departing and a number of guest had attended to Breakfast and brought their suitcases in with them and staff placed the luggage near the reception desk where we were sitting. Come on Sofitel / Wentworth this is a 5 star Hotel, please live up to your standards and band luggage from the Restuarant and have guest take it to the Concierge.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just love staying at this hotel -- we start relaxing as soon as we smell the customary fragrance in the foyer & friendly service at the front desk & nearby bar. That night we dined on the eight floor & were not dissappointed -- the meals & service were superb & the onion soup was the best i have ever tasted -- I was so impressed i asked to see the chef who i suspect thought that i was going to complain & was genuinely surprised that i complimented him -- Breakfast was just as good -- only two minor issues-- the bed we had was a little tired & the hotel forgot to wind the bedside clock back causing us to get out of bed one hour earlier than planned -- It must be the best all round hotel in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic expierence - terrific service, little touches”
Reviews.Author: gizmo0037
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "Club" room and elected to upgrade on arrival. All in all an extremely pleasant experience. The service from reception to concierge to waiters were all first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel Sydney Wentworth for the first time last week we both thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. It was very clean and had all the necessities we required. We found the reception very helpful and all the concierges full of incredible knowlege. We would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: farawyeyes Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay here in a very comfortable suite on a great value special deal through Accor, felt like a home away from home. Easy walk to Circular Quay, opera house, gardens, galleries, The Rocks. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Lovely surprise was champagne and strawberries from the hotel for or wedding anniversary. Would highly recommend Sofitel Club, generous food and drinks. Only negative was short-staffing in Club on one of our three days which left us floundering around on our own trying to work the coffee-maker and chasing staff for other drinks. Hotel ideally needs a swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Questionable Service...”
Reviews.Author: tripstyler
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was incredibly unhappy with my 3-night stay at Sydneyâ€™s Sofitel and would never recommend it, however, for the sake of the reliability and objectivity of this review, hereâ€™s â€œthe goodâ€� before I get into â€œthe bad.â€� Good - Welcoming lobby with flower arrangements resembling intricate art pieces and a candlelit glow at night - Each concierge we dealt with were helpful and knowledgeable - The beds were pretty comfortable with a down pillow-topper over the mattress - Adjacent to the hotelâ€™s lobby was a petite chocolate shop serving treats and coffees with big flavor. Donâ€™t miss it! Bad I stay at hotels on a very frequent basis for work and pleasure, and I can stay without a shadow of a doubt, the Sofitel Sydneyâ€™s front desk staff are the worst Iâ€™ve dealt with in years. Though staff were attentive, they were uninterested in guest satisfaction. When something went wrong, you may have been lucky to get a nonchalant â€˜sorryâ€™, but thatâ€™s it. For example, we checked into a superior room and before bed noticed unmentionable bodily fluids caked on the tiles behind the toilet, as well as a light red splatter {resembling blood} on the interior bathroom door. A further red drop under the closet and dark scratches on the white walls were unsettling too. We told 3 different staff members about this during the course of our stay and NOBODY bothered to take any money off the bill. In fact, at check-out, we had to firmly request they take money off given the bodily fluids adorning our bathroom and in the end they didnâ€™t take off much. Also, prior to my check-in to the hotel, I emailed them to let them know that I was going to be checking in early, advising that an early check-in would be appreciated if space was available. When we got the hotel after a 16-hour flight, there were no rooms available in the room class we booked, so instead of offering us a complimentary upgrade which is a fairly normal practice in hotels, they said the only way we could get immediate occupancy, was by paying an extra $40 night to upgrade rooms {many of which appeared to be available}. So if this is their normal practice, why couldnâ€™t they have told me this in the email I sent? We even inquired if they could tell us when something came available, but they simply said no, come back at 2pm. They could have also offered us the opportunity to freshen up in their health club facilities, but were not interested in this option either. It was their way or the highway, no compassion or helpfulness. What to Know - Wireless is charged hourly up to $27 per 24-hours - Circular Quay is the closest rail stop for catching the train around town or to the airport - If you call a Sydney mobile phone from the roomâ€™s phone, they charge you $3.50/minute, a charge they are not forthcoming about. When we explained this to the gentleman who checked us out, he said, youâ€™re right, sorry, but then charged us anyway. Again, poor service. - The hotel calls themselves a 5-star, but the facilities, amenities and rooms are 4-star at best. The roomsâ€™ design motif is generic contemporary and the sizes are small. Save yourself the time and stress. Stay elsewhere in Sydney if you value customer basic customer service. I had a way better experience at the Shangri-la, which is in a great area {the rocks}, has nice rooms, excellent on-site restaurants and bars AND offers FREE wifi!

Reviews.Title: “pure indulgence”
Reviews.Author: goldcoastqueenie54
Reviews.Content: we have just returned home after another fantastic stay at the sofitel. I have made another two bookings for this year. Being a member of advantageplus gives you a great rate and 50% of food in the restaurants. book a club sofitel room you will not be sorry the staff are beautiful and all the extras you get are worth the extra money. We are counting down the days to our next visit in july.

Reviews.Title: “jj”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The bathroom doors (2 barn style doors) were a poor addition - or else I would have ranked the room higher. The front check in staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms were quiet and the hotel met our needs for the the overnight stay

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely hotel and good service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely older style hotel that has been nicely revamped for the 21Century. We did have a few issues over the bill, but this was dealt with sympathetically and ultimately all worked out well. Good value for money in the centre of Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: andyhg
Reviews.Content: This hotel was flawless. The staff and service were excellent. Because it is a historic landmark, the rooms and bathrooms are not large, but nevertheless they are luxurious and comfortable. The flower arrangements in the lobby are breathtaking. Each evening in the lobby they light candles with a heavenly scent.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: chicky2c Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary. We were pleasantly suprised on our arrival with wine/strawberries and dipping chocolates - thought this was wonderful in terms of service etc. The room itself was average in comparison to other 5 star places we've stayed at, considering we did upgrade our room. Reception tried to upgrade us again, not noting we already had upgraded, We also had some trouble with being charged again for our room as we had already pre-paid this online. On a positive note, the Garden Court restuarant food and service was fantastic and i highly recommend dinning here.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms a little dated and bathroom lighting poor. Location good for Opera House & State Theatre (events we attended). Restaurant meals were not up to Accor's usual standard, particularly lunch. Parking a bit pricey @ $45 per day but overall experience good. Location was most important reason for staying there.

Reviews.Title: “A place of comfort and peace”
Reviews.Author: Ellerslieboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Easter. The welcome bonjours set a tone of this is your place for teh entire stay. A room glitch was quickly fixed with an upgrade. Beds were sofitel super comfy. the restaurants and house bar offered great options from breakfast to light suppers and a lovely dinner. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Dianna_04 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Sydney Wentworth is marketed as a 5 Star hotel.We stayed in the Classic room and felt we were in a 3 Star hotel. The room was very small and there were no easy chairs to sit on, only the bed. There was a small table and one upright chair for basic office work. One small window was covered with a holland blind that was dirty and partially torn from its base. The bathroom was large but sparse in ammenities. The handbasin was free standing and there was no bench area for personal toiletries. We had to sit these on the floor. The restaurant that serves breakfast does not open until 7.00am of a weekend or on public holidays. It opens at 6.30 am during the week. We were unaware of this when we tried to get b'fast one morning (Easter Sunday) prior to being collected at 7.10 for a Day Tour. Along with several other people who were also wanting an early breakfast that morning, we were given the option of room service (too late for us by the time we were informed of this, and also very expensive). We tried to find a place up the street selling b'fast items, but there were no places close to the Sofitel that we could find. The reception staff were very indifferent and gave the impression they did not care. We often avail ourselves of room service after a long day of sight seeing, but we did not use that opportunity because there was nowhere suitable to sit in our room, other than on the bed, to eat. After two nights at the Sofitel we transferred to the Shangri La. Yes, it was more expensive, but excellent value for money and very worthy of its 5 Star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic Rooms for a 5 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stuggle to see how this hotel gets 5 stars, I found the bedroom and bathroom facilities very basic, I was a bit dissapointed having stayed in Sofitel hotels in other locations in the World which have been excellent. However the bed was very comfortable and the staff were very attentive and freindly.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Ellie M
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights over Easter with partner and child. We paid more for a larger room, but it was still very small. There were 2 double beds with a 15cm space between them. We could not move anywhere in the room except down the narrow alley between end of room and entry door. We were quite disappointed when we attempted to access the internet, the cost was alarming (around $28 per day), for a 5 star hotel, it seemed ridiculous. I would have thought it was free - surely the internet is not a luxury item these days? The room was clean and the bathroom stocked with nice toiletries, but nothing really special as you would expect from a hotel of that standard. We requested extra towels as we were only supplied with 2 for 3 guests. They arrived promptly. I was quoted $30 per day for parking when I booked. It was valet parking. We did not remove or use the car during our stay. At checkout we paid $90 for parking, and then on our return home find a receipt for another $46 for parking not paid for at time of checkout, charged to my credit card. Apparently its $45 per day (plus credit card surcharge). Fine, but not when quoted a different amount! Obviously a communication breakdown somewhere. The location is great and the lobby smells divine. The hotel rooms are way too small though and a bit dated. I would stay elsewhere next time and spend the savings shopping at Pitt Street Mall. I would also park in the suburbs and take public transport :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a Sydney stay”
Reviews.Author: kjbMirani
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to CBD, the Rocks and Circular Quay and to the Domain. Easy to get to/from airport. All staff very friendly and helpful. Room a little small, but well appointed and bed very comfortable. Breakfast and dinner choices very good. We were offered a deal to upgrade to a slightly larger room, with a balcony view over the courtyard; a good decison as much more interesting. Only downside is the hotel still permits smoking; no smell in the room but from our balcony you could see all the butts that had been discarded on the awning.

Reviews.Title: “Above Expectations”
Reviews.Author: qf380 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Suprised at the quality of the property. Service Level provided by Bruno on Checkin was above all expectation and Club Sofitel Receptionist on the Night of 22 April. went above and beyond.. I just wish staff in Club sofitel on the Saturday where of the same mould as the Friday staff...... A Top Notch property. We have already booked a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed the stay. Great food in the Garden Restaurant. Excellent service and facilities. This hotel is in a great position in Sydney. It is very accessable to most attractions and would be a great base for visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not the best.”
Reviews.Author: roseh1009 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel, Great Club Lounge with excellent food. Staff friendly and attentive. Impressive lobby with beautiful flower displays. Rooms reasonable but bathrooms (and bath) very small. Main restaurant not very good with poor menu selection. Good location, but only city views. Hotel shows age in some respects, particularly room design.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely environment”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a lovely out look and the staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful. If using the restaurant facilities it is a conveninet location other wise it is a little out of the way as far as CBD. need to get taxis rather than a stroll to restaurants etc

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: poor service and tghe room was too noisy then i requested room move the guy at reception told me to pack my stuff they will move for me but when i got back the hotel my stuff was still there and the staff knew nothing

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Just back from our night at Sofitel and would like to share with you my disappointment in Accor Membership. Although all Staff were lovely, we were placed in a back room overlooking the workmen. Believe me I am no snob but from the purchase of this membership to now I have been very disappointed. We save our money for special treats and we were very disappointed with what the membership gave us. We will not be renewing our membership. From now we will be purchasing our accomodation on wotif, where the service and rooms have always been spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Free overnighter”
Reviews.Author: lpovolny Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We paid an extra $40 to have a larger room with a bathroom. The bed was the best I have ever slept on and the pillows were fabulous. The tea and coffee were very basic with not even a biscuit! Staff at breakfast were very helpful. We did enjoy the stay

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Sofitel was as you would expect Perfect. I was using my Accor Club free night so it was even better. The lobby was stunning, lovely fresh flowers everyday. The rooms were spacious and very well appointed and the staff were friendly and helpful. The Wentworth is positioned perfectly for business or pleasure, right in the financial district and just 2 blocks to the Quay, Rocks and Opera house. Museums abound at that end of town and many many cafes and restaurants. So it was a marvellous stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The stay was very pleasant, staff members were extremely lovely and helpful. The beds were fantastic and the hotel was extremely clean. Everything in the room was of a very high quality, I was highly impressed with the room and stay in total. I would recommend the hotel to anyone in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Average isn't what I expect for 5 stars..”
Reviews.Author: beedoo747
Reviews.Content: We went up to Sydney for an overnight stay to meet some friends from the US who were staying at the Sofitel, so we thought it would be easiest to stay in the same hotel. We drove up so we needed to park. I thought $45 was expensive until I investigated other parking options in the city. $45 per night for valet parking is actually incredibly reasonable for Sydney. We handed the car over to the valet staff which was a very easy process and headed into the lobby. On arrival we had to wait in the exquisitely scented lobby as there were others checking in.. With 4 gorgeous chandeliers, candles and pretty flower arrangements this was no great chore. We were placed on the 10th floor and the check in staff member told us we had been upgraded which would mean we had a balcony. If there was one, we never found it and when I looked out the window in the morning I didn't see any balconies on the floor we were on. I'm torn about the room. In some ways I think this is one of the best designed rooms I have ever been in. The bathroom was small but perfectly formed. There was enough room to swing a cat, but probably not enough to swing a larger dog. That's ok, we didn't bring any pets. :) The room is perfect for a single night stay or perhaps a couple of nights. If you were staying any longer the lack of a lounge might begin to get annoying. There was a couple of chairs, one for the desk and one for sitting in. A lounge could easily have been fitted in, if the space on either side of the windows was not taken up with very large cabinets with lighting and glass shelves which hold one (dusty) vase each. I am baffled as to the purpose of those cabinets. There was quite a lot of cabinets already in the room across from the bathroom, there was a cupboard, the mini bar, and a small benchtop with a kettle and some snacks all of which was hidden behind cupboards. Do people staying in 5 star hotels bring along their own knick knacks which they wish to display in their hotel room? :) If you are reading this review and you want to bring along your own knick knacks and display them, the Sofitel is your best bet! We went out for dinner, walking down to The Rocks which was not far and was mostly downhill. Note that we are people who like to walk a lot while on holiday, for us it was a short stroll but for non-walkers it might be a bit further than they would like. On the way back we stopped for gelato at Circular Quay which was a happy accident - after we left we discovered the next street up from the gelato place was Philip St which is the street the hotel is on. The walk back to the hotel up that particular street is uphill for the most part. Again that was no problem for us. BTW Gelatissimo was the name of the gelato place, it was awesome, a great range of gelato and sorbets. If you walk down Philip St to Circular Quay, you will find the place quite easily and I highly recommend it. Back to the hotel, and we sat in the lobby for a while chatting with our friends. The perfume down there is just so awesome. A previous reviewer (Mattalie) mentioned that she thought it was Chanel Allure Sensuelle - the next day when we were out exploring Sydney's shops, I picked up a tester of that perfume and sprayed a card with it. I don't know if that is the perfume Sofitel uses or not, though I do think it smells similar, but I do know that I will have to buy a bottle of that perfume because it is incredible. :) Our friends from the states mentioned how expensive the internet was in the hotel - I think they said $27 for 24 hours but we were not there for long enough to investigate or try it ourselves. I guess being Aussie we're more used to being charged big fees for the internet in hotels - and everywhere else! Upstairs and to bed. On arrival in the room we discovered staff had been in while we were gone to turn down the bed, lay the floor mat in the bathroom, leave laundry bags on the bed and also to leave a breakfast menu with pillow chocolates! That was a nice touch. The bed is like lying on a white fluffy cloud. The pillows are a bit too soft for me - and sadly there wasn't a pillow menu like some other hotels I have stayed in - one of those was the Novotel Oasis at Cairns which is an Accor hotel. So that was a little surprising as this hotel is meant to be a step up from that one. I did notice some level of noise from fellow guests - mainly people lifting up the toilet lid which is very heavy and tends to clang on the marble when you raise it. I slept very well as did the other half. In the morning there was traffic noise which is to be expected in the middle of Sydney though perhaps not to be expected inside a 5 star hotel. I know it is possible to completely stop noise from the outside, airport hotels manage it nicely. But perhaps with this heritage building it may not have been possible. Down to Breakfast, where the other half ordered cappuccino ($6 each for a very small cup! egads!) and I ordered a mushroom omelette from the egg chef. It was lovely. The smoothie of the day in a shot glass was amazing, the pastries were great, the juice was cold and refreshing and there seemed to be an excellent selection of items to choose from. An excellent start to the day, however I would wait till later for your cappuccino because $6 will buy you quite a large cup of coffee in most coffee places in Sydney. Back to the room and in the cold light of day, it wasn't quite as spotless as it seemed at night time. Maybe I am a bit picky because I've been a cleaner myself but the cover to the exhaust fan on the ceiling in the bathroom was very dirty and there were odd stains on the ceiling in the bathroom as well as the blind in the bedroom. Looked a bit like red wine stains. At checkout there is a 1.5% surcharge for credit cards. I tried to pay via debit card (visa debit but I can use the savings option on eftpos) but the hotel had placed a hold on funds in my account making it impossible for me to get around the surcharge. Unfortunately I ended up having to pay by Visa because they were unable to undo the hold right away. Had I know this, I would have preferred to pay for the room with my debit card on check in and not had a hold placed on the account. They had the credit card number, and they would have been able to charge extras to it if necessary. The hold was also for $80 more than the room charge, which was not awesome. So that might want to be something you clarify with them on check in - however the hotel should be letting guests know about that. Many hotels just want to have the number on file in case something happens, they don't put a hold on funds. We left our bags with the concierge while we went wandering around Sydney for a few hours. When we returned we got the bags quickly and easily and headed down to the carpark to pick up the car, which was also an easy and quick process. Overall, as wonderful as the hotel smelled and as comfortable as the beds were, I don't think we would stay here again. There are a lot of great 5 star hotels in Sydney many of which we have stayed at previously - we would revisit those before we stayed at the Sofitel again.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: CJACCM
Reviews.Content: We waited 15 min to check in to our confirmed rooms only to be advised not available We were traveling with children under 10yrs and had specifically requested connecting rooms for obvious reasons. Apparently the hotel management think rooms five rooms apart were the answer. A suite connecting to a king room became two connecting king rooms with the hotel blaming the company travel agent. Same blame game next day with the manager saying the room configuration confirmed by the agent didn't exist We were then accommodated in a suite with connecting twin king room by 5 pm next day, after having to repack and room shift - after another 10m wait at reception to change room keys ( finally got them in the club area a further 25m later) What is going on in this hotel? So at last we were in the very room configuration the hotel denied having, No empathy, no care from the hotel No return by this guest

Reviews.Title: “ALL HYPE AND SPIN”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Having been an Advantage Plus member for more than a decade i get one free night per year which we usually spend at a Sofitel. The night last year was in a Superior Room (for which I paid an upgrade charge) and apart from the fact that it was small, it was luxurious. Clean, great linen, pillows etc. This time we decided to upgrade to the LUXURY room, $120.00 extra for one night, and it was a total letdown. We arrived at around 4pm, walked to the room, found a vacuum cleaner lying in the passage and a tray of half eaten food outside a door. They were still there we we returned around 11pm. The room was a disgrace. Stained carpets, a tiny flat screen TV that could not be viewed from the bed and we had to draw up a chair to watch a movie. Small bathroom, no separate shower stall, just an inefficient shower over the bath with a cheap curtain. This despite the elegant plaque explaining the amazing features of the circular design. The linen was nothing like the previous rooms, not much better than motel or hospital grade. 3 pillows instead of 4. The bed was adequate - not like the great pillow-top one in the Superior (cheaper) room. The unit containing the fridge had a particle board vertical divider that had obviously been in serious contact with water and it was split and bulging. This is NOT 5 Star quality. The Club Lounge was good, the food adequate and the service staff pleasant. When I commented about the poor standard of the room the duty manager immediately went to the computer, typed in a few words and told me that she was so sorry about the quality she would be deleting the upgrade charge and the account was zeroed. Checked my MasterCard today and found that I had been billed $75.00 the day we arrived and a further $69.50 the following day. We bought a movie and had a chocolate bar and a small tub of cashews. I called today to ask why there were these items billed and got someone who did not know what to do, other than to take my name and number and tell me that someone would call back - which they did not do.
