Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in busy Sydney”
Reviews.Author: MrsJo156 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: pleasant service, clean surroundings and good location. just don't stay in room near lifts as loud,late guests often don't realize how well their voices carry! Overall, would recommend hotel - easy,pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice room was ok a bit disapointed that free accor advantage free night is in the chepest room in hotel. a

Reviews.Title: “I'll tell you what the smell is!”
Reviews.Author: Mattalie
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed at the Wentworth quite a few times now, & we do always leave feeling special. So, obviously, 'that smell' has been bugging me for years now, because it is beautiful & it always smells that way & I've spent these years (sad I know) trying to find this scent! At first I thought it was a Calvin Klein eternity moment, but I was mistaken. I finally had a client in the other day who did smell exactly the same. I can now confirm it is Chanel allure sensual. The most, welcoming, lovely smell ever! I wouldn't suggest upgrading to club sofitel with the food included in the 'club lounge', it's a smaller, less stocked buffet & squashy (which frankly reminded me more of a pigs trough in a 3star) than the fantastic garden room (if it ain't broke, don't fix it!) with no personal service which you would expect. But definitely do it for the rooms, your own Nespresso machine & mybed!!

Reviews.Title: “4 day weekend”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked a club room and were extremely impressed, firstly with the dedicated club check in on 5th floor, the quality and quantity of club lounge meals, but mostly with the service and friendliness of all staff we came across, be it in the restaurant, club lounge or at the concierge desk. We have never stayed anywhere, in any hotel chain where we experienced such good service. Thank you for a most enjoyable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful as always, my desired location when I visit Sydney. Only issue was with a staff member who knocked and opened the door when we had the do not disturb sign on over an checking to see if our door worked which was a little suss and not appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Overpromising Wentworth Sydney”
Reviews.Author: marlowstevens Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked a Prestige Suite for two nights at $1550. The suite was the same size as a normal room at Sofitel Melbourne and one third the size of a Junior Suite in Manila. Sofitel Club offered very ordinary breakfast and the lifts did not allow access to car park (at $45 per night). I recommend the Sheraton on the Park when in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable room, great (albeit expensive) room service breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: AndyChiara
Reviews.Content: For our first night as a married couple, my partner and I stayed at the Sofitel. All in all, the room was very comfortable - the bed especially - and spotless: I was particularly impressed by the large bathroom, which had (surprisingly) strong and generous water pressure. The lobby was fantastic and smelled divine, and was a truly gorgeous welcome after a very long wedding day! Our only niggle was that room service breakfast did not arrive when requested (15 minutes late) and reception had to be reminded to bring a toothbrush - which had been requested - to our room (quite annoying when all you wanted to do was go to bed!). We found the sofitel to be a reasonable bang for our buck as we booked the room via a secret hotel deal (AU$300 per night). Please note, the $45 "Australian" option on the room service menu is HUGE! Order 1 plate for 2 people. All in all a very reasonable hotel in Sydney central business district.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel albeit not cheap”
Reviews.Author: westy54
Reviews.Content: Stayed one Friday night and was upgraded to a garden view room - although this was still not much of a view given location of the hotel. Rooms comfortable and clean enough although not large and bathroom was also small with shower in the bath. Toilet flush did not work in morning Reported it to reception and workman arrived and fixed it about an hour later (albeit after a second phone call). Breakfast buffet was plentiful although it was expensive. Overnight parking - $45 - was exhorbitant as was internet connectivity.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Woken up by nearby construction - shouldn't have chosen this during this time. Was charged for internet when another manager miscommunicated that it's free, when we checked in - should be clearer. No swimming/spa pool facilities.

Reviews.Title: “CONSISTENTLY FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We always stay at Sofitel because of the quality of the rooms and the great service and they definitely have the most comfortable beds. Staff are always friendly and willing to assist. We have stayed at Sofitels all over Australia and the US and have never been disappointed. Always in great locations - handy to major tourist attractions and public transportation. They have the best Concierges of any hotel - they know the city back to front - and can assist you with anything you need in terms of maps, shows, shopping etc. And they make the best pizzas ever!

Reviews.Title: “The best bed!”
Reviews.Author: ghostsTravellers Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the country as we had an evening booked at the Opera House. It is a very convenient place to stay for that part of Sydney. Hotel was lovely, the beautiful perfume in the elegant reception area was stunning. We were given a voucher for a free drink in the bar as we were A Club members - wine or beer only. Our room, an upgrade - paid for - was fine and the bed was one of the best we have ever slept in! the pleasant reception staff member told us that it would be a bigger room with a better view. Hmmm?? The bathroom was very clean but the step into the bath was pretty precarious and getting out even more difficult for us older generation. Breakfast next morning - not cheap was fine and was the usual hotel fare.

Reviews.Title: “need improvement”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: average hotels parking a bit expencsive and no help on loading & unloading luguage especially with infants hotel is quite old and need refurbishment did not go to dising but sounds very nice. breakfast is quite good and we enjoy it

Reviews.Title: “Elevator nightmare”
Reviews.Author: VOLUNTEERGIRL_68
Reviews.Content: Our tour group was moved to this hotel when we stayed over because of the earthquake in New Zealand. The lobby was beautiful, but so heavily perfumed that several of us could barely breathe. The room was attractive, but the bed was hard. We were given only a duvet (couette) and no top sheet, which was too warm to sleep under. We requested a top sheet from the maid on the first morning, and didn't get it. We requested a sheet again from the front desk that evening, and it was delivered promptly. The bathroom was small (as was the room), but beautifully updated. The staff was friendly and the buffet breakfast was the standard British version. As Americans, we are not thrilled with undercooked bacon and scrambled eggs. The biggest issue we faced was the elevator nightmare. Only 2 elevators ever appeared to be working, one making very alarming creaking and groaning noises. In the mornings both days we were there the elevators did not arrive for at least 10 minutes, and when they did they were jammed with people with suitcases. Since the lobby is on the ground floor, another main entrance one floor below, and the breakfast restaurant is on the third floor, with blocked stairways when you tried to walk up, this was terrible. Several people we talked to on the elevator (when we finally got on one) had ridden down to 3 trying to check out, only to have the elevator go back up instead of descending to the lobby. It took about 25 minutes to get from the 10th floor down to the 3rd, and then about the same to get back up. The trip down to the lobby with hand luggage to check out took longer. There were people in a panic about trying to catch flights...including airline crews. We resorted to catching an up elevator and riding to the top to get to the bottom. Staff took pity on some of our group and let them ride service elevators. This is just not what I would expect from a 5 star hotel. We accidentally left a battery charger in our room when we checked out, and called that evening when we discovered the loss. They refused to check the room for us because it was occupied, and by the time they did check the item was gone. We thought they could have gotten permission from the occupants and checked for us. We were disappointed with the hotel's performance in general.

Reviews.Title: “Gone downhill since last stay”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedOz
Reviews.Content: When you stay at a Sofitel, I think there is a certain level of attention to detail that you expect but which was absent on this trip. Stayed here in 2007 and had a fantastic experince, alas, not repeated on this occasion. Three main issues I had this time: 1. Noisy a/c unit that kept me awake. I arrived at 10pm after a long day and I just wanted to hit the sack. This should have been checked before I arrived. 2. Room faces a brightly lit skyscraper/garage of some kind with blinding lights shining right in your window, even late at night. The blockout blinds provided were cream in colour and not sufficient to cut the light. Also, the blind was faulty so I had to climb on the desk and manually pull it down. 3. When I checked in, I was asked if I wanted a complimentary newspaper. I ticked the AFR box. No AFR arrived. The room itself was OK, nice marble bathroom with a toilet almost wedged into the corner. UHT milk for coffee (not fresh). Bed was OK but had a separate "pillow top" attached to a cheap frame rather than a quality bed. Next time, I'll choose the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: cowboyjb
Reviews.Content: magnificent experience from the moment you arrive until you leave. Wonderful hotel. Awesome fitness centre, amazing food. Rooms a little on the small side, but the bed is the best in the business - huge and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was a beautiful hotel to stay at but the only complaint i would have is the slow service. We organised to have a rollaway for the night at lunchtime and at 9pm the bed was yet to arrive so i asked and then at 10.30pm yet to arrive so i rang and they said it would arrive. The rollover arrived at 11pm!!! The bed arrived extremely late and at that it was a very uncomfortable used mattress in which the springs went through. Very disappointing for a luxury hotel. The rollaway needed a garbage bin!!! They wanted to charge in excess of $70!!!

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: skylarkriver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night (I have stayed before three times) and it was a very pleasant stay. There is nothing to fault this hotel except the pricing can be quite expensive (though this is a general problem with Sydney since the currency is above parity with the USD). We paid $335 for the room, which was a rate offered to me as Accor Gold card member. We arrived at the hotel early (around 1015) and were given the room straightaway with a complimentary upgrade to a luxury room. This Luxury room is really nothing special, compared to Deluxe, except it has a nicer view and probably has a few touches (though the size is still small, about 28 - 30 square meters. The bathrooms are old fashioned and small. The lighting is not as good as it could be. Other than these minor complaints, the service and the location were excellent, and the beds were unbelieveably comfortable, like sleeping on a cloud. (This is the signature Sofitel bed which is a great product). The internet was not free, sadly. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No next time”
Reviews.Author: jadey2000
Reviews.Content: Location We chose this hotel as it was across the road from our office. It is only a 10 minute walk down to circular quay which is a further 10 minutes to the opera house. Do note that Phillip Street is quite steep so the walk back to the hotel could take longer (stopping for breaths!). Shopping - Sydney tower, George Street, Westfield is also a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Beware that as it is in CBD area, there are literally no shops/cafe/restaurant open after office hours. Room I stayed in a twin room with a balcony for 2 weeks. The room is very small for just 1 person â€“ canâ€™t imagine if 2 people lived here. Thereâ€™s very little space between desk and foot of the bed. To make things worse, my room was opposite the elevators â€“ so I was disturbed the chatter of other patrons several times a night. Food Dined in the French restaurant once only. The onion soup was so salty that I sent it back. The waitress was not apologetic. For mains, the spring check and braised pork belly were quite nice. Room service was comparatively better â€“ I had the nicoise salad which had a very generous serving of salmon and the creme brulee which was served in a flan dish! Facilities As my stay was quite long (2 weeks), I was disappointed to find out that the hotel (although 5 star) did not have a pool. The front desk explained that this is because the hotel building is a heritage building and they were not allowed to install a pool. The gym is also a separately operated gym in the shopping arcade below the hotel. The equipment is not bad although packed a little too tightly together for my liking. Also, suggest you check and double check the opening hours of the gym â€“ the front desk had given me the wrong information causing me to be kicked out of the gym mid-run. Others I don't know if it is standard across Australia but I was charged 2% extra for settlement via credit card. Do other patrons really settle by cash? Why would I carry around AUD2600 of cash? Overall, not happy with my stay at Sofitel Wentworth. Finally, I sign off with a quirky anecdote: I requested for a smoking room when making the booking. The hotel emailed me to say they will try to accommodate it. Upon check in, front desk informed me that there are no smoking rooms but they will give me a room with a balcony and I can smoke out there. I didnâ€™t have an ashtray, but I didnâ€™t want to flick/ditch my butts (especially since there would be quite a number of them over the course of 2 weeks!). I stupidly placed them in a cup inside the room. The next day, the cleaning lady left me a note by the bedside table warning â€œyour room is a nonsmoking room. My supervisor said if I found ash or butts in the room I shall report it and you will be finedâ€�. Whatâ€™s more, the note was written in Chinese. I guess she saw a Chinese magazine in the bathroom and assumed I am Chinese. At first I thought it was plain rude for a maid to leave a patron a note, then I figured she was just trying to help out a fellow Chinese. From the second day onwards, you all know where the butts went ;)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SteelersGal85
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely lived up to my expectations. The staff was super friendly and very helpful with any questions that we had. The room was small, but clean and the bed was amazing! So comfortable! The location is perfect, with only a five minute walk to Sydney Harbor and tons of great restaurants. Ideal for tourists without a car. We did have something in our mini fridge that smelled like a dead animal every time we opened it and couldn't figure out what it was. When we called to have someone come take a look, the man that came actually smelled worse than a dead animal. All he did was wipe some condensation from the bottom of the fridge, and left. We decided keeping the fridge closed was a better option than having him come back into our room again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Service by staff was excellent.. Wait staff in restaraunt was fantastic and even something as simple as being greeted with a smile and friendly attitude at front desk was a refreshing change that made you feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I haved stayed at this hotel several times and I love the luxury

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean and quiet room, close to all amenties in CBD area. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Vaccum cleaning at 06:44 followed by JACK HAMMER”
Reviews.Author: Giboos Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Like many other guest reviews, my husband and I were very disappointed in this supposed 5 star hotel!! As the title suggests our sleep quality was severly interrupted by vaccum cleaners at jack hammers in the adjacent rooms at ungodly hours of the morning when we were hoping for a sleep in. After airing my complaints I almost had to beg for compensation which came in the form of a lousy bottle of cheap sparkling wine! To top things off they booked the wrong company to transfer us back to the airport which meant we were almost late for our flight..... they did pay for a taxi but again this was my request was not freely offered! Not happy..... for the price I rate this as appauling!! I dont mind paying for good service and a great sleep.... this hotel provides none of this!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff, Rooms and hotel were first class. Many thanks for an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i recently stayed at the Wentworth Sydney and had an extremely enjoyable time there. Great rooms, food, service and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Best motel we have ever stayed at, We have stayed at different motels all around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: If you are not concerned of price, the service and facilities are outstanding in this centrally located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We came down to see Sting and stayed the one night. Parking was great, coming from Newcastle, we can not get used to the cost of parking, but at $45 per night, we lived with it... Rooms we lovely, bit small for the money paid though. Bed was fantastic, downstairs bar had a great feel and excellent service, just a little tarnished by a Johnny Walker Red and Dry for $12.....sheesh! The restaurant was sublime, for was brilliant, they charged significantly also, but it was worth every cent and more! My steak was stunning, wine was beautiful . Service, again was excellent, Somebody at the top has their stuff together in that place. Only downside to the room was the bath, I have a lower leg disability, and the bathroom has a deep step in to the bath, so in and out was hard. Who uses baths these days?? Especially half baths...who wants sit where 100's of strangers feet have been!! I did not offer up my disability, who likes doing that, but I was not asked by the hotel either... Food for thought Overall, the stay was enjoyable, in fact very enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “mini city stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: great position, nice establishment although expected a little more opulence for a five star hotel, dissapointed to discover a $6 charge for a bucket of ice, would have thought 5 star establishment would have been able to provide ice free of charge. Although still enjoyed stay

Reviews.Title: “Wentworth”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I love this old hotel. The staff have always been incredibly helpful. They cant be faulted. The room lacked a little,a few broken bits here and there. Bathroom is becoming aged, but good design and use of small space. The wonderful staff make up for the buildings shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend staying at the Sofitel in Sydney. great location, fantastic service, excellent food and you are made to feel very welcome.Also it is maintained very well.

Reviews.Title: “Review Sofitel Sydney Wentworth”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For a five star hotel I would have liked to have seen a bigger TV. The bathrooms are small. The corridors (carpet and walls) seem a little warn. The dining facilities are great. Service was generally very good. I would not pay high prices for this facility in its present condition. Location is suitable. Parking setup is a bit awkward and rates are expensive but I guess typical of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “"Everyone says Bonjour!"..... And it's really quite annoying”
Reviews.Author: Akira1981
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, on entering foyer, you know it's a very good standard of hotel. Room and facilities within, tea making, mini bar, iron really useful after site seeing. Bed, really comfortable. Resteraunt seemed nice but we never used it breakfast seemed very over priced, plus there was a great cafe as you turn left out of hotel (illy). Everyone says bonjour is their catch phrase..... All the time, it's annoying. It's pretentious and annoying. The hotel is trying to cater for all types of clients not just tourists, which is fine and produces a high quality hotel. However there is no pool and the leisure facilities are aimed at local members. After a hard day trekking around the city, a pool, sauna etc would be perfect. Do something on the roof garden, just dot some jacuzzis around. All in all a very pleasant stay, but it was the same price as the Hilton, had no pool or spa type luxury. If i wanted to be greeted in French I would of holidayed in France.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Celebrated our 40th weding anniversary at the Sofitel Sydney Wentworth. Had a wonderfull time. Staff were great. Within walking distance for lots of entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The stay at the hotel was very good. It was only an overnight but the food was excellent and the service very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, close to the CBD and luxurious comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: Nick_CE
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now my favourite hotel while traveling on business. The pleasant scent when you walk into the lobby is refreshing and the staff is very friendly and pleasant to deal with.It's within walking distance to circular key for the scenic sights. In the evenings it's not exactly a lively part of the city and most shops would have closed around the area. You'll have to either eat in pricier restaurants or in the hotel. Overall my stay has been very pleasant and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “a night at the opera”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: fratastic location to walk to the domain to see the opera, great comfy room, we had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to other Sofitel we have tried.”
Reviews.Author: Rogerbelvedere Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at five different Sofitel's around the world and except for this one, highly recommend Sofitel. Sofitel Wentworth was one one of the most expensive and its facilities were the least attractive. The hotel is OK, but make sure you do not pay high dollars. Location is better suited for business than leisure, no pool, it is a ten minute walk to Circular Quay. The basic rooms are too small, we upgraded and it was barely acceptable. Pillows were too soft and deprived us of good sleep, it's a wonder we did not suffocate. We tried the Club for one day and canceled our membership for the remaining time, not as good as other Club Sofitels in Melbourne and Brisbane that we have enjoyed. The afternoon tea was not fresh, dry three point sandwiches - only vegetarian and over baked scones (we were there at the beginning of the afternoon teas, so we were were too late) with limited choice, the Club Breakfast was good (yes there was meat), the evening drinks were OK but consisted of all vegetarian entree's/snacks. Sofitel please note that there are meat eaters out there.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay at the Club Sofitel, Sydney Wentworth Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was our 13th stay in this hotel and have always preferred to stay in the Club Sofitel in the Sydney Wentworth Hotel when looking for a city getaway. I have found on the last 3 visits the decline in standard and after the last visit on the 29th January 2011 have decided I will not go back again. This 5 star hotel use to have excellent service, quality food and beverages in the Club Sofitel and the rooms where serviced well and the bed was comfortable. This last visit the room was of poor standard with a bed that sloped dramatically on one side so much so that my husband rolled over through the night and fell right off the bed. The dirty towels where not replace and the room was very tied looking. The Club Sofitel has lost its luxury feel due to allowing the other guests who do not book a club sofitel room to use the Club facilities at a minimal extra fee. TThe service has dropped, there is no dress code in forced and the afternoon teas and pre dinner canapes are not to the same high standard they use to be. Very disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Margo57
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated about 1/2km from Circular Quays and about 1/2 km from the city centre shopping precinct. If you are doing alot of tours from circular quays, its not the closest hotel but the walk does you good, especially going back, as its uphill, which may put some people off. I booked this hotel through wotif mystery hotel and was hoping for one closer to the quays. Dont expect a fantastic room when booking this way and I wouldnt suggest booking a mystery hotel myself again. We stayed for 4 nights and the first night we were in the classic room which is the smallest and we found it too small and clostraphobic, so we paid extra and upgraded to the superior room which had about an extra 1/2metre in width which did make a difference. Dont expect a view, as the hotel is jammed up in the middle of other taller buildings and thats all the view you got, not sure if the suites / penthouses had views or not. We had some issues with bedding but this was resolved quickly and efficiently. The Gym which i didnt attend, but my husband went to, said was large and very well equipped. I dont think they had a pool, we didnt have time to look into this. The room was made up and serviced each day and even when we went for breakfast there on the sunday morning for an hour, in that time they had come in and made the bed etc, i was impressed. The buffet breakfast was very nice and freshly made when asked for an omelete etc. The floor manager came by twice while we were seated to ask us if everything was ok. We did feel a need for a 1 bedroom apartment with kitchen and laundry facilities for a stay that long, but we managed with the hotel room. Also a very nice touch from the Guest relations manager was that not long after we arrived in our room, they had sent up a bottle of champagne and strawberries for our anniversary. Some maitenance needed, the first room we were in, the seat was broken, and in the bathrooms the tiles in some areas were mouldy / black in the grouting, but lovely all over as they were marble up the walls, the only thing i didnt like was that the shower was over the bath, a bit outdated i thought. The bed was fantastic, 1 king or 2 singles together, but it was so roomy, with feather top on the mattress and feather doona/pillows, i had the best sleep ever. When we moved rooms the bed didnt have these but they obliged and remade the bed with these extras, much appreciated. One thing I didnt like is when my husband was waiting at the counter to drop something off, the staff said to him that the workman behind him was next, i thought that guests would have come first. There was a charge for the internet which I think hotels shouldnt be charging in 5 star hotels, but we didnt need to use this.

Reviews.Title: “Above average except....”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My only complaint was the terrible house keeping service which, on 2 days of my 3 day stay, took many hours for the room to be serviced. First day 3 hours and second last day took 10 hours. Very disappointed as this hotel is the flagship for the Accor brand. The room rate is expensive so I expect good service. The food, on the other had, is lovely and well presented. I think it is time for the rooms to be refurbished as they are starting to look a bit shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Achingly bad. Literally”
Reviews.Author: Talanoaman
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Wentworth bills itself as a five star hotel yet couldn't meet the basic standard for even the world's poorest lodging during our miserable stay, which is to provide a bed we could sleep in comfortably. Anyone who reads my previous reviews will know I'm not in the business of nitpicking. But if a five star property is going to relieve you of a large amount of money and then subject you to the discomfort we suffered, then it deserves to be eviscerated. We were given a superior room - Room 639 - on checkin so this wasn't even standard fare. The room itself was bright and serviceable, though with an LCD television that was so small it was barely viewable from the bed. But the problems began when we checked out the bedding. A thick duvet and no sheet. Hello? The temperature was 41 degrees in Sydney on February 5th so the idea of languishing under a duvet, no matter how low the air conditioning, was hardly appealing. We rang housekeeping. No answer. We rang reception. "We'll pass on the message to housekeeping. We'll get a sheet to you shortly". Two hours passed. We rang housekeeping. No answer. We rang reception. "Oh, sorry I'll get onto it straight away". An hour later, we went out, expecting the find the sheet in our room when we returned. Six hours later, still no sign of it. I rang reception and angrily said I would check out in 15 minutes if we didn't get a sheet. It finally arrived, eight hours after the first request. This is incredible in a competitive five star market like Sydney. But it was when we were finally in bed that things really deteriorated. The "king bed" is made up of two twins, both of which sagged in the middle in a way that I've only ever struck in the worst doss houses in Africa or the Middle East. We barely slept and arose nursing pains in the lower back. I called the Duty Manager, wanting to show him just how bad the bed was. He arrived with another Duty Manager called Mohammed who proceeded to tell us that there was nothing wrong with the bed, a statement that provoked incredulity and anger from us after our appalling ordeal. "But you can see the sagging in the middle on both beds!" "Oh that's Sofitel's "My Bed". If you don't like it, you should have taken off the top layer of feathers". "But you can see the bed itself is sagging. So much so that we've both got sore backs and barely slept". " I'm sorry, we'll look into it after you've left but I can't see anything wrong with it", was the response. We checked out soon afterwards, determined not to spend another cent in a hotel that treats its guests with such disdain. Believe me, the Sofitel Wentworth is a disgrace, except perhaps as the setting for a bad movie you might call "Sleepless in Room 639". And if the Sofitel "My Bed" is a feature of this chain globally, then its Accor owners are sadists for inflicting it on the travelling public and masochists if they enjoy it themselves. An experience never to be repeated.

Reviews.Title: “wentworth worthy and worth it”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Plane delayed, arrived at restaurant floor at 9.30pm, only one other person finishing a meal, it was no problem for them, fully professional, not rushed. Stayed many times, often delighted, never disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “stay in sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was adequate, centrally located to our needs. We dined in the resturant, service and food were excellent. Unfortunately the ajoining table were rude and loud which ruined our evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: happyislanders66 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. The lobby is always gorgeous! Rooms are small but well appointed. Services is always excellent. Our preferred choice in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and modern, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sdwylie
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay at the Sofitel Wentworth for business. Generally, the hotel is very accommodating, and the service I have received is some of the best I have ever experienced in a hotel, and the ambience of the rooms and public areas is modern and luxurious. The staff have a way of making everyone feel welcome and valued. The restaurant, bar, and room service menus all offer interesting and well prepared meals, if a little on the pricey side. I find the room rates tend to be fairly good value at the right times, but the hotel car parking costs are quite high, and there's no self-park option at the hotel. It's well worth paying for the superior room rather than a classic room - as, although they're all exceptionally comfortable, the classic rooms are particularly small. The rooms are all exceptionally quiet and comfortable, and the beds are the best I've experienced in any hotel in Sydney. The hotel has a high standard of attention to detail, and on the odd occasion I've had an issue with any aspect of my stay, the hotel has done their best to fix the situation. This is a definite Sydney favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Staff need to be trained in hospitality”
Reviews.Author: albert26Cairns
Reviews.Content: Very unfriendly hotel, staff and management have very limited customer service experience. Much prefer Sheraton on the Park and The Westin Hotel for service and quality. Just don't expect them to do anything more during your stay than check you in at 2.00pm and out at 11.00am the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Jan 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I got the room at staff rates so I can hardly complain, however I stayed at the Sofitel in Brisbane the year before in the same kind of room and found it much nicer, fixtures etc. seemed a lot newer in Brisbane. Our room at the Wentworth seemed really bare and there were a few smudges on the walls. Plus there was some building going on outside that was a bit annoying during the day especially early in the morning. However, the staff at the sofitel wentworth were fantastic and the service great. Plus, location is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “My disappointment with Sofitel Sydney Wentworth”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: To start, my partner and I arrived mid evening (I did advise Sofitel I would be late after a day of meetings). I drove to the Wentworth street entrance and battled with taxis to park in the drop-off/pick-up point. Went inside to be told that I would have to drive around to the rear of the building to use the car-park and valet service. Finally got inside and I upgraded to the 'Club Sofitel' on offer. The front desk didn't bother telling us that there was a 'happy hour' ongoing in Club Sofitel lounge so being unaware of this we chose to have a drink outside the Hotel so missed out on 'happy hour'. The room was OK but didn't have any ice in the fridge. I inquired a passing staff member about an ice machine on the floor but was told that I would have to go to the ground floor bar or ring room service. I chose to go downstairs only to be given a glass of ice - not an ice bucket, just a single glass containing about 6 ice cubes! Meanwhile, my partner asked reception about an alternate latex pillow as she doesn't like feather pillows only to be told that the pillow she wanted had quote "Run out" unquote and none were available. No one was answering the house keeping phone by the way. Next morning, we went to breakfast and as per normal practise and habit, I displayed my Advantage Plus card only to be told that it was invalid in Club Sofitel and that to use it, I would have to go to another meal area and pay for breakfast. I pointed out to the staff member that I had paid extra to be upgraded to Club Sofitel status so she checked a list and surprise surprise, there was my name! During breakfast, I asked for some tomato sauce as there was none to be seen. It was brought to me after a short wait when 5 minutes later, the same staff member asked if she could have the tomato sauce back. I was flabbergasted to hear that this was the only sole tomato sauce available for the complete restaurant (There was at least 30 people having hot breakfast) Check out was quite painless and I admit to being glad to leave the Sofitel Wentworth!

Reviews.Title: “anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this was the 10th year we have spent our wedding anniversary at the sofitel.It was just as pleasant as previous years although there was no special treatment for our 53 years married as happened in previous times-we did enjoy our 0/n stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “thumbs up for sofitel wentworth”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: my stay at the wentworth sofitel was very satisfying! we especially enjoyed the restuarant and longe down stars, we were very impessed with the quality of the food. A handy location within sydeny CBD, walking distance to most areas. We would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wentworth Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel but the costs of eating and drinking in this place is way out of line. Far too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Our Anniversary Stay at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Sofitel Sydney Wentworth. We received a wonderful welcome and congratulatory gift for our anniversary from the hotel. The reception service, room service and food services from the restaurant were excellent. The food was fantastic and prepared to order. The location of the hotel allowed for easy access to all of the Sydney sights we were interested in, including the harbour, opera house, the rocks, art gallery, theatre and the domain. However, after a busy day of sightseeing, it was disappointing to find that our room was unmade at the end of each day, when we were tired and needed private time to rest and relax. Also, a charge for ice was unnecessary and excessive, even though it was small.

Reviews.Title: “Good 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: SitoCH
Reviews.Content: This is a good 5 star hotel located in the middle of the city, it's great if you plan to get around because everything is near. The staff was always friendly and helpful and we didn't have any problems at the desk like others so I think that they added more staff. The only downside is the price for in room internet: 25$ / day is very high and I expected to be included in the room's price or at least pay a lot less (especially since it's throttled).

Reviews.Title: “immaculate hotel for sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: incredible value for inner city hotel excellant access to the opera house, harbour the true heart of the city easy transport road and seaside.

Reviews.Title: “Beware parking rip off”
Reviews.Author: snowdavs
Reviews.Content: Having booked our hotel room in conjunction with tickets to the Jersey Boys show we checked in to the hotel and paid top dollar for a room which was pretty tired. Not only was breakfast not part of the tariff but on arriving back home 2 days later our credit card had been debited without our permission,for car parking. At no time were we informed that parking would be charged and certainly not at the rate that they charge! The bottom line is, I believe that some hotels in Australia are not offering fair value for money! It's no wonder there is a mass exodus of tourists overseas!!

Reviews.Title: “Desk Check-In”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: There aren't enough staff on the check-in desk. For an international hotel I felt that having to wait whilst airline staff all checked in was bit rough. When you know they are coming in you need to put extra staff on to serve other guests checking in. I think you need to review the needs of guests, I know the airlines are paying guests too, but maybe a little thought for other guests might go a long way.

Reviews.Title: “POOR SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel and the air con wasnt working, i complaint 5 times and everytime a guy rocks up and says it is working and will ne fine. Finally after 6th time i had 2 to go to the reception and ask for manager. Who was also least intrested, but some how deciedd to change my room. Still it wasnt working in the other room too, so i was very pissed off. Finally i checked into the 3rd room and caught up on some lost sleep esp, after a cancelled flight. So would not recomment people to stay, if they do make sure the a/c works and if not straight away request for a room change. To some it all they didnt even offer any free upgrade or complmentary meals for the inconvience caused.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We came to Sydney for a relaxing day and certainly found it at the Sofitel. It was great to have parking and a good welcome by parking attendants. The reception in the main foyer was lovely and the staff courteous. Our evening meal was a delight and the service good though a little slow. Our bedroom was pleasant and my only comment would be that the mattress was too soft - I have a bad back. Otherwise a delightful time

Reviews.Title: “Pretty lousy hotel - not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: normanjamesnorman
Reviews.Content: Check in and chack out are appallingly lengthy. Constant battle to get coffee at breakfast - lack of management evident. Classic rooms poky and smelly. Housekeeping lacksadaisical. Toilets not well cleaned. Bath tiling needs regrouting. Foyer is 5 star - rooms and service are distinctly poor.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I found the staff courteous, efficient and willing to pleasant. The food in the Lounge Bar was most enjoyable. The bed was spacious and the pillows extremely soft.

Reviews.Title: “Camplin”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed before at the Sofitel Wentworth, and booked our accommodation thru the Accor Advantage Plus website, however this time we had to cancel at the last minute as my husband became ill and couldn't travel. We reside in regional NSW. The booking staff were most courteous. They rang me the next day to say that there would be no charge for the cancellation which was a nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, shame about the Quilt”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: What is it with otherwise 5 star hotels and their obsession with cooking their guests alive? After a lousy nights sleep the last time we stayed there we actually asked at time of booking for a sheet/blanket combo as an alternative to the Antartic-rated quilt that is so hot your choices are 1 Staying awake all night 2 Staying awake and frying or 3 throwing off the quilt and doing battle with the air con. What we got was a very warm (again) and scratchy blanket but no sheet. I fear they don't own any. Neither of us slept at all well. What's the point of a place to sleep if you can't?

Reviews.Title: “25th Wedding Anniversary Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great gift of wine, strawberries and chocolate (unexpected!). Great difficulty in getting firm pillows for the bed (three phone calls and got one for the first night), asked at reception for am papers and never received them. Reception was great and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was our second getaway to the Sofitel Sydney and is one of our favourite hotels in the city. We upgraded to club sofitel which is excellent value, this gave us a lovely environment to meet with our friends and enjoy unlimited food and drinks. The superior room was very nice however the bed and pillows were very soft and the airconditioning a bit noisy during the night. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself is fine but the check in and out procedure leaves a lot to be desired. It took over 20 mins to check in and longer than that to check out. No excuses, if 11am is check out time then man the front desk to suit the times that you have set . Same with check in, be flexibel and have back ups staff available

Reviews.Title: “club room overcrowded”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a very good venue with good service & pleasant staff. upgrade to club rooms is a bit disappointing as way to many for them to cater for so difficult to enjoy breakfast & amenities as overcrowded

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel....nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: ok hotel....would benefit from a pool, more comfortable pillows and really for the price the rooms could have been better!! If you stay in the club sofitel I strongly suggest you have the breakfast that is served to the general stays as the club sofitel breakfast was terrible, non edible e.g. pancakes you could use as coasters they were that hard and the wait for a cup of tea was 45min!!! don't bother paying the upgrade...The restaurant was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Wentworth”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We are members of Accor Advantage Plus and on a recent visit to Sydney we took our complimentary night at the Sofitel Wentworth which is located near to where we were going to a theartre, I upgraded the room and joined Club Sofitel and my wife and I had a marvellous time within the Hotel thourougly enjoying the service we received in Club Sofitel. We were also very pleased with our room. The food that we had during our stay was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: LynnBAustralia Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have stayed at this Hotel many times. We have always found it to be of a high standard. It is in a good location not far from the Rocks and Circular Key. The rooms are clean, and comfortable and have all the necessary facilities. Staff are friendly and helpful. Restaurant is of a high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Buggalugs
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Softel Wentworth every couple of years when dining out in th city, I have held events at the hotel and always found it a good value five star since it became a Sofitel. Great for couples, the service is excellent, the location is great also, being a wlak to anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: baldog
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant staff really endear me to this hotel. Been coming here regularly for several years and have yet to come across one employee who has been less than very pleasant. The lobby area is very stylish with elegant bar. Rooms are well furnished, bathrooms are smallish but well laid out. The beds are a little too soft for my liking, but that's a personal thing. The bedlinens are excellent Now here's the 'but'. The one thing that really, really irks me is the internet service. It's horrendously expensive for what you get. $27 for 24hrs, however only the first 100mb (tiny) is at broadband speed. After that it slows right down to virtually dial up speed (you must pay per MB to continue at BB speed). Streaming etc is then impossible. However it's still not unlimited as 'fair usage' is capped at 1GB in that 24hr period! Huh?! That's a 90 minute film! This may to an OZ thing in general as the country is pretty behind in the IP stakes, in which case not a gripe specifically against the Wentworth.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We experienced a lovely stay at the Sofitel Wentworth. The staff were friendly & very helpful throught our stay - from the doorman to the restaurant which provided 1st class meals and and a perfect Christmas banquet. We will definately be going back! The location was excellent - great for a walk along the harbour or wonderful shopping just on the doorstep.Our rooms were spacious ,the beds a little soft for our liking but everything else was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape plan”
Reviews.Author: selilekwi Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As a girlie getaway for a friend and I, I booked a couple of days in a Luxury Room at Club Sofitel between Christmas and New Year. For the most part the facilities and service was well worth the additional cost. Access to Club Sofitel afforded us access to breakfast, afternoon tea and pre-dinner drinks which was a real treat although more vegetarian options would have been appreciated. I have stayed in this hotel on previous occasions in both Classic and Superior rooms and while the â€˜Luxuryâ€™ room was a little smaller than expected it was comfortable all the same. This was possibly due to little touches as the complimentary Evian and chocolate at turndown in the evening, and the amazing king sized bed that seems to envelope you for a divine rest each night. Room service was prompt and food arrived piping hot, a problem with the TV remote control was sorted with the minimum of fuss and a menu for the day spa located in the hotel complex delivered without delay. On the downside there was nowhere to dine-in the room comfortably which we chose to do on one occasion, the daily â€˜housekeepingâ€™ neglected to wash all used crockery, Iâ€™m assuming because cups werenâ€™t completely empty, and towels were replaced in spite of our decision to follow in room instructions for reusing towels and bathrobes. Iâ€™m also curious why hotels donâ€™t use fitted sheets on their beds as we had an ongoing battle keeping the bottom sheet in place. Most Club Staff were attentive although at times distracted, perhaps due to the demands of more insistent guests. On the whole we enjoyed our stay at the Sofitel Sydney Wentworth as a treat for having survived a long and busy year. A little bit of luxury we all deserve from time to time.Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Indulgence”
Reviews.Author: DomenicPapa Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I take advantage of my Advantage Plus membership and upgrade my free night to a suite, with Club Sofitel access. We then indulge ourselves with a night of good food, drinks and the hotels excellent service. (if it sounds like an advertisement its because we love staying here). Even though we stay on Boxing Day and I an sure staffing levels are minimal due to the holidays, the staff are still friendly and attentive. We hope to be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Xmas in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of Sydney. Staff were very polite and helpful, food was first rate. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure to stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mondialtiles
Reviews.Content: Great luxury hotel staff were very freindly and did everything possible to help with requests .We had the Luxury club sofitel room which included the club sofitel prvileges, private check in check out, all day refreshments and hor d"oeuvres and the assistance given to us by Danielle at the front desk of the club sofitel was super and a credit to sofitel sydney wentworth for having staff like her. The hotel was very central and close to everything the rooms were not big, but for the style and era of hotel they were big enough, I normaly travel internationaly and stay at hotels in the oriental group, pan pacific, and intercontinental group of hotels, but will be staying at more sofitel group hotels from now on . Will be staying at the sofitel next time Iam in sydney

Reviews.Title: “Stay review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Christmas lunch had a very high price tag, but understanding you are paying 3x wages for the day, and the standard of service and food was excellent, I could not complain. Excellent stay. Would do it again, when we can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: conniequeensland Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Sydney Wentworth is one of Sydney's top Hotels. You can have a delicious meal in the Restaurant. The rooms are spacious and very good service. A central position; but if you want a view of the Harbour you will need to choose another Hotel with a Harbour view.

Reviews.Title: “very happy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Sylvia in the restaurant was especially welcoming and friendly. thank-you.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not quite 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had an enjoyable stay. Found the location to be great but the service to be average, especially in the Club Lounge. Stayed in a Club Sofitel Prestige Suite which was very nice but still had the old style televisions, which was disappointing. Good 4 Star hotel in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Thankyou”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many of your accor affilliated hotels both here in Australia and throughout Asia. In general the staff were fantastic however the staff in the sofrital club with the exception of the club receptionist could be a little more attentive. Tea pots were a concern on more than one occassion. I asked for a cup of tea on two occassions only to be told there was no tea pots left, considering the cost of the stay one would have thought obtaining a cup of tea would not be a concern. The location was made of dreams what a beautiful city is Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the upsell”
Reviews.Author: JunBoston Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving, we were informed that our Sofitel Platinum upgrade for the next room level was not available because the hotel was sold out. However, the next statement from the female staff at the front desk was that she "could upgrade the room to the next level for an extra AUD40.00 per night". After calling this contradiction to the attention of more senior hotel staff, we were promptly upgraded to the next room level without charge. In addition, the hotel gave us access to the Club Lounge during our stay. Very good recovery and the proper way to respond. Our concern is that the staff at the front desk may be operating with some kind of incentive compensation plan that is causing them to literally lie, cheat and steal to upsell you. This time around they were selling us an upgrade that should have been offered for free. On our last time staying in this hotel, we were given all the reasons why we would save money if we took the Club Sofitel upgrade option. If you are going to Sofitel Wentworth in Sydney, just be aware and make sure that you are getting the deal you agreed to when making your reservation and kindly turn down all the efforts the front desk will make to "help you" with a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “worst nights sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: possiegirl Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: firstly the parking $45 overnight way too expensive.Secondly when asked if we could leave the car till the afternoon we were told we could but it would cost $9 per half hour after the 24 hrs was up,we have always been able to do this at most other hotels at no charge.Thirdly the receptionist was not very freindly on check in,not a good start.The room was very small,one of the smallest rooms I have stayed in especially for a 5 star hotel,the bathroom also was minute,we are not big people and my husband had to walk in sideways.Unfortunately our room was near the lift and all night long people were getting out and laughing and talking loudly with no thoughts to any one who may have been sleeping,it was without doubt the worst nights sleep we have ever had in a hotel; and I would say stay in the 3 star Ibis it is actually much better value.We had gone for a relaxing break and when we got home we were exhausted.The following week we styayed at the Sofital in Broadbeach Qld and couldn,t have had a more different experience it was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Lunch at the Sofitel Wentworth in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have always considered a stay at the Sofitel Sydney Wentworth to be a real pleasure and a bonus for joining the Accor Club - this time we used the opportunity to invite our niece to join us for a 'quick lunch' - watch out if you are really short of time, as there was a large group of people who didn't seem to be in a hurry were served first. I noticed that in the main dining area the meals were served very late. This was disappointing as our niece has only just started her job and we were embarrassed that she would have been late. This was the only time there has been the necessity for a critical comment - and we would most certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “far from 5 star”
Reviews.Author: plecman
Reviews.Content: upon arival we were impressed with the lobby area and told by friendly staff we had a private check in at club sofitel.We were then told we had been upgraded to a luxury room,this was much apreciated.It was from this time on the hotel let itself down.Upon entering the tiny room we were some what dissapointed.The king size bed was way too soft with a hump in the middle that made a cuddle almost impossible,there was no nespresso machine,and in the right light you could see what looked like urine stains on the wall around the toilet.The breakfast in club sofitel was very average,the bacon was like glass(nearly broke my teeth),pancakes were soggy,and no menu to select from(unlike sofitel on collins melbourne).So i asked the staff if i could have some eggs benidict from the kitchen,that was fine and after around 20 min they arrived.I dont know who cooked them but all i could taste was vinegar on over cooked eggs.Canopes were boring also.I am a regular sofitel on collins(melbourne)stayer and realy find a stay there hard to fault.Come on guys lift your game a little and stop riding the sofitel name.

Reviews.Title: “No, won't be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: DZA_A
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel only 3 days before our visit as we had a last minute meeting scheduled in Sydney. At check in, we tried to upgrade, but were unable to as the hotel was heavily booked. The check-in guy told us that we were in a VIP room so it should be nice anyway. After seeing the room though, it was obvious that the "VIP" comment must be a line the hotel uses as there was nothing special about this room. The fabric on furniture had stains as did the carpet. The bathroom was full of mold. It was disgusting - mold at the back of the sink and around the shower. We stayed 2 nights only - Friday and Saturday night. There was a party in the hotel restaurant several floors below our room, but we could hear the music until early hours of morning. Not cool. The bed was somewhat comfortable (even though it was two single beds pushed together), but we could not sleep because of the booming music. The TV/Pay TV did not work the entire time we were there. The service guy came up several times. First he insisted we were not pressing the correct buttons on the remote (ridiculous). He ended up resetting the TV on more than one occasion but no luck... eventually he gave some lame reason why it wasn't working, blaming the pay TV provider. There is no excuse for this. There was one bathrobe in our room, and we needed two. There were no slippers. I called Housekeeping several times to ask for another bathrobe and 2 pairs of slippers but no one answered the Housekeeping line. So then I called Room Service, Concierge, Reception, etc. for about 20 minutes just to speak to someone... anyone... and no one answered. The lines just rang and rang. Finally, someone at reception answered and very pleasantly said she would have a bathrobe and 2 pairs of slippers sent to the room. An hour or so later we received 1 bathrobe but no slippers. Called again and the phone rang and rang. Finally, reception answered and I asked for the slippers again. Eventually they were delivered. Had the same issues with no one answering the phone when we called about the TV not working. The phone issues are beyond ridiculous. We both felt the cologne scent in the lobby was overwhelming. We ate at the hotel once and it was less than memorable. The positives: hotel staff were nice, and location was good. Concierge staff were helpful and gave good restaurant recommendations. This stay was one of the worst hotel experiences we've had in a long time. For $450 per night, I expect to at least have a clean room, without mold, and a TV that works. I would not stay here again, nor would I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Star quality”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: was a lovely night. club facilities excellent. would have liked complimentary wi-fi in my own club room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Would like to thank the Wentworth hotel for making our stay most enjoyable and my husband and I look forward to another stay but longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Foyer is the best part of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Googliana
Reviews.Content: Once you get past the beautiful foyer and are checked in by very courteous reception staff the rooms are a disappointment. The rooms look tired for a 5 star hotel & are very noisy we stayed on level 6 and heard the scrapes of chairs from restaurant below until late at night and then again early in the morning. Doors are very thin, do not get a room opposite lifts, the comings and goings of other guests can be heard through the doors easily. Choose another 5 star hotel for a romantic weekend. I made a complaint about our room and never heard back from the hotel, so I guess they don't care.

Reviews.Title: “Slow dinning”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Once again we enjoyed the pleasures of the wentworth in Sydney, after a slight hicup with my accor booking we found a pleasant room, we ventured to the downstairs bar wich was overcrowded were the drinks arrived after more than 15 mins, we enquired about how long a snack would take as it we were going to a concert, we were told that the kitchen was quite and about 15 mins that was 6pm . We had to change to room service which arrived at 7.15pm. Not overly happy.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel with an excellent restaurant”
Reviews.Author: gwokypoodle
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel several times and find it very pleasant and comfortable. I arrived early morning but my body clock was telling me it was evening so I was delighted by the variety on offer at the excellent breakfast buffet in the Garden Court restaurant including smoked salmon and sparkling wine. I also ate dinner in the restaurant one night and it was superb with very helpful and friendly staff. Not cheap but not absurdly priced and well worth it. Another dining option in the hotel is the lobby bar which serves brasserie type food all day and afternoon tea. The lobby area of the hotel is very airy and spacious and furnished with very contemporary seating. My room was slightly smaller than I had expected but was very modern and the bed was supremely comfortable. The hotel is in an excellent location just five to ten minutes walk from The Rocks and Quayside where there are numerous eating opportunities with views overlooking The Opera House and the bridge and from where to catch ferries. The staff in the hotel were friendly especially the concierge who seemed to delight in their job. There is a gym and a spa in the hotel which I did not use but no swimming pool. However, the concierge informed me that there was an Aquatics centre very nearby The hotel charges a surcharge of 1.5% if you pay your bill with a credit card or a non Australian debit card which I found very strange indeed. I shall be staying in the hotel for a couple of days in January and am looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A fabulous place to stay...very good room and generally the staff were attentive. Unfortunately at both check in and departure the service was very sub-standard. Long delays and staff that seemed distant and disinterested. Yet if you can survive this, it's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable night”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: When my wife & I stayed there the service and people were great,the room was clean and tidy and we had a really good time.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: ShaneQld_Australia
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights from 2 December 2010. I was with my wife and 4 year old daughter. I had bought 2 nights at the hotel in a charity auction and paid advantage plus rate of $330 for the third night. The hotel was fine but not sofitel good. It was more in line with the novotel standard rather than sofitel standard. That is in the room standards. The lobby and other common areas were very classy. Because we were travelling with our little one i rang the hotel when booking our nights to find out if a twin double beds room would sleep us all comfortably. I was assured that it would. We arrived late (11pm) on the first night and when we got up to our room we found that a double/double room is really 2 single beds not 2 double beds. Clearly we couldn't all sleep comfortably like that. I went back down to reception to enquire and was told that was their double/double room setup and I was asked if the 2 beds were pushed together. I confirmed that they were but they were made separately and that our little one wouldn't like sleeping on the crack between the 2 beds! To their credit they delivered up a rollaway bed for my daughter and there was no fee for that. Just a word of warning though that a double/double is really a single/single and 2 couples could not share a room with that bedding setup. We had complimentary bfast for the first 2 mornings and it was fine but not great. I definitely wouldn't pay $35 a head for it. The location of the hotel was ok. We walked down to circular quay to catch the ferry and the free CBD shuttle bus pulled up not far from the hotel if you didn't want to walk. There wasn't a lot in the way of restaurants around the hotel. There was a couple of coffee shops near the rear entrance of the hotel. The walk to Martin Place and the pitt st mall wasn't too far. The concierge was very helpful, assisting us with details of getting to taronga zoo, luna park etc. He also recommended an italian restaurant for us near Darling Harbour called Casa del Nico at which we dined saturday night and had a great meal. Checkout on sunday morning was frustarting. There was a very long line and a 25min wait. I think it was partly due to the arrival of an emirates flight crew checking in at what was checkout time for everyone else. I think this hotel would be a reasonable choice for business travel but not at full rack rate. The rooms and furnishings are a bit tired and there really isn't the facilities at the hotel to make it a good choice for an extended holiday stay. We were happy enough but would look elsewhere next time at the price range this is currently situated in.

Reviews.Title: “no swimming pool?”
Reviews.Author: SasiUruguay
Reviews.Content: even not having a swimming pool, i think its a nice hotel. Very class and well located. Service was good overall but with some shortfalls. After a 14 hour flight i got there, checked in, and went to my room to find that it wasn't cleaned after the previous guest left (bed undone, etc). I called reception from the telephone located in the floor, and someone who bearly spoke English couldn't understand that i was just checking in when i found a messy room. I think this person thought i was saying that my room wasn't made up that day, and told me to wait in the room saying she would send the cleaners... I had to go down carring my bags to try to speak with somebody else who could understand what was happening, and finally got a new room. My advise, English test before hiring, we are talking about Australia, i don't care if the employees don't speak Spanish or Greek, but English they MUST be able to understand.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We did not find the service of the standard of our previous five stays - cups not washed up and coffee not replenished. We actually stayed from 21st - 27th not 22nd as noted. The restuarant menu was not as enticing as other years but the service was impeccible

Reviews.Title: “Bed too soft”
Reviews.Author: Ted4606 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a back room. It was like sleeping in a big queen "baby bed" - too soft for this bear! Everything else was as expected from a Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Baraka4589
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel in conjunction with a show package it's just as well the show was great because the Sofitel was really not up to all the hype in its advertising. We stayed in a Classic City view room which was extremely small, the furniture was worn out, the bed and mattress needed replacing, there were no curtains at the window and the bathroom was built into a cupboard (or at least that is what it appeared to be) very small and grotty with mould in the tilesand a cracked sink. I really can't think of one good reason why I would ever stay there again or even recommend it to others. Obviously the Accor group need to spend some money on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Sofitel added to the memory of a happy holiday”
Reviews.Author: carryon70 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days and were satisfied with our room which we upgraded to, from a classic room. Marvellous location, friendly and efficient staff. Dining options were excellent and food very good. , Had problems using busines centre. the computers didn't function as I would expect and it cost a lot of money to us them without little results.

Reviews.Title: “Feedback on Stay in Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the service. I actually told the hotel about it when I had to fill in a feedback form from he hotel. The manager was ver apologetic and he has given me a free upgrade on my next stay. I strongly believe that a good customer service is very important especially when this hotel has been rated as a five-star hotel in the accor group of hotels,

Reviews.Title: “6th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Sofitel Wentworth, Sydney. I have wanted to stay here for a while and we finally booked it for our wedding anniversary. Staff were excellent and the Club room was fantastic. We were spoilt with complimentry champagne and strawberries for our anniversary which was a very special touch. My only criticism would be the condition of the bath in the Luxury Club Room. It had chips the porcelain and dry paint drips and it was small for a luxury room. Other than that we had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed stay at Sofitel. Excellent location for city shopping,circular quay and Rocks area. Short stroll to city rail stations. Room was good size and bed was huge and VERY comfortable.All staff very pleasant and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Objective”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Bathroom a little dated in room I stayed in x x x x

Reviews.Title: “A great break!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location and very comfortable. A little bit of luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Midweek stay at the Sofitel Wentworth”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Check-in was efficient but could not cope with our 2 day booking so we had to revalidate our door keycards after being "locked out" of our room on day 2. Each day of the booking was at a different rate for the same room, with the cheaper rate receiving signficantly poorer quality towels. Despite following the "energy saving" policy of hanging our towels they were taken by house-keeping and replaced replaced with inferior quality towels. The room was very pleasant, quiet and comfortable with a nice view. Housekeeping and concierge staff were friendly. Location was good for the purpose of our visit and convenient to transport, parks, harbour, theatre and shopping. The hotel is at the high price but has many facilities and services, if you have the time.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colin358 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Wentworth is a well regarded Sydney hotel in the heart of the city. The foyer is attractive and spacious and the staff are welcoming and friendly. The only major drawback were the relatively small rooms for a 5 star hotel that were not in good repair - stained chairs and blinds that were broken. An upmarket hotel that needs to maintain the upkeep of its rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. Lovely big room and great large bed. Will stay again some time. The newspaper didnt arrive on Monday

Reviews.Title: “Went without breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the sofitel was a surprise prsent for my partner and i chose a breakfast inclusive package. I was very upset to find that there was a miscommunication and or a misunderstanding between your staff, the kitchen and myself. needless to say we didnt recieve any breakfast on the morning of our departure.

Reviews.Title: “suite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The suite was my favourite room at the hotel and included a separate powder room, and the club room facilities (included) were excellent. Staff were particularly nice.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The only disappointment I had was the window blind could not be opened for a clear view, otherwise very good. Regards Richard Sargeson.

Reviews.Title: “One very good room one dreadful room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: First night complimientary as advantage plus member - the room was dreary, torn upholstery on chair,mouldy bathroom and very small - worse than a cheap motel Second night paid for and upgraded because of complaint Much more like a luxurious hotel For a luxury expensive hotel the classic rooms are very poor

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location Rooms OK if you are lucky but snobby staff”
Reviews.Author: theowldullsville
Reviews.Content: First up the location is perfect walking distance to just about everything you could want to see even Darling Harbour and China town if you like walking its not far. Only 2 blocks to Circular Quay and the beauty of the harbour. None of the rooms have harbour views only city and if you are over looking the courtyard area onto HPhillip you might think this is OK but if you are looking into a brick wall almost right up against the glass you will not be happy so check this out before arrival Some of the restaurant staff are what you would describe as warm and hospitable however for the most part especially the reception and front office team including the porters are disinterested and avoid eye contact , only greet you if you initiate it and are not helpful-what a shame for the Wentworth with its claim to fame as Australia's first 5 star hotel-It is not a five star hotel anymore though, for a start no swimming pool- this was missed and there is no other arrangement for guests Breakfast will be boring after 2 days small selection and dinner in both the restaurant and lobby area was excellent quality and serve for a premium price Stay at the Wentworth for its location but in a place like Sydney you have plenty of choices and there is no point of difference in choosing the Wentworth over any other

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable elegance and service”
Reviews.Author: Kiwigirl58 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It doesn't get better than this. Upgraded to Suite, used Business Lounge. Far exceeded expectations. Totally refurbed and standard of decor/product is 6 star I feel. Staff are naturally attentive and on to it. Nothing too much trouble in any part of the hotel. Fantastic service from arrival to departure. Lounge staff are intelligent and accommodating. Quiet rooms, fast lifts, great food, the Business Lounge is definitely worth it, b/fast, afternoon tea and light food with evening drinks. Location fantastic. Have travelled the world and this superb Hotel is by far one of the best. Not pretentious but totally elegant and worth every penny. Loved the garden for peace and quiet. Beds hugely comfy. Nespresso coffee machines in room were a treat. This place is like heaven one earth right in the middle of Sydney city. So close to transport and business or personal interests one has in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
