Reviews.Content: The Wentworth is my favourite place to stay. The staff are friendly and extremely helpful. It has everything a traveller or visitor could possibly need. I recommend it to any wishing to spoil themselves or a loved one.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stronly recommend you upgrad to the Club Room which included entry to the Club Lounge - this is where we checked in instead of the entry foyer. We were able to relax in the Club room having a couple of drinks and light snacks. We paricularly enjoyed the complimentary afternoon tea as well as the complimentary pre dinner drinks and finger food from 5.30 till 7.30pm. The room was lovely - clean fresh on the second highest floor. The bathroom was luxurious and the bed had a thick underlay which made the bed even more comfortable than normal. Our complimentary buffet breakfast in the morning was also served in the Club Room which allowed you to relax in the comfortable lounge chairs enjoying breakfast quietly. The service overall was also exceptional. We are members of the Accor Advanatage Club as well as the Accor Vacation Club and its our stays at the Sofitel which makes our decion to join both a wise one. We are looking forward to our next stay at the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations not met”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel Wentworth a couple of years back and it was much better. Bathroom was not clean. Hair on the shower tiles. Pulman at Olympic Park is so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Blissfull sleep”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before going on a South Pacific cruise. Spend the extra money and upgrade to Club Sofitel. Exclusive check in area, beautiful buffet breakfast and your own private club lounge. Sublime!! We have stayed here before and to my mind this is the best 5 star hotel in Sydney. Everything is elegantly understated, the service is superb and the beds are the most comfortable you will probably ever sleep in. The rooms are quiet and with the blackout curtains can transform day into night. A beautiful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Conference attendee”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is a wonderful hotel for a conference. The amenities are excellent, service prompt, food delicious. The only issue I had was the room size. On other occasions I have had a larger room, but this time, sharing with a colleague, our single beds were practically touching and the room was tiny. There was also no space to hang dresses in the wardrobe. The room would have been perfect for a single person or a couple, but not suitable for two singles.

Reviews.Title: “Principals Conference”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Wentworth is a superb venue for a large conference. Excellent major conference room and more than adequate break out rooms if required. Conference meals were superb and service was nothing short of outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in CBD”
Reviews.Author: Happy0nH0liday
Reviews.Content: Clean, well appointed hotel in Sydney CBD. Only thing lacking is a swimming pool and an expanded room service menu (not many choices- no vegetarian or healthy options).

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Jassym
Reviews.Content: I extended my stay in Sydney before my conference and stayed at the Sofitel. I didn't expect it to be so close to Circular Quay and Martin Place. All the places I wanted to visit were within walking distance. The rooms were also nice, though I have one complaint - the internet access. I had to pay for it and could only get wireless at the lobby. Other than that, the staff were wonderful, especially the concierge. The restaurant also had good food and service (there's no bad food in Sydney!) The gym, located at the basement, is bigger than many hotel gyms, but it's a little dingy, having no windows.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_85_10
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with our stay at the hotel. PROS Central location - you can walk to Circular Quay and the hotel is in the CBD Decent rooms - the room was a little dated, but still quite nice. Comfortable Sofitel bed Glamourous lobby Helpful concierge Several restaurants and access to a health club. CONS Meals are overpriced. We found many staff to be rude - we came back to the hotel after a walk and in the elevator couldn't find our key, and a staff member came in and asked us to step out - he acted as though we were trespassing and was suspicious and rude, not helpful and understanding, even though we were hotel guests. He did not apologise to us. The shower smelled strongly of mould. The room decor is ok but a bit dated. The room was not cleaned properly. No swimming pool. No slippers - the marble bathroom is freezing cold on bare feet! Staff were condescending and unfriendly. We were asked to spell our surname three times and the staff member acted like we were irrirating her because she couldn't understand the spelling of our name. We were woken in the middle of the night by a fire alarm. We went outside and all the guests were in the hallway. There was no announcement and we did not know what to do. Eventually a man came along and told us to go back to our rooms, but there was no announcement. Obviously a fire or a fire drill is out of their control, but they should have made an announcement about what was happening, apologised for waking everyone up, and offered at least a free drink. Very poorly handled - some people may have evacuated. VERDICT This hotel was only just ok. It's probably ok for a business trip but if you are travelling for leisure and would to stay somewhere luxurious where you will be treated well, I recommend you look elsewhere. This did not feel like a 5 star experience. The staff ruined the experience for us. Usually staff at a 5 star hotel are well trained in hospitality. Most of the staff we encountered did not even smile and did not make us feel welcome. Almost everyone we spoke with was unfriendly. It seems they need basic training in customer service. At no stage did we feel that we were being treated well. We are not demanding but I did expect friendly service with a smile at a 5 star hotel. The rooms were fine but not nice enough to make up for the lack of service and lack of attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb”
Reviews.Author: MistressL Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. From the fragrant flowers that bedeck the hotel lobby through to the luxurious club lounge. The staff were friendly and helpful. We felt relaxed and pampered. The concierge was fantastic and extremely helpful with making dinner arrangements. Written confirmation and information about the restaurant was delivered to our room. I loved the L'Occitane bath products and the only thing we could find fault with during our stay was that my man found the size of the bathtub a bit small! Other than that it was perfect and we look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: an excellent hotel with great services and very good location. A favourite and have never been let down. Friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, food and service - great beds too. Internet policy very irritating”
Reviews.Author: skyfriendbrighton
Reviews.Content: I stay here often for work and look forward to each stay. the location is great - five minutes walk to Circular Quay, same to the pedestrianised shopping areas. The lobby is impressive, service efficient. The on-site gym is good, but has restricted hours at weekends. The breakfast buffet is superb. The rooms are modern in style, and the beds are outstandingly comfortable. The A/C is effective and silent. The property was spotlessly clean. The room service I ordered was no good, but the staff effectively recovered the situation. The (expensive) internet has a very restrictive data cap which meant I ran out of bandwidth after a few hours browsing and had to pay again. This was very irritating and was a worlds first for me - very annoying. Apart from that, I love staying her and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: karen13156 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Sofitel Wentworth in Sydney lived up to its reputation. Staff were pleasant without being intrusive.The service was efficient and friendly. The upgraded room made our stay a very special night and we loved the breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Its just okay but no way luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vinay17in
Reviews.Content: I visited Sydney for business trip and stayed at Sofitel, Wentworth. The hotel is in very very nice location and is close to Sydney Harber/Opera House. The Hotel has very elegant welcome loby, and also hosts a very good bar and restaurant. I must say reception, concierge staff is very efficient and do their job best. All comes down when you hit the room. The room I stayed was having quite old furniture/decor, looks like these have not been looked upon for a while (15 yrs I guess). Room had small TV, bed with sagging matteresses and overall it was not a good feel. I changed my room from second night onwards but the other room was exact copy of the old room. I remebered Motel 6 brand from US, which gracely honored as cheapest budget hotel. I wouldn't reccommend anyone to opt for Sofitel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel spoilt by uncomfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: OuterSydneyAnnabel Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff are very friendly & helpful. But it would have been nice to have been told on check in that the dining room was unavailable till late due to a private function. This was our complementary night (as Accor Advantage Plus members), be we felt we'd been put in a "cheap" room because we chose not to upgrade (at our expense). The king size bed had a large hump in the middle which meant my husband & I slept in our own "valley" each side of the bed. This was not our first stay at this hotel, but it was definitely the most disappointing. (I wish there was a "maybe" for the recommendation.)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location close to Harbour Bridge”
Reviews.Author: Lyng10 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to the Rocks, Circular Quay,Opera House and Darling Harbour. Within five minute walk to Theatre Royal where we saw Jersey Boys. Hotel has a lobby bar, with excellent food and wine service. Staff were very helpful and able to answer all requests quickly and efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “just loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: goldcoastqueenie54
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this sofitel on six occasions and have booked again for november. We stay in a club sofitel room and have never been disappointed with the service. From the time we step out of the taxi we are treated like royalty. I would recomend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, let down by Cramped Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fwombats
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in a double/double. This combination ended up being a bit cramped, well cramped really. Other than that we had a great time. Beds are as advertised really comfortable and no problem ordering off the pillow menu. 'High Tea' in the front bar was spectacular. Staff were great also. My 16 year old daughter soon had her favourites and got the best service of the 3 of us. Valet service was efficient. Location in the business end of Sydney means you walk or taxi to most of the major attractions, although Circular Quay is only about six minutes walk away, with ferries and trains available.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value, mixed service”
Reviews.Author: richardlondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well positioned in the centre of the city, good for business and pleasure. The initial appearance in the lobby is good and the concierge team are helpful/friendly. Check-in however was painfully slow, they had just 2 staff working on a peak weekend when the hotel was full. The lack of service was a constant theme throughout my 6 night stay. Trying to call for anything resulted in either an engaged tone, or a long, long wait for anyone to answer the phone. It simply isn't acceptable for a hotel of this standard and quickly become annoying. This hotel also likes to play on it's French heritage - the staff are trained to answer the phone with â€˜Bonjourâ€™ and the like, but when you hear 'Bonjour, this is Jill...' in a strong Australian accent it sounds plain stupid and makes you feel you're in a theme park and not a business hotel. I just didn't think it was appropriate and made the staff look a bit daft. For a business hotel I'd expect a good internet connection, for a whole day it was down which was very inconvenient. I had a to repeatedly chase to get the charge waived for the period the service was unavailable. I had a superior room which I thought was well sized and nicely appointed. On the downside, it didn't have proper blinds which meant the light woke me earlier in the morning than I'd have liked. Also, noise from the street was not well insulated. All the extras - room service, laundry, breakfast etc I felt were extremely pricey - even for a hotel of this standard. Overall I'm sure there are better options for your stay in Sydney. I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a shake up. Living on its reputation. Great beds and pillows.”
Reviews.Author: daveevans22
Reviews.Content: Stunning Hotel on first look, amazing public areas, beds and pillows in the exec suites that make you feel like you're floating on a cloud. Rooms small for the money though, needed upgrading with tired furniture and faded carpets, bathroom disappointing with just a shower over the bath. "Upgraded" shampoo, etc, smelt very odd, not at all pleasant. But, oh dear, the Club Floor! Not enough seats for the number of people booked in, we had to wait nearly half an hour to get a seat then we were in an ante-room. This happened twice , afternoon tea first day and breakfast next day. Also, the french toast ran out 45mins before the end of breakfast service and we were told that there was no more. Not good enough for what is supposed to be a premium service at a premium price in a five star hotel, mes amis!!!! I have copied this review and submitted it to the hotel website where I received a message that it would be "reviewed and if found suitable posted on the website". We shall see!!

Reviews.Title: “Reconsider your stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: pk666au1
Reviews.Content: I am very glad I found this site! I would strongly recommend you reconsider staying here. My stay 2 weeks ago was less than satisfactory from check in to check out (wait time). My room was somewhat tired , paint badly scuffed, carpet stains, blind not working and the bathroom claustrophobic. I ordered room service and it arrived luke warm after an hours wait. However, today I thought I would give it another chance, it may have been an off night! How wrong I was. Arriving at Reception I was greeted to a line of people waiting (7pm and 6 people standing in line - 2 being served). When I got to Reception I requested not to be placed in the same room as last time as there was a gap at the side of the blockout blinds that the office building and street lights streamed through all not. So up I go to my room and I thought I would check the blinds before I unpacked. This time the blockout blind gets stuck halfway. Maintentenance come to my room and end up dismantling the blind. In the end I took myself back downstairs (7:30pm) and re-queue to move rooms. Finally at reception and explain situation. Get room change - guess what - there is a gap in the blind. So I try and stuff the blind behind the rail (7:45pm tired and hungry and completely over the whole experience). God help me when my room service finally arrives - let's see if I have warmer food this time! I will not be returning back. Back to the Raddison for me for my fortnightly stays in Sydney. Extremely disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Not enough for this amount of money”
Reviews.Author: rayu66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a high class hotel, however you wonder if it justifies the money you spend here. The rooms are comparable small for an hotel of this class. They are small and do simply not look as you may would expect them to be. The bar/lounge is quite loud and the food extremely expensive and just of average quality. This hotel misses a kind of personal touch. The location istelf is good in downton Sydney, suitable for business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: DACKSON
Reviews.Content: As with all Sofitels, this is a nice property but the standard rooms are very small with tiny bathrooms. I wouldn't not stay here again but I would probably rather stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: penny_mou
Reviews.Content: A relaxing few days, wish I could have stayed longer. The stunning flowers in the lobby and the friendliness of staff are a real treat. I stayed once before a month ago and the staff remembered my name, great service! Looking forward to coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jayaka_10
Reviews.Content: Solid hotel in down town Sydney. Public areas are good, as is the restaurant. The room was a little dated/dark, but Sofitel bed made up for that. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I'm switching to the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: aratamar
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant overnight stay in a superior room. The staff (reception, valet parking, bar) were all very courteous, the room was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The food at the bar was delicious and well priced. I travel frequently on business and will definitely switch my preferred stay at the Sofitel in future.

Reviews.Title: “Another Sofitel Winner.”
Reviews.Author: jolly999
Reviews.Content: Sofitel is the best upper mid range hotel chain that I stay in. This is another winner, with an outstanding location, first class staff and a lovely ambience. Keep it up,

Reviews.Title: “The Good and Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: rugbypopsie
Reviews.Content: First impressions are wonderful, Sofitel has this wonderful fragrance in their reception areas..beautiful marble floors, helpful friendly staff at reception. Valet parking is $48. We had a classic room, on 14th floor. Clean, small bathroom in marble, no bath, french toiletries. King size bed overall impressions were very good. They serve afternoon tea downstairs which looked very popular at $49 p.h. As we belong to the Accor loyalty program we decided to dine in the 5th floor restaurant. We were pleased to accept some complimentary Moet Champagne courtesy of vouchers however the meal itself was disappointing and not really of the standard you would expect, bland and not particularly interesting. The service was all over the place as well, overly solicitous and then no one for extended periods. Unfortunately the complimentary morning papers were not delivered as promised and things did not improve when we arrived at breakfast. The hot buffet was a mess, sloppy spoons, totally empty bain maries and very limited choices..what food there was was cold and it was very unappetising...even the coffee was cold..yes it was after 9.30 but the restaurant is open until 10.30. When I mentioned this they did refill the hot buffet but pouring cold sloppy scrambed eggs all over the new bowl in front of us was not a good look. I have to say when asked on check out I said that the breakfast $45 p.h. was not up to the expected standard they refunded it immediately without any question or my asking for a refund..but overall it was not a good experience compared with other Sofitel stays.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing and Unattentive Service”
Reviews.Author: Ingynor
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sofitel since we were going to a concert and as it was my boyfriend's birthday - so obviously it was a very special occasion. When I checked in, the receptionist didn't acknowledge his birthday so that was disappointing, When we arrived to the room we had been allocated a small room that looked into a brick wall and it was the accessible room so I was again quite disappointed. I then called to arrange a room move and was put on hold and then told that the Duty Manager would call me back. This never happened and after 30 mins I called again and a girl said she was organising this. Over an hour later someone knocked on the door and we were moved to a nicer room, however the Duty Manager never called and no one followed up to ensure that everything was going well. I was also disappointed that my boyfriend's birthday was ignored as I had booked this room as a surprise for him. I would not want to stay at the Sofitel again as the staff did not seem interested in ensuring that the guests are happy and that most of the rooms were pretty average. I'm also surprised that they don't have a pool - isn't that a requirement to be rated as five star? I think following up with guests to make sure their stay is going well is very important and Sofitel obviously failed to do this on this occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute indulgence”
Reviews.Author: Tavare
Reviews.Content: This was meant to be our Slow Dancing in a Big City" weekend, but the reality is that we never actually left the hotel. Although we live just 15 minutes by car from the city this was a special night out sans kids, so we booked a bed, breakfast and dinner package at the Sofitel and upgraded ourselves to a Club Sofitel suite to make the most of the weekend. Not used to such "posh" surrounds we attempted to check in at the regular reception only to be told that we could check in at the Club Sofitel reception in the Sofitel Lounge. It was like we'd fallen down Alice in Wonderland's tunnel because we'd entered a very special world of eating, drinking, more eating and drinking, and service that suggested we were VIPs (something my wife got used to very quickly). While I had been to the Sofitel for conferences and functions, so I was awre of the changes to the hotel, I hadn't seen other parts of the hotel since it was a rather ageing Sheraton. The level 5 Sofitel Club Lounge and Garden Court restaurant are obviously relatively new additions because I remember a rather cavernous buffet restaurant when it was a Sheraton. The Club Lounge is very stylish and we had drinks and pre-dinner nibbles before eating at Garden Court. What I did recall from the old days was the waiter - Claude - who told us that he'd been at the hotel since 1976 (I think) and apart from serving me about 10 or so years ago, he'd served the Queen, prime ministers and John McEnroe, who apparently was thrown out of the hotel for trashing his room. His service was very special and really made our meal. The menu was French-inspired, but light and modern, and quite reasonably priced for such 5-star surrounds. We managed two courses and felt as if we needed to walk the length of the city to recover, but when we got to our room there were chocolate covered strawberries, so what can a pair do but eat them? Fortunately the bed was remarkably comfortable - firm yet really enveloping if that makes any sense - and we slept like logs. We had to rescue the babysitter fairly early in the mornig so w didn't get to enjoy a long sleep-in, but a quick breakfast in the Club Lounge was a great way t finish our indulgent getaway. We didn't get to dance away the night in one of the night venues around Circular Quay, but that can be next time. Our package wasn't cheap but for a couple who don't get much "quality time" together, it was worth every dollar. I just need to work out how I can spirit Claude away from the Sofitel to be the maitre d' at our next dinner party.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable evening away with great service”
Reviews.Author: l_gregory
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews posted recently, I was a bit concerned about my stay at the Sofitel. However, I was pleasantly surprised by many aspects. The service from the lobby desk, to dining, to check-out were fantastic. No snobby attitudes (as some have posted) were experienced by us! Only smiles and consistent attention to our needs. We upgraded to Club Sofitel and were treated to a lovely afternoon tea, pre-dinner drinks and hors d'oeuvres and a yummy buffet breakfast all in the relaxing Club area. Highly recommend this if your budget allows. Very good value for what you get. I do agree that the rooms are not quite up to 5 star standard and are very small in comparison. However, I guess it depends how much time you are actually going to spend in your room. Overall, a pleasant stay for those whose concept of 5 star is still a luxury and not an expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: KristyA
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price we paid. The building itself is older in style but rooms and hotel inside is very modern and clean. We upgraded for an extra $40 per night for a larger room and can't complain. We took the 'I Love Chocolate' Package online which included an afternoon chocolate tea with hot choc and choc mousse which was very decadent. Rooms were very clean and well serviced. Close to Circular Quay and you can easily take the train from the airport to this station and walk uphill for 2 blocks. Easy to do. Also, walking distance to Harbour Bridge and Opera HOuse. We even walked to Chinatown, Darling Harbour etc. Concierge staff incredibly friendly. There was a mix up with our upgrade - check in staff said it included breakfast but when queried after breakfast the next morning, it wasn't. Duty Manager then gave us breakfast at half price. This was our only negative experience. I am also an Accor Silver member so we received 2 complimentary drinks. For $560 AUD for 3 nights, you'd be hard pressed to find anything as good as this in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “never EVER again...”
Reviews.Author: ShyGirlVictoria
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked amazing from the Loby, We were booked into the exclusive club sofitel; which promised to be amazing... We walked into our tiny 'luxury' room, it was nothing like we expected, barely as impressive as the Loby. The we walked downstairs to the luxury sofitel room, and had some complimentary afternoon tea, which was just a small selection of nibblies, I didnt eat them but my boyfriend ate a few. That night he was violently ill with severe food poisioning and was head in the toilet bowl for over 12hours. The next day I approached the hotel about it and ask them to organise a doctor, they explained it would be $300 and didnt offer an apology let alone to pay for it. We then asked to have our complimentary late checkout which was meant to be till 4pm, but they would only give it to us till 12pm... They even refused to let us spent the time before our transfers in the lounge and so we spent the time in the loby. NEVER visit the Sofitel Wentworth Sydney, Unless you enjoy severe food poisoning and snobby, inconsiderate staff members!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of luxury”
Reviews.Author: council_worker
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Club Sofitel room prior to heading on a Northern Territory holiday. Have stayed in Club Sofitel rooms before but this was on of the smaller we've stayed in. Having said that that was probably the only thing that was not perfect with our stay. ALL the staff were magnificent from the people on the special check-in desk to those manning the club room itself. It does cost a bit but for an "every now and then" type splurge this was up there with the best.

Reviews.Title: “not what I expected for a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cathric
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel for 6 nights on a business trip to Sydney. My biggest complaint was the very expensive internet service AUS$27 per day. Upon arrival I was asked if I would like to upgrade to a larger room for $20 per night - bigger room, bigger bed, small balcony. Since I was staying 6 nights I said yes. I was then informed that the internet use was not free because they have an "outside provider" -although I found out that if you are staying with Club Sofitel or you can get someone to give you the internet code it is free. The "larger room" was OK, but I would hate to see what I would have gotten without the upgrade. And the balcony was a joke. I should have checked the room out before I decided to upgrade. Also, I was out of my room from 8 am until 3:45 and when I returned my room still had not been cleaned. This happened a coupe of times. The hotel is well located and the lobby, fitness club, etc are very nice. I would have given up the free daily paper for free internet since I was there on business and needed to keep in touch.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller304551
Reviews.Content: terrible terrible hotel. problems began at check-in. the rooms are also not very good. the washrooms are horrible compare to what u expect from a 5 star hotel. no emphasis on cleanliness. room not serviced a couple of days during a weeks stay. look below the balcony, its filthy. room service also terrible. they just forget if u order something. have to call up again and again and after that also have to give up sometimes. not at all a 5 or even 4 star property. just fooling us. i will never stay at an accor hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel - you've got to be joking”
Reviews.Author: lovers1996
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was over the weekend (ie Friday and Saturday nights). As I was an Accor Advantage Plus Member and wanted a quality hotel I chose to stay here. My arrival in Sydney started off badly when I left the airport terminal by taxi. It was the ride from hell and the driver had no idea where the Sofitel was (but that's another story). My experience with this hotel did not get off to a good start. I arrived at the hotel after 4pm. I had to wait at least 15 minutes to be attended to by reception. When I was attended to I was advised that although my room was ready, I couldn't have access to it because it had to be checked first. I was told to take a seat and it would be ready soon. As I had friends to meet at 5pm I was keen to have access to the room so I could unpack, change and get ready to go out. I ended up waiting 45 minutes (this is no joke) until the room was ready for me. The room was clean and tidy and the bed was comfortable. Also there was no noise at all to speak of, which was a pleasant surprise as you usually have to put up with some noise at most hotels. However, the room was tiny by any standards let alone a 5 star hotel. Also there was virtually no natural light in this room. The room had a small window but the wall of a neighbouring building was right outside the window. My booking included the buffett breakfast for both mornings. On the Saturday morning I had no problem. However, on the Sunday morning when I went to the restuarant for breakfast I was told that my room number was not on the list. Instead of the restuarant staff sorting it out for me I was told to go down to reception and sort it out myself. I spoke to the manager and I told him who I spoke with when I made the booking. The on duty manager didn't seem to care but eventually said I would be okay to have the buffett breakfast. When I checked out I had a quick look at the bill before I paid. Surprise, surprise! I had been charged extra for Sunday's breakfast. I pointed this out to the young man at reception and told him that the manager (who just happened to be standing behind him with his back turned) knew all about this matter. The man at reception didn't even ask the manager (and the manager who was in earshot of this conversation didn't even turn around) he just deleted it off the bill. I don't know what criteria is used in grading hotels, but I have stayed in 4 star hotels that are way better than this (eg Novotel on Collins in Melbourne). This was my first stay at this hotel and it was also my last.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room, Great Bed, Divine Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: 3littlepigsgotroppo
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd 5* hotel we have stayed at in Sydney over the last 6 months. The others were the Hilton and Sheraton on the Park. The Sofitel falls a long way short of both other hotels, although at the right price I would certainly stay there again. We have stayed here before in a Superior room, its worth the extra. We would normally upgrade to club benefits but didnt this time as our package included a full breakfast. My rating would have been different had we stayed in a higher grade room with club benefits but for this trip and this room here it is! The upside: The beds are supremely comfortable, the V shaped pillow from the pillow menu highly recommended. The room was VERY quiet, very impressive in a busy hotel. The breakfast buffet was very high quality and the range and options delicious, we sat and ate, reading the Sunday paper for ages. The location is great for business, access to the quay area, Macquarie Street and not bad for the shops. A fair hike to the train. On the downside: Our "Classic Room was tiny. We have stayed here before in a superior room and they weren't a lot bigger. Bathroom was very small. Water flows so thinly from the shower head you struggle to get wet! Bathroom wasn't as clean as it could be. It was superficially clean but when I had a bath I noticed mould under the soap holder, a few bits of hair left from a previous guest and the side of the toilet wasnt very clean. I wouldnt have noticed any of these if I'd had a shower but being at bath level puts a whole new view on things! The TV is very small, more computer moniter sized, very little choice of channels The bathroom entrance is small so there is a strange door, slightly odd! There's a pillow menu, we rang and requested latex pillows at 4pm. They hadnt arrived at 9.30pm so we rang again, no latex pillows left so they sent an alternative which was very comfortable. Can be tricky to catch someone for coffee at breakfast. The checkin/out arrangement is a bit haphazard with the long semi-circular desk attended at various points, you just line up where you see someone, no particular order or cueing arrangement. No swimming pool Sounds like a lot of downsides but they are all small things really. We enjoyed our stay very much, slept like a log and had a great breakfast, we didn't spend long in our room so it worked just fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel -Wished could stay longer ................”
Reviews.Author: Dronmando
Reviews.Content: We received a tremendous deal by choosing the Indulgence package, which entitled us to afternoon tea, pre dinner drinks and canapes, dinner and dessert, a complimentary bottle of wine, and full buffet breakfast! I would definitely love to stay there again next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “More like a 3.5 star experience, way overpriced, does not like up to a it's name”
Reviews.Author: jasont3Melbourne
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with my stay at the Sofitel Wentworth! Unlike other Sofitel hotels I have enjoyed, this one is way below par in many ways. Checking in took over 20 mins for starters! I have various privilege cards in the Accor group chain, being a member for 8 years and my friend working in the airline industry so I was expecting some extra perks! No, instead we were placed in a rack room rate room (having been told there were no upgrade rooms available as they were full) which was barely big enough to hold the bed and a small wooden desk! Very basic, felt like I was staying in a hostel! The bathroom light switch was faulty and complained to reception to fix it. After several calls, the electrician visited and suggested (tongue in cheek) we change to a 'better' room, as the power to the room would need to be removed to repair the switch! After a few squabbles to reception we were moved to an upgrade suite (surprise suddenly one becomes available!) which was much larger and way more stylish and comfortable! I would not recommend this hotel for the high price they want, it's close to circular Quay if you don't mind the uphill climb from the quay with your luggage, but the level of service, room quality and lack of other facilities like a decent gym or even a pool does not justify these prices. Novotel chain provides a much better experience. Lift your game guys, Sofitel is meant to be your top hotels providing exceptional service!

Reviews.Title: “not surprising”
Reviews.Author: further40
Reviews.Content: It is not surprising that this hotel costs at least $100 less than other 5* hotels in Sydney. I am not sure how the rating is allocated but the room I stayed in was more like a 3.5* room. Service was not great either. Email confirmation of the booking was received the day of arrival! 2 calls to reservations prior to that to ask for the status of the confirmation were not returned. Wake up call came half an hour before the requested time. At 7.45 am the cleaners were knocking on the door. No express checkout option provided although the hotel appears to have it. The room was very small, carpet shabby, bathroom small, with an annoying cupboard like door, showerhead not very effective. The room contained one relatively small window and a very small television. The room was stuffy and smelt musty. Even though it is almost winter, the room was very hot and I had to turn on the air-conditioning to sleep. The location is good to most Sydney CBD offices and not far from the Quay. Concierge seemed fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Amitravel
Reviews.Content: Nice looking hotel but service is lousy. They don't really really care about their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent and hassle free”
Reviews.Author: LeahGallivants
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed with colleagues at the Intercontinental in the past but this time I booked the Sofitel Wentworth as I've always had positive experiences with the Sofitel brand elsewhere. Staff were professional and friendly from the moment I arrived. The lobby is beautifully appointed, candle-lit in the evening (and scented) and is welcome respite for a business traveler. Stayed on level 15 in a perfectly tidy, well-sized room. The hype that Sofitel's MyBed receives is well deserved - I sprawled on it for a good thirty minutes before having a very enjoyable dinner of red snapper in the Garden Court restaurant on level 5. Internet is fast and reliable - cost didn't bother me as it was included in the room rate, although I understand that otherwise it's quite expensive and needs to be purchased in 24-hour blocks (typical). Good water pressure in the shower; toiletries worth stuffing into your suitcase to take home. I'd have liked more time to use the hotel facilities - I can certainly see myself staying here if traveling to Sydney for leisure. Zero complaints, although a full in-room dining menu would have been convenient, as well as a hot chocolate option in the mini-bar.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: ozFinn
Reviews.Content: I booked an evening here for my wifes birthday and upon arrival, on top of the bottle of champagne that came with the package the hotel included a bottle of (very nice!) Australian sparkling wine, and a handwritten note from the hotel manager wishing my wife a happy birthday. A small touch maybe, but a nice one. The room itself was very nice, although it did seem to be starting to fray around the edges a little. The bed was extremely comfortable. The location is pretty damned good as well as it's only a short walk down to Circular Quay or Wynyard stations. The big breakfast that we got included in our package was indeed BIG, neither of us could eat it all. It was also very tasty, which is after all the most important thing! We would not hesitate to to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: NORPeB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel Sydney for 4 nights over the new year! This hotel have all the things you expect from a 5 star hotel, and I really enjoyed my stay! The bed was amazing.. probably the best hotel bed I have ever slept in. Great bathroom and well equipped minibar. The location is also very good, with shopping and restaurants close by. It's just a 5 min walk down to Cirular Quay and the Opera house. The price was a bit stiff, but it is understandable since it was over the new years.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Gassini
Reviews.Content: From the moment the porter opened my car door and ushered me into the lightly scented, opulent lobby, I was in love. Check in was prompt, with down to earth service. The rooms were a good size, very clean, and I was impressed by the menu of pillows you could order from housekeeping - even though there was an ample selection already on the bed. The lobby bar bustled at cocktail hour - mainly with suits doing deals I assume. We had four different types of oysters in the hotel restaurant - all delicious, with prompt, professional service. The breakfast buffet the next day was one of the best I've ever had. In short - I felt like I was staying in 5 star luxury at a classy upmarket popular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: agent_anonymous
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby area and easy checkin had me thinking I was onto a winner with this hotel. The size of the room let it down enormously. Smallest 5 star hotel room I've stayed in. Wardrobe wasn't even big enough to hang all my shirts/suits for a 5 day stay. The bathroom was clean and modern, but very small. I felt quite claustrophobic in there. On the plus side - the breakfast was fantastic. Very fresh, service was attentive and just a nice ambience to it. The gym was also great, lots of workout areas and you can even join a class. The hotel bar was nice, but nothing exciting. There are other 5 star hotel properties in Sydney which I think offer better value...

Reviews.Title: “Don't you just hate being ripped off!”
Reviews.Author: justcruizen
Reviews.Content: 5 star business hotels are much the same, it's the little things that make or break. Take internet, a constant annoyance for travellers. Any other hotel $A20-25 and your covered, not the Sofitel Wentworth, $20 odd dollars gets you an account and a small size of down loads. Run a few web sites, down load some huge emails and check the odd You Tube and your quickly up to $60 DOLLARS IN A FEW HOURS. Even writting this will cost me money. (power to the consumer)

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Travlil
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on this hotel through Travelzoo and decided to try it. After a long flight from NYC, it was such a relief to step into a clean and refreshing hotel room. The location was close to shops although further from most sights. I was there for work so it didn't bother me too much. The service from the reception was mediocre but their concierge and bell boys were both fantastic! The rates are usually very high at the Sofitels, if I can get the same rate I did, I would definitely without a doubt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very over rated - disappointing , expectations were high but failed to deliver”
Reviews.Author: c0untryc0uple
Reviews.Content: The king size bed was 2 single beds pushed together. The dining room was empty but refused service because we did not have a booking. We had planned a night of luxury but were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: lynnb742
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel at the beginning of March ahead of my stay there to say how helpful the hotel had been in booking arrangements for our party of 12. My husband & I were the first to arrive on 22nd March & stayed for 2 weeks. From the outset we found everyone at the hotel to be friendly & helpful, especially Vikram & Mark on the Concierge desk who were absolutely lovely. The hotel is ideally located for Circular Quay although the walk down is quite steep but doesn't take any more than 5 minutes - a bit longer to walk back up again after a couple of wines!! We stayed in a superior room on the 8th floor overlooking the courtyard area on the 5th. The room was lovely & clean & it's true that the beds are probably the most comfortable in any hotel I've stayed in! We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant during our stay but we had room service a couple of times and the food was good. It's pretty expensive but we found Sydney generally to be an expensive city, not helped by our poor exchange rate currently. Overall this is a great place to stay & I wouldn't hesitate in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “should not call itself a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Mulli283
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a 4 day trip to Sydney. The room was much smaller than I expected - tiny bathroom - very small tv. When I arrived at the hotel - nobody offered to bring bags to my room - a small thing but something you expect from a hotel billing itself as "5 star". The bedroom blind in both my room and my parents room did not work. The noise from a nearby nightclub on Friday and Saturday night prevented me from getting any sleep until after 2am when the nightclub shutdown. Overall disappointing and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Frenchy_in_OZ
Reviews.Content: Well, overall this hotel is just below average (on 5* standards). Don't be fooled by the pretty garden picture on the internet, the entrance and the lobby are one level below the pretty french garden, not the pretiest lobby. Check -in staff was a bit short, not rude, but not polite either. We arrived at 10 am, check-in staff told us that she'll give us a call when room will be ready and.... never called. The superior room was very very tiny, bathroom was dated, TV was the size of a laptop, nothing special. You can hear people talking in the corridor like if they were just next to your bed. Ask for a turn down service, was told that it was ok, and.... never happened. No swimming pool, disapointing in this category. On the other hand, the concierge staff was extremely nice, helpfull, took care of luggage, of restaurant reservation... It's a pitty, it could be soooooo much better if their staff selection was a bit more sharp. Miles away from the Hilton...

Reviews.Title: “my experience was far from 5 star”
Reviews.Author: iankkh
Reviews.Content: This hotel purports to be a 5 star property however on the basis of my experience this week i could only rate it 3 at best.Late night check in,allocated a tiny, internal room that looked out on a wall.It would have been ok, i was tired and just wanted to sleep.Frankly the room was dirty,mildew on the window blind, mould around the bathroom sink.No bath mat so had to use the hand towel.The previuos guest must have purchased some new clothes as packaging and tags were still in the room on the tiny desk!No nice touches that you expect in a 5 star property, not even a pencil by the phone!I wont be back.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel-Sydney”
Reviews.Author: HarishI
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very private and chic. The hotel is located very close to circular quay and has a number of hotspots around it. Wouldnt rate the food very high but their breakfast is very nice. Full points for the location though.

Reviews.Title: “Club sofitel service is substandard”
Reviews.Author: aussieloz88
Reviews.Content: Went here with my husband for 3 nights as our honeymoon as we were unable to get any more time of. MOst things about the hotel were quite nice and demonstrated attention to detail. However on my second night i went to pre dinne drinks and canapres which were included in my package, and this is where the hotel and its service were appalling. i am alergic to shell fish and as such was disapointed to see that nothing served was labeled with what it was, as such I repeatly asked about each product I ate and wheather it contained shell fish. I was told they did not so ate away, after about 10 minutes i started to feel very sick so opened up my food to see if anything did indeed contain prawns, i found a piece of prawn in my dumpling, i showed this to a staff member and asked her to make sure there was no prawn in the dumplings and she assured me there was not. it was a prawn and I ended up spending the rest of my time at the sofitel feeling extreamly unwell as well as the following week, not the way I had wished to start my marriage. The manager on duty was very nice about the situration although he did seem pretty preoccupied, we were refunded one nights stay, and the hotel paid for the doctor who came to give me injections for how sick I was feeling. Whilst these were both nice gestures they in no way made up for hving my first week of marriage wrecked by feeling so sick, espesically when considering how many times I had asked staff about the food.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, Really made our wedding day special!”
Reviews.Author: emsy843
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for 3 nights in January and one of the days we stayed there was our wedding day. The hotel made us feel very welcome and we had a lovely room on the top floor and were welcomed with a lovely bottle of champagne to celebrate our wedding. Rooms were lovely and beds incredibly comfortable. Hotel has a fantasic location in the city only a 2 min walk to circular quay and the opera house/bridge and your pretty much directly in the main shopping area with plenty of restaurants and bars to chose from at night. The only thing that I would say the hotel was lacking was a pool and it would alos be nice if breakfast was included in the room rate as when your paying Â£180/night it would be nice if a few slices of toast and some cereal in the morning were included in that price. Overall we loved this hotel and were so glad that we chose it as part of our special day.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful luxurious stay”
Reviews.Author: wiwiani
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Sofitel for a short stay. The first thing that hit us was the scent that wafted through the foyer when we checked in. I asked the concierge and he said it was a signature scent - it was Christmas time so the foyer was decorated beautifully. We chose to stay in a Club room which included access to the Club area - this was great value as we were given breakfast, teas, cocktails in the evening and it was like a private lounge. There was turndown service in our rooms and Nespresso coffeemaker in our room too. Beds were extremely comfortable. I have stayed at Sofitel in Melbourne too but Sydney was very good. Staff friendly for a 5 star hotel. Room was your average room a bit small but ample for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to pay extra if you want a reasonable room”
Reviews.Author: MontiNb
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this hotel through Wotif as we have with a lot of hotels in Sydney. We always try to get a room, breakfast and carparking package. This has always been good value and we always stay at 5 star hotels. We have always had great rooms until this hotel. Our room was not ready when we checked in, and we had originally booked for 2 nights but had organised 3 weeks in advance a 3rd night and made sure we cross referenced the original booking with an additional night. The staff took about 5 minutes to find this and then said we were only in for 2 nights. After showing them the confirmation they eventually found the 3rd night and said come back in 1 hr. When we did again they could not find the 3rd night, despite them taking a photocopy of the confirmation. We were then showed to a disabled room at the end of a corridor which had a shower curtain and basin and a view of the wall. When my husband complained saying that as were staying 3 nights we would like a bit more comfort and somewhere to put our toiletries we were told we had to pay an extra $40 per night, which we did. The new room is what we would have been given at every other hotel in Sydney. Service at breakfast is non-existent and the buffet warm. When we checked out the parking attendant would not let have our car until we paid for 3 days carparking. We explained this was part of our package, we again produced our confirmation but this was not enough, until reception rang down and told them it was. No apologies at any time and there are a lot more customer focused hotels in Sydney with similar packages and decent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: travelinaussie
Reviews.Content: My husband & I booked to attend the 60th Anniversary Military Tattoo in Melbourne Feb 2010. The accomodation part of our package was with the Sofitel Wentworth Sydney. The hotel itself is lovely, with the wonderful floral displays in the foyer, large rooms, comfy beds and an excellent position to sightsee. All of this great stuff was offset by the poor service experienced in the hotel restaurant. If the breakfast portion of our package hadn't been included after our first experience in the restaurant we would have dined elsewhere. Being that the hotel was a sponsor of the Military Tattoo it was to be expected that the dining room would have a large patronage and each morning there was a queue for breakfast. We were expecting this to be the case so it is not a part of our gripe. What is part of the gripe is the person who greeted us with not a "good morning" or "may i please have your room number" but "what's your room number". This was followed by much sighing, which gave the impression we were taking up a valuable portion of this person's day with our presence in the dining room. This was followed by a wave of the hand in the direction of a table covered with dirty dishes and linen and we were told go help ourselves to breakfast and by the time we came back to our table with our selection from the buffet it would be cleared. Then began the game of "could we please have a cup of coffee/tea"? If you were exceptionally lucky you would be able to snag one cup for the morning from a passing waiter/ess. The not so lucky went without, usually after quite a few requests. Don't bother looking for a second cup as that was never going to happen. Snagging a table with clean cutlery, crockery and napkins was a bonus. Three times in four days I had to request clean cups and napkins. The only shining light was a young lady named Frances who was trying to do the job of three people. You might think after the first experience you wouldn't go there for dinner, but my husband and I seemed to be suckers for punishment. As there was quite a bit of rain around we decided to have dinner in the restaurant one evening rather than chance the rain and get wet again. Thinking any restaurant that charged 5 star prices for a steak ($50) also be offering 5 star service to match would be a seriously bad move in this restaurant. While the restaurant was no-where near full, the service was again abysmal. Even the Chef was finding it hard to find staff to convey the meals from the cooking area to the tables. Never mind getting another drink. Sofitel my question is....where is your food and beverage manager? If he/she was on duty they obviously have no idea of what constitutes customer service i.e. the customer is more important than putting away cutlery and talking to your friends out the back. They are the ones paying your wages.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing & Memorable”
Reviews.Author: Semaphore41
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights at the Sofitel and it was just what we were after - relaxing, refreshing and no hassle. Which suprised me as on first glance it seemed geared towards the business market, we stayed for leisure. The level of service provided by the staff is efficient and attentive which to us is the hallmark of a professionally run hotel. Check-in was easy, but not rushed, as it was moderately busy. On check-in we asked for a different bedding configuration from what we'd booked and the staff member happily changed us to another room. Arriving in the room the TV needed fixing as there was no signal, the maintance man was there in no time and was jovial in the vein of a typical Aussie larrikin (didn't think they were still in Sydney) and fixed it in seconds. We appreciated his good humour and individuality. We anticipated issues as our 3 year old daughter is noisy and busy. She was attentively fussed over by the restaurant staff, which was great as it made her quiet and shy, in turn making breakfast enjoyable for us adults. Perhaps, as we only saw one other child whilst at the hotel so the presence of a child may have been a novelty for the staff? Breakfast was included, we haven't stay in 5 star hotels much and were impressed with the buffet choices and the amount available. There was champagne available! Sleeping on the my-bed is supreme, I need one at home. The superior rooms have a lounge near the window which was a great place to read the paper, relax, play children's games. It added a positive spatial dimension to the room. Location for us was important as we like to us public transport, both Martin Place & Circular Quay train stations are within walking distance, although there is a moderate climb from the Quay back to the hotel. Walking to the Quay is leisurely. To and from Martin Place is almost level. The Botanical gardens are very close and a great place for kids to run, look at the flowers, ducks, statues etc. Being close to an area where kids can run, discover new things and just be kids influenced our choice on where to stay. But it rained a lot we only went there once and got soaked. We liked the atmosphere and staff's obvious commitment to their guest's needs. We loved the dinner room service menu and considered it reasonalby priced. Room service presentation was impecciable. My wife had the same pasta dish 3 times. The lack of a swimming pool was a major drawback and nearly prevented us from booking the Sofitel; kids love to swim. By chance it became a non issue as the rain would have curtailed our dreams of reclining by the pool. We booked in conj. with a business credit so the amount we paid out of our own pocket didn't reflect the rate paid so commenting on value is not mentioned. However, for service, comfort and location we'd recommend the Sofitel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Kiwis13
Reviews.Content: We had a long weekend in Sydney staying at the Sofitel Wentworth. The hotel service was impeccable. It was a truly enjoyable experience from the moment we arrived until the time we left. The staff were very polite and helpful. The food was great at the restaurant. I would thoroughly recommend it as a place to stay for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “I Would never stay at so called 5 star Sofitel which arent 5 star at all.”
Reviews.Author: GingerKiss
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior room which included pre dinner drink,canapies etc for more than $300 for one night. We arrived about 1 pm and have to check in at the club lounge so we did. The girl who check in us was helpfull at first she said the room isnt available till about 4 pm, we said is okay we can wait. and we ask which floor we can get,she said our room would be in 14th floor. So we are happy with it. then we had drink with our friends at the coffee shop and the phone rang told us that our room are ready. We think thats a quick, so we comeback to the reception., took the room key and went to our room in 14th floor only to found out that our room wasnt in 14th floor is in the 9th floor. So we complaining to the manager and hes quite good arranged for our correct room. So we go down take our key and went off to the 14th floor,this time we got our room.But only when we arrived in our room, We think it was different room from what we booked,then I found out it was heritage room.we supposed to get a superior room in 14th floor. So we make complain again. This time the girl at the check it seem bit rude and doest like us complaining, she told us that she think we would in hurry to check in and the heritage room was the superior room.What a liaR! Is cleary sign on that room is Heritage room which I didnt like it at all, so after argue a bit we finally got our superior room but not on 14th floor,is in 13th floor. I dont want argue anymore so i just took it. I would never stay at this hotel again is not 5 star at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with room and not up to 5 star standard”
Reviews.Author: liza9079
Reviews.Content: The rooms of this hotel are not up to 5 star standard, most of the staff are nice and attentive but the blatant false advertising of the "City View" rooms is unacceptable. There are two views available for this hotel which are the "Garden Courtyard" view (facing Phillip St) and the "City Views" (Facing Bligh St). Unfortunately, 4 rooms on every level of this hotel (that is 2 rooms at the end of each hallway) which are advertised and sold as "Classic Rooms with City Views" actually have a view of 3 brick walls running the height of the hotel meaning that there is absolutely no City View at all! My partner and I were so disappointed by the first room we were given as we could not see any sort of City View from the window (unless you count the sky if you look upwards?). We could not see anything at all as looking out of our window we were surrounded by 3 brick walls and the window of the other non-city view room. After further investigation we discovered that 4 Classic Rooms on every single floor of this hotel have such a view of 3 brick walls so after seeing a show and dinner with friends we requested a change of room so we were facing Bligh St (and so we actually had the view that we expected and paid for). The lady on duty that night gave us attitude because we did not request a change of room straight away (gee, sorry for having pre-made plans but we didn't have time to line up and explain the situation as we had tickets to a show) but she agreed that the room we were given did not have any view at all. The second room we were given was what we expected in terms of the city view that was advertised but the broken tray/shampoo stand in the bathroom, the small stains on the linen and cold room service food are just little things that added to our disappointment of the stay. I would like to ask management of the hotel why the 4 rooms at the end of the hallway on every floor are advertised as "City View" when clearly all the staff know that there is no view at all from these room as they face each other and brick walls but still charge the same price for these undesirable rooms? Fair enough if these rooms were a bit cheaper but they cost the same as the rooms facing Bligh St (and with a view) so who would be happy staying in a room which felt like a prison? I'm not blaming the staff as most of them were nice enough and helpful but the fact that we had to argue to get a room with a city view that we paid for did dampen our holiday mood so we would not recommend this hotel to our friends as there are many other similar hotels in the same area which hopefully really are up to 5 star standard. This hotel is very old but has been refurbished but it is far from 5 star luxury, don't let the pictures on their website and nice entrance foyer fool you. We also dined at the Garden Court restaurant, the food was nice but the waitress mixed up the "medium rare" request for the steak and "well done" request for the fish so I sent my fish back to be recooked. The restaurant manager on duty was very attentive and apologetic which is appreciated. One more thing, expect all the staff of this French run chain hotel to greet guests with "bonjour" which is amusing and after a while just strange as we are in Sydney, not France.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel,great location,”
Reviews.Author: Kingstonman
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Wentworth.The room-630 was superb. The fttings were both chic and great quality.The bed was one of the most comfortable that I have stayed in. The hotel staff were very genuine and helpful throughout my stay. A great choice for location as Circular quay is just 5 minutes walk. Verall a great hotel.very attentive staff and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great start... poor finish”
Reviews.Author: weekendwarriorSydney
Reviews.Content: Arrived at sofitel for a week end getaway, thinking its always great to take time to be a tourist in your own town. My first impression of this hotel was quite impressive, the lobby was very welcoming with plenty of staff and many beautiful floral arrangements The check in was very smooth and the recptionist was very polite chatty and helpful. All seemed well and as though I was recieving my value for money, and the room was modern and inviting. Until the next morning.... At about 7 am on sunday morning after a lovely sleep in the big comfy bed my partner and I were rudely awoken by another guest in our room!!! At first we thought it was staff fumbling witht their keys in the door but then an elderly gentlemen burst in after his key actually worked demanding to know why we were in his bed!!! maybe a simple mistake but I was quite upset by the hotels reaction to this. When i called the reception to inform them of this I was met with umms and arrrrrs and no real outcome. My partner and I considered that maybe our door was just slightly ajar but I was under the impression that doors were heavy enough to self close for security reasons? regardless i was hoping to have a member of staff might send up some new room keys just as a secondary precaution?,maybe a little later check out as I'd been woken so early on a sunday? or maybe simply just console me as I was freaking out about intruders coming in my room so early? .... From the lovely welcome to my lack of acknowledgment at the end im sorry to say I may not return to this property as the good experiences were quickly forgotton by the poor service recovery that was applied by the management team.

Reviews.Title: “Good beds.”
Reviews.Author: luvdog
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through wotif and got a really good deal, so it wasn't going to be hard for them to make me happy.. the beds were amazing huge with the softest mattress known to mankind. I didn't use the restuarant or room service. I found the hotel all in all to be very comfortable but I didn;t really feel like I was staying 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Club Rooms are the go!”
Reviews.Author: The_Hotel_Reviewer
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Sydney Wentworth is a famous historic hotel in the Sydney CBD, that was acquired by the Accor chain in 2002 and last refurbished about three years ago. It is located on Phillip Street, close to the NSW Parliament, the Royal Botanic Gardens, and Circular Quay. I had a Luxury Club Sofitel Room (Rm 1735) on the top floor of the hotel, on a corporate rate of approx $280. Valet: As I drove, I used the hotelâ€™s valet carpark, which is operated by Premier Parking on behalf of the hotel (charge $39.60 per night â€“ multiple in/out privileges). Youâ€™ll need to use not the front entrance of the hotel, but the Bligh Street entrance of the hotel. The parking attendants will call down a porter for you if needed. Service was fast and efficient, but I opted not to wait for a porter. Didnâ€™t have to wait long to claim car either. No issues, and parking rate was reasonable for Sydney. Porter: I dropped my bag and suit carrier with the porter, after coming up the escalator from the parking station. Was handled efficiently by staff, and had bags in my room in less than 15 minutes. Didnâ€™t use the porter on the way out, but they will bring your bags down to the garage and load your car for you. Check-In / Check-Out: As I was staying on the Club level, I was able to check-in and check-out directly at the Club on Level 5 (recommended). I was handled by the same agent both times, who was friendly, informative and proficient. Hotel Public Spaces: The lobby is very attractive and has a pleasant fragrance lingering â€“ I particularly like the little library space. There are plenty of little nooks in which to sit and relax. The Club: The Sofitel Club at the Wentworth is a very lush feeling space, available to all guests staying on a Club Level of the hotel as well as guests willing to pay for the privilege. It has a very elegant feeling, but is hardly stuffy as plenty of people were dressed in relaxed casual wear. It offers breakfast, afternoon tea, and evening canapÃ©s with a full drink service. Coffee, tea, soft drinks and mineral water available at all other times. Afternoon tea consisted of premium teas, barista coffees, and a small selection of finger food (both sweet and savoury). Evening canapÃ©s were somewhat unexciting (spring rolls, meat balls, etc) but a good range of standard spirits, Chandon or Deutz Sparkling, and James Boag beers made up for the food. Breakfast offered full continental and American breakfast options, with a small selection of pastries and tea and coffee. Service was average to good. The Room: In a word, almost excellent! The interior design is very pleasing â€“ you definitely get the feeling of quality. The bed is very comfortable, and despite it having a separate pillowtop (which normally I dislike) it didnâ€™t feel lumpy. The feather pillows were fantastically comfortable. The bathroom was stylish, and while the bath was only half-sized (hence, almost excellent), pluses where that a second set of Roger & Gallet toiletries were provided in the shower recess (a great idea) in addition to a full set on the marble benchtop. The only thing that was a little disappointing was the small LCD TV but it did include a reasonable range of Free To Air and Cable TV stations including Fox Sports 1-3, Sky News, National Geographic, Fox 8, Nickelodeon, and MTV. The room was very clean, and in good condition. The room also offered a pillow menu, from which I chose a contour pillow from, that arrived in 10 mins and was excellent in quality. I would note that, even though I was on the top floor of the hotel, traffic noise was outside was audible in the morning. The level wasnâ€™t over the top, but it was noticeable in a quiet room. Service: A very nice surprise was that the hotel sent me a complimentary bottle of Bancroft Bridge Cabernet Merlot (which was very good) as well as a bottle of still and sparkling mineral water â€“ despite this only being my first stay in two years. I am an A-Club Platinum member, so this may have been the reason, but this is not normally the recognition I receive when staying at other Sofitels so points to the Wentworth. Evening Turndown service left chocolates, and a bottle of Evian water (but does not appear to offer full room service as bathroom bin not emptied). As was registered on my profile, I correctly received a Financial Review in the morning along with an information copy of my bill. Gym: I used the Eâ€™lixer Health Club, that guests of the Sofitel can use. Itâ€™s only a small gym, with a small range of fairly standard cardio and weights equipment to use. It does however offer private and instructor led classes in yoga and pilates, at an additional cost, for those interested. Restaurant: As we had been grazing on the evening canapÃ©s at the Club while sinking a few beers, we didnâ€™t feel up to a full dinner, but we did stop at the Garden Court Restaurant for desserts and coffees. I had the raspberry soufflÃ© with white chocolate sauce and my guest had the vanilla panna cotta â€“ both were excellent and the service was fine. The coffees were a little cool but otherwise all good â€“ cost $46. Mini-bar: Good selection, although prices fairly typical of hotels in CBD. Beer - $7-$9, Spirits $12, Half Bottle Wine $22, Half Bottle Moet $75, Water $5.50, Soft Drink $6, Juice $6.50, Snacks $5-$8. Tea and coffee provided on house, and Club Rooms offer Nespresso machines. Room Service Breakfast is available at $35 ($31 plus $4 tray charge) for Continental or $46 for Full. Summary: You pay for what you get, the Club rooms arenâ€™t the cheapest (top three in terms of cost for Club rooms in CBD that day), but the Sofitelâ€™s Luxury Club Room and The Club are worth it. This hotel basically operates as two hotels almost â€“ the non-club rooms (judging from previous experience and other Tripadvisor rooms) target the lower end (price wise) of the five-star market, while the club rooms compete fairly well with the best club rooms in Sydney. In you want to spurge for a nice night away, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Wentworth is fantastic for guests with disabilities”
Reviews.Author: BillericayJoanie
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Sofitel Wentworth Sydney. The foyer is impressive and fragrant, the staff are all first class. The bar and restaurant are comfortable and service is excellent. I travelled with my niece, a wheelchair user and stayed in a room with twin beds and an accessible bathroom. The room and the bathroom were spot on, lots of handrails in the bathroom, low level washbasin, pull down seat and efficient shower. Lots of room to enable someone to assist a disabled person in the shower. I stayed on a 'Stay 3 nights, pay 2' deal so it made a 5 star hotel affordable. The Sofitel is close to Circular quay, there is a hill back up to hotel but you can get buses to Martin Place and then walk from there to the hotel, just a couple of minutes walk. It is also near the Wynyard area where there are lots of shops and a Cityrail station.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay with excellent service and the best coffee in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: eaj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Sydney Wentworth as part of an Expedia long weekend package. It was an excellent trip. The room was not huge but was extremely comfortable. Our bathroom although small had every facility needed and was spotlessly clean. The king sized bed was very comfortable - there was even a pillow menu - and we slept well every night. We had dinner in the restaurant on our first evening. It was on the pricey side but service was excellent and the food was delicious. Breakfast was very good too but the service not as good at this meal. The waitress who served us at that meal was the only staff member who was less than enthusiastic and didn't seem to want to be there. Otherwise we were very satisfied with the level of service. A great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Went somewhere else - wouldn't go back!”
Reviews.Author: bluewhite
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a number of five star hotels in Sydney ( Intercontinental, Sheraton, Hilton, Harbour Marriot, Shangri La) and decided after so much hype about the refurbishment programme at the Sofitel, to give it a try. We booked our 3 nights through Expedia in a Classic Room. We arrived at the hotel just after 11am and on pulling up at the entrance in our hired car a member of the concierge opened the car door and immediately said we would need to go to the back of the hotel to park and he would attend to the luggage. I approached the reception/check in area and all the comments you read about their lack of interest are well founded. The lady who checked me in behaved like a computer generated message rattling off all the terms and conditions of our stay....without so much as a welcome, a smile or any other human attribute. We went up to our room and if you think all the complaints on here about the size of the Classic rooms are untrue/unfounded....think again. I could not believe that a 5 star hotel would offer such small, depressingly furnished rooms. The bathroom seemed like it opened from a cupboard and I immediately went back to reception to find out how much it would cost to upgrade to the next category room. I was told it would be $40 per night to upgrade to a Superior room and asked if we could see one before accepting it. A member of the concierge team took us up to a room on the 14th floor which was much bigger than the classic room. The reviewer who stated that the furnishing of the rooms is typical Ikea - got it right. We decided to accept the upgrade and settled into our room. The Concierge staff were extremely helpful, and always friendly and polite. Later in the afternoon I thought I would go to the "full gymnasium and health club" ( as advertised on Expedia & Wotif.com, only to discover that the Health club does not exist. There is a gymnasium and a day spa for treatments but no sauna, spa/jacuzzi etc..........I cannot see how the hotel can advertise a Health Club when it has none of those facilities. Reception staff could not tell me what facilities were available and kept putting my call through to the day spa which never answered the phone. I asked to speak to the Manager on Duty, who I was told was out of the office, Although I left a message to be contacted just after 3pm, by the time we went out at 4.45pm no call back had happened. We returned to the hotel just before midnight and I telephoned guest services (reception) for a wake up call, at the same time I asked if the hotel provided newspapers each morning and the answer I got was " that needs to be arranged at check in" I told the person nothing had been mentioned at check in and could he arrange for us to get the Sydney Morning Herald. We got the newspaper the next morning but not the following day. What is puzzling is that in a number of responses the hotel has written here it is said that they are surprised at the inefficiency and unfriendly attitudes of reception staff - yet this continues to come up time and time again which shows that despite their comments, nothing is actually done about it. Room service was very speedy but although we ordered virtually the same thing every morning - there was no consistency in what was delivered. The 3rd day the pastry basket and coffees arrived with no plates, no jams/preserves, no sugar....when I called room service and told them , they were delivered within minutes. Housekeeping was good , although when we checked in there was a noticable difference in the towels on the rack - one was new and fluffy, the other much older and thinner. The bathroom amenities were good and replaced as needed. On the second day in the early evening when we were leaving the hotel I called guest services/reception and asked for the bathroom to be cleaned and although I was told this would be done - when we returned to the hotel later that night with family guests of course it was exactly as we had left it. We visited the lounge on the lobby level for coffee and cake the one night and the service initially was excellent and presentation of the order was outstanding - however when we had finished and wanted to get the bill......there was nobody in sight and had to go to the bar and ask them to find someone who could give us our bill. When we were checking out I found there were 4 charges for parking instead of 3 but the extra charge was credited when I queried this. The entrance to the hotel is very luxurious and when you read about the Awards the hotel has won you would think you're in for a really good experience - forget it; for the same money you can get much better service, more facilities and bigger accommodation!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa_S1977
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here 4-7 December for a long weekend to shop and catch up with friends. Only waited about 5 minutes to check in.
