Due to an early flight, I had asked in advance if our room could be made available. It wasn't but that didn't matter. Left our bags with concierge and went itto the CBD. Returned to find bags in room. The beds were so comfortable, I had 3 mornings of sleep-ins. Blinds really blocked out the light, which was good. Only downsides were that the bathtub seemed to be peeling, the hose for the shower was bent so you had to position the handle so water flowed and there was no hairdryer. The other downside was noise from below. Thumping music from somewhere. Certainly windows should be double paned? I LOVED the smell when entering the foyer...does someone know what it is? I would stay here again and I would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “not the best front desk service for 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: worrior33
Reviews.Content: During check in I asked about possibility of room upgrade, and also late check out because I have A club silver and Accor Advantage plus blue card. I was advised that my card did not qualify for upgrade, and that they could provide late check out for an additional payment, which I declined. Upon return I checked the terms and conditions of my membership cards. I note from my member pack that my Advantage Plus membership entitles me to complimentary room upgrade and late check out (subject to availability). It would therefore seem that the staff at Sofitel Wentworth are not familiar with the membership terms of this card as they offered me a late check out with a charge and advised I did not qualify for upgrade â€“ neither reasons apparently have anything to do with â€˜availabilityâ€™. I also note that Silver status A club members should receive a 'welcome gift and welcome drink when staying at any Sofitel' â€“ neither of which were offered. Following check in we went to the room and awaited delivery of our luggage. After 20 minutes I called the front desk to enquire as to the whereabouts of our luggage, and they undertook to check. After a further 15 minutes wait we decided to continue our itinerary although upon passing the front desk I complained about the delay in delivery of our luggage. Finally as we were leaving the hotel I noticed a bell boy with our luggage, â€¦. well almost , he had three out of our four pieces of luggage on the trolley and I advised him to return to find the remaining piece of luggage. Fortunately when we finally returned to our room all of or luggage had been delivered â€“ well done! The dinner at the restaurant did, however, saved the day. Great service especially the receptionist, very friendly and helpful. Food was very good, as well as the services...

Reviews.Title: “I think 3 star hotel that needs to be updated and cleaned.”
Reviews.Author: Jan056
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for our 30th wedding aniversary I it was a disgrace to advertise it as a 5 star hotel when it clearly is not. The room had furniture that was damaged the bed was hard and uncomfortable. We complained that the room smelt like smoke and we were offered to have it sprayed with air freshner as it that will help. The dinner at the restaurant was very poor service was bad no bread rolls for our table but a waiter was going around with a basket full of rolls. My pork dish smelt so bad a could not eat it and the dessert was very ordinary, so I left the restaurant without dinner there was no way I was ordering anything else. So what was going to be a great stay at a 5 star hotel was one of the worst experience at a hotel and I will never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “1st class-wow”
Reviews.Author: trent
Reviews.Content: We stayed there Nov.16 to Nov.20-great location,clean room,very friendly staff.We were extremely pleased with this hotel.Why?One,held our luggage safely on check in and late flight out.Two,gave us late check out privilege to 1pm.Third,sent us a bottle of drink for our anniversary.The hotel is near the wharf and boats for walkabouts or cruises.Would recommend to all and suggest look for a deal-then it's a steal.We travel a lot around the world and this was one of the best hotels we ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “A taste of Ikea in the heart of Sydney.....”
Reviews.Author: Speedbird275
Reviews.Content: If it weren't for the distinct lack of meatballs in my room, I'd have woken up and thought I'd fallen asleep in an Ikea. The hotel's communal areas are plush. Lovely marble floors in the lobby with spacious, light and airy coridoors throughout, but the rooms themselves are, though trendy, a little on the unimaginative side. The furniture looks like it's straight out of Sweden - all flat pack kinda stuff. But the bed is comfy and the views from some of the rooms are pretty good. Breakfast in the hotel is superb if a little pricey, as are drinks in the lobby bar. There's another bar on the 4th floor though with outside areas and while also expensive, the atmosphere is nice. However, why anyone would stay in the hotel when they're so close to a massive selection of superb bars and restaurants is beyond me. Get out. Explore. The hotel is a 10 minutes (slow, relaxed) walk from Circular Quay and the Harbor Bridge and the SOH. This is also where ferries depart from linking downtown Sydney with Manly and the other beach-burbs of the city. The staff in this hotel can be hit or miss. VERY hit or miss. The bar staff tend to be outstanding but the reception staff can be rather surly and uninterested. The rooms are all well equipped with minibar, superb bathroom (with great toiletries - you can get a good few quid on eBay for them if you don't use them!), flat screen TV and comfortable bed. There's also a desk but it's small and quite uncomfortable to use. The window coverings are among the best I've ever found in a hotel. With a mesh blind and a black-out blind provided, these are both fitted to tracks along the side of the window so when the black-out is in use, it really does block every glimmer of sunshine to the room. Great if you're trying to get some sleep during the day. I've given the hotel a rating of four overall but to be honest, unless my company put me here when I visit Sydney, I'd never choose to stay at Sofitel. I'd go to the Marriott Sydney Harbor instead.... Or, infact, one of the superb rooms or suites at Star City.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Stay and a great location in Downtown Sydney Harbour!”
Reviews.Author: Maximvs2
Reviews.Content: My 7 year old son and I stayed at this marvelous hotel. Upon our arrival, my son was immediately given special attention by the staff. They ( hotel staff) were very polite and gracious in attending to our needs. The room we were in was very spacious, well maintained, and orderly. While having dinner in their restaurant, the staff gave attentive detail to my son and treated him regally. The breakfast menu is also great with many selections to chose from be it: Cold or hot breakfast. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and accommodation”
Reviews.Author: chana21
Reviews.Content: I'm totally recommended this hotel...Good services and spacious room..Located on Cbd...

Reviews.Title: “Credit card fees at a 5 star hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Bear93
Reviews.Content: Have to agree, nice hotel, but credit card fees??? Must be the only 5 star in Syndey or even Australia where I have come across this. It is really strange, but for the sake of a couple of $ it does effectively leave a bad taste! Great hotel for a meeting - very organised, good food and nice facilities. Lack of swimming pool is a downside for me. Breakfast buffet is poorly laid out - you spend most of your time trying to dodge the staff who are equally desperate to replenish the plates and glasses that are empty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Magicstreets7
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The lobby was very impressive with very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms were great with a choice of pillows and a good bathroom. All very clean and quite The only reason I haven't give the hotel a rating of 5 is due to the location. It was perfect for Circular Quay, the Botanical Gardens and the Opera House. We ended up preferring the area around Darling Harbour for the evenings so would prefer to stay there and get the train or walk to the Opera House during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Hot and noisy room with impersonal atmostphere”
Reviews.Author: KittyCat28
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sofitel hotel for 6 nights - when we checked in, we were told we had been given an upgrade - but the room was very small. The room was incredibly hot in the night and loud road noise woke us up early every morning. Room service was slow aswell....the worst hotel in our 3 week visit !

Reviews.Title: “Just unlucky hiccups... otherwise enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: CanberraTourist
Reviews.Content: My partner & I booked Sofitil Wentworth misery hotel through lastminute.com for $150 per night for 1 night, which we thought was excellent value. Two days prior our arrival, I have received a phone call from customer service offering us upgrade of the room with breakfast etc which I thought was good value, except she said the record said I have booked for 2 nights instead of 1 night and I thought I may have made a mistake in booking. When I checked my record, it was only booked for 1 night and later this has been rectified to the original booking so I thought I had the original booking back without the upgrade. When we arrived at 5 pm that day, unfortunately the room was not ready yet. I didn't ask if I have been upgraded nor the staff informed me that I have been upgraded with breakfast included. She was nice enough to provide us with drink vouchers and sent our luggage to the room. The room was clean and a bit small for a 5 star hotel and a small bathroom (well.. I thought that's ok for a cheap deal in a 5 star hotel). And yes we paid the upgrade fee of $140 at check out, not knowing buffett breakfast for 2 was included (at least I was happy it included parking... and bit disappointed with the small room and bathroom in the upgrade.... can't imagine the budget room would be like) We came back to the hotel after a concert at 12 30 am and found and car park was locked. We had to park the car on the street, went to the front desk to ask for the car park staff to open the gate. Complimentary newspaper was not delivered when we requested at check in (not a big deal for me) 2 lifts were broken during the peak check out time so it took us 10-15 min to get to lobby. Probably the most expensive internet in a 5 star hotel in Sydney (in terms of hourly rate) Probably the only 5 star hotel in Sydney charges credit card fees. The positives sides of this hotel.... excellent and comfortable king size bed, probably the most comfortable bed we slept in. Room and bathroom were clean. Comfortable aircon. Nice lobby. Great location and in a quiet street of the CBD without any outside noise on a saturday night. Staff are friendly enough

Reviews.Title: “I won a luxurious accom for 2 but the room had no luxury whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: eventsmanager
Reviews.Content: I had won a night at the Sofitel Wentworth and was so excited, the prize was described as accommodation for two at a luxurious superior room. My expectations were high due to the key work "luxurious", I expected a huge room with a spa bath. When I phoned the hotel to confirm I was coming noone knew about the prize not even the person that had signed the prize! that was a bit sad but nevertheless still looking forward to a luxurious room... to our surprise, we were given probably the smallest room in the hotel, very economical looking. On a high note the room service was excellent, they did find gluten free food for me and the food was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss?”
Reviews.Author: ozmadmax
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times and despite myself I keep going back, mainly because the location is good and there are often cheap rooms available. However you get what you pay for. I have never had an "incident free" stay at this hotel and I wonder if it is simply poor housekeeping or poor management? On my most recent trip the check-in was ok, given room on 10th floor, supposedly non-smoking. When I opened the door I was accutely aware that non-smoking probably meant that the room itself was not a smoker but perhaps previous guests had been. The room had been poorly cleaned with beer bottle tops on the floor, the bathroom had plenty of pubic hair (another gift from the previous guest). Ordinarilly I would have asked for a room change, but having experienced room changes at this hotel before I was not sure that the effort would be worth the wait and hassle. Upon checking out I was asked how my stay was and I replied "adequate". The reception staff muttered something like "well that's all you can hope for here". It says it all.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER VALUE TV PACKAGE”
Reviews.Author: travelwizSydney
Reviews.Content: Wow, if this is not the best value at a hotel, I don't know what is. Our package cost $298 and was for 2 adults and 3 children. It included soft drink, water, juices all day, pre dinner canapes and drinks, afternoon tea, buffet breakfast, upgrade to a luxury room, bottle of wine AND valet parking! Rooms are pleasant but housekeeping attention to detail is rather poor, with pubic hair left all over the place. With the extreme value of this package I was prepared to turn a blind eye, but at standard rates I would have been very unhappy indeed. Position is good, with easy access to shopping, business and circular quay districts.

Reviews.Title: “In room internet a rip-off!!”
Reviews.Author: DoMeAFavour
Reviews.Content: Had to pay AUD24.95 for 24 hrs internet and got at best 0.50 Mb/s download and 0.13 Mb/s upload speeds, see test result here http://www.speedtest.net/result/580845557.png What technology are they using?? What a rip-off!!

Reviews.Title: “very Good”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghGraemekidd
Reviews.Content: Great Location,very comfortable room and bathroom,friendly service,good breakfast buffet style and room service.Plush lobby and nice bar on ground floor.Stayed here on many occasions and never had reason to complain!

Reviews.Title: “sensations package”
Reviews.Author: jut1702
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here on the sensations package,along with a lot of other people.We stayed in a superior room,which overlooked the courtyard.The room was clean and comfortable,and the bed was like sleeping on a cloud.The bathroom was on the small side though. Our package included afternoon tea,a good selection of sandwiches and cakes,with great coffee.Pre dinner drinks with a buffet of really good hoers doerves.Two course dinner and bottle of wine,and buffet breakfast.All the meals were really good,with lovely service from the staff. At no time were we made to feel like 2nd class because of the package as one previous reviewer said,the staff were proffessional,and polite,and went out of their way to help. I would stay here again,and would recommend this hotel to others.Maybe upgrade to club room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Secrets”
Reviews.Author: maccaj73
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sofitel Wentworth three times when i have visited Sydney over the last two years. On the last occasion i was bitterly disappointed. My first two experiences were great, the hotel looked fantastic and i was quite happy with the service and decided when ever i was to return to Sydney this would be my place of choice!! (I work for an airline so getting up there is cheap). On my last occasion we were put in a room which was hidious and a lesser room than what we had booked. The room looked out onto a dirty courtyard and the bed was not the best which they seemingly love to boast about! After further inspection it was a DUNLOP Mattress which looked like it was bought 20 years ago and was incredibly uncomfortable!! (We had a look because we knew it didnt feel right!)

Reviews.Title: “hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: Buddenz
Reviews.Content: We checked in at the 'club checkin' which was great, room was lovely. The club lounge was so convenient as in other Sofitel hotels. We dropped in to the lounge for afternoon tea, then for pre-dinner drinks and canape's. Breakfast was a little busy but the staff were very friendly and helpful so you didn't mind the slight delay. it was located within walking distance to everything and the staff were very helpful. We really enjoyed our stay here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and plush in the city”
Reviews.Author: Ang H
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my 2 besties for a girlie trip. Got a greeat deal, otherwise we would have had to skip to another property. Check in was fast, I had nothing to fill in and was given the room key. We were staying on a club floor and luckily I have stayed in this room category before or I'd have no idea where to go or what was on offer as reception told me nothing on check in. This was settled when we went up to the club floor after ditching our suitcases as they apologised and gave me the welcome letter that reception should have. The club floor was nice and spacious with a generous offering of canapes and drinks each evening, and the morning brekki was lovely. The internet was as little slow though. Our room was small, as per most reviews and as there were 3 of us they had forgotton to put in the rollaway so I had to ring for that, that really made the room tight but we managed. The facilities were nice and the shower / bath was lovely. The concierge did more than his share to help us on a number of occasions but reception was a bit of an effort each time I spoke with them. Also the property is very close to the Quay but a bit of a hike to darling harbour if you need to get there, but we made use of our legs and the monorail so no biggie. All in all a great stay, you have to make use of the club floor in its entirity to get value for your money as it is exy. I think Brisbane sofitel is still premier to this one. But would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our trip!”
Reviews.Author: Cinnamonr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel on a club floor and found the service professional and frendly. The rooms were small but adequate and serviced on time. Unfortunately the view is not nice. However , the hotel is very nicely and centrally situated and many attractions can be reached on foot. The club facilities are fantastic!!! We took our scrumptious breakfasts at leisure in the tranquil venue. We simply loved the high tea and the pre-dinner drinks where we had many glasses of French champagne and excellent red wines. The accompanying snacks at both the tea and drinks session were very elegant. We loved every moment of our 4 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Liberal Party Feels at home”
Reviews.Author: KetutSeminyak
Reviews.Content: The high point is the staff service and welcome. Its very good, although reservations through their call centre can be downright rude. The rooms are small - oh So french! But they don't look out on any nice views, sometimes onto a concrete plaza. The restaurant food is good - Jesse Ong is a great chef but the breakfast service can be hit and miss. Coffee can take an eternity. Come to think about it its stuck in a funny place with not much around it - sort of half way between anything. Maybe thats why the liberal party feel cormfortable here and always book their election night gathering in house. Stay here if you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: RayandLisa
Reviews.Content: I admit I was apprehensive about the hotel as it has some less than positive reviews on TA... but we were very pleasantly surprised. The staff were all really great and helpful, the breakfast was great (loads of choice), the bed was very very comfy and all in all we had a great stay.The only very minor issue is they forgot our newspaper... but no biggie!

Reviews.Title: “the worst attitude hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovemysydney
Reviews.Content: we have stayed in over 25 hotels in sydney over the last 20 years it is something we love doing, we love staying at 5 stares hotels this was not a five stare hotel although they charged like it. First the attitude of some staff members were beyond annoying they were down right rude on two occasion my partner was spoken down to by two different staff members he said it made him feel like a second class citizen . The room package that we chose was not what they had advertised it was below average even though we had up graded our room it was still very small and not very clean no were nere a 5 star room . i would like to tell you more about this hotel but one of the other hotel patron has said it all in his review on the 27 august all i can say now is that we were very very diappointed in your hotel your service and some of your staff.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Sofitel I have ever stayed in.......”
Reviews.Author: Hollywood1973
Reviews.Content: As an A-Club "Gold" member and frequent Sofitel Hotel guest in many countries I can easily say this is the worst not by a bit but by a country mile. The only good part was our courteous check-in and professional attitude of the front desk officer Daniel. The rest is laughable. The rooms are smaller than even rooms in Paris. We even has an upgrage superior room, not a classic room. I asked what was superior about it and they said it was bigger and I had a view over the courtyard. I would hate to think what a classic room looked like. The rooms were very dusty, the glass panels on the wall unit hadn't been dusted in years it seemed. The toilet roll holder was broken and the rolls had fallen off. the bin in the room was still full from the previous guest. But that was not the worst. We were here for one night whilst returning from LA and thought it would be nice to break up the trip home in Sydney. We took advatage of the Sofitel Sensations special which gave us a classic room, dinner for two and a bottle of wine, breakfast, pre-dinner drinks and canapes and free parking(which was not needed). Sounds good, I agree....BUT The dinner consisted of 2 courses and few options but on the menu you could UPGRADE to some other dishes. We wre not know this as our waiter did not point this out and when my partner askes what the soup of the day was she was glared upon and told that is not on the "Sensation" menu but was next to where we were reading. the waiter said that's optional but still refused to tell us what it was. as was if he thought we couldn't afford it. our table of four just laughed at his attitude and tried to enjoy the meal. The food was ok, nothing more, nothing less. The best part however was the pre-dinner snacks and drinks. When we arrived at Club Sofitel we were instructed that the drinks etc would be in a back room away from the main club area. I asked why as I always stay in a Club room at every Sofitel and that this looked like the main area. i was told that I couldn't stay here and have a drink as I was on the "Sensations" package. I found this insulting and my dinner party and I felt like homeless people being offered some refuge and meal when in fact we paid a fair price that they advertised. it was the biggest upsell I have ever seen a hotel in Australia attempt. I suggest they spend money on a complete overhaul including training for staff and become like the Sofitel in London and LA and charge more and gives those who frequent this chain the service and respect they pay for. In hospitality I always thought the customer really pays the bills. The Sofitel Sydney needs a good hard look in the mirror.

Reviews.Title: “Good business stay”
Reviews.Author: seaview088
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are somewhat small and the decor a little dated, the Sofitel Wentworth still stacks up as a sound choice for a business stay in Sydney. After a long day travelling to or working in the city, those Sofitel beds are really hard to bead. Forget the cramped room. When you lie on that bed it's worth it. For me, what the Sofitel lacked in room space (including the little bathroom with the very weird doors), it made up for in sound customer service by the front desk staff. After a major mix up with a room service meal, I received my meal at no charge. All can be forgiven when a mistake is made and the venue "owns" the mistake and is genuinely apologetic. Good customer service Wentworth. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but seemed unerstaffed.”
Reviews.Author: AileenCBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Formerly the Rydges Wentworth and formerly the Sheraton Wentworth (and probably a few other itinerant brands) . The rooms are smallish for 5 star but very presentable. We had room service dinner and it lacked flavour. Good facilities in a good location though. Staff service in the bar, and reception was too slow.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Disastor Stay - Highly Unrecommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: MissT78
Reviews.Content: I booked a two night package stay that was marketed on Foxtel which supposedly included complimentary dinner, wine etc was a total rort! Admittedly, the hotel itself is stunning but that is the only positive thing I could say about it. The staff were unaware of the marketing package so I had to keep reminding them what I was entitled too, we were charged excessively on things that were sold to us as complimentary and I can honestly say that I am shocked they class themselves as a 5 star hotel. Unless you want to pay $1000 for a 2 night supposed great package stay, I would suggest you find a more appropriate establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: rc33
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a superior room with a friend and it was just a 1 night stay before an early flight the next morning. Not an overly large room but there were 2 double beds in the room. The 'My bed' was really nice. Down pillows, mattress cover, and doona. One of the best beds I have tried. Really nice staff. Tried room service quite late in the evening and they were prompt. Food was very good for room service, especially the pizza and creme brulee. Had room service breakfast as well and was quite a spread. Breakfast was included in the room rate however it stated it needed to be taken at the restaurant. Checked with front desk and was told it could be taken as room service. When I checked out, I noticed the charge for the breakfast was on there but the front desk person happily took the charge off with no hassle. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: jos527
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights at the Sofitel at the beginning of our trip and 4 nights at the end of the trip. We arrived at 8am and our room was ready for us (which was wonderful since we could shower!). Our room was really nice - clean, comfortable bed, nice sized bathroom. It was just the standard room (we also received calls about upgrading, but chose not to since we knew we wouldn't spend too much time there). The concierge was very helpful and gave us great dinner recommendations each night and also great ideas on when to go to various attractions. The happy hour in the bar was nice, but we did feel under dressed with all of the business people! I loved all of the flowers in the lobby - it had a great feel. The location was incredible! A short walk to the Rocks (my favorite area), a couple blocks to the Botanical Gardens (great for a run), and also close to Circular Quay and the Opera House. I could not have been happier with this hotel. When we booked, we opted for the lowest rate, non-refundable. I was a little nervous having booked at the end of the trip, too (what if we didn't like it?), but I was happy that we did. When we left for Cairns, they even kept our suitcases for us so that we just had to bring smaller ones - extremely helpful. Upon returning, we had a corner room which was not as nice as the first room. We stayed one night and asked to switch...they did with no problem and even upgraded us for free! We had a great room with a balcony and it was a perfect size. Overall, I would definitely recommend staying here...and eat at the Chophouse behind the hotel. Delicious!

Reviews.Title: “An utter disaster”
Reviews.Author: Lockjaw
Reviews.Content: You know when a deal comes up and it seems too good to be true, well with the Sofitel it was. We (like previous reviews here) underwent the hard sell upgrade and package add ons, which never materialised. The "deluxe" room was poky and the bath was the size of a tray. Our "welcome drinks" were conveniently ignored, and we turned up just too late for Afternoon Tea... and the canapes... and pre dinner drinks. It was a complete nightmare. Then we had to endure the dinner service. The service was unorganised, slow, inexperienced and our mains (which we had to order twice) took an hour to arrive. When they did they were cold, inedible and just wrong. But the Sofitel were very quick and accurate with the bill at the end of the night, despite us canceling our desserts for taking too long. So trying to salvage the remainder of a disasterous stay, we tried to retire to the room, only to find a broken TV. We thought that the next morning's buffet breakfast would redeem the hotel - only to fail us once again. When the hot food is colder than the cold cuts, there is a serious problem. And having to chase down a member of waitstaff to get a glass of water, there is some serious errors. Our experience was so bad, we checked out early and went home, it was more comfortable and a lot nicer. Avoid this hotel like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Kids were impressed”
Reviews.Author: YingYang66
Reviews.Content: I bid for two rooms on a well known "bid for rooms' website. Landed two rooms at about 10% off the best rate otherwise available on the web. After the booking was made I contacted the hotel directly and requested one of the rooms to be twin room. Also requested an early checkin. Upon arrival at 9:30 in the morning, rooms were made available. A minor hicup with the twin room being allocated as a double. Was quickly sorted out. As expected with a hotel like this, most of the facility was in very good order. Room was very clean, bathroom functional and plush. Towels very fluffy. We arrived on a Saturday and walked the local streets. Be aware, the hotel is located in a business precinct and the adjoining streets are very quiet on weekends. Not a great variety of close restaurants on weekends. We ended up at Chinatown for dinner - a $6 taxi ride. This hotel is within easy walk of Circular Quay and the Botanic Gardens. We had breakfast in the restaurant the next morning. Food was good but something was going on with the staffing levels and service priority. It took 45 minutes to get a coffee t our table. Plates were not cleared form our tables between courses. For a $160 meal for the 4 of us, I expected better service. Checkout and concierge service were all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Solid 5 star hotel but needs finishing touches”
Reviews.Author: MrMagGoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sydney Sofitel for 3 nights. I came from the airport at around 10am and left my bags, pre-registered and had to wait for my room to be ready. Upon returning at 3:30pm they had no records of me even pre registering and required my credit card again. This was rather embarrassing as i "pushed' in front of a long queue of travelers waiting to check in because i thought i just needed to simply pick up my keys. Despite check-in being 2pm my room was not ready in till 3:50pm, I was given little explanation, I was far from impressed. I would have been a lot more accommodating with the staff if they actually gave me an explanation not just their silence followed by "its been a slow day" which was annoying. My room was a well furnished superior room. Which was up to usual Sofitel standard. Despite being a superior room it felt like what I would expect from a standard room at Sofitel. Never the less it was very clean and used high quality finishing's throughout, A solid five star. My only gripes about the room were that there was only one telephone in the room on the bedside table. However there were telephone jacks under the desk and above the toilet. Why there was no telephones connected to them , I do not know) But for a business hotel, I find it poor there was no phone at the desk. The two sets of blinds in the room were also shocking to operate, taking a long time to wind up and down. The room also features two oversized bookcase type units on each side of the windows about a meter thick (why these things have to be so big and cumbersome in the room is beyond me for such a small room, maybe there is something hidden behind them?) The hotels advertising was also fluffing the truth. My room was supposed to have a â€˜deep soaking bath tubâ€™ but it just was a plain run of the mill bath tub (nothing special). The hotel needs to look at the technology at Sofitel Melbourne to automate the lights; blinds and television to give it that edge, maybe even put a tv in the bathroom! The fact that the hotel is heritage listed I guess does limit its potential for major works but the improvements they need are not really structural. I think eventually Accor will need to look at relocating its Sofitel or re-branding this property. However overall, a good experience but nothing special. The staff were very efficient and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Hideous”
Reviews.Author: w84it
Reviews.Content: We arranged a 4 night stay in this hotel as a second honeymoon for my partner and I. From the word go it was a disaster. We probably should have realised this when a week before our trip we had a call from an Indian woman on behalf of Sofitel trying to hardsell a room upgrade. I have never felt so humiliated by this...for an extra 100$ per night you will receive...etc etc as far as I am concerned this is entirely inappropriate behaviour from a 5 star hotel. All we wanted was a nice quiet clean room that was central in Sydney. Sure, we booked a 'red hot' room on wotif but this shouldn't mean that you are given the worst room in the hotel. The king size bed was so uncomfortable that we thought that it must have been broken as it sloped to the right...so much so that I would wake up on the edge of the bed...There was this enormous hump in the middle of the bed as well which I had to 'climb' to get over to my wife.There was no top sheet and the pillows were unbearable and left me with a severe pain in my neck. The tv was tiny and way over in the corner of the room away from the bed. Blinds were broken floor not vacuumed, bathroom was miniscule. I would have said 3 star at the most. We didn't expect this when booking and will NOT stay here again. We have stayed in other Sofitels in Melbourne and Hua Hin in Thailand which were superb but this has tainted our whole experience of Sofitel and I doubt if we will ever stay in one again. Oh did I mention the 8 teenage boys roaming the hallways at midnight on the Saturday yelling and carrying on? Avoid!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities and location”
Reviews.Author: hails_79
Reviews.Content: Like any five star hotel you come to expect certain things. I got a really good last minute rate so the value for money was really good. Clean, well appointed room and all the facilities you could possibly need. The location is great for anyone doing work in the business district. Generally the service was good, however I did complain about the fact that they have held my credit card imprint ($150) for 7 days despite only staying for 2 nights... bit rich. I also find some of their staff condescending and too toffy. Generally however their staff are helpful and provide a good service.

Reviews.Title: “Worth upgrading to Club Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Gracie_Family
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the Sofitel with our 8 month old bubby. We booked a room at the Club Sofitel, and the service was great. We especially enjoyed the club lounge, with beautifully designed relaxation room. There was even a Nintendo Wii for the guests to use! Our room was clean and furnishings were of a high quality. Restaurant was nice but I would not say that it comes close to the top Sydney restaurants that we sometimes go to. Service at the restaurant was mediocre and the food was just decent. The room service breakfast was a different matter altogether - it was fantastic! Overall we were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: blossySydney
Reviews.Content: As a accor card holder, and the fact we paid extra for an upgrade for a "garden view" we were expecting something quite nice. The reception had a lovely array of oriental flowers so it bode well. On arrival, into our room on the 12th floor, it absolutely stank of cigarette smoke, only to discover despite the fact we requested a non smoking room, they had given us a smoking room. When we told reception, they then gave us a room on the 11th floor right opposite the lift. The upgraded garden view was difficult to see with a roman blind and even then it was nothing to look at!! The traffic noise was audible and when buses drove by the glass bookcase shelves rattled. The bath and shower were together, there was only one dressing gown, the air conditioning didn't seem to work and there was an extremely heavy doona on the bed with no top sheet. The king size bed was very comfortable but unfortunately the overheated doona, made for an uncomfortable nights sleep. Breakfast was ordinary, had to ask to get coffee and for a coffee cup without lipstick, hot food was cold and the pastries seemed stale. We had planned to stay there again later in the year but will stick to the Marriott or Sheraton on the Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: Olympick
Reviews.Content: I was really tempted to give this place 5 stars, but it came short on one point only. The hotel is wonderful, we really enjoyed our stay. The check-in staff were friendly and efficient, the rooms were great and the beds â€¦ it was like sleeping on a cloud!! We only stayed for one night, but Iâ€™ve previously eaten at the hotel and the lounge is very nice and they do great high tea. The location is great, just a short distance from Sydneyâ€™s most beautiful location â€“ Circular Quay â€“ where you can soak in the sights such as the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Go at sunset for an unforgettable view. The only thing I was disappointed about was breakfast. For a hotel of this class I thought it was rather basic. The food was delicious, but the choices were limited. I will definitely return, but I hope they do improve the breakfast experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in a Sofitel Club Room”
Reviews.Author: Melburnians
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel Wentworth in March in a Club room (around $300 for the night) and really enjoyed it. The staff were great, the room was clean, albeit on the smaller side but more than enough to be comfortable. The bathroom was large and modern although it did have a shower over the bath, which didn't worry me but may concern others. Of note was the VERY comfortable bed that was like sleeping on a cloud! The staff at the Club were wonderful and accommodating and did everything they could to make the stay enjoyable. I would recommend this hotel and would say that it is certainly worth upgrading your room to include Club privileges.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely surprise”
Reviews.Author: Fuffel
Reviews.Content: We stayed just this weekend. Booked as a mystery last minute deal and didn't know where we were going until paid. Was a bit hesitant when I found out as that part of the city can be quiet on weekends. However, in we went and when I got to reception asked sheepishly if an upgrade would at all be possible and without a blink of an eyelash was upgraded a room type. So we had a lovely Superior room which overlooks the courtyard. Was a wild and wooly night in town, so didn't want to venture far for dinner. So just had a casual dinner at the NSW Leagues Club which is close by, there is also a convenience store close by for snacks etc. The lobby of the Wentworth smells delicious - makes you feel special every time you walk in. The room was decorated stylishly and the beds and pillows were great, only complaint was the doona was a bit too hot and kept me awake a bit, they could actually downgrade the doonas - is that a minus though! I'm in my 40's and the Wentworth has always been a part of Sydney in my era, I remember going there in my youth to a bar/nightclub there. Has been upgraded since then though. Rooms small but all you need and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: tretyersen
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd time that I have stayed at the Sofitel Sydney - I love this place! The location is great - easy to get to the shops and also the sights of Sydney. The reception staff are so friendly - Paul even recognized me from my last stay.... I was running late for a meeting and the concierge staff were really helpful giving me perfect directions to my appointment. Its worth upgrading to Club Sofitel, particularly if not on business as the afternoon tea & complimentary evening drinks are a nice treat. My husband & I ate in the Garden Court restaurant on sat night.... the food was outstanding, they have a really good wine list also. Its a great hotel for both work or pleasure. - can;t wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Luxurytime
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking forward to our trip as we were celebrating our 50th wedding anniversary. Due to my husband's recent knee surgery, a flat base shower was a must. We made the reservation through the hotel directly and the staff was very helpful with our special needs requests. On arrival, we found the reception staff to be both friendly and helpful. The scent in the lobby was beautiful. It was a beautiful fresh and lavender smell. The room was nice and clean with decent sized flat base shower. Due to my husband's lack of mobility, we ate most of our meals at the restaurant. The breakfast consisted of a full buffet and the fresh pastries were lovely. The staff were polite and friendly. We felt welcome every morning during our stay and was addressed with our names. Our dinner experience was beautiful. The food was superb and according to my husband the steak was cooked to perfection. My fish was accompanied with a delicious sauce. The waiter recommended us wines to match our meals which was matched perfectly. Overall we throughly enjoyed our stay and will definately be returning in the future. We have been telling our friends of the wonderful time we had and would highly reccommend other people to stay and especially to dine in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good and friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: LennyF
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed twice at the Wentworth. It did not surprise me to learn that a large percentage of its customers are repeat business. The location is central. But what makes the hotel so good is its wonderful, friendly, dedicated staff. Louise at the reception is great, she is been very helpfull during all our stay. My wife and I are picky hotel consumers. We have been delighted with the Wentworth and look forward to returning there.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you have a hardskin for breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: LuckyMcTucky
Reviews.Content: Not going to be a particularly positive review for this hotel im afraid. After a 23 hour flight we arrived at the Hotel lobby at 9am. This seemed to confuse the desk clerk as we had arranged an early check in the day before but the request hadnt actually been sent to the staff, the clerk told us that it was our fault for not actually doing it and we were lying, it was only when we produced a conformation email from the hotel that he decided his neck needed to be wound in. The battle had been won for the check in, but the war for our rooms was not over, the hotels team had another trick up their sleave. We had planned to spend the day sightseeing but wanted to change and shower after the flights. The clerk told us that there was 1 room that 3 of us could share to change and go out and when we get back later in the day our room would be ready. With no other options we headed up to share a room - a very small one I might add. Hotel - 1/Guests - 1. Breakfast at a 'luxury hotel' for me is normally one of the best parts of a trip, endless amounts of reheated stodgy beans and sausages. Perfect! This is not the case at this hotel. The 2 head waitresses for the breakfast area acted as if you were a nuisance for coming down to their lair. On the first morning i was greated from the 'tall one' - "Whats your room number." in a demanding bark more than a greating question. Then in a huff took me over to a dirty, badly laid table. Id asked for a table for 5 but was given a 4 and told to get my own extra chair. The food was covered in fruit flies and the yoghurts were warm and clearly were just reused from the previous day. The barked greatings with no personal recognition carried on for our whole 2 week stay. It got to the point where our responses became rude back to the 'tall one' because she just didnt have any resemblance of customer care, maybe she just had a bad memory. Saying this, the rest of the staff were friendly and seemed equally intimidated by the 'tall one' and her sidekick. Also dont look at the state of the kitchen if you want to eat - Gordon Ramsey would have an expletive field day. The rooms are ok - once we got them - i had a lounge and a bedroom but seemed pretty pointless to me as id rather have 1 big room instead of 2 small dark rooms. However the beds are really very good and the bathroom is as you'd expect in a 4*. This is a hotel with a great location, nice furniture, and a nice facade - However it seemed to me that as soon as something wasn't as you or they had expected it then you better be ready for a fight or just disapointment. Id suggest just getting a Room and dont even bother with the breakfast unless you want to experiance the joys of dealing with the headgirls. Maybe i was just unlucky with who i spoke to but I think some of their staff need to seriously be retrained in customer care.

Reviews.Title: “Good CBD Value”
Reviews.Author: lien
Reviews.Content: Booked thru the Wotif "secret deal" so was not expecting the best room in the house. And it wasn't. Small and irregular shape with an outlook onto the central airshaft. This did not bother us too much as we were there just to sleep. The facilities in the room were 5 star and the bathroom had everything needed including a large shower recess with plenty of powerful hot water and nice big fluffy towels. Check in staff were friendly and efficient as were the concierge and porter. All the staff we came across looked as tho they enjoyed their jobs, had a word or a smile for us and we felt welcome. Valet parking was $30 overnight. Would return again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: JessicaLeeCbr
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. was expecting a little larger room but the room had enough space for everything we needed and didnt feel crowed at all. The Bed is FANTASTIC!!!!! if anyone knows where u can buy one please please please let me know i have never had such a good night sleep!. The staff were very helpful with everything!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise.”
Reviews.Author: Juzshmee
Reviews.Content: Friends of ours booked us into this Hotel for a weekend trip away, and after reading some of the reviews on Tripadvisor I don't think I would have booked there myself. But I was pleasantly surprised. Staff at check- in were wonderful. Upgraded us from a standard room to a Superior King without hesitation. Were polite, friendly and helpful with every request. Our room was on the 6th floor with a cute little balcony so we could have the doors open for fresh air. The room was spotless with a large comfy bed (Love those pillows!!!), a small writing desk and chair, plus an arm chair and ottoman. The room wasn't huge but my husband and I didn't find it too small either. There was a luggage rack in the wardrobe which we placed beside the writing desk with room to spare for the extra shopping bags I accumulated over the weekend!! The bathroom was lovely and clean with all the usual complimentary goodies (shampoo, soap etc) which were replaced everyday and beautiful large clean, white, fluffy towels which were also replaced everyday. The Hotel is in a great position with an easy walk down to The Rocks and Circular Quay .There is a 24hr convenient store nearby which is handy and all of the fantastic Sydney shops and department stores also within walking distance or a $5.00 approx. cab fare. No trouble getting a taxi as the doorman is quick to hail them down so we never had to wait if we did want one. We had breakfast one morning in the Hotel restaurant which was a bit pricey,but there was plenty of different dishes to chose from and everything was fresh and tasty. Staff were helpful and everything was clean and well presented. Or flight out of Sydney wasnt till 8.30pm but we had a late checkout of 1pm without any extra charge and the hotel stored our luggage for the rest of the time. All in all we had a wonderful 2 night stay and really can't complain about anything at this hotel. Because of the location, and lovely room we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Perfectly Formed”
Reviews.Author: BeePhoenix
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Wentworth while in Sydney to see a comedy show. The hotel was booked through a Wotif mystery hotel deal. The hotel lobby is beautifully decorated in a faux Art Deco style with chandeliers, flowers and mirrored surfaces. Our room was on the 16th floor and was very comfortable, but very compact. The reviews are right - the rooms are small. But they are quite lovely. The room was a standard room with a big, inviting white bed, a flatscreen TV, beautiful lighting and some random vases. The writing desk looked out over the Sydney cityscape and the Harbour bridge. There was a construction site below but there was no construction happening as we stayed on a public holiday weekend. There was only one armchair and nowhere to put your bag - a serious problem if you were staying more than a night or two. The bathroom was marbled and very elegant but you had to go through tiny closet-style doors to access it. Likewise there was a nice flat screen tv but it was on a stand in the corner - there was not enough room for it to be facing the bed. All that said, however, the Sofitel bed was really really lovely. We had a great night's sleep after the comedy show - it was comfortable, warm and there was plenty of space to stretch out. We had two huge fluffy goosedown pillows (and discovered a fifth in the closet) and the sheets were delightfully soft. The staff were also faultless - they were thoughtful and took care of taxis and luggage without having to be asked. We also had a good experience in the Aveda hair salon and spa in the hotel building, getting a haircut and a facial with a couple of complimentary five-minute head and neck massages. The Sofitel is a good luxury hotel but if you are a thrifty and utilitarian soul you will probably be disappointed. If you always have trouble sleeping while travelling, though, then we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Room was below my expection...Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravellerhkHongKong
Reviews.Content: I had spent a day with my family on 12 April 2009 before I went back to Hong Kong . A bit dispointed ....The room was very small. It seems to be designed for one traveller only....even though you have booked for two persons. The wallpaper of the room was a bit dirty and the vase was covered with dust. On the other hand, the staff were great.... attentive, good product knowledge, particular Concierge Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Terrible Food”
Reviews.Author: pete67
Reviews.Content: We live in Sydney, and stayed one night for a family function. This hotel is comfortable and the beds are a dream, however overall I would not recommend it as a 5 star hotel. Positives: excellent, friendly, efficient service from everyone we met. While the rooms are small they are absolutely fine for a short, comfortable stay. Negatives: The friendliness of the service is let down by the awful restaurant.... Dinner: The "freshly shucked oysters" were obviously not freshly, nor properly, shucked â€” dry, gritty and stuck to the shell. Unacceptable in a so-called quality restaurant. I almost sent them back. The main meals were also uninspiring; my wife's cassoulet of duck was overcooked, dry and salty; my mother's dish "on a garden pea puree" was on the puree bed but also surrounded by your basic frozen peas... unforgivable. Breakfast: The buffet includes all the usual cold treats, however the cooked breakfast was terrible â€” overcooked bacon and the worst and saltiest scrambled eggs I've had in my life. If you want eggs etc done differently you have to stand in a queue for the friendly but over-worked lady to make them as you wait, with a dozen other people... again, not 5 star. Anyway, this hotel is fine for a short stay in the middle of the CBD, but definitely not 5 star. The rooms are OK and the service is very friendly and efficient, however if you are the kind of person who expects the dining experience to match the "5 star" rhetoric, I would recommend that rather than book into the hotel restaurant you instead explore the many wonderful restaurants Sydney has to offer elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “we had great service here.”
Reviews.Author: aussie_rose64
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel with my adult and teenage daughter's for one night prior to our cruise and found the staff just wonderful. nothing was too much trouble and check in and out were fast and efficent. the location is great as everything is within walking distance, circular quay, museum, shopping and resturants. we had our dinner at a resturant around the corner called "chophouse" the ribs are to die for!!! i have no trouble recommending this hotel and we did get a good deal with our accor card.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Find a good Deal”
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with attentive, friendly, polite and helpful staff. The location of the hotel is excellent and wihtin easy walking distance of Circular Quay, the Botanic Gardens and CBD shopping. My room was quite compact and was impacted somewhat by the construction noise opposite. All other elements, however, were very good, including an extremely comfortable bed, huge new towels and good airconditioning. The main problem for this hotel in competing with the big players in town (Shang, Four Seasons, Park Hyatt) is the absence of on-site recreation facilities, especially during the weekend when the off-site gym closes after 12 noon. If a large room and recreation facilities aren't a high priority then this is a good option within the CBD but find a good deal and don't pay rack rates. All round better value can be found elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room overlooking construction”
Reviews.Author: Richlo
Reviews.Content: We took this one as a mystery pick and were sorry we did. First the good parts: it's definitely a luxury hotel with a beautiful lobby in an excellent location. Two major problems: the room we were given would be perfect for a single traveler on business but it didn't work for the two of us travelling on holiday. For example - (1) there were absolutely no drawers to put our clothes in; (2) you could not open the bathroom door if the other person was opening the closet.(3) there was no space in the bathroom for toiletries. The room overlooked a construction site that operated from 7 to 7 every day. We are early risers and this was guaranteed by the adjacent noise. Returning to the room for a late afternoon nap was just not possible. Altogether not a great deal even though the rate was low.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: welovequeenstown
Reviews.Content: I find it hard to believe this is a 5 star hotel. We stayed here for 2 nights for work purposes. We made a point of asking for non-smoking but on opening the door to our room, the stale smell of smoke hit us. The whole room reeked. We went back to reception to discuss the matter, only to be told, all other rooms were full, hence we were on the smoking floor. The whole floor reeked! When it was time to go to bed, we were hit again by the smell, when we put our heads on the pillows (which by the way are gorgeous feather ones). There was simply no way either of us could sleep with these pillows. When I called reception to ask for new pillows, the person at the other end actually argues with me, that new pillows would not make a difference to the smell. It was only after some time, that he finally gave in and said they would send up new pillows. Definately not 5 star service in my books! Also the valet parking is not so valet. You are not able to leave your car at the reception, they ask you to drive it down to the carpark and then the parking attendants do the "valet" parking. You are then required to enter the hotel via the back entrance, up as escalator. The same thing on checkout, you carry your own bags out the back entrance, to the car park and wait for your car to arrive. For $30 a day, I expect valet parking if I have paid for it. We paid extra for breakfast, which was lovely, the restaurant gorgeous, but as it was a weekend, we had to wait in a very long line, just to get a table. Perhaps it would be better during the week. Location is great, easy to walk to restaurants and shops. We had a "city" view and overlooked a construction site. I would not stay here again. I have stayed in other 5 star establishments in Sydney and have to say, service was much better than here. A hotel room is pretty much a hotel room, but service does make a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: sharonyp
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a "mystery" hotel on wotif.com. Having discovered the identity of the hotel, i read the reviews on tripadvisor.com and was getting a little worried as to what to expect... but then again, for the rate that i had paid, i decided to proceed with no expectations. but it turned out to be a good experience. i stayed at Four Points Sheraton during my previous visit to Sydney. I would say Sofitel is much better than Four Points. Sofitel is very centrally located, and i could walked to the Rocks and also to some of the offices that i had meetings. check-in was smooth but the check-in staff must have all been trained to try and induce guests to upgrade to a bigger room or to Club rooms. but do not be swayed! you can check the room first and then decide later if you want to upgrade. though breakfast was not included, i had no problems looking for cafes. there's illy's coffee just down the road (less than 50m), some deli just at the back of sofitel, and some cafes in chifley tower and buildings surrounding sofitel. the room was just right for 1 person but may be a little small for 2 persons. my room was not facing the construction site (PHEW) - no noise pollution and no eyesore. the concierge was very helpful and obliging. essentially, i had no complaints for the rate that i paid. but then again, i may not have paid their usual rates for the smallish room. so, it's all relative to the rate that one paid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms - but small and very dusty”
Reviews.Author: feeev
Reviews.Content: As a last minute thing, my boyfriend and I booked this hotel for a 1 night stay. Upon arrival, we checked in with no hassles. However the check in girls didn't seem very friendly - not even a smile. The lobby looks amazing though. It is not located right in the middle of the city (the restaurants, clubs, nightlife, etc) but is located near Circular Quay/Wynyard. A nice quite area, away from the busy streets of Sydney. The room is VERY tiny. One of the smallest rooms we have ever stayed in. However the room looked very nice and clean. Had a small mini bar, separate shower (no bath tub), and I loved the different lights in the room (night light, reading light, bedside light, etc). Everything seemed fine until we both started sneezing a lot, and our noses became very blocked. My boyfriend and I both have hayfever but it hasn't acted up like this for a very long time. The room was VERY dusty, you can see all the dust particles floating around under the light. What was worse was that the windows could not be opened for some fresh air. We had a terrible sleep and kept waking up during the night! It must've been a very dusty room. The bed was also very soft, and it sunk. I prefer to sleep on hard beds. I'm glad I didn't pay full price for this room as it definitely isn't worth it's price. The rooms are small and are very dusty. Definitely not a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, great service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ritchard
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel Wentworth for three nights. Great location. Well proportioned rooms and with excellent amenities. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, which is just as well.....”
Reviews.Author: snooky860
Reviews.Content: Located a few minutes walk from Circular Quay and the Opera House, but far enough away from the noise and hustle. This place gives the appearance of a business hotel, which it probably ideally is, but I didn't feel out of place in shorts and t-shirt. The close proximity to the attractions is probably just as well, as the hotel itself doesn't really have much to offer the non-business traveller. I booked a superior room as a last minute special offer, but wasn't overly impressed. The room was nothing special and I'm glad I didn't pay the regular rate for it. Certainly not a 5 star room. The bed was comfortable, but I would recommend using the pillow menu. I couldn't decide if the feather pillows smelt like cabbage or feet! I would stay here again, but will try other places first next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “warning: construction site”
Reviews.Author: Hottuberrol
Reviews.Content: A few comments from someone who spends 50-60 nights a year in hotels in asia and europe. I like staying in sofitels when the budget allows, as the beds are generally great, the rooms well furnished and with quality bathroom products. This stay wasnt so good. Firstly - DONT take a "city room" view without ensuring it doesnt overlook the construction site across the road in Bligh St. I reckon there's at least 6 months work there, its a hole in the ground at present. The builders are not supposed to start jackhammering and drilling before 9am, and for the two nights I was there, it was more like 7.30am and 8am. The soundproofing in the windows is non-existent - they are not double glazed. I had to get up around 8am anyway but if you wanted to sleep in or work from your room - just forget it. Secondly - regular Sofitel customers will be familiar with the nice soft layer they put on top of the mattresses. Mine must have been put on the bed while still damp...when I got in at midnight from my first day, I lifted the duvet to be greeted with the stink of wet wool. Not impressed - had to get it changed the next day. Thirdly....you would think that having Platinum A-Club membership would result in an "amenity" , and upgrade (away from the noise!) or free internet or something....nothing on offer here (and yes my club number was on the booking). I didnt ask to be moved or upgraded, because I wasnt spending much time in my room, and I wasnt interested in packing and unpacking again just to make a point. I'm not losing sleep over any of this (only because I had to get up at 8am ;) ) but I hope you find this review helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Only maybe 4 star?”
Reviews.Author: bigdav0
Reviews.Content: Overall I've found that Sofitels in australia just aren't 5 star. The Sydney Wentworth truly lives up to this. On the upside they are relatively cheap, but I would only stay again if I was booked on the club floor with the club lounge access. The restaurant at breakfast time was reminiscent of Fawlty Towers (except it was not funny), reception staff uninformed and rude, and the rooms small & ordinary. In all, just not a 5 star hotel. Overseas I'll continue to stay at a Sofitel, but in oz next time I'll play it safe at the Westin

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: stuaris
Reviews.Content: Such great staff from check in to concierge, all couldn't be more helpful and friendly. Lovely comfy rooms with divine beds. Tea and coffee making facilities, mini bar, dressing gowns and nice toiletries.Great location just up from Circle Quay. My only gripe is the same i have with most top end hotels, internet and Wifi access is so expensive, so unnecessary when its virtually cost free to provide. Come on Sofitel make a stand and provide free access for guests, such a necessary part of modern day life now. Ps lovely breakfast although not cheap either.

Reviews.Title: “loved the sofitel”
Reviews.Author: larrywinnipegcanada
Reviews.Content: sofitel is truly a 5 star hotel. excellent location iht the cbd.easy walking distance to opera house, shopping markets and the rocks area. helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced, poorly thought through amenities”
Reviews.Author: IndigoTraveller
Reviews.Content: If you are male, not allergic to feathers, and tolerant of small amounts of dirt in high priced hotels, then this hotel may be for you. If you don't have a feather allergy, the bed was fantastic. Even with the feather mattress topper stripped off, it was extremely comfortable and extremely large with no roll together and no transmission of your other half's fidgeting. Unfortunately, in two nights, their best replacement for the feather mattress topper, pillows and duvet, was three tatty non-feather pillows and a couple of blankets which it took 30 minutes and two phones calls to get (one of which the chambermaid took away when she came, without replacing it with the requested non-feather duvet, leading to yet another later night phone call to get enough bedding to sleep in back). This is also the only hotel I've ever been in that considers one sanitary bag the appropriate number for each 24 hours (and the bathroom bin has no lid). The small amount of dirt was (hopefully) squashed and smeared insects both in the bathroom and on the blackout blind. The blackout blind was very effective. The hotel did not suffer from traffic noise, but if you are sensitive to noise, get a room away from the lifts, as you can hear other people talking as they go back to their rooms. The decor was beauiful, and the staff attentive - unless you wanted something more complicated than help using the lift. Overall though, at that price, I would expect the room to be spotless and for them to be able to cater to a feather allergy better and quicker. Other luxury hotels are clearly aware of the problem and cater to it more efficiently and appealingly.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant is rubbish!”
Reviews.Author: Springstreet77
Reviews.Content: THe service is the restaurant is terrible. A coffee takes 30 mins to arrive. Would not recommend. I was not the only one complaining during our visit.

Reviews.Title: “got what I paid for”
Reviews.Author: DownunderSugarglider
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night when on business and so I booked the cheapest room available - and I got what I paid for. Others suggest upgrading and perhaps you could consider that is this is to be a special holiday. I was in rm 1607 which was right next to the lifts (no noise) and at the back of the hotel - no real view - except over the street, other blds and construction site. I suppose the building is really old and the room must been the original size - really small! I've had bigger rooms in Japan! the king bed had barely any room around it. At least the decor was modern and fresh and quality. The wall with the window had the desk and TV cabinet built in. the TV had lots of cable channels but I had to get the technician in twice as it suffered the blue screen of death. the bed was very comfy but the pillows were uncomfy duck feather no support type - fortunately House keeping provided a foam pillow on request. They had that "doona in a sheet" thing that is becoming popular - but WAY too hot. I ran the A/C down to 16 degrees and then had the "too cold to not be covered, too hot under the doona" situation. Ordinary Sheets Please!! The entrance hall had the mini bar cabinet - all very nice - but no coffee machine. Cupboard had safe, ironing board, bathrobe, luggage rack etc The entrance hall was teeny - had troubles opening the door and letting room service in - I couldn't work out how I was going to open the door whilst holding the tray to put it out again - impossible. The bathroom had these teeny doors - nice marble room - good towels, great selection of good quality toiletries, magnifying mirror, etc just all on the small scale. Then the next morning when getting ready all the lights went out in my room and the technician had to come up and reconnect me. I had breakfast in the buffet - which was the worst part - outrageously expensive and the selection was very average - basically for the price I've had gourmet brekkies in other places. Also there were not enough tables so there was a long queue and wait for a table; and a long queue for the chap making the eggs, and a wait to bring the tea etc - very slow and not particularly great. I had dinner the night before from room service and that was good! a little bit expensive - but very good quality, large serving, delivered in average time and enjoyed. All up I think I spent too much time interacting with a variety of hotel staff. they all came quickly and were very pleasant, achieved the aim but I should not have met 3 technicians in a 1 night stay. I went to a conference in the hotel and the conference room was fine - the A/C was a bit cold, the food was fine and plentiful etc

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi75
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Sydney was a bit of a letdown. The rooms were small, no views and construction noise to keep us awake. The other big issue was housekeeping which was very hit and miss. On the plus side the concierge service was very good, helpful at arranging transfers and giving directions. The breakfast was very disappointing with limited selection and average quality. We also found the reception staff unhelpful and not particularly friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: skiggy
Reviews.Content: Having just got married (for the 2nd time) my new wife and I had booked a 13 night cruise for our honeymoon.We flew into Sydney the day before and stayed the night pre-cruise at the Sofitel Wentworth.I had booked through the Accor website as an Advantage Plus member and thought that I'd splurge a little and stay in a Club Sofitel room. It's not often that my expectations are exceeded when it comes to hotels but in this case they most certainly were. We arrived by taxi and were warmly greeted at the entrance, luggage was quickly whisked away and we were escorted to the comfort of the Club Lounge for private check in by a very friendly young Frenchman. Within a very short time we were in our room (luggage was already there) and to our delight realised that we had been upgraded to a Club Suite with bubbly and petit fours on arrival compliments of the management on our recent marriage. The 15th floor suite was just lovely and very clean and modern with (of course) separate lounge and large marble bathroom with Roger and Gallet toiletries.The Sofitel My Bed is just divine and guarantees a good night's sleep. Club inclusions were : complimentary Lenotre afternoon tea,pre-dinner drinks and canapes,and of course,full buffet breakfast. Even when I couldn't see something that I wanted (pancakes with maple syrup and cream) I simply asked if it was possible and they made it happen.I liked the several large plasma screens dotted throughout the lounge and the wait staff were ultra friendly at all times. We were so impressed with what we saw,we shelved our plans to see Sydney at night and stayed in. The lobby was just lovely and very inviting and my wife just adored the flower arrangements. At every turn we encountered a friendly staff member...from the valet to the doorman,waitresses to cleaners...nothing was too much trouble and all with a big smile...how lovely! If this is how they treat their guests worldwide then I can't see any reason why I would stay anywhere else other than Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “French Indulgence without going to Paris !”
Reviews.Author: ozcookie1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wentworth for a significant birthday and wanted somewhere special. We had reserved a Club room and on arrival were upgraded to a Junior Suite (but in hindsight the Junior Suite was facing the rear and a construction site with noise so would have prefered the Club room). Check-in staff were very courteous and whisked us straight up to the Level 5 club where you have a seperate check-in. We got a quick tour around the sofitel club as well as afternoon teas, evening drinks and breakfasts are all included here. The room was excellent with two TVs, well appointed bathroom and all facilities you expect of a five star hotel. The bed and pillows were the highlight and easily the most comfortable we've ever experienced and 'triangle pillows' appeared in our room within minutes of the request. On the negative, there was a welcome note for another guest with a piece of old fruit on the desk that had not been removed. We loved the club experience as we spent most of our time at the hotel. The Lenotre afternoon teas were delicious and tempting and so petite that you didn't feel guilty indulging. We drank enough fine teas over the 4 day stay to sink a ship. The canapes and two hours free drinks that come with club access were another highlight and the canapes were of a very high standard and it's amazing how many glasses of champagne you can drink in two hours ! Staff in the club were exceptional and clearly of a standard not seen in Australia. Most were European, several French and we only noticed one Australian. Agree with other reviewers that paying the extra for club access is almost essential here as our review would be different if we had not. There is not much the hotel can do about the building site with construction noise (and we could have requested a move) but the noise is disconcerting and quite loud. Dinner at the Garden Court was incredible with a price to match but the standard of service and quality of food was extr emely high. My wife said she's never tasted oysters so good, We had an accor card so got half price food but even with that Dinner for two and a wine flight came to $140. Bottles of water were charged at $10 each The recent renovations are obvious and the public areas and rooms all look wonderful. If you want a view or a a swimming pool in your hotel then go elsewhere but if you want a high quality experience in the heart of the CBD this will do the job. We had a great stay and next time will know to request a room away from the construction site !

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of a bustling city”
Reviews.Author: worldly_gems
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we've stayed at the Sofitel in Sydney. Being Accor privilege members, we have stayed at numerous Sofitel hotels throughout the world and Sydney was one that did not dissapoint. The furniture was well appointed and was furnished with taste. Unfortunately, the hotel doesn't have a view of the harbour due to its locations but don't let this point get you down. Some of the other reviews commented on noise issues but we definitely didn't encounter any. The staff went well and beyond to help with luggage held for the day, thorough instructions to get to shopping destinations, the correct buses to hop on/off etc. Breakfast was pretty good in terms of Sofitel standards. The location was perfect in terms of buses to the Paddington shops and Bondi Beach. It was just a short walk (about 100m to the bus stop). We'll definitely make a stop here again for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: OskarandSunny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel to mark a special occasion. We arrived early but the room was available. We were pleasantly surprised to receive an upgrade to a junior suite. The service provided at the desk was wonderful and this was followed up with a gift in the room. The hotel is older than some but has been beautifully decorated and has a warm comfortable feel. Location is very central for both business and pleasure travellers. All in all we could not fault the hotel or the wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5* unless pay for Club rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Expat_Bean
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have indicated, unless you are willing to pay for a Club room, this hotel is not 5*. This is compounded by the lack of a pool and an 'indpendent' in-house gym (which closes at 12pm on Sat and Sun!). Also beware that there is currently a very large demolition project underway directly opposite the standard room windows - nothing like window panes shaking all day to take the already dulled gloss completely off the experience. Breakfast was underwhelming, and not just because it was $40. Normally stay at Sheraton-on-the-Park, but was full at the rate I normally book. Will definitely go for the next rate up at Sheraton next time (which will work out cheaper than a Club room at the Wentworth anyway!).

Reviews.Title: “Just the Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: muzarro
Reviews.Content: We have previously stayed at the Sofitel Wentworth, however their recent refurbishment, including the Sofitel Club is quite spectacular. We normally book Club Floors so as have access to the Clubs for breakfast etc..... and this visit proved to be the Best Experience ever. We were directed to the Club to check in - which was ever so pleasant and welcoming, nothing a problem, welcome drink in hand, shown around the new club facilities etc etc etc.... Fabulous room as well, and the service impecable. so much so that this would have to be our favourite Hotel now with a far Superior Club service than what we have ever ever received. Top Marks!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic the Second Time round!!”
Reviews.Author: firebucket
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel in December, 2007 and was less than impressed. However, I decided to give the hotel a second chance in May, 08 and I'm so very glad I did! The members of staff that I encountered could not have been more polite, helpful and courteous. The hotel has really improved in this area and cannot be faulted. The GM, Simon Harris should be commended for these efforts. The atsmosphere was very pleasant and welcoming. The hotel room was clean, well lit & beautiful and in-room noise has never been an issue for me. The blackout blinds are excellent! I enjoyed another fantastic buffet breakfast, consuming my body weight in Latte's and omelettes. lol I have found most 5 star hotels in Sydney to be quite similar, but the staff at the Sofitel make all the difference. Well Done.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, but get club access!”
Reviews.Author: BallerinaApple
Reviews.Content: I have been to SWS many times for work but this was the first time my partner and I have actually stayed in the hotel overnight. before getting to that I just want to add that this hotel is a great venue for a conference.
