They have the most comfortable boardroom chairs ever! and also offer high quality water, mints and snacks throughout. Although we didn't pay extra for club access (we will next time because it includes most of the food you'll need while you're there and much more) we were upgraded to a recently refurbished club room. The room was compact, the the decor was fantastic and the view down to the courtyard was nice. The bed was probably the most comfortable I've ever slepped in. Oh, and I can't forget the coffee machine! It took me a moment to figure out how to use it. It was actually quite simple, just choose the strength of coffee you want, pop the pre packed capsule in and hey presto a true espresso in your room. They still have the sachets and a kettle if you prefer instant too. My only real complaint would be that the shower floor is marble so it is extremely slippery when soapy. I called down and got a bath mat brought up by House Keeping. I should add that they have the best shampoo I have ever used in a hotel. The staff were fantastic, smiles all round from everyone. I couldn't fault them. Oh, and make sure you tell them if you're staying for a special occasion, we were overwhelmed with the generous gift of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries the hotel provided for us. In short Pros: *Lovely staff *Comfy bed *Great Blockout blinds- make sure you close both, we didn't see the second one at first. *Hotel smells fantastic -not the usual chlorine and cleaning product smell. Cons: *Slippery Shower *Expensive Internet *Expensive Breakfast (but included if you pay for the club room. . .highly recommended) *No pool *Gym is open at odd hours.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Barbarella111
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel Wentworth over the Easter weekend in a Club room and was delighted by all aspects during my stay. From check-in to when it was time to leave, each staff member I encountered was thoroughly gracious, very friendly and more than helpful, which helped to make the weekend away most enjoyable. The intoxicating scent of lavender and ylang ylang in the lobby was a precursor to the wonderful facilities provided on the Club Level and to a very comfortable, well appointed room with a good sized, very clean, modern bathroom. The bed was so wonderfully luxurious, it was hard to leave! I slept very well indeed. I highly recommend this hotel and would strongly suggest staying in a Sofitel Club room as the use of the Club lounge certainly made all the difference,

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: countryNSWBam
Reviews.Content: I stay here for work quite often, it's a great hotel. The rooms are clean and modern, the food is great and the staff are friendly. The beds are very comfortable as well. Can't fault this place at all.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ala737
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be expensive, but it's worth it. A beautifully designed building in a quiet part of downtown, with Circular Quay and the main shopping areas a short walk away. Front desk and room service staff were very helpful. The fire alarm went off while we were there and by the time we had taken the steps to street level, they had identified that it was a false alarm. All the staff was informative, calm, and professional during the "crisis". The business center was small, but did not charge me for printing, nor did the front desk charge me for sending an international fax. The room was clean and simple. Some might say sparse, but I'd rather not be surrounded by cheap graphic prints. Bathroom was great, it even had a fogless mirror! The breakfast is expensive, but worth it - everything was fresh, and there was lots of it. The staff gives you newspapers and doesn't try to rush you through your meal. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful Club Lounge I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: wacka
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Sofitel in Asia and the US so it was natural for me to consider this property while spending 7 nights in Sydney recently. The Hotel was built in the 1960's and can be considered a landmark in the city. It is a nice walk to the harbour and next to great shopping and restaurants. The hotel was completely renovated recently and the rooms (I stayed in a suite) are tastfully furnished although I am not a big fan of blond wood finishes. The fabrics and linens are excellent. The bathroom is a bit too small. The highlight of the hotel is Le Club lounge, which is available to guests at an extra cost. The finish and design of this lounge is absolutely beautiful. It is spacious and has a side array of snacks and drinks throughout the day, including champagne and fine wines. It has many different kinds of seating, so it was enjoyable at breakfast (with big flatscreens tuned to the local news and plenty of newspapers) and superb coffee. The staff is no doubt a notch above the rest of the hotel in this venue. I visited several othe hotels while I was in Sydney for various meetings and the selection is excellent. None of the other properties have this kind of experience, however. The reason why I rate this hotel only at 4 is because it had a poor selection of tv channels and $29/day internet. Do you believe that BBC and CNN are not available? I watched local news for a week and got international news off my blackberry and online. Of course, I paid the $29/day for the internet (on top of my $550 room rate), but I think this is a bit over the top. Maybe this is severe to complain about but I like many frequesnt travellers are fed up with this fee and go nuts when it is so extreme.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss dinner”
Reviews.Author: waiheke
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Wentworth for one night in February 2008. The staff are friendly and helpful even if they greet you in French, I suppose to accentuate the French Accor Group ownership of the chain. The room was clean and modern but we felt small for this level and price of hotel. The bathroom was very small and did not have a bath only a shower. When I mentioned the size of the room it was explained as being a â€œheritageâ€� building which restricted alterations that could be made. The buffet breakfast in the Garden Court Restaurant was underwhelming and the impression we got was that they just could not cope. In the evening dinner at the same restaurant was sublime, such a change from breakfast time. The service was impeccable, the knowledgeable and friendly staff always seemed to be there when you wanted them. The food was some of the best that we have eaten in Sydney. We especially recommend the scallops, had to ask for extra bread so we did not miss a drop of the delicious sauce. The meal was finished with crepe suzette flambÃ©ed at the table, a treat not offered in many restaurants these days. So to sum up the Sofitel Wentworth in Sydney, small rooms, give the breakfast buffet a miss but even if you are not staying there go for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Improvements at the Sofitel Wentworth”
Reviews.Author: The_Made_Guy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel Wentworth in a Superior Double Room for five nights in February 2008. The hotel has undergone some improvements since I stayed there last in early 2007. Firstly, the foyer has been enhanced with some welcoming furniture, which gives it a less stark impression when you first enter. Secondly, the Sofitel Lounge on the 5th floor is a welcome addition, adding a nice touch of class to the hotel. Thirdly, the breakfast/dining area has undergone a refurbishment - it has more of a cafe feel compared with before. Finally, there have been some small improvements to the rooms - nicer bedding (doona, pillows) and a new flat-screen television. All of these made for a better hotel experience, especially the bed. It really was a lovely bed to sleep in at night. Overall, I think for the price the Sofitel offers quite reasonable value. The hotel markets its "French flavour" in the staff and menu, but in my mind it is a token effort. There are some lingering issues at this hotel which give it t less than a 100% rating from me . Firstly, room service. Has the menu changed AT ALL in the past five years?! It is dull. Secondly, the carpets in the rooms I've stayed in during recent visits have been quite worn. Thirdly, the hotel appears to be battling some staff shortages, but I think this is a problem for the hospitality industry nationwide at the moment. The only other thing I wanted to stay is that I have never experienced noise problems at this hotel, and that it's location - while it is in the heart of the CBD - is not proximate to many good mid-range dining options. And if you're looking for a special view of Sydney, this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Club Sofitel very special”
Reviews.Author: Constant_Travellers
Reviews.Content: After just reading the other reviews, I am pleased I was there during the week, as even then the street noise was noticeable on a Wednesady as it seems to bounce around the hotel (semi-circlular shape). Apart from that the Club Sofitel lounge is definitely something that you should experience. Personal check-in, tea/coffee and softdrinks all day, then champagne and canapes from 1730-1930, and a beautiful peaceful breakfast in the Sofitel lounge. The standard of food was exceptional and the service impeccable in the lounge. The only gripe I have is the standard of the rooms. Travelling alot with work, this is certaily not the usual Sofitel 5 star standard (even staying on the Club Sofitel floors). Rooms were smallish and quite plain, which was dissappointing. Would stay again if just for the Club Sofitel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great but the NOISE!!”
Reviews.Author: laney_o
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the suites at the sofitel. The suite was lovely. Club sofitel was fab. It was all good till we tried to go to sleep... At about 10:30pm (on a Saturday), dance music from a bar down on Bligh St started. We were on the 11th floor but still the noise floated straight up and we may as well have been lying in bed on the dancefloor. At about midnight, after staring at the ceiling for for a few hours, I called reception. They said that it should get better soon. At 1am, the club shut the doors where the bar was open to the street . The noise was muffled but there was no mistaking that thumping bass. I fiinally went to sleep at 4am when the bar closed. So my tip is, don't stay there on the weekend unless you can stay on the Philip St side. We booked through a last minute site so got a great rate. I couldn't help but wonder if thats why we were in that location.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: AnnieBWoollamia_NSW
Reviews.Content: I stayed one Friday night here - the room and bathroom were incredibly small (only slighhtly larger than one in the Hotel Formule 1 chain, and you expect them to be small for the price). Also the NOISE was awful , from the pub on the ground floor ( I was on the 14th floor but still heard everything until 2am) The reception staff qucikly brought up ear plugs when I complained ?a common event Would NEVER stay there again

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: skyfriendbrighton
Reviews.Content: Lovely lobby with really pretty flower arrangements which scent the area. Charming reception staff. Rooms smallish, modern and very clean, with effective blackout blinds, and soft high quality beds and bedding. AC silent and effective. Breakfast buffet excellent, room service delicious and promptly served. Concierge very knowlegable and helpful. The building is an architecturally significant ex office building which has been clevely converted. The area is in the CBD with a five minute walk to The Rocks, and shopping areas near Pitt Street. The hotel have an arrangement witha Parisian pattisserie and the desserts are amazing and world class.

Reviews.Title: “good service and location”
Reviews.Author: travextr
Reviews.Content: stay for business in sydney and have stayed here several times. always extends consistant high service levels. new restaurant is really cool!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: carina1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sofitel Wentworth during Easter this year. It was without a doubt a fantastic experience. The hotels atmosphere was lovely. The room itself was furnished elegantly and the bed was very comfortable. Housekeeping did an excellent job and were helpful in any extra requests we had such as blankets. The staff were very pleasant and even suggested places for us to go. The location itself was great, only a short stroll to Circular Quay. The hotels restaurant IS A MUST. The food there was just exquisite. I cant remember the name of the chef but he is french and has added his own flair and experience to the restaurant at the sofitel and it shows. I highly recommend eating there. All in all, a lovely hotel and we will definately return :-)

Reviews.Title: “Love The Wentworth”
Reviews.Author: GerberH123
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and i have recently experienced the new Qantas first lounge - here i learnt that Sofitel manage this amazing product and decided to experience their hotel in Sydney, The Wentworth. Unfortunately, they were refurbushing their restaurant, but the new designs look great. The overall stay was far superior than my previous hotel - The Hilton, which quite simply - rubbish. The staff seemed more refined and the reception staff were professional and knowledgable about their hotel and city. Housekeeping were prompt and my room was always serviced before i got back at 3pm. Am certainly staying here again and will try the other Sofitels soon. ps: if you join Sofitel Privilege Club (which is free), you get free acess to theor health club.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: trib22
Reviews.Content: We ended up here after a short-notice trip to Sydney. The staff are attentive without being intrusive and try to please. We were offered a room for three (2 adults, 1 child - 10yo) which only had a king bed. When we pointed out it wasn't possible to sleep three in that, we we given a rollaway bed at no extra charge. The staff paid particular attention to our daughter, treating her as much as a guest as my wife and I. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Service is amazing”
Reviews.Author: AlexS776
Reviews.Content: WOW - this hotel has amazing service. I recently stayed at Radisson but it was full on this occasion, so I stayed at the Sofitel which is just a short distance away - still well located. The hotel rooms are really comfortable and they overlook a courtyard which looked like a great place to have a drink, but I found out that their restaurant was under construction - nonetheless I had a drink in their lobby bar. Throughout my stay (4 days) the staff were just amazing - they seemed so happy and pleased to be working there - what a credit to management - best overall service i have ever received.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, for a one stop trip to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Niall
Reviews.Content: Staff were brilliant at reception, arrvd at about 7a.m. from New Zealand, and the room was ready. It was great that we did not have to spend hours filling in the time after an early start. Location is super, a stones throw from the Opera House. And access to most Sydney has to offer. Room nice and neat and really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: timbo1terror
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Wentworth is a lovely place to stay right in the heart of Sydney. A stroll away from the Opera House and Circular Quay, a stones throw away from the shopping district. Right from the check in the staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. We were in room 1114 which was a junior suite. Given some of the slightly negatvice reviews here I was a little apprehensive as this was an important occasion for my wife and I. I shouldn't have worried! The lounge area was skinny but well appointed, furnishings were all of a very high quality. The bedroom was a good size with a very classy feel, features included; a beautiful timber wardrobe/entertainment unit, side tables with an ambient night light which was a thoughtful inclusion, last but not least the bed was one of the most comfortable we have slept in. The bathroom was very clean and well appointed with seperate shower and bath, nice marble finishes were all appreciated. Food in the restaurant was excellent and again the staff were professional and the service could not be faulted. There may be hotels in Sydney which have a better view of the Harbour etc, and there may be hotels which offer larger rooms, however for what the hotel offers, you would have to be really nit picking or have suffered an unfortunate experience to rate this hotel less than 5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Room not up to snuff for Sofitel brand”
Reviews.Author: 123456FLY
Reviews.Content: Poorly designed room - virtually no storage space for your clothes. No chest of drawers or armoire. Limited closet space was taken up by the safety deposit box, ironing board and luggage rack. Two bathrobes took up further space, leaving only 3-4 hangers for your clothes, while the shelf above was too high to be used and, in any event, was filled with extra pillows and blankets. Minute corner shelves were filled with an iron and a shoe mitt. Every day I had to unpack my suitcase and repack everything in the AM, as there was nowhere else to put my clothes! Lots of wasted space in the room. Built-in bookshelves contained glass vases, which took up valuable space that could have been used for drawer space. Mirrors behind the shelves and on the wall facing the bed were disconcerting to look at. You felt as if you were sleeping in someone's living room, not a hotel room. Roll-up window blinds took forever to roll up or down - there were two layers, so it took twice as long. The TV was placed at a perpendicular angle on one of the bookshelves (on the side of the room), so you had to twist your neck to watch TV in the evening. Lots of sharp edges in the room, particularly the cabinets housing the barware and mini-fridge. Watch your elbows! Bathroom has lots of granite, but little counter space. Hand/face towels, glasses and hotel toiletries took up most of the limited counter space. Barely enough room to put down your toothbrush. Shower stall had two plastic soap holders - obviously dysfunctional, as a third metal shelf was added to hold the soap, shampoo, etc., but the metal shelf still jutted out at a downward angle, causing the shampoo to fall off - and you had to be careful not to scrape your elbow against the shelf. If you turned the shower head away from the shelf, you risked leaking water outside the shower stall. There is no ventilation in the bathroom, so if you wish to do hand laundry, it is pointless to hang it on the clothesline in the stall, as the door bumps into the clothesline if you leave it open, so you must close the door and shut off all air to the wet clothes. You could try leaving the glass shower door partially open, but you might accidentally walk into the door if you want to use the toilet in the middle of the night. The "queen" size bed is actually two twin beds joined together, so have fun sleeping in the middle of the crack. Also, the left side of the bed sagged terribly - too many heavy people have evidently left their mark on this bed. Finally, the hotel is located in the central business district, which is DEAD at night. Nowhere interesting to dine (except for the Bligh restaurant, which apparently belongs to the family that manages the Sofitel). Overall, this stay was a huge disappointment, and whoever designed the interiors fell far short of the goal of customer satisfaction. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value light”
Reviews.Author: GreatBloke
Reviews.Content: I booked the top Accor hotel in Sydney for my mother visiting from England, to ensure we had a good time. So we were disappointed when the little things kept going wrong. The rooms were nice and comfortable, if a little cramped. And the views no longer exisit as the hotel has been completely dwarfed on all sides by office blocks, so close I could read posters on their office walls. Initially we were delivered to the wrong room, which was corrected within 20 minutes. The staff were very obliging and friendly. Room service was so asleep. Still jet lagged we ordered some missing spoons and some fresh milk about 5am, which never arrived even after a reminder an hour later. A later request met with an incredibly long wait, so we gave up trying anymore. Dinner in the hotel is restricted to the only (open style) restaurant, with prices to match the 5star impression, but the fare was quite good On check-out it took about 40 minutes to locate our car in the car park and bring it up, at a reasonably quiet time of the day. There are better value for the money locations in Sydney, even though this is centrally located and well established.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimita
Reviews.Content: Great service. Hotel staff helped us out with everything from umbrellas when it rained to booking tours to locating hard-to-find shops. Rooms were well decorated and clean. Location is within walking distance from key tourist attractions (The Rocks, Sydney Opera House, Circular Quay) and shopping malls on Pitt Street and Castlereagh.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Eric_Beylon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in January 2007, on a breakfast included rate. Got the usual 'Sotitel privilege card' advantages (complimentary Evian & Perrier bottles, strawberries, chocolate mousse, etc. were waiting for us in our room on arrival) and I highly recommend taking this (free) card. Very nice hotel, perfectly located, with small but top notch room. Breakfast buffet with comprehensive food and drink offerings, among which some sophisticated items. Many French (or French speaking) employees. Only complaint : some TV channels sometimes unavailable (called maintenance but it was not our TV set fault, major hotel problem with antenna...).

HotelInfo.Name: Sofitel Sydney Wentworth
HotelInfo.Address: 61-101 Phillip St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
